doc: ['Friction : An ethnography of global connection .', 'A wheel turns because of its encounter with the surface of the road ; spinning in the air it goes nowhere .', 'Rubbing two stick together produces heat and light ; one stick alone is just a stick .', 'In both case , it is friction that produces movement , action , effect .', "Challenging the widespread view that globalization invariably signifies a `` clash '' of culture , anthropologist Anna Tsing here develops friction in its place as a metaphor for the diverse and conflicting social interaction that make up our contemporary world .", "She focuses on one particular `` zone of awkward engagement '' -- the rainforest of Indonesia -- where in the 1980s and the 1990s capitalist interest increasingly reshaped the landscape not so much through corporate design as through awkward chain of legal and illegal entrepreneur that wrested the land from previous claimant , creating resource for distant market .", 'In response , environmental movement arose to defend the rainforest and the community of people who live in them .', 'Not confined to a village , a province , or a nation , the social drama of the Indonesian rainforest includes local and national environmentalist , international science , North American investor , advocate for Brazilian rubber tapper , UN funding agency , mountaineer , village elder , and urban student , among others -- all combining in unpredictable , messy misunderstanding , but misunderstanding that sometimes work out .', 'Providing a portfolio of method to study global interconnection , Tsing shows how curious and creative cultural difference are in the grip of worldly encounter , and how much is overlooked in contemporary theory of the global .', 'How to study public life .', 'How do we accommodate a growing urban population in a way that is sustainable , equitable , and inviting ?', 'This question is becoming increasingly urgent to answer as we face diminishing fossil-fuel resource and the effect of a changing climate while global city continue to compete to be the most vibrant center of culture , knowledge , and finance .', 'Jan Gehl has been examining this question since the 1960s , when few urban designer or planner were thinking about designing city for people .', 'But given the unpredictable , complex and ephemeral nature of life in city , how can we best design public infrastructure vital to city for getting from place to place , or staying in place for human use ?', 'Studying city life and understanding the factor that encourage or discourage use is the key to designing inviting public space .', 'Ten question on the soundscapes of the built environment .', "Soundscape research represents a paradigm shift from noise control policy towards a new multidisciplinary approach as it involves not only physical measurement but also the cooperation of humanity and social science to account for the diversity of soundscapes across country and culture , with more focus on how people actually experience the acoustic environment ; and it considers environmental sound as a 'resource ' rather than a 'waste ' .", 'The ten question presented in this paper range from the very basic definition underlying the emerging soundscape science , to more applied topic about how to use soundscape as a design approach for the planning and management of the built environment .', 'Although significant research activity has been conducted so far , there is still a need to systematically provide the underpinning science and practical guidance in soundscaping .', 'Thus , the last question aim to identify the most crucial gap in soundscape research and set the agenda for future advancement in the field .', 'Soundscape and the built environment .', 'Soundscape Basics and Practical Implications Soundscape research represents a paradigm shift , as it involves human and social science and physical measurement to account for the diversity of soundscapes across country and culture .', 'Moreover , it treats environmental sound as a resource rather than a waste .', 'Soundscape and the Built Environment is the first book to systematically discuss soundscape in the built environment .', 'It begins with a presentation of theory and basic background , answering question such as : what is soundscape , how is it important , and how does it affect people in term of their health and perception on the acoustic environment .', 'The book then sets out tool for implementing a soundscape approach , with measurement technique , mapping , and good soundscape practice .', 'It also delivers a series of example of the application of the soundscape approach in planning , design , and assessment .', 'Discus soundscape and environmental noise Explores cultural variation and the way they influence soundscape Introduces binaural measurement technology and psychoacoustics Examines the physical , psychological , and physiological restorative mechanism of high-quality acoustic environment Present soundscape mapping based on human perception of sound source Includes real-world example and case study highlighting the key issue in soundscape intervention Soundscape and the Built Environment is written by a group of leading international figure and derives from a four-year EU COST project on Soundscapes of European Cities and Landscapes .', 'It presents a consensus on the current state of the art and is not merely a collection of different view .', 'It is written for acoustic consultant , urban planner , designer and policy maker , as well as for graduate student and researcher .', 'Evaluating the behaviour of different thermal index by investigating various outdoor urban environment in the hot dry city of Damascus , Syria .', 'Consideration of urban microclimate and thermal comfort is an absolute neccessity in urban development , and a set of guideline for every type of climate must be elaborated .', 'However , to develop guideline , thermal comfort ranges need to be defined .', 'The aim of this study was to evaluate the behaviour of different thermal index by investigating different thermal environment in Damascus during summer and winter .', 'A second aim was to define the lower and upper limit of the thermal comfort range for some of these index .', 'The study was based on comprehensive micrometeorological measurement combined with questionnaire .', 'It was found that the thermal condition of different outdoor environment vary considerably .', 'In general , Old Damascus , with its deep canyon , is more comfortable in summer than modern Damascus where there is a lack of shade .', 'Conversely , residential area and park in modern Damascus are more comfortable in winter due to more solar access .', 'The neutral temperature of both the physiologically equivalent temperature ( PET ) and the outdoor standard effective temperature ( OUT_SET * ) were found to be lower in summer than in winter .', 'At 80 % acceptability , the study defined the lower comfort limit in winter to 21.0 °c and the upper limit in summer to 31.3 °c for PET .', 'For OUT_SET * , the corresponding lower and upper limit were 27.6 °c and 31.3 °C respectively .', 'OUT_SET * showed a better correlation with the thermal sensation vote than PET .', "The study also highlighted the influence of culture and tradition on people 's clothing as well as the influence of air conditioning on physical adaptation .", 'A qualitative study of Chinese wine consumption and purchasing : Implication for Australian wine .', "Purpose : This research aims to examine Chinese consumer ' wine consumption and purchasing behaviour .", "Design/methodology/approach : The study , conducted during the Chinese New Year in early 2006 , used in-depth interview with 15 consumer in Guangzhou , People 's Republic of China .", 'Finding : The result suggest that Chinese consume Chinese spirit for all occasion , yet consume red wine only for special occasion such as Chinese new year and other holiday .', 'A key point for selling red wine to the Chinese is its positive image ; drinking red wine is considered trendy and shows good taste .', 'Another key point is consumer perception of red wine as healthier than Chinese spirit because wine contains less alcohol .', 'Two other finding are that most Chinese consumer assume all wine is red wine and have little wine knowledge .', 'Most respondent did not know of white wine or that Australia produces wine .', "Finally , China 's culture of face value , mianzi , plays a key role in purchasing and consuming wine .", 'Chinese tend to purchase inexpensive wine for private consumption and public occasion , yielding more mianzi in front of others .', 'In some important occasion , consumer will purchase a foreign ( French ) red wine to impress their guest and obtain even more mianzi .', 'In most situation , Chinese purchase and consume wine for perceived health and symbolic - lucky or good face - value .', 'Research limitations/implications : The small sample size is a limitation .', "Another limitation is that all the respondent lived in the urban area of Guangzhou , one of China 's most developed city .", 'The finding do not generalize to China .', 'Practical implication : The finding suggest that wine is a symbolic product rather than a necessity product in China ; therefore , image is an important attribute for selling wine in China .', 'Furthermore , limited wine knowledge tends to make Chinese consumer rely heavily on price for their wine purchasing decision , as price relates to mainzi .', "Chinese consumer ' high awareness of France as a wine making country and their deep-rooted positive belief about French wine pose difficulty for marketing other foreign wine , such as Australian wine , in China .", 'Originality/value : This is perhaps the first academic study in English of Chinese wine consumption and wine purchasing .', 'It offers important insight on the characteristic of wine consumption and purchasing in China .', 'Chinese cultural value and gift-giving behavior .', "Purpose - The purpose of this paper is to report the result of a study undertaken to investigate the gift-giving behavior of consumer in the People 's Republic of China ( PRC ) during the Chinese New Year and the influence exerted by Chinese cultural value on such behavior .", 'Design/methodology/approach - Using a survey among a large sample of people in the city of Tianjin , gift-giving behavior was measured by the importance accorded to gift-giving , the amount given , the effort spent on gift selection and brand orientation when selecting gift .', 'The cultural value examined were renqing ( human obligation ) , guanxi ( relationship ) , yuan ( destiny or fate ) , reciprocity , family orientation and Mianzi ( face ) .', 'Factor analysis and structural equation modeling were used to analyze the data .', 'Finding - Result indicated that Chinese cultural value as a whole as well as most of its component investigated in this research had positive effect on the various gift-giving behavior .', "The `` face '' component was , however , found to affect only the importance attached to gift-giving , the amount given and the choice of brand .", 'Research limitations/implications - Research result should be interpreted with caution as the study was limited to Tianjin - one of the several major city in the PRC .', 'Also the Chinese New Year may not be representative of other occasion when gift are exchanged .', "Practical implication - The result of this investigation would benefit practitioner involved in the marketing of `` gift item '' in the PRC by providing them with a clear understanding of the general consumption pattern of the PRC urban consumer , insight into the various antecedent of gift-giving and linking them with various aspect of Chinese cultural value .", 'The research finding would also benefit researcher , academic and others interested in the PRC market by making them familiar with some of the salient aspects that characterize Chinese consumer .', 'Originality/value - This study develops a new model describing the relationship among value ( Chinese cultural value and personal value ) , motivation for gift-giving and gift-giving behavior .', 'It also develops new scale for measuring the construct such as Chinese cultural value , motivation for gift-giving and gift-giving behavior .', 'Ethnic minority group and the design of public open scape : An inclusive landscape ?', '.', 'People from ethnic minority group have a range of experience of living in Britain , some of which are significantly different from those of white British people .', 'Previous research and case study suggest that the physical environment has a positive or negative role in perception of everyday life .', 'It is argued that landscape have a symbolic dimension , and aspect of landscape can be recognized as familiar or alien , welcoming or excluding .', 'A wide variety of case study in Britain are used to discuss design and management practice that reflect a range of cultural experience .', 'The need for landscape architect and manager to be aware of how place may be interpreted in different way by different ethnic minority group , and to work towards inclusive design , is highlighted .', "BlueHealth : A study programme protocol for mapping and quantifying the potential benefit to public health and well-being from Europe 's blue space .", 'Introduction Proximity and access to water have long been central to human culture and accordingly deliver countless societal benefit .', "Over 200 million people live on Europe 's coastline , and aquatic environment are the top recreational destination in the region .", "In term of public health , interaction with 'blue space ' ( eg , coast , river , lake ) are often considered solely in term of risk ( eg , drowning , microbial pollution ) .", 'Exposure to blue space can , however , promote health and well-being and prevent disease , although underlying mechanism are poorly understood .', 'Aim and method The BlueHealth project aims to understand the relationship between exposure to blue space and health and well-being , to map and quantify the public health impact of change to both natural blue space and associated urban infrastructure in Europe , and to provide evidence-based information to policymakers on how to maximise health benefit associated with intervention in and around aquatic environment .', 'To achieve these aim , an evidence base will be created through systematic review , analysis of secondary data set and analysis of new data collected through a bespoke international survey and a wide range of community-level intervention .', 'We will also explore how to deliver the benefit associated with blue space to those without direct access through the use of virtual reality .', 'Scenario will be developed that allow the evaluation of health impact in plausible future societal contexts and changing environment .', 'BlueHealth will develop key input into policymaking and land/water-use planning towards more salutogenic and sustainable us of blue space , particularly in urban area .', 'Ethic and dissemination Throughout the BlueHealth project , ethic review and approval are obtained for all relevant aspect of the study by the local ethic committee prior to any work being initiated and an ethic expert has been appointed to the project advisory board .', 'So far , ethical approval has been obtained for the BlueHealth International Survey and for community-level intervention taking place in Spain , Italy and the UK .', 'Engagement of stakeholder , including the public , involves citizen in many aspect of the project .', 'Result of all individual study within the BlueHealth project will be published with open access .', 'After full anonymisation and application of any measure necessary to prevent disclosure , data generated in the project will be deposited into open data repository of the partner institution , in line with a formal data management plan .', 'Other knowledge and tool developed in the project will be made available via the project website ( www.bluehealth2020.eu ) .', 'Project result will ultimately provide key input to planning and policy relating to blue space , further stimulating the integration of environmental and health consideration into decision-making , such that blue infrastructure is developed across Europe with both public health and the environment in mind .', 'No commercial use is permitted unless otherwise expressly granted .', 'The role of urban design in cultural regeneration .', 'One of the technique that has been used as a tool for urban development in recent year is that of cultural regeneration .', 'This is seen as a means of restoring and improving the quality of urban life through the enhancement and development of the unique characteristic of a place and its people .', 'This article argues that urban design is integral to the process of cultural regeneration , as such thing as mixed-use development , environmental improvement scheme and , in particular , public art help in the expression and development of the culture of an area .', 'The article looks at how specific cultural quarter are developed in city centre area , focusing on an area of Manchester known as the Northern Quarter , and outlines the way in which urban design technique are used as part of the process of wider cultural regeneration .', 'It is suggested that , for improved chance of success , the adoption of a holistic approach to urban regeneration is required , with policy-makers using culture as an organizing principle for city management and urban design .', 'A comparison of the cause , effect and aftermath of the coastal flooding of England in 1953 and France in 2010 .', 'This paper provides a comparison of the cause , effect and aftermath of the coastal flooding that occurred on the east coast of England in 1953 and the west coast of France in 2010 that resulted in 307 and 47 death respectively .', 'The cause of both event are strikingly similar .', 'Both were caused by a combination of high tide , low atmospheric pressure , high wind and the failure of poorly maintained flood defence .', 'In both case the number of death was related to the vulnerability of the building and people .', 'Building in the flood zone were often single storey bungalow and the people who died were mostly over 60 yr of age .', 'Both tragedy were national disaster .', 'The 1953 flood in England acted as a catalyst for an acceleration in flood risk management policy and practice .', 'It resulted in : the development of a Storm Tide Warning System for the east coast of England ; the setting of new design standard for coastal flood defence ; increased investment in improving coastal defence ; and a substantial new research effort into coastal process , protection and forecasting .', "In France there has also been an episodic shift in flood risk management policy with the focus falling on : control of urban development in area at risk of flooding ; improved coastal forecasting and warning ; strengthening of flood defence ; and developing a `` culture of risk awareness '' .", 'This paper outlines the lesson that can be learnt from the two event and provides recommendation concerning how future loss of life as a result of coastal flooding can be reduced .', 'Autonomous adaptation to global environmental change in peri-urban settlement : Evidence of a growing culture of innovation and revitalisation in Mathare Valley Slums , Nairobi .', 'The growth of peri-urban area is increasingly recognised as a dominant planning and urban design challenge for the 21st century .', 'In burgeoning poor urban settlement growing on city margin , autonomous adaptation strategy are often the only measure to respond to increasing climatic and compounding stressor .', 'Yet , in both research and practice there remains lack of understanding regarding the dynamic of adaptation and risk reduction at the level of the community .', 'In this paper , we argue urban slum are ideal place to consider adaptation because they offer example of more extreme social-ecological stress than one finds in more established community - the kind we can anticipate more broadly in the face of climate change .', 'A framework for identifying local adaptation processes is presented and applied to analyse the case of Mathare Valley Slums in Nairobi , Kenya - a densely populated suburb , where resident are regularly exposed to flooding from heavy rainfall .', 'Finding reveal that slum , often viewed as illegitimate , makeshift , and temporary settlement , are place experienced by many resident as permanent community characterised by rapid environmental change .', 'Process of adaptation in Mathare have become institutionalised through time , as a new generation of people imagine themselves staying and ( re ) organise to achieve a higher level of functioning through various strategy to reduce risk .', "Innovative and revitalising adaptation occurs as resident shift from employing more generic and expected coping strategy , such as evacuating home or economic diversification , to creating `` gated '' community and saving scheme to maintain and improve the settlement , despite uncertain tenure .", 'Both formal and informal institution , such as youth group , play an important role in governing such heterogeneous locality , incrementally upgrading the slum and providing critical public service .', "Long-term resident ' increasing recognition of the permanence of the slum community and its stressful condition appears to lead to more collective action toward adaptation pathway .", "However , this is in marked contrast to the dominant non-local perspective of Mathare 's status as both impermanent and illegal , which prevails among government official .", 'As such , strategy are generally not incorporated into planned intervention .', 'While progressive policy designed to reduce risk exist , they remain nascent in their establishment and fail to benefit slumdwellers .', 'The case illustrates the need to incorporate the wealth of knowledge , technique , and experience extant at the community level in the development of adaptation planning .', 'COVID-19 and city : From urban health strategy to the pandemic challenge .', 'a decalogue of public health opportunity .', 'Background and aim of the work .', 'The ongoing pandemic of COVID-19 , which nowadays has exceeded 2.5 million notified infection in the world and about 200,000 death , is a strong reminder that urbanization has changed the way that people and community live , work , and interact , and it ’ s necessary to make the system and local capacity resilient to prevent the spread of infectious disease .', 'How we can re-design the concept of Public Health in relation to the built environment and the contemporary city ?', 'Method .', 'According to the previous statement and scenario , aim of this paper is to integrate the Urban Health strategic objective , focusing the possible response , both immediate and medium-long term , to the current environmental , social , and economic aspect of the ‘ period ’ of physical distancing .', 'Results.Immediate Action are 01. program the flexibility of city schedule ; 02. plan a smart and sustainable mobility network ; 03. define a neighborhood service ’ plan ; 04. develop a digitization of the urban context , promoting the smart community ; 05. re-think the accessibility to the place of culture and tourism .', 'Medium-long term Action are 06. design the indoor flexibility of domestic living space ; 07. re-think building typology , fostering the presence of semi-private or collective space ; 08. renovate the basic care service ’ network ; 09. integrate the existing environmental emergency plan , with those related to the health emergency ; 10. improve stakeholder ’ awareness of the factor affecting Public Health in the city .', 'Conclusion .', 'The Decalogue of Public Health opportunity may provide a useful basis for Designers ( Architects and Urban Planners ) , Policy Makers , Public Health expert and Local Health Agencies , in promoting action and policy aimed to transform our city in healthier and Salutogenic living environment .', 'From multiculturalism to multinaturalism : What rule of method for the new socio-scientific experiment ?', '.', 'This article reflects on the traditional distinction between scientific laboratory experimenting on theory and phenomenon and a political outside where non-experts make do with human value , opinion , and passion .', 'Since today all people are engaged in emerging collective experiment on matter as varied as climate , food , landscape , health , urban design , and technical communication as consumer , militant , and citizen , they can all be considered co-researchers .', "Co-researching has consequence for our understanding of nature and demands a renewed attention to `` multinaturalist '' politics .", 'It also question the division of labor between expert and nonexperts .', "The article finishes with a call to `` dis-invent '' modernity so that we `` modern '' can finally become ordinary human again .", 'Influence of hot arid climate on the use of outdoor urban space and thermal comfort : Do cultural and social background matter ?', '.', 'Climate-sensitive open space within city may have a positive effect on economic , social and environmental aspect of the urban environment .', 'Improvement of microclimatic condition in urban space can enable people to spend more time outdoors , with the potential to influence the social cohesion of a space and increase economic activity .', 'The wider aim of this research is to develop a better understanding of the complex relationship between the microclimate and human behaviour in open public space in hot arid climate .', 'Case study are selected in two different part of the world ( Marrakech in North Africa and Phoenix , Arizona in the US ) to represent a variety of user in a similar climatic context .', 'This enables the author to study the effect of socio-economic and cultural diversity on thermal comfort , behaviour and use of space .', 'Field survey include structured interview with a standard questionnaire and observation of human activity , along with microclimatic monitoring , carried out during the summer and winter of 2008 and 2009 .', 'The analysis consists of : microclimatic influence on thermal sensation , preference and people attendance ; effect of psychological adaptation on the subjective thermal evaluation of outdoor space ; and investigation of socio-economic and socio-cultural impact on the behaviour of people in outdoor space .', 'Behavioural factor influencing corrupt action in the Australian construction industry .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to explore behavioural factor which are perceived to influence corrupt action in the Australian construction industry .', "Design/methodology/approach : The paper draw on Rabl and Kühlmann 's Model of a corrupt action and the result of face-to-face interview with 23 people working in the Australian construction industry .", 'Finding : The result suggest that corruption is ambiguously defined yet perceived to be very common and primarily associated with personal gain rather than breaking the law .', 'The main form of corruption were identified as kickback , fraud and bribery and this behaviour is perceived to be driven by high goal feasibility , by conducive attitude and supportive subjective norm and by high perceived behavioural control over being caught .', 'Research limitations/implications : The research is based on a relatively small sample of 23 respondent and the use of snowball sampling may have meant that the respondent would tend to present a particular view of the industry .', "It is also important to point out that this research took place within a highly politicised environment coinciding the with launch of the third Royal Commission into corruption in the construction industry and is based on the respondent 's perception of corruption rather than incontrovertible evidence of corruption in practice .", 'Nevertheless , given the care the author took to avoid these bias , it does provide a useful window in the incidence and type of corruption in construction and the behavioural factor that might influence it .', "Practical implication : In term of tackling corruption , it is recommended that greater attention be given to exploring the culture of the industry which appears to normalise corrupt behaviour and to the hidden informal `` institution '' which appear to be undermining the many formal policy and procedure which have been put in place to tackle corruption in the construction industry .", 'Social implication : The global construction industry has been identified by Transparency International as the most bribery-prone of 19 industry it rated .', 'The cost is huge with scarce resource being diverted from much needed urban regeneration , community concern about development being ignored , individual human right being abused , productivity and efficiency being compromised and important environment , culture and heritage being destroyed .', 'In Australia , concern about corruption in the construction industry have led to an unprecedented three Royal Commissions which have argued that there is a culture which encourages , accepts and reward this behaviour .', "Originality/value : By using Rabl and Kühlmann 's Theory of a corrupt action this paper throws new light on how corruption is defined by member of the construction industry .", "The finding suggest that while formal technical and procedural solution to corruption are important in addressing corruption they are likely to be undermined by strong culture and informal institution which dictate the `` rule of the game '' on the ground .", 'There is a clear need to better understand how these informal institution work to constrain formal rule devised to bring about reform .', 'Socio–spatial variation in the nature of entrepreneurship .', 'Purpose The purpose of this paper is to evaluate critically the discourse that entrepreneurship and enterprise culture are inextricably inter–twinned with profit–driven capitalist endeavour by seeking to understand whether amongst some population , the culture of entrepreneurship is more socially–oriented than profit–driven .', 'Design/methodology/approach To do this , a secondary analysis is undertaken of the result of the UK Global Entrepreneurship Monitor in general , and UK Social Entrepreneurship Monitor more particularly .', 'It compares the level and ratio of commercial–to–social entrepreneurship across various population group and area in the UK .', 'Finding The finding is that there are different culture of entrepreneurship across varying population group .', 'Many marginalized group are more socially–orientated than profit–driven .', 'This is particularly the case amongst the long–term registered disabled ( 2.3 time more likely to engage in social rather than commercial entrepreneurship than the average UK entrepreneur ) , other non–White group ( 2.2 time more likely ) and the retired ( twice as likely ) .', 'Similarly , people living in rural area display a greater propinquity to engage in social rather than commercial entrepreneurship than those living in urban area .', 'Research limitations/implications The finding raise question about whether it is appropriate to parachute into some population a culture of commercial entrepreneurship that might be “ foreign ” to their enterprise culture and whether a focus on social entrepreneurship in the enterprise culture agenda will promote greater inclusiveness of population traditionally under–represented .', 'Originality/value This paper is one of the first to document the varying ratio of commercial–to–social entrepreneurship amongst different population group and area .', 'A city for all citizen : Integrating child and youth from marginalized population into city planning .', 'Socially just , intergenerational urban space should not only accommodate child and adolescent , but engage them as participant in the planning and design of welcoming space .', "With this goal , city agency in Boulder , Colorado , the Boulder Valley School District , the Children , Youth and Environments Center at the University of Colorado , and a number of community organization have been working in partnership to integrate young people 's idea and concern into the redesign of park and civic area and the identification of issue for city planning .", "Underlying their work is a commitment to the Convention on the Rights of the Child and child 's right to active citizenship from a young age .", 'This paper describes approach used to engage with young people and method of participation , and reflects on lesson learned about how to most effectively involve youth from underrepresented population and embed diverse youth voice into the culture of city planning .', 'Wounded healing : Forming a storytelling community in hip-hop lit .', 'Background/Context : Over the past 5 year , there has been a growing body of scholarship that examines the intersection of hip-hop culture and classroom pedagogy .', 'Although recent scholarship has persuasively demonstrated the classroom potential of hip-hop texts for promoting student engagement , scaffolding sanctioned form of knowledge , and nurturing critical consciousness and activism , little work has been done to unpack the complex relation of power that emerge in such classroom .', 'In particular , we know very little about the way in which student and teacher are ( re ) positioned within classroom that engage in hip-hopcentered pedagogy .', 'This article contributes to the current literature in hip-hop based education , culturally relevant pedagogy , and critical pedagogy by examining the some of the issue and tension that emerge when teacher engage in hip-hop-centered classroom pedagogy .', "Purpose/Objective/Research Question/Focus of Study : This study detail how the articulation of personal narrative within Hip-Hop Lit , a hip-hop-centered high school English literature course , produced a practice of `` wounded healing , '' in which people bearing the scar of suffering shared their story in way that provided a form of release and relief for themselves and others .", "This article highlights the complex relationship that student forged with the course 's hip-hop texts , many of which resonated with their own lived experience .", 'I then illustrate how these relationship enabled the classroom discussion and interaction from which the practice of wounded healing emerged .', 'Finally , I highlight some of the dilemmas and tension that emerged as my coteacher and I attempted to privilege the story and experience of our student and ourselves within the classroom .', "Setting : Data for this study were collected at `` Howard High School , '' a small comprehensive urban high school in the northeastern United States .", 'Research Design : Data for this 1-year ethnography were collected using field note , formal and informal interview , document analysis , and video data .', "Conclusions/recommendations : This article shows how Hip-Hop Lit operated as a space in which member offered and responded to various type of individual and group narrative through the practice of `` wounded healing . ''", 'Through this practice , student were able to recognize the commonality of their experience , challenge various ideology , and produce new knowledge .', 'In doing this , the member of the class forged a cohesive community replete with multiple role and relation of power .', 'This article points to the need for critically interrogating the ostensible virtue of hip-hop-based education , as well as critical and culturally relevant pedagogy more broadly .', 'This article also underscores the need for more ethnographic research that unpacks the complexity , contour , and contradiction of curricula , and pedagogy that responds to the lived experience of student .', 'Brain culture : Shaping policy through neuroscience .', 'This unique book offers a timely analysis of the impact of rapidly advancing knowledge about the brain , mind and behaviour on contemporary public policy and practice .', 'Examining development in behaviour change policy , neuroscience , architecture and urban design , education , and workplace training programmes the book analyses the global spread of research agenda , policy experiment and everyday practice informed by ‘ brain culture ’ .It offers an alternative , geographically informed set of explanation for what matter in explaining how people behave and how citizen ’ behaviour should be governed .', 'It will be of interest to student and academic across the social and behavioural science .', 'Porous landscape - The case of Greater Copenhagen .', 'Many blueprint for urban development argue for the benefit of a sharp distinction between rural and urban space .', 'While such planning design have been quite successful in maintaining a physical distinction between rural and urban , major transformation of the socio-economic environment in peri-urban area are creating a more diffuse and porous interface .', 'This paper examines socio-economic consequence of the current transformation of peri-urban area .', 'Three theme are selected for analysis : changing economy , overall impact of urbanisation as perceived by the individual farm owner and the degree of their local orientation and engagement .', 'Based on case study in Greater Copenhagen , longitudinal trend and detail of the current situation are analysed .', 'In addition , by differentiating between newcomer and long-term resident , possible future change are indicated .', 'The analysis shows that the importance of agriculture has declined , whereas other gainful activity and residential use have increased .', 'Thus , the function of the local economy and community are changing .', 'An increasing proportion of the farm owner appreciate the proximity to urban agglomeration ( public service , shopping , public transport , social relationship and market ) , but this location also has drawback , for example in term of uncertainty concerning future urban development , inconvenience for agricultural production and problem related to public access to private property .', 'Difference between newcomer and long-time resident are identified .', 'Newcomer without any agricultural background are frequent .', 'They often work outside the municipality and are more frequently personally involved in other gainful activity on-farm .', 'Newcomer perceive more problem related to people accessing the farm property and are less involved in local activity .', 'In combination , these trend indicate possible future increase in conflict between farm owner and the public and that the local engagement may be declining .', "The analysis , however , also shows similarity between newcomer and long-time resident , and therefore does not indicate the development of two culture or `` two nation '' .", 'Rather , the urban fringe population is becoming more heterogeneous , ranging from full-time farmer to resident with their social and professional network outside the local area or people engaging in non-agricultural business on-farm .', 'Cultural value and effective executional technique in advertising : A cross-country and product category study of urban young adult in Asia .', 'Purpose - The purpose of this study is to examine likeable executional technique in advertising across five Asian country and their impact on purchase intention .', 'Design/methodology/approach - A total of 1,000 urban young adult in five Asian country ( HK , China , Indonesia , Thailand and India ) were telephone interviewed on their thought about the TV advertisement/s that they liked , product that was being advertised and purchase intention .', 'Their response were summarised into seven likeable executional technique and product category .', 'Finding - There is not a specific likeable executional technique that influences a purchase in four of the five country .', 'India is the only country where significant but weak overall model fit observed .', 'These result demonstrate that , while there are difference among the country , people in the same cohort broadly share the same value .', 'For product category , our finding demonstrate that product nature may moderate cultural influence on advertising effectiveness .', "Practical implication - International advertiser who are vying for a share of the largely-untapped Asian market can benefit by understanding the target country 's cultural value and using it as a guideline for creating effective executional technique in advertising .", 'Originality/value - This study extends the existing knowledge which demonstrates that , in Asia , persuasive executional technique differ depending on the product category .', 'An exploration of environmentally-conscious consumer and the reason why they do not buy green product .', 'Purpose – The purpose of this paper is to understand how and why environmentally conscious consumer rationalise their non-green purchase behaviour .', 'Design/methodology/approach – Seven focus group were conducted .', 'A total of 51 people , aged 19-70 year , participated in the study .', 'Theoretical thematic analysis was used to organise the data as various theme emerged .', 'Finding – Through application of neutralisation theory , this study identified additional barrier to green consumption .', 'Two new neutralisation technique emerged , namely protecting ( maintaining ) one ’ s sense of self and consumer attachment to the brand .', 'These technique recognise the impact consumer culture has had on consumer .', 'Research limitations/implications – The study took place in an urban centre hence the view of the participant may be different from those who live in rural centre ; low-income consumer were under-represented ; and more male participant would have been desirable .', 'Social implication – Despite its limitation , this study reveals that consumer will rationalise their decision in order to protect their self-esteem and self-identity .', 'Until green becomes a social norm , consumer will continue to place individual goal over collective goal .', 'Understanding this rationalisation process is important if marketer and policy maker want to encourage behavioural change .', 'Originality/value – This study makes a valuable contribution to the understanding of the green attitudebehaviour gap .', 'It provides fresh insight into how environmentally conscious consumer vindicate their non-green consumption behaviour and how marketer and policy maker can overcome these challenge .', 'It also identifies two new neutralisation technique and extends the theory to a consumer culture context .', 'A cultural political economy of school desegregation in seattle .', 'Background/Context : School desegregation has been variably conceptualized as a remedy for racial injustice , a means toward urban ( economic ) revitalization , an opportunity to celebrate human diversity , and an attempt to more equally distribute educational resource .', 'At the center of the debate over the year is the extent to which school desegregation is a matter of class or race , of redistribution or recognition .', 'A cultural political economy of school desegregation begins with a rejection of the popular notion that desegregation is simply , or even primarily , about race .', 'It also eschews the idea that what is needed is a `` corrective interjec- `` tion of social class and economic justice .', "In proposing neither a racial nor an economic solution , cultural political economy sheds doubt on the very proposition of a `` racial '' or `` economic '' analysis , politics , or remedy and helps us more powerfully explain how the cultural and material force of race and class breathes as one through the historical-political trajectory of school desegregation .", "Purpose/Objective/Research Question/Focus of Study : This article is based on finding from a larger historical-ethnographic research project intended to explicate the cultural-ideological and structural context ( s ) within which Seattle 's Black leader , educator , and activist made sense of the relationship between school desegregation and the life and liberation of Black people in the post-civil-rights era .", 'Here , the author uses cultural political economy as an analytical framework to elucidate the relationship ( s ) between cultural production such as the construction of right , justice , and racial progress , and political-economic formation such as the ( ab ) use of the state and market by certain class - in this case , middle-class and affluent White Seattleites - to preserve their own privilege through the implementation of social and educational policy that serve to reproduce material inequity .', 'Setting : The study setting is Seattle , Washington .', 'Population/participants : Black leader , educator , and activist who participated in the school desegregation struggle in the city of Seattle from the mid-1970s through 2007 .', 'Research Design : This study employed semistructured ethnographic interview , content analysis , and historical/archival analysis .', 'Conclusion/recommendations : The trajectory of school desegregation politics in Seattle , culminating in the U.S. Supreme Court ruling in Parent Involved in Community Schools v. Seattle School District No .', '1 , reveals a long and systematic political effort to delegitimize and dismantle justice-oriented redistribution of educational resource along racial line .', 'Cultural political economy provides an analytical framework that contributes to our theoretical understanding of the interimbrication of culture and political economy in education politics and policy-making .', 'The author argues that understanding the interimbrication of class and race in the politics of school desegregation allows us to more clearly theorize how school desegregation policy are undermined in way that reproduce material and cultural relation of power .', 'Ultimately , critical researcher , educator , and youth and community activist must develop political strategy to shift the very relation of power highlighted in the Seattle case .', 'Facilitator of and barrier to physical activity in retirement community : Experience of older woman in urban area .', 'Background .', 'Older people are being encouraged to be physically active for as long as possible as a preventive measure against disease and functional decline .', 'It remains , however , uncertain how living in a retirement community affects physical activity ( PA ) .', 'Objective .', 'This study was conducted to understand the PA experience of older woman living in retirement community and what they experience as facilitator of and barrier to PA. Design .', 'The study was qualitative and guided by the Vancouver School of doing phenomenology , a unique blend of phenomenology , hermeneutics , and constructivism .', 'Method .', 'Participant were 10 woman , aged from 72 to 97 year ( mean=84 year ) .', 'In-depth interview were conducted , recorded , transcribed , and thematically analyzed .', 'Result .', 'A model was constructed with 3 main theme : ( 1 ) the woman themselves , including their experienced health condition , individual aspect of functioning , and various personal factor ; ( 2 ) the physical environment ; and ( 3 ) the social environment .', 'These main theme all include subthemes of experienced influence on PA , such as health , design of housing and environment , and local culture .', 'These influence could both facilitate and hinder PA , depending on the context .', 'The facilitating effect of good outdoor area , accessible physical training facility , a familiar neighborhood , and finding joy in PA were clear in the study .', 'The barrier included worsening health , a colder climate with ice and wind , and lack of a PA culture within the retirement community .', 'Conclusion .', "An older woman 's residence may strongly influence her ability and motivation to be physically active .", 'Physical therapist should acquaint themselves with the facilitator of and barrier to PA of woman within retirement community and use that knowledge to influence the physical and social environment and to target PA intervention to the woman themselves .', "China 's changing culture : Rural and urban consumer ' favorite thing .", "Purpose : Following the upheaval of the revolutionary era , the People 's Republic of China 's consumer culture is somewhat over 20 year old .", 'This research aims at discovering and thus better understanding what Chinese consumer value most among their possession .', 'In turn , this finding should help better understand the contemporary Chinese culture .', 'Design/methodology/approach : The general research approach utilized in this effort is qualitative .', 'All data were collected through at-home , in-depth personal interview , following established guideline outlined by Lincoln and Guba , and Wallendorf and Belk .', 'A snowball sampling resulted in the participation of 20 rural and 20 urban household .', "Finding : Participant ' demographic profile ended up matching well the national profile in term of income , and the gender and age make-up of the rural and urban sample were not significantly different .", 'Four category emerged to comprehensively represent all the favorite product identified by the participant : entertainment , functional , hedonic , and memento .', 'In addition , a numerically significant number of participant could neither think of a favorite product nor possess one .', "As developed in the paper , conventional typology , such as Hofstede and Triandis ' collectivism-individualism do not account well for the result observed in this study .", "Rather , the study turns towards Lu 's research and suggestion that using instrument developed by Western culture suffer from methodological defect when applied to Chinese behavior .", 'This research then defines the Yi , a Confucian value related to benevolence , morality , righteousness , and the Li , a Mohist/Legalist value related to utilitarianism and profit , and suggests that the two better help understand the finding and support observation .', 'Research limitations/implications : The nature of qualitative research clearly limits the generalization of its finding , and therefore to offer more definitive result , future effort would have to consider other method .', 'Also , and while great care is taken to ensure the validity of the data collection process , there is always the possibility that some respondent may not have been as candid or truthful as would be hoped .', 'However , and altogether , finding from this research do match well what public medium have often been reporting , and what frequent casual observation point out .', "Practical implication : China 's contemporary culture is rapidly changing , somehow breaking away from tradition , yet retaining core value and reshaping them with modern , sometimes alien input .", 'This research clearly indicates what motivates the younger generation , raised in a nation governed by an all-controlling Communist party that orchestrates an openly capitalistic , materialistic societal development .', "Such apparent contradiction , the result of `` Socialism with Chinese Characteristics , '' may be puzzling to some in the Western world but are not so with today 's Chinese consumer .", 'Originality/value : This research is unique in its topic and research approach , given that it deals with Chinese consumer , the largest block of consumer in the world .', 'It offers a perspective , not yet considered within the marketing and consumer research literature , that seems to explain well what is observed .', 'Moving up , down or sideways ?', ': Exploring consumer experience of identity and status incongruence .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this article is to argue that consumer experience conflict not only when in identity transition or social status transition but also in-between these two , and that the relationship between these two is becoming increasingly important to address .', "First , this is done by identifying how status transition ( vertical movement ) overlap but differ in some important respect from identity transition ( horizontal movement ) , and second , the consumption strategy used by people when these movement lead to an experience of conflict between one 's ( new/old ) identity role and ( new/old ) status position have been demonstrated .", 'Design/methodology/approach : In this multi-sited , qualitative data collection , the phenomenological and ethnographic interview have been conducted with 35 urban middle-class consumer in their home at three culturally and historically different site ( Sweden , Turkey and the USA ) .', 'Finding : The importance and kind of a consumption strategy to resolve the status-identity incongruence relates if it is mainly a vertically or horizontally determined transition .', 'To consumer with a main focus on status change - characterised by hierarchical and competitive dimension that identity role transition are free from - the engagement in consumption becomes more important and intense .', 'Practical implication : Marketer have historically mainly been engaged in static categorisation and segmentation of consumer lifestyle .', "By instead emphasising consumer ' life transition and their accompanying status-identity conflict , marketer may consider the implication for market communication .", 'Social implication : Given that liquid modernity ( Bauman , 2001 ) and its loose social structure forces the middle-class to become increasingly socially mobile , match and mismatch between identity and status position ought to become more common and the resulting consumption strategy more sophisticated .', 'This research offers a first , tentative framework for understanding these conflict in relation to consumption .', 'Originality/value : Although lifestyle transition have often been elaborated on in consumer research , the difference between social status transition and identity transition , and especially the conflict in-between these two , have not been paid its deserved attention .', 'Based on multi-sited , qualitative data collection , concrete consumption strategy following the experience of status-identity incongruence have been identified .', 'The result also contribute to a better understanding of the growing uncertainty and volatility of social status position in contemporary middle-class consumer culture .', 'Repatriating Indigenous Technologies in an Urban Indian Community .', 'Indigenous people are significantly underrepresented in the field of science , technology , engineering and math ( STEM ) .', 'The solution to this problem requires a more robust lens than representation or access alone .', 'Specifically , it will require careful consideration of the ecological contexts of Indigenous school age youth , of which more than 70 % live in urban community ( National Urban Indian Family Coalition , 2008 ) .', 'This article reports emergent design principle derived from a community-based design research project .', 'These emergent principle focus on the conceptualization and us of technology in science learning environment designed for urban Indigenous youth .', 'In order to strengthen learning environment for urban Indigenous youth , it is necessary , we argue , that scholar and educator take seriously the way in which culture mediates relationship with , conception of , and innovation in technology and technologically related discipline .', 'Recognizing these relationship will inform the subsequent implication for learning environment .', 'Thermal comfort in interior and semi-open space of rural folk house in hot-humid area .', 'Semi-open space are a key element in the climate adaptive design of rural folk house and are important place where rural resident perform daily activity in hot-humid area .', 'In this study , a year-long thermal comfort field survey was conducted in rural folk house in 11 rural area in the Guangdong Province , the hot-humid area of southern China .', 'The subjective response of resident were recorded via questionnaire , and all ambient environment parameter were measured .', 'The result show that air speed was greater and relative humidity was lower in the semi-open space .', 'The clothing insulation of the survey respondent varied with indoor operative temperature from 0.27 clo to 1.2 clo during the non-summer season and remained steady at 0.30 clo during the summer season .', 'The thermal neutral , acceptable and preferred indoor operative temperature were determined for the interior and semi-open space in the summer and non-summer .', 'Compared to those of the interior space , the thermal neutral temperature was 0.6–1.3 °C lower and the upper limit of 80 % acceptable temperature was decreased by 0.8–4.7 °c in the semi-open space .', 'The acceptable temperature in the summer for the rural resident was found to be 0.2–1 °C higher than that of the urban resident in the same climate .', 'Psychological factor such as local culture , expectation and perceived control might be the reason for these difference .', 'This study contributes to a better understanding of the thermal comfort of rural people and to the improvement of rural living condition .', 'Memorial as space of engagement : Design , use and meaning .', 'Memorial are more diverse in design and subject matter than ever before .', 'No longer limited to statue of hero placed high on pedestal , contemporary memorial engage visitor in new , often surprising way , contributing to the liveliness of public space .', 'In Memorials as Spaces of Engagement Quentin Stevens and Karen A. Franck explore how change in memorial design and use have helped forge closer , richer relationship between commemorative site and their visitor .', 'The author combine first hand analysis of key example with material drawn from existing scholarship .', 'Example from the US , Canada , Australia and Europe include official , formally designed memorial and informal one , those created by the public without official sanction .', 'Memorial as Space of Engagement discus important issue for the design , management and planning of memorial and public space in general .', 'The book is organized around three topic : how the physical design of memorial object and space has evolved since the 19th century ; how people experience and understand memorial through the activity of commemorating , occupying and interpreting ; and the issue memorial raise for management and planning .', 'Memorial as Space of Engagement will be of interest to architect , landscape architect and artist ; historian of art , architecture and culture ; urban sociologist and geographer ; planner , policymakers and memorial sponsor ; and all those concerned with the design and use of public space .', 'Industrial Heritage : The past in the future of the city .', 'The concept of cultural heritage has clearly meant different thing to different group of scholar and the public interested in reclaiming tradition and cultural landscape .', "Change associated with urban growth often involve the destruction of built characteristic and natural element , eradicating the physical expression of former indigenous way of life that are a very important part of people 's culture .", 'This fact was particularly evident after the Second World War , when industrial landscape faced deep transformation that in several case contributed to its dereliction and to the disappearance of numerous industrial value , commonly known as industrial heritage .', "This phenomenon added to the necessity of reusing abandoned industrial landscape in detriment of consuming new one , increases the need to enlarge the interpretation of the term `` cultural heritage '' , to analyse and interpret the value and significance of post-industrial landscape and to develop new mechanism to preserve it .", "Furthermore , it is increasingly acknowledged that the value connected with culture and heritage are highly significant for people 's life and need to be identified and highlighted .", 'This paper presents a set of design principle that will be applied to the post-industrial landscape of left margin to the Arade River .', 'These principle describe in a general manner the way in which relevant resource created and deposited by the industrial society can be enhanced and how they can best be reclaimed and used .', 'Cultivating eco-sustainability : Social-economic-natural complex ecosystem case study in China .', 'This paper discusses ecological development in China based on the theory and methodology of SENCE ( social-economic-natural complex ecosystem ) , and two typical case study of Yangzhou city and Dafeng city.Ecological development in China refers to the integrative learning process , integrative design process , interactive adaptation process resulting in ecologically sound , economically productive and behaviorally feasible development .', 'Ecological development in China includes the ecological assessment/evaluation , ecological planning/design , ecological engineering and ecological management which require systematically responsible planning , totally functional design and ecologically vivid management .', 'Since several decade of year , different scale of ecological administrative unit including ecological county , ecopolis ( eco-cities ) and ecological province have been developed , which indicated that the process of ecological development helps local people to engage in a vision and action regarding how the urban or regional ecosystem are coupling systematically , vitalizing and functioning ecologically and how the action are connected with their social , economic and long-term ecological interest .', 'The constructive practice of ecopolis and eco-provinces in China has demonstrated this success.The key instrument for ecological development in China is the eco-integration of total metabolism of material and energy ; total cultivation of eco-industry , eco-scape and eco-culture ; total coordination of systematic coupling in time , space , quantity , structure and order ; total design of developmental goal of wealth , health and faith ; total cooperation between decision maker , entrepreneur , researcher and the public .', "The special emphasis of China 's ecological development has been placed on encouraging bottom-up and flexible action rather than top-down and rigid institution , and helping local people to help themselves through capacity building .", 'Traditional architectural form in market oriented Chinese city : Place for locality or symbol of culture ?', '.', 'China provides a unique social-economic and political context for urban conservation and regeneration within the current trend of modernisation and globalisation .', 'This paper investigates 4 urban regeneration project conducted in four most internationalised historical Chinese city from 1989 to 2005 , in order to understand how traditional architectural element are manipulated in these project .', 'It also examines the role local government , developer , designer and local resident played in these project in the intensification process of the market oriented economy over time .', 'The paper argues that socio-cultural sustainable regeneration of historical urban environment must make place for local people , rather than preserve certain traditional form as cultural symbol .', 'Tradition must evolve by the collective and traditional form must be widely used in architectural and urban design with community involvement , in order to achieve real cultural identity and social cohesion .', 'Generating sustainable town from Chinese village : A system modeling approach .', "The great majority of China 's developing town will be extension of already existing village .", 'With the prospect of hundred of million of Chinese farmer projected to leave their village to become industrial worker in new and expanded town within the next few year , new challenge will be faced .', 'As expansion and modernization progress , this development moves from the traditional village model that operates not far from resource sustainability to increasingly unsustainable pattern of commerce , urban development , and modern life .', 'With such an unprecedented mass migration and transformation , how can Chinese culture survive ?', 'What is to become of the existing million plus agricultural village ?', 'How can these massively unsustainable new industrial town survive ?', 'In the European Commission sponsored research program SUCCESS , researcher worked from the scale of the Chinese village to find viable answer to these question .', 'To address these issue , the Center for Sustainable Cities , one of the SUCCESS team , studied the metabolism of several small village .', "In these study , system dynamic model of a village 's metabolism were created and then modified so that inherently unsustainable mean were eliminated from the model ( fossil fuel , harmful agricultural chemical , etc . )", 'and replaced by sustainability-oriented mean .', 'Small Chinese farming village are unlikely to survive in anything like their present form or scale , not least because they are too small to provide the range of life opportunity to which the young generation of educated Chinese aspires .', 'As a response to this realization as well as to the many other threat to the Chinese village and its rural way of life , it was proposed that one viable path into the future would be to enlarge the village to become full service town with sufficient diversity of opportunity to be able to attract and keep many of the best and brightest young people who are now migrating to the larger city .', 'Starting with the village in its sustainability-oriented model form , the village model would be enlarged both quantitatively and qualitatively through many trial iteration .', 'A research program is described whereby an operational definition of the sustainable city is developed as a means of creating these enlarged model through citizen participation assisted by outside expert using software under development called the Sustainability Engine™ to guide the process and provide feedback as to the consequence of various proposal that are brought to the table .', 'As this process is continued , the village would be incrementally enlarged and made more diverse and more complex through a variety of scenario until it would emerge as a modern , sustainable town or city .', 'In this way , through a participatory , balance-seeking civil society process involving villager and scientist in what the Center for Sustainable Cities calls the Sustainable City Game , the village can become the DNA for generating future sustainable Chinese town and city .', 'As an extension of this discussion , a new urban model , the Sustainable City-as-a-Hill , is presented that responds to both the quality of the traditional Chinese village as well as to the modern demand of industrial and post-industrial economy and , in particular , to the need for sustainable urban pattern .', 'In addition a new concept , the Sustainable Area Budget ( SAB ) is introduced which definitively creates the boundary condition for both modeling the sustainable city and presenting the quest for the sustainable city-region as a coherent , scientific design process .', 'Singapore in transition : From technology to culture hub .', 'Purpose - This paper aims to present an approach to the knowledge-based economy that focuses on the developmental synergy between technology ( especially information and communication technology ) , culture and place ( hub ) as expressed in the innovative milieu of the inner city .', 'Design/methodology/approach - This paper draws on research in city and urban planning , which emphasizes the importance of quality of a place , location or city and the more intentional emphasis given to development of human and cultural resource , which are conducive to innovation , learning , creativity and change in a knowledge-based economy .', 'Finding - Singapore is chosen as a case study of analysis for a knowledge-based economy in transition because of its developmental approach and strategic shift from one focused on technology-intensive sector to one focused on high knowledge-intensive company and towards a free-spirited dynamic creative hub in the making .', 'It displays many characteristic typical of a knowledge-based economy in which people , their idea and capability are the key source of wealth and opportunity .', "Practical implication - The paper observes a missing link in the transition from technology to knowledge to culture hub , which might have implication for Singapore 's effort towards establishing itself as a cultural industry metropolis , a renaissance city using culture to re-position its international image as a global city for the art .", "Originality/value - The originality and value of the paper lie in this analysis , which makes one conclude that , although Singapore 's developmental model had created benefit in many way , it had also negatively constrained its development , particularly in the area of knowledge creation and application to entrepreneurship , innovation and creativity .", 'Key concept in event management .', 'In recent year we have seen an enormous growth of festival and event activity and the literature within the field is consequently huge .', 'In order to make sense of this rapid and dynamic comprehensive and illuminating account of the festival and event field .', 'Written with academic rigour yet accessible at the same time , Quinn proves herself to be an outstanding communicator and
