this area of research .', 'This study , acting as a kind of test of the research , can not be considered representative .', 'Nevertheless , the analysis prompts several reflection on the current and future role of the built environment in the development of our civilisation , as well as further challenge related to it .', 'Borrowing from the past to sustain the present and the future : indigenous African urban form , architecture , and sustainable urban development in contemporary Africa .', 'Urban spatial expansion resulting from urbanization in Sub-Saharan Africa ( SSA ) is not going to stop or stabilize in the near future .', 'Effort should therefore be concentrated on accommodating this phenomenon through the promotion of sustainable urban planning and development .', 'Relying on secondary data , this paper examines model of indigenous African urban form and architecture to understand these form and their characteristic , and how these model and associated management , design , and planning principle can be adopted in contemporary SSA urban development in the quest to achieve sustainable urban development .', 'This paper argues that planning is culturally and contextually defined and the specificity of a place are critical in planning .', "Developing strategy based on indigenous urban form which embody local people ' culture , aspiration , experience , and value is consistent with the concept of sustainable urban development .", 'The article concludes that there exist clear element of socially , politically , economically , culturally , and environmentally sound and responsive sustainable planning principle to be derived from indigenous urban form and architecture which can inform current urban development process in SSA .', "Colonial laboratory , irreparable subject : The experiment of ' ( b ) ordering ' San Juan 's public housing resident .", 'This article provides a genealogy of the discourse that shaped the public housing policy of the mid-twentieth century in the US island colony of Puerto Rico .', "In the 1950s and 1960s , a conversation arose between government official , social science expert , and the local press about how to fix social inequality by 'ordering ' mostly black and mulato , economically dispossessed family residing in shantytown and barrio .", "This led to the establishment of caseríos ( housing project ) as place where the government would attempt to 'modernize ' resident through architectural design , planning , and social betterment program .", 'Because the caseríos did not address the structural cause of inequality of power and wealth in the island , they failed in lifting resident out of poverty .', "From the mid-1960s onwards , a host of writing blamed caserío dweller for the failure of the project , attributing it to their purportedly dysfunctional - and nearly incorrigible - 'culture of poverty ' .", "This perpetuated a particular characterization of Puerto Rican economically dispossessed people as incapable of political or social agency without the guidance of elite Puerto Ricans and the 'benevolent ' American colonial metropolis .", "It also led to the subsequent 'bordering ' of caseríos space with wall and checkpoint , which in turn reproduced the branding of public housing resident as irreparably dysfunctional and 'criminal ' .", 'Contradiction across space-time and language ideology in northern arapaho language shift .', 'In 1878 , when the federal government relocated the Northern Arapaho tribe to the Wind River Reservation in Wyoming , all of the approximately eight hundred member were fluent in their indigenous language .', 'Most were also fluent in Plains Indian sign language , some in one or more neighboring language , and only several in English .', 'By 2005 less than approximately 7 percent of the more than six thousand member of the tribe remained fluent in Arapaho .', 'As Salzmann ( 1998:287 ) confirms , language shift has progressed to what can be defined as an irreversible stage .', 'At present all remaining fluent speaker are bilingual and member of at least the grandparental generation .', 'The age discrepancy in fluency varies with family and individual childrearing contexts , but only several people under the age of seventy remain fluent .', 'Today , all child acquire English as their first language .', 'In all social domain English predominates except in educational contexts for language renewal , ceremonial speech , and occasional interaction among elder .', 'When elder are together they sporadically switch to Arapaho but generally only for a few exchange as a speech event unfolds .', 'Despite concerted effort over the past twentyfive year , language renewal program have produced no fluent speaker among younger generation student studying it as a second language in formal educational contexts .', 'In the Northern Arapaho speech community the process of language shift over the past seventy year , and more recent effort in the past three decade to reverse it , have been concomitant with a proliferation of competing and converging language ideology .', 'During the same history the Wind River Reservation social landscape and temporal order have changed dramatically .', 'During my first continuous field study of 1988-94 I participated in many language and cultural education program and was thus daily immersed in discourse articulating these ideology .', 'As Arapaho people talked about element or the whole of language ( s ) , I came to realize that the ideology expressed were effort to understand and resolve contradiction generated by the dramatically changing environment beyond language itself .', 'Older fluent speaker today comment , often with a profound sense of loss , that they have few opportunity in their daily life to speak Arapaho with others .', 'With modern ordering of space-time , the vast majority of elder live in nuclear or extended domestic social space in which they are the single speaker or only one among several fluent senior relative .', 'Those who participate in interview and educational program often mentioned to me that they looked forward to such rare time to speak the language and connect with others in their own generation .', "As many observe , language shift is not just a demographic process of declining number of speaker but also a process of contracting `` domain '' of usage ( Fishman 1972:440-53 ) or site of cultural production ( Silverstein 1998b:138 ) .", 'Language or speech does not , however , construct the social space and time of its use sui generis .', 'As I explain elsewhere ( Anderson 1998:51-52 ) , domains themselves are equally constituted by the interdimensionality of time and space on a number of level .', 'The socially constructed space and time orientation in which Arapaho people live , such as ceremony , home , school , political discourse , and economic activity , have all changed significantly in history , both in the way sites reproduce social relation internally and in the speech practice that link the domain together .', "Borrowing a useful term from Giddens , it is insightful to examine speech practice and reflective ideology relative to `` time-space zone '' as individual and group move through `` time-space path '' ( 1987:146 ) in daily life and trajectory of larger extension , such as the annual calendar , life cycle , and family history .", 'What is needed is more attention in anthropology to the way community change their speech practice in response to constructed change in the physical and social environment .', 'Built environment can enhance or inhibit any social practice , whether by design or unintentionally ( Lawrence and Low 1990:461 ) .', "More generally , as Harvey recognizes , imposed order of space and time are the principal apparatus of `` conquest , imperial expansion , and neocolonial domination '' ( 1990:419 ) .", 'Following Foucault ( 1984:252 ) , it can be said that government exert power through built form in a process of canalization , the control of the flow and distribution of individual body in space .', "With respect to time , Munn states , `` Control over time is not just a strategy of interaction ; it is a medium of hierarchic power and governance '' ( 1992:109 ) .", 'Top-down-imposed order of space and time were alien to indigenous people and as a whole were the primary apparatus for transforming the system of social reproduction , including language and culture .', 'It is therefore essential to examine way Arapaho people have tried to appropriate those structure , construct new structure , or adapt traditional one to invent or sustain language and culture .', 'In Native American history , dominant ideology and their instantiation in local space-time orientation have never been coherently hegemonic .', "Approach to language ideology must steer theory away from reified social force or hegemony toward an understanding of competing and historically shifting ideology , which Friedrich defines as `` pragmatic ideology '' ( 1989:300-302 ) , grounded in the particular , concrete practice in local , socially constructed space and time orientation .", 'Rather than blending , though , Euro-American oppressive and progressive ideology have generated enduring contradiction in a hybridized chaos unique to the space-time of reservation community in the United States .', 'Wind River , like other reservation , is largely a constructed environment ( Lawrence and Low 1990 ) always in the making and remaking , shaped by state policy that shift precipitously among competing , evolving ideology that never congeal into a coherent or uniform system of thought qualifying as hegemony any group can embrace or resist in total .', "Thus , Arapaho language has shifted to English in a history in which , as Althusser recognized , `` the locus of confrontation may vary according to the relation of the contradiction in the structure in dominance in any given situation '' ( 1969:215-16 ) .", 'Dominant language ideology are therefore neither wholly uniform nor explicitly durable within a speech community undergoing shift .', 'At one level , language shift on reservation took place in a social space-time different from that of other group , such as urban or transnational immigrant ethnic group .', 'State-sponsored shifting utopian model in reservation history have resulted in a local heterotopian space-time ( Foucault 1986 ) .', 'The contradiction between utopian mission of integration and heterotopian reality of sequestration provides the material for many local language ideology .', 'As discussed below in more detail , Arapaho language ideology negotiate but never resolve the contradiction between a utopian language renewal mission and the objective reality of shift as an irreversible process , between the utopian model of Euro-American education as the universalizable solution to all problem and the impoverished local political economy , and between idealized nostalgic purism within Arapaho ideology and the proliferation of modern technology and bureaucratic apparatus of communication and governance .', 'In the relatively new study of language shift there has been a tendency to remain unreflexive about the social scientific ideological ground and spatiotemporal construction that support it ( Collins 1998:259 ) .', "To borrow Phillipson 's term , model of shift are often `` bedeviled by myth and binary over-simplifications '' ( 1992:23 ) .", "Today there is no permanent , closed , `` us versus them '' border to contest , no singular Euro-American ideology set against a singular Arapaho language ideology , and there probably never has been .", 'Beginning in the 1880s , for example , competing Euro-American ideology approached the Arapaho speech community with contradictory purpose , such that repression reigned in some time-space zone , while acceptance and even valorization applied in others .', 'In the mission boarding school at St. Stephens child were barred from speaking Arapaho in the classroom , but in chapel the priest and brother spoke Arapaho with the aim of conversion .', 'By the 1890s and early 1900s other Euro-americans arrived to research the very language and culture that federal agent sought to eradicate .', 'Dimension of space and time interrelate to define language ideology in four correlative way , which I explore in the rest of this chapter .', "First , competing dominant culture ideology have imposed order of space and time on the reservation as solution to the `` Indian problem , '' reflecting a range of dominant ideology toward American Indians , from extreme racism to progressive compassion .", "Beginning with the first relation , as Deloria suggests , `` It is debatable which factor was most important in the destruction of tribal ceremonial life : The prohibition of performance of traditional ritual by the government , or the introduction of white man 's system of keeping time '' ( 1985:18 ) .", 'The same statement applies if language prohibition is inserted and the effect of time for restructuring space appended .', 'It is not enough to situate language loss and ideological frame about it in the narrow space , policy , or historical moment wherein Arapaho language has been openly repressed .', 'Art , culture and ambiguity in Wilcannia , New South Wales .', 'The claim of most town white that Aboriginal people of Wilcanni make art but have no culture and the claim by Aboriginal people of the town that their art work and art design demonstrate their culture and cultural tradition opens up the powerful and productive dimension of art and culture for closer scrutiny .', 'In so doing , the ambivalence and ambiguity which saturates these category is ethnographically revealed .', 'How can the presence and production of artwork in Wilcannia and the white denial of culture be considered ?', 'Why indeed do these question matter , in what way do they matter , and to whom do they matter ?', 'How do the category of traditional/remote , urban/settled and their avatar intersect with black and white notion of Aboriginal art and Aboriginal culture discursively and experientially ?', '.', 'Bioregioning : Pathway to Urban-Rural Reconnection .', 'There is a metabolic rift running through our economy and culture , and it is distracting our attention from care for the biosphere .', 'To heal this rift , the diverse group of people that make up humankind need a shared purpose that everyone can relate to and support .', 'A strong candidate for that shared purpose is care for the bioregion—bioregioning—as an activity that creates value .', 'In this article , I present a number of design action and case study that demonstrate how design can contribute to system change , for example via the reconnection of urban and rural ecosystem , the design of social infrastructure that enable the emergence of new enterprise , and the deployment of technology .', 'Eliciting cultural heritage value : landscape preference vs representative image of the city .', 'Purpose : In 2011 , UNESCO recommended the application of a value-based landscape approach to cultural heritage conservation .', 'In this framework , culture in its manifold expression is considered as an embrace for the social , economic , and environmental pillar of sustainable development .', 'There is a need to unveil the different cultural value generated from the interaction between people and their environment since these value will help city maintain their unique identity and integrity .', 'Accordingly , the purpose of this paper is to present the result of a survey method intended to assess the range of cultural value attributed by people to the historic urban landscape ( HUL ) .', 'Design/methodology/approach : This paper is an experimental enquiry that combines a qualitative and a quantitative approach .', 'It is designed to distinguish the different interpretation and outlook of people to the HUL .', 'It integrates landscape preference study with investigation on representative image of the city and assesses these in relation to activity , feeling , and valued aspect of landscape .', 'Finding : The main finding is that the most preferred scene of the city are not the one that best represent the city .', 'Result exposed two side of the HUL and related heritage value .', 'The first is associated with the scenic beauty of the landscape and its aesthetic value , while the second is reflected in ordinary landscape and everyday practice .', 'Originality/value : This paper provides an insight into the different interpretation and meaning of the HUL throughout the city .', 'It provides an empirical evidence that ordinary landscape are of great heritage value as they surpass all aspect of human environmental interaction to contribute to the image that society make of themselves .', 'Pocket Park : Product Urban design .', "Pocket Park , small area that can make up for the emptiness , abandonment and no function of many space that are located within our city , triggering process of urban regeneration through the discovery of a new `` life '' and a new potentiality to accommodate .", 'This must be rediscovered and brought to light so as to realize and perceive a different urban imaginary .', "A product of urban interior design that is confronted with large courtyard : room without roof , this product can improve the quality of everyday life , designed to be together and to know the other 's culture , where the confrontation between people is based on the sharing of the common space , living outdoors to accommodate people and make them feel like `` home '' , and together with the people .. with all the other .", 'Published by Informa UK Limited , trading as Taylor & Francis Group .', "The restaurateur as a sustainability pedagogue : the case of Stuart Gifford and Sarah 's Sister 's Sustainable Café .", "With the popularity of celebrity chef , television cooking show , gastronomic holiday and food festival , it is clear that people 's engagement with food is developing into a significant social phenomena .", 'People are searching for way to secure sustainable and ethical food and are open to learning new possibility .', 'This article provides a case study analysis of the work of Stuart Gifford , a long-term sustainability advocate , restaurateur and urban activist .', "Gifford currently is co-owner of Sarah 's Sister 's Sustainable Café .", 'This restaurant features sustainability in the design principle and management of the enterprise .', "Gifford 's commitment to sustainability advocacy and teaching permeates not only the business but is also a life commitment as he undertakes initiative such as fostering an external eco-market , creating sustainability event associated with a major metropolitan festival , community activism and political advocacy .", "This article analyses the import of Gifford 's effort .", 'Employing a qualitative research methodology , this article presents rich insight into the way in which running a sustainable café can be read as a cultural pedagogy .', "Employing Giroux 's theory of culture as pedagogy , Gifford 's work through Sarah 's Sister 's is considered as an alternative cultural pedagogy intended to counter the destructive pedagogy of neoliberalism and its attendant cultural value .", 'Mexico-City , sustainability and culture : A plea for hybrid sustainability for a baroque and labyrinthine city .', "This article focuses on Mexico City 's sustainability plan and politics , as well as some related art project and practice .", 'Where Mexico City was declared the most polluted city of the world in 1992 , it is now known for its very pro-active environmental politics and related initiative .', 'At the same time the city is gaining attention as a cultural city and hosts a growing creative class .', 'The article shows how these two , sustainability and the cultural/creative , are interrelated in various way .', "In one way the city 's sustainable policy reinforced the gentrification process of the city 's historic center .", "In another way the cultural elite respond to the city 's activity in sustainability in term of an increased interest in eco-artistic project .", 'In a third way the article shows how the introduction of the Western concept of sustainability is problematic in a Latin American cultural context .', 'It runs the risk of - again - reinforcing the existing cleavage between well-educated Western oriented elite on the one hand and the mestizo mass and indigenous people on the other hand .', 'Moreover it disregards the fact that Latin America has a fundamentally different kind of modernity and culture that can be labeled as labyrinthine , baroque or hybrid .', 'The Western concept of sustainability most probably will not function within such a culture , a reason why the article makes a plea for the design of a concept of hybrid sustainability ( or sustainability ) that match the characteristic of the Latin American reality in general and the reality of Mexico City in particular .', 'Transfiguring the postsocialist city : Experimental image-making in contemporary China .', 'Shanghai in Sixty Years ( Liushi nianhou Shanghai tan ) is a long forgotten futuristic comedy made in the besieged Shanghai of 1938 .', "According to an extant synopsis , at the beginning of the film two men find themselves suddenly in a Shanghai of 1998 , following an evening out in the dancehall cut short by their annoyed wife , who promptly placed them `` in the doghouse , '' in the attic .", 'They fall into a long sleep .', 'In the dreamscape they find themselves in a future Shanghai stranger than paradise , with flying car and apartment where interior design is instantaneously changeable by remote control .', 'The most shocking change is that people no longer have name but are identified by number .', 'This popular science-fiction comedy from old Shanghai is not my main concern here .', "But the surprisingly accurate prophecy on the ubiquity of remote control and digitalized personal identity provides a unique entry point for `` traveling '' to the present-day postsocialist Chinese city .", 'Indeed , the universal adoption of ID number for Chinese citizen is recent , coinciding with the erosion of the socialist structure ( in particular the strict city residence registration , or hukou , system ) and of rural-urban boundary .', "Hence the adoption of IDs parallels the unprecedented physical and social mobility of million of Chinese , forming a gigantic `` floating population '' ( liudong renkou ) .", "That the two men taken for dead by their family emerge intact from a futuristic construction site , along with the prescient reference to digitalization and virtuality , inspire reflection on the changing nature of temporality and body in the context of frenzied urbanization in China today , especially in Shanghai - where the film unfolds in the `` present '' as well as `` future '' tense .", "The film 's interest in both the utopic and dystopic potential of technology and its impact on the human body is also relevant to the place of cinema in the so-called `` post-material '' and `` posthuman '' condition today.1 In the last decade of the twentieth century - the ambivalent locus of desire for the 1930s film - an art movement traversing experimental and documentary film , video art , photography , and performance has emerged with much creative energy in metropolitan center such as Shanghai , Beijing , and Guangzhou .", "This new generation of artist place themselves right `` on the scene '' ( xianchang ) to record the momentous shift in the physical and mental topography of China in the country 's headlong rush toward a quasi-capitalist economy and culture .", 'What are the distinctive feature of the metropolitan imagination created by this nascent movement deploying , or rather blending , old and new medium ?', 'In what manner do these image-makers , who grew up in the socialist period , engage with memory of the past and the post-revolutionary condition while fashioning provisional design for living the seismically shifting reality ?', 'More crucially , how do these experiment exploit the changing nature of the photographic or cinematic image for alternative social and cultural vision , as China is propelled onto the information highway and the full-speed lane of globalization ?', "This tentative study aims to make sense of an array of still and moving image about performing ( in ) the city and explore way for understanding their producer ' obsessive experimentation between stasis and motion , between real and virtual time , and between the documentary and the fantastical register of time and image .", "I call this performative play with both image and body , in a variety of cinematic and paracinematic form , a `` transcinematic passage '' cutting through the postsocialist and post-cinematic landscape .", 'Latino design in an age of neoliberal multiculturalism : Contemporary change in Latin/o American urban cultural representation .', 'This article considers an emerging shift in Latino cultural politics of design representation and urbanism .', 'To illustrate this shift , I include interview with designer whose imaginative and geographic location across the Americas have fostered a global attitude that challenges previous Latino design that follow nationalist cultural politics of differentiation and are shaped by neoliberal multicultural imperative .', 'This article serves as an analytical study for scholar interested in understanding the way in which cultural difference is included in a creative industry that has a large role to play in the configuration , evaluation , and theorization of poor , urban , and ethnic space .', 'In particular , this article stimulates a debate about the different mode of incorporating Latino culture in design and generates future discussion on how to achieve more inclusive urban representation .', 'Home and away : Mental geography of young migrant worker and their belonging to the family house in Northern Ghana .', 'In Northern Ghana migration is of topical interest since an increasing number of young men and woman move towards the southern city in response to harsh economic and climatic condition in the northern region .', 'Large part of the compound house are abandoned .', "During their absence or upon their return the migrant build new room in expensive material and with new design , as witness of their partaking in a larger , so-called 'modern ' world .", 'In this paper I focus on seasonal as well as permanent national migration among the Kasena people .', 'I explicitly take up the point of view of those who stay behind in the homeland .', 'Field research was carried out in the rural area of the Upper East Region of Ghana .', 'This contribution discusses the migratory movement in the light of mental geography and their socio-cultural and material implication for dwelling and belonging in rural compound house .', 'Adaptive strategy for water heritage : Past , present and future .', 'This Open Access book , building on research initiated by scholar from the Leiden-Delft-Erasmus Centre for Global Heritage and Development ( CHGD ) and ICOMOS Netherlands , presents multidisciplinary research that connects water to heritage .', 'Through twenty-one chapter it explores landscape , city , engineering structure and building from around the world .', 'It describes how people have actively shaped the course , form and function of water for human settlement and the development of civilization , establishing socio-economic structure , policy and culture ; a rich world of narrative , law and practice ; and an extensive network of infrastructure , building and urban form .', 'The book is organized in five thematic section that link practice of the past to the design of the present and vision of the future : Part I discusses drinking water management ; part II addresses water use in agriculture ; part III explores water management for land reclamation and defense ; part IV examines river and coastal planning ; and part V focuses on port city and waterfront regeneration .', 'Today , the many complex system of the past are necessarily the basis for new system that both preserve the past and manage water today : Policy maker and designer can work together to recognize and build on the traditional knowledge and skill that old structure embody .', 'This book argues that there is a need for a common agenda and an integrated policy that addresses the preservation , transformation and adaptive reuse of historic water-related structure .', 'Throughout , it imagines how such effort will help us develop sustainable future for city , landscape and body of water .', 'Cultural and Religious Perspective on the Sufi Shrines .', 'This paper explains the Sufi shrine which hold great importance in Pakistani society .', 'The Shrines inhabit a vital position in the cultural and social as well as religious and culture life of ritual , Saint , traditional belief , sounds , trance , dance , music in ethnic healing , and spiritual illness/disease .', 'It is not only a place of belief and devotion based on Sufi shrine but a place where Muslims and non-Muslim take part in happiness activity together .', 'The design and architecture of the Sufi Shrines have local as well as worldwide influence , representative spiritual , belief system , economic , and esthetic dimension of Muslim social institute .', 'Therefore , Muslims ’ association with the Sufi Shrines has much importance from traditional , political , social and economic perspective .', 'Centered on an ethnographic illustration , this research aims to highlight the use of Sufi Shrines space and Peoples ’ Perceptions about Visiting Sufi shrine in the ethnic perspective of rural and urban Sindh .', 'In addition to discuss the socio spatial interaction about the Sufi shrine , this study has discovered that majority of the people and visitor have strong belief system upon the blessing of Sufis and they visit shrine to fulfill their social , economic , physical , mental and spiritual wish .', 'Story of creative ageing .', 'Purpose - The purpose of this paper is to highlight some of the benefit and issue relating to art participation in later life .', "Design/methodology/approach - The paper draws on literature relating to older people 's art participation , and also includes discussion of the author 's doctoral research into art and ageing .", 'The research was a qualitative study , influenced by narrative approach and life-course perspective .', 'It involved interview with 24 participant who have connection with a case-study town in the English Midlands .', 'Finding - The paper focuses on the finding from six participant belonging to a male voice choir .', 'The theme that are discussed include the importance of continuity ; issue of identity ; mutual support ; impact of ill health and the sustainability of group activity .', 'Research limitations/implications - This is a small-scale study , based in one case study town .', 'Care should therefore be taken in generalising to different population and area .', 'Potential for future research includes : other geographical location , including larger urban area .', 'Specific focus on choir participation , or other art form .', 'Involving people from a wider range of ethnic background .', 'Social implication - This study adds to a growing body of evidence about the value of art and culture to society .', 'Originality/value - This study is original in adopting life-course perspective to understand later life art participation .', 'It also offers original insight into the nature of arts-generated social capital and how this may be viewed within a wider context of resourceful ageing .', 'Housing in postwar Japan : A social history .', 'Radical change in the design of housing in post-war Japan had numerous effect on the Japanese people .', 'Public policy toward housing provision and the effect of escalating land price in Tokyo and a few other very large city in the country from the mid- to late 1970s onward are examined , but it is dwellings themselves and the slow but steady shift from a floor-sitting to a chair-sitting housing culture in urban and suburban part of the country that figure most prominently in the discussion .', "Central to the book is the author 's translation of an account written by Kyoko Sasaki , an observant wife and mother , about the housing she and her growing family experienced during the 1960s , and subsequent chapter explore some of the issue that flow from her account .", 'Chief among these are the small size and generally poor quality of the private-sector housing that Japanese of fairly ordinary mean could afford to occupy in the early postwar year , the new design initiatives undertaken at about that time by public-sector housing provider and the diffusion of at least some of their initiative to the housing sector as a whole , and the adjustment that the occupant of housing had to , or chose to , make as the dwelling available to them as renter or as owner changed in character .', 'Attention is also paid to the structural requirement of dwelling and attitude toward dwelling of diverse type in a country prone to earthquake .', 'Rethinking urban design for a changing public life .', 'Purpose – The nature and conceptualization of public space and public life have been always associated with collective participation and socialization – in other word , the capacity to live together among stranger .', 'Today these association seem to have become challenged and problematic , and often end in questioning whether public space still matter for our public life ?', 'This paper aims to bring new understanding to the reading of public life in public space and also contribute to rethinking of the role of urban design today within our changing public life .', 'Design/methodology/approach – The paper adopts participant/observation within a case/study area , “ Parque das Nações ” , in Lisbon , Portugal .', 'Finding – The paper identifies a number of spatial , social and experiential condition that are conducive to social interaction amongst stranger .', 'Often it is the combination of three factor that generates the most interaction .', 'Research limitations/implications – Participant observation is a useful method to study public behaviour in the public realm .', 'Nevertheless , as the study was conducted in one location , the finding may not be transferable to other locations/cultures , etc .', 'Practical implication – This paper demonstrates the need to rethink and adapt urban design practice to an increasing changing public life .', 'Urban design needs to be much more sensitive to all location ( planned and unplanned ) and the favourable spatial , experiential and social condition people make use of and which can provoke positive interaction need to be recognised .', 'Social implication A better understanding of the factor that are conducive to positive interaction between stranger and non/strangers in the public realm will help to develop more favourable condition for these to take place .', 'The interaction between people is part of the fabric of social life .', 'Originality/value – This is the first paper to combine social/spatial and experiential factor in the observation of social interaction in public place .', 'Participatory place-making in the renewal of post-Communist large prefabricated housing estate : Újpalota case study , Budapest .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to introduce a Central-European perspective into the international discussion of the participatory place-making .', 'The research focuses on the renewal of the large prefabricated housing estate , dominant type of urban housing in the area where after the privatisation process resident-owners own only a so-called floating plot under their block .', 'In total , 80 per cent of the land of the whole neighbourhood remains public .', 'The question is how participatory place-making work in this specific urban , social and cultural situation ?', 'Design/methodology/approach : By introducing the topic from a theoretical point of view , the study is based on research conducted in Budapest ’ s Újpalota Housing Estate .', 'Fieldwork , project analysis and interview uncover the complexity of this Hungarian case where appropriation of resident , municipality and European social regeneration project are simultaneously present with different type of participatory method .', 'Finding : The majority of real change in Újpalota – as well as in housing estate of post-Communist country in general – are led by individual or common appropriation that sometimes becomes convincing participation .', 'This informal transformation of the built or natural environment can create a small sense of place everywhere .', 'At the same time , it can work against the architectural and urban character of a neighbourhood or a building , rendering a feeling of disorder .', 'Originality/value : The paper based on this Hungarian case shows that the real culture of participatory place-making is still missing in post-Communist context , and despite some good example , the majority of people are inactive , waiting for change to be made by leader .', 'An experiential approach to differentiating tourism offer in cultural heritage .', 'Nowadays , many tourist are in search of active holiday and engaging , emotionally , physically , socially , psychologically and/or spiritually authentic experience , rejecting mass tourism and standardised package .', 'In addition , tourist increasingly devise their holiday with the aim of learning , self-development and making contact with the local population .', 'Due to the postmodern commodi ?', 'cation of culture , visitor ’ experience with cultural heritage require innovation and adaptation in order to order them unique and meaningful personal event rather than the former passive activity .', 'All around the world , numerous museum , heritage site and cultural venue are now working in this direction , introducing new visitor model .', 'Memorable visiting experience can be designed in museum and at heritage site , not only for the segment of traditional demand but also for new one which , in general , include younger guest .', 'It is a way to transform cultural heritage into an ‘ experiencescape ’ ( O ’ Dell and Billing 2005 ) - a place of enjoyment , socialisation , pleasure , emotion and amusement , offering visitor different kind of valuable tourism , educational , cultural and entertainment experience .', 'In post-modern society , consumer , who are continuously in search of emotion and subjective and personalised consumption , do not demand good and service , but memorable , unique , holistic and engaging experience with a high symbolic content ( Holbrook and Hirschman 1982 ; Addis and Holbrook 2001 ) .', 'The customer is not only buying a good , but also service and information , experience and culture ( Rifkin 2000 ) , and wish to have an active role during their consumption ( Prentice 2001 ) .', 'This means that ffrms must be increasingly dedicated to trying to order experience-based product , which can engage the customer emotionally , physically , mentally , socially and/or spiritually ( O ’ Sullivan and Spangler 1998 ; Pine and Gilmore 1999 ; Fabris 2003 : 203 ; Argano and Dalla Sega 2009 ) .', 'Therefore , there is now much more emphasis than in the past on sound and music , scentsand fragrance , atmosphere , colour and image , taste and interactivity to enrich good and service .', 'For example , it is common practice to use music in location to make the visit more pleasant and more memorable ( Krishna 2010 : 149 ) .', 'Colours , fragrance and light can have a similar impact .', 'Sometimes the deprivation of one sense is used to exalt others .', 'This is the case of Dialogo al Buio , an exhibition held using route to be followed in complete darkness , accompanied by expert non-sighted guide , to experience new and unexpected emotion that amplify the perception of touch , smell and taste .', 'Pine and Gilmore ( 1999 ) have identified four different experience sphere on the basis of two parameter , the ( active or passive ) involvement of the guest and the type of relationship between the customer and the experience ( which involves absorption , in other word physical or virtual involvement , and immersion , in other word mental involvement ) .', 'These four sphere , which are called entertainment , education , escapism and the aesthetic experience , are not opposed to one another , but on the contrary are often mixed and lead to global , subjective , unique and tailored experience .', 'The best experience are , in any case , those in which the visitor , by taking an active part , is completely immersed in the situation that they are experiencing .', 'This requires the involvement of the five sens or the order of something memorable ( Smith 2009 : 188 ) .', 'Generally , provider tend to order a mixture of experience that are judged more complete if enhanced by all four component .', 'An example of this is Emozioni da Museo , an initiative at Palazzo Vecchio in Florence , which is described in the case study in this chapter ( Box 48.1 ) .', 'Therefore , experience that mix entertainment and education ( ‘ edutainment ’ ) , shopping ( ‘ shoppertainment ’ ) , or eating ( ‘ eatertainment ’ ) are increasingly common .', 'Tourism agency , private and public body and destination are also making an effort to offer event , packaging and atmosphere , involving physical setting , extravaganzas ( Ritzer 1999 ) , sensory design and other differentiating element , which allow tourist to enjoy meaningful experience and create positive attitude in them .', 'Continuous ‘ re-enchantment ’ process ( Baudrillard 1993 ; Bauman 1993 : 33 ) aim to make the ‘ cathedral of consumption ’ even more magical , fascinating or fantastic .', 'These are place where process related to the purchase , supply , consumption and/or use of good and service are undertaken , and are often important tourist attraction , destination or infrastructure , such as retail centre , theme park , museum and archaeological site , etc .', '( Ritzer 2005 : 68 ) .', 'Frequently they become multipurpose container which simultaneously satisfy different need ( entertainment , socialising , shopping , education , eating , etc . )', '.', 'For example , museum often have an increasing range of support and auxiliary service that offer highly engaging experience , which are sometimes unique and unforgettable , thanks to themed setting , event , atmosphere , tactile sensation , colour and image , sound , fragrance , virtual reality , multi-sensory stimulus , theatre piece , workshop and operator performing as actor in the setting .', 'In some case the ‘ cathedral of consumption ’ are symbol of Western culture that have been exported and sold in other country , as has been happening for some year with museum and art gallery , which are reproduced in multiple location ( such as the Guggenheim Museum which is now present , besides New York , in Bilbao , Berlin , Las Vegas , Venice and Abu Dhabi ) .', 'All this entails risk of mass reproduction of culture and art and the search for perfect imitation - in other word , the ‘ McDisneyisation ’ of culture , which is feared by expert in the sector , who are afraid that museum and cultural heritage are becoming the new theme park ( Swarbrooke 2000 ) .', 'Nowadays , the field of museum and cultural heritage is greatly affected by shift in demand and supply .', 'In particular , there is increased competition to access ever-shrinking fund .', 'Moreover , there has been an increase in consumer ’ attention towards the quality of their leisure enjoyment .', 'Furthermore , museum and heritage site are frequently considered as institution that can trigger virtuous process of urban renewal .', 'All this has fostered the development of cultural consumption , but , at the same time , has increased visitor ’ expectation and need .', 'In fact , consumer today are not only interested in satisfying their need for learning , but also wish to have more engaging type of experience .', 'In particular , there appears to be a strong demand for experience providing inner growth and self-development in social , cultural , intellectual and emotional term ( Doering 1999 ) .', 'Thus , the role of these institution is changing , also due to the commodification of culture and to the merging of high and low culture in the post-modern era .', 'They are trying to increase visitor attendance also by attracting new segment ( especially family and young people ) .', 'It can be claimed that for all these reason , heritage venue and cultural site now ought to modify their image and their offer to become more market-oriented and to create more engaging visit .', 'In fact , cultural heritage and ‘ museum are essentially experiential product ’ ( Prentice 1996 ) , and smell , colour , sounds , animation and interaction are potentially part of this product ( Prentice 2001 ) .', 'Currently , significant effort in this sense have been made above all by science museum , in which ‘ edutainment ’ and the need to make the visit engaging and fun , as well as instructive , for the youngest visitor and for school group as well , has already seen a significant effort in this direction for a number of year .', 'The role of cultural heritage today is broader , and safeguarding it requires growth in demand and adequate management to enable the public to perceive its value and the need to protect it .', 'There are numerous tool now available to management to achieve the above aim , by guaranteeing visitor not only learning experience , but also entertainment , excitement and time for contemplation ( Kotler and Kotler 1999 : 187 ) .', 'In this regard , it is interesting to note that in recent year a growing number of expert have been addressing the issue of multi-sensoriality in tourism , which in the past was overlooked in favour of the sole sense of sight .', 'In particular , the latest edition of the book The Tourist Gaze ( Urry 2002 : 146 ) , which previously concentrated on the use of sight , now also talk about other type of panoramas and perception beyond visual landscape , such as ‘ soundscapes ’ , ‘ smellscapes ’ , ‘ tastescapes ’ and ‘ geography of touch ’ .', 'Example are olfactory-based route , touch and sound stimulus , and multimedia installation .', 'Thus the importance of ‘ sensescapes ’ ( Quan and Wang 2004 ) is growing , being the setting that stimulate visitor ’ sens and manage to offer sensation other than the routine and everyday environment ( Urry 2002 : 155 ) .', 'Moreover , the supply system should be flexible and encourage some discretion in the use of the setting by various customer , in order to be able to allow them to undergo unique personal experience , based on their own use of the ‘ servicescape ’ ( Bitner 1992 ) .', 'In addition , in order to enhance the experience offered , often complementary or auxiliary component are added to the core product , such as restaurant , bar , shop , e-commerce , meeting area , guided tour , conference , concert , programme for teacher , workshop , etc .', 'The new technology enable traditional service to be accompanied by innovative service , thanks to interactive multimedia resource , multi-sensory technique and IT support ; example are audio guide with palm-tops , also for child , multimedia kiosk , digital archive of art work , virtual and audio-visual visit , and three-dimensional reconstruction of monument ( Falk and Dierking 1992 ; Bourgeon-Renault et al .', '2006 ) .', 'Given this background , location use new mean , other than information board and traditional guided visit , to present the object displayed in relation to other object and to the visitor , for example through the reconstruction of an environment to mirror the original context of a work or historic moment or through particularly striking display .', 'One example is the Statue Room of the Egyptian Museum in Turin , in which the lighting and soundscape have been designed by Dante Ferretti , a famous set designer , to recreate the atmosphere of the inside of the pyramid and make the work displayed even more powerful and striking , thus emotionally involving the visitor ( Xanthoudaki 2003 ) .', 'In some location it is possible to relive past era thanks to historic re-enactments in period costume and reconstruction of environment and lifestyle of far-off place and time .', 'An excellent example is the Butser Ancient Farm , in England , a real open-air workshop in which it is possible to experience aspect of everyday prehistoric life by tasting the meal of the age and taking part in celebration , such as that for the start of the summer , building a hut using ancient technique , etc .', 'Other innovation concern the introduction of new communication method that guide and accompany the visit , such as animation or the use of actor who tell story associated with the collection or the location ( Jackson et al .', '2002 ) , the offer of workshop where visitor can fashion object using ancient technique or can experience new sensation ( for example , a short walk in a gravity-free environment ) , and the use of game to involve the youngest visitor who , while visiting an archaeological museum , as happens in Milan , can play the game that their ancestor used to play .', 'Finally , it is now common for cultural site to use storytelling ( Kotler 2003 ) , thanks to new , professional role ( for example , actor , set designer , costume designer ) , or people normally responsible for back-office work ( for example restorer ) , who increasingly work in the public gaze .', 'All the tool set out so far can increase the value of the experience , by enhancing its ‘ theatrical ’ aspect and ensuring that the place visited becomes a setting that offers a show ( Falk and Dierking 1992 ; Bourgeon-Renault et al .', '2006 ) .', 'They are transforming the enjoyment of culture by increasingly involving visitor , who are becoming the co-creators of their own experience .', 'The aim is to shift the visitor ’ s attention to playful element , entertainment , emotional pull , thus stimulating their creativity , imagination , emotion and not only the traditional conflicting sentiment that are felt before an artwork : emotion or boredom , curiosity or lack of involvement ( Zorzi 2004 ) .', 'In designing the route to enjoy the cultural resource of a location , it is therefore necessary always to take account of the fact that visitor are the co-designers and co-producers of their own experience ( Simonsen et al .', '2010 : 187 ) .', 'Therefore , they see and assess attraction , place and cultural event through their own personal way of interpreting them , linked to social , cultural and personal value that are highly varied .', 'The expectation can also change markedly depending on whether the tourist is looking for the authentic or just an experience ( Smith 2009 : 189 ) .', 'In conclusion , cultural heritage should be considered as place of interpretation , in which percep-tions are sharply influenced for each consumer by imaginary and real representation of the past provided by the social , material and cultural environment of the place being visited and by the social , temporal and spatial dimension ( Sundbo and Darmer 2008 : 181 ; Simonsen et al .', '2010 : 187 ) .', 'In designing an experience and in assessing it , it is necessary to take account of these dimension , of space-time link , and of imaginary world and personal fight of fancy .', 'Small business and the vitality of main street .', 'People use the neighborhood Main Street for shopping but also for other leisurely activity , active and passive engagement , social affiliation and interaction , sensory stimulation , and relaxation .', 'Traditionally , small business have made up a fair share of business on Main Street .', 'Small business have been an integral part of the American culture of entrepreneurship , individualism , and self-reliance and have played an important role in American economic development .', 'Community development program recommend supporting small business for their social and economic benefit .', 'This paper examines the role of small business in supporting public life on the neighborhood Main Street .', 'The study urn conducted in two city and one town in the Boston , Massachusetts , metropolitan area .', 'Extensive behavior mapping and interview were conducted to determine the relationship between social interaction and small business .', 'The finding expand our understanding of the social value of small business and suggest a strong relationship between small business and the vitality of Main Street as a result offour quality of small business : uniqueness , engagement , friendliness , and responsiveness .', 'These finding have implication for urban design , community planning , and economic development policy because they suggest that small business influence their immediate public space by paying more attention to it than large business .', 'Small business provide quality that help make Main Street a good place for people to interact .', 'Art and cultural participation at the heart of community life .', "A COMMUNITY 'S ART-its creative and cultural expression in the form of music , dance , theater , visual art , and crafts-embodies its essence and is crucial to its well-being .", 'Through making art-amateur and professional , formal and informal1-communities preserve , invent , and assert their identity ; transmit heritage ; and comment on their existence .', 'Art and cultural participation contribute to community condition in education , economic development , civic engagement , and to stewardship of place ( Jackson et al .', '2003 ; Jackson and Herranz 2002 ) .', "Based on year of research , we know that mural , altar , choir , music band , ethnic dance troupe , embroidery and quilting group , drumming circle , theater troupe , parade , and festival are all example of what people describe as cultural asset in community around the United States.These are artistic and creative outlet that are a crucial aspect of quality of life.They are valued for the intrinsic property of art and contribute to the community 's well-being .", 'They are found in a variety of place , including formal cultural presentation venue such as museum and theater , small and midsize organization where artists gather to make art and produce event , and in community cultural center .', 'But they also occur with great frequency , formally and informally , in place and through organization that are not primarily concerned with the art , such as school , church , park , community center , social service organization , social club and benevolent society , and sometimes business and commercial retail establishment .', 'Moreover , art and non-arts entity often have to work together to make cultural participation possible ( Jackson and Herranz 2002 ) .', "Although art and cultural participation at the community level are at the heart of community life , many policy maker , urban planner , and art administrator have not acknowledged the art as an essential part of a community 's core , to the detriment of community .", 'The range of opportunity for cultural participation needed for a healthy community eludes many of these player .', 'Instead , large cultural institution concerned primarily with presenting formal professional art , often with tie to the nonprofit and public sector , have dominated with their idea of what constitutes the art world and the cultural sector .', 'Activity at all artistic skill level , often in smaller art and cultural organization as well as through other public , private , and commercial art outlet , exists at the periphery of recognition , even though in reality it is at the center of real life in community .', 'In the art administration and cultural policy field , informal art practice were formally recognized as an important aspect of the cultural sector during an American Assembly meeting in 1997 focused on the art and their public purpose.2 During that meeting , the importance of ethnographic research that could capture informal , amateur , community-based , and unincorporated art , in addition to quantitative or statistical research on other aspect of the sector , was emphasized .', 'Since that time , research on this kind of informal or unincorporated activity has continued , although work is still needed to position this aspect of the cultural sector in a way that does justice to the significance of its role in society .', 'This chapter sets out to challenge the dominant model that relegates community art and culture to the sideline ; it offers an alternative set of value that has implication for how arts administrator , urban planner , and policy maker should pursue their work in planning , urban design , funding , and cultural programming .', 'With better research about community and charged with defining and engaging with the creative economy3 and the ideology of the creative city,4 they have an opportunity to reassess their assumption and approach .', 'The material presented here is based on year of research completed by the Urban Institute on the art and artist in community life.5 Research has included participant observation of arts-related activity and event in neighborhood all over the United States as well as hundred of interview and score of focus group discussion with artist , art administrator , urban planner , community development professional , policy maker , and community resident .', 'It has also included general population survey on cultural participation and attitude toward artist .', 'A preliminary review of competitive reaction in the hip-hop music industry : Black American entrepreneur in a new industry .', 'Purpose The aim of this paper is to explore the entry and success of hip-hop entrepreneur in the music industry and identify the competitive reaction of well-established firm within the industry .', 'Design/methodology/approach The paper used anecdotal data and popular press coverage to trace the evolution of the hip-hop music industry in the USA and discuss aspect of the marketing strategy of key player in the industry .', 'Additionally , the strategic response of dominant firm to their success within the industry is explored .', 'Finding Hip-hop music and its ensuing culture is now a well-established industry that has enormous marketing power .', 'Although few championed their effort in the beginning , the contribution of Black American entrepreneurs to the music industry is becoming increasingly recognized by existing firm within the industry and beyond .', 'The failure of major record company to capitalize on the hip-hop phenomenon resulted in the creation of new venture and a new industry .', 'While one could argue that very few key Black American entrepreneur remain in the industry , the impact and influence of these entrepreneur and those that have been recruited by major label suggests that the hip-hop entrepreneur should not be ignored .', 'Originality/value This paper sheds light on the development of the hip-hop music industry , which could be of value to aspiring Black American entrepreneurs and marketing manager of company in other industry that target young urban customer as well as company that are interested in forming partnership with Black American entrepreneurs .', 'The urban fabric of Igbo architecture in South-eastern Nigeria in the 1990s .', 'This paper seeks to explore the extent to which local building tradition have been retained within modern urban housing development in primarily Igbo-speaking area of South-eastern Nigeria in the 1990s .', 'Its premise is that there are vestige of tradition which remain part of the urban fabric in most southern Nigerian town .', 'It is thought that these tradition can , and should , be developed further to ensure that there is a positive integration of the old with the new , in the physical form , aesthetic and theoretical interpretation of urban design .', 'Also as a development model , this integration approach has considerable relevance to other aspect of Nigerian urban life where there is the need for the accommodation of various culture and social background .', 'Relevant material , including documented data , will be used to discuss the premise and theory put forward .', 'Central to the main theme is the argument for a re-ordering of architectural design and urban planning in southern Nigeria to better accommodate the more traditional or cultural feature of life as the illustration shown will highlight .', 'The paper focuses specifically on the Igbo-speaking area of South-eastern Nigeria .', 'The development of its housing fabric has varied distinctly from that of Northern and South-western Nigeria , which both have the effect of Islamic influence and , in the latter region , Brazilian and European influence , on local culture to be considered .', 'Both these region have had more urbanised and cosmopolitan cultural indigenous development pattern than the south-east .', 'The text occasionally , however , draws architectural comparison with these Nigerian region and other developing area .', "It would seem that 'Igboland ' escaped these influence mainly due to its geographical location in the hinterland of South-eastern Nigeria .", 'Islam did not penetrate as far down from North-eastern Nigeria to the south-east as it had done from North-western Nigeria to the south-west .', 'This was partly due to the more tropical humid terrain which was detrimental to horse and mounted warfare and the way in which religious war or Jihad were traditionally fought .', 'Also , the acephalous societal organisation of the Igbos , when contrasted with the more hierarchical Northern Hausa and Western Yoruba society , were less predisposed to convert voluntarily from native individualised worship to a more structured heirarchic monotheistic religion .', 'Being away from the Atlantic coast of Nigeria meant that European influence took longer to affect hinterland Igbo lifestyles .', 'It also meant that the area had few settlement of repatriated and freed African slave who had made their way back to Nigeria from America and Brazil .', 'Called Saros and Agudas respectively , these returnees brought with them new cultural style and established residential settlement which were influential in the development of coastal town such as Lagos and Calabar .', 'Similarly , missionary and government enterprise reached the Igbo hinterland much later than the coast , thus Christianity and its cultural influence was felt much later in this area .', 'The text occasionally , however , draws architectural comparison with other Nigerian region and other developing country .', 'Introduction : Connectingwater and heritage for the future .', 'Water has served and sustained society throughout the history of humankind .', 'People have actively shaped its course , form , and function for human settlement and the development of civilization .', 'Around water , they have created socioeconomic structure , policy , and culture ; a rich world of narrative , law , and practice ; and an extensive tangible network of infrastructure , building , and urban form .', 'Today , the complex and diverse system of the past are necessarily the framework for preservation and reuse as well as for new system .', 'Through twentyone chapter in five thematic section , this book links the practice of the past to a present in which heritage and water are largely two separate disciplinary and professional field .', 'It describes an alternative city .', 'Review on the Traditional Us and Potential of Totora ( Schoenoplectus Californicus ) as Construction Material .', 'The recent advance in the wood construction field have demonstrated the replacing high-energy consuming material like concrete or steel , with wood and biomass-based material .', 'Among these biomass-based material are the Non-Timber Forest Products ( NTFP ) which are plantsthat canprovide important contributionsto the construction sector and help to reduce the net CO2eq emission of the building industry .', 'One of these plant is the totora ( Schoenoplectus Californicus ) that has been long used by several community for making handicraft and as construction material .', 'Recent study on this plant have analyzed its property and its feasibility to be used for producing material of interest to the contemporary building industry .', 'The totora is a bulrush that grows in lake and marsh in America from California to Chile and some of the Pacific island .', 'It grows from the sea level to 4500maasl , it can grow in fresh water and estuary , and it is resistant to water level change and drought .', 'This bulrush has been used by many culture as medicine , food , forage , material for building house , boat and different handicraft .', 'The most important example of the use of totora in the world are the floating island of the Uros in Lake Titicaca .', 'The Uros people have developed traditional technique for building their home , boat , and even the artificial island where they live on with method based almost exclusively on the totora .', 'This way of living and production system has been maintained for more than 500 year .', 'This review is about the main constructive technique that have been used for traditional construction in totora and some of therecent research that have been made on this subject .', 'Experiment in architecture and industrial design object made with totora have shown its versatility , durability and high aesthetic value which is exploited in object design and architectural finish .', 'Additionally , recent study on the insulating capacity of totora sample have determined an average conductivity of 0,06W/mK , which is comparable to some of the common insulating material in the current market .', 'The review of the historical us and recent study on this material indicate its potential in the contemporary construction field along with other environmental benefit .', 'One of the key feature is the totora productivity that can be as much as 56 ton of dry matter per hectare per year , which is near 5 time the average production of a conifer plantation .', 'Therefore , to foster the research about its feasible application in the contemporary construction field could lead to the reduction of the pressure on wood forest and plantation by developing a new material source for the construction industry .', 'Sustainability achievement and estidama green building regulation in Abu Dhabi in the city of Abu Dhabi .', 'Currently the research field focus on developing a comfortable and energy efficient residential building design and also with construction sector through developing a building for the new generation .', 'The Gateway Arch : A biography .', "Rising to a triumphant height of 630 foot , the Gateway Arch in St. Louis is a revered monument to America 's western expansion .", "Envisioned in 1947 but not completed until the mid-1960s , the arch today attracts million of tourist annually and is one of the world 's most widely recognized structure .", 'By weaving together social , political , and cultural history , historian Tracy Campbell uncovers the complicated and troubling history of the beloved structure .', 'This compelling book explores how a medley of player with widely divergent motivation ( civic pride , ambition , greed , among others ) brought the Gateway Arch to fruition , but at a price the city continues to pay .', 'Campbell dispels long-held myth and casts a provocative new light on the true origin and meaning of the Gateway Arch .', 'He shows that the monument was the scheme of shrewd city leader who sought to renew downtown St. Louis and were willing to steal an election , destroy historic building , and drive out local people and business to achieve their goal .', 'Campbell also tells the human story of the architect Eero Saarinen , whose prize-winning design brought him acclaim but also charge of plagiarism , and who never lived to see the completion of his vision .', 'As a national symbol , the Gateway Arch has a singular place in American culture , Campbell concludes , yet it also stands as an instructive example of failed urban planning .', 'Digital inclusion and lifestyle transformation among the orang asli : Sacrificing culture for modernity ?', '.', 'In the Digital Era , being part of the digital society is no longer an option particularly for those living in the urban area .', 'Caught by the e-wave and the onslaught of sophisticated information and communication technology ( ICT ) , most urbanites are e-savvy unlike those living in rural location , particularly the indigenous group .', 'Is there a need for simple , rural folk to embrace digital literacy and be e-inclusive ?', 'Hence , the objective of the study is to assess the level of literacy and computer literacy amongst the indigenous people or native living in a rural area of Perak , Malaysia .', 'Cross-sectional research design with purposive sampling was employed and the instrument used was a survey form .', 'The finding revealed that 30.8 % of the respondent were illiterate and only 5.2 % who were computer literate thus , substantiating the myth of digital inclusion among the minority .', "With the government 's transformation plan to have connected citizen through broadband access , the dilemma was the motivation for this research and inherently , substantiated .", 'Although native minority in Perak , Malaysia formed the sample size for this study , the implication provide justification for policy analysis on socio-technological inclusion among other disadvantaged group as culture remains strongly ingrained in their every day existence .', 'However , with time , the new generation may revolutionize the outlook of the indigenous group towards modernity and ICT .', 'A change champion together with a positive , political environment would retard the myth and rhetoricism in promoting e-access for social inclusion and citizen development .', 'Designing affordable housing with cree , anishinabe , and métis people .', "Three level of government are investing in the renewal or construction of affordable housing in Manitoba 's inner-city area .", 'Much of this housing is targeted to community that are predominantly Aboriginal .', 'Little consultation has occurred about the underlying cultural assumption of the design of these home .', 'This is in spite of the fact that the layout of a home may significantly direct the life way of a family or affect their relationship to relative or neighbour .', 'Lack of consultation has proved problematic in some Indigenous community , whereas in those few case where consultation has occurred , the emerging design have been significantly different from conventional design .', 'This article describes a four-year process of consultation on cultural concept in the design of building intended for Aboriginal family in urban community in Manitoba .', 'Participatory design activity drew out numerous theme that , if incorporated into building , might help Indigenous family retain or recover their cultural value and lifeways .', 'A number of these Indigenous theme have been incorporated in building that have already been constructed .', 'The theme relate not just to the decorative feature of the building but to conceptual assumption underlying their design .', 'The article concludes with some public policy recommendation .', 'Chapter 7 : other non-local - pressure have influenced a rural archipelago area by studying change in fisheries-related livelihood , use of natural resource and regulatory regime .', 'Design/methodology/approach : The material for this chapter comprises mainly of structured and semi-structured interview with fisher and other stakeholder in the Archipelago Sea and in the Åland Islands , SW Finland .', 'A governance approach is used , taking into account the interactive social , economic and ecological system embedded in institution , social network and culture .', 'Finding : The economic importance of traditional fishing livelihood has diminished , but fishing still holds a strong position in the culture and life mode of the local people in the studied archipelago area .', 'In family selling fish , this income stands typically for a part of the household income and especially wage work has become an important income source in the pluriactivity .', 'Providing service for the tourist and summer cottage dweller is a potentially growing source of livelihood .', 'The increased recreational use of the Finnish Archipelago Sea has changed the ownership structure of the land area , mostly due to the popular summer cottage dwelling .', 'New public fishing right for ( often urban ) recreational fisher have narrowed the scope of the local decision-making and aroused resistance among the local archipelago people .', 'Originality/value : Rural-urban relation and governance aspect have been rarely studied in relation to the use of natural resource .', 'This chapter gives new insight into the multifaceted role of new urban influence in rural setting .', 'The dialectic dimension of home as an expression of identity and communality in Amman , Jordan .', 'This paper presents a conceptual framework for analysing socio-psychological feature of home and home territory .', 'Home from the urban culture of Amman , the capital of Jordan , are described in term of two dialectic dimension : ( 1 ) identity/communality , that is , the degree to which home display the uniqueness or distinctiveness of people from one another and also the degree to which they display the bond between resident and their community and culture ; ( 2 ) openness/closedness , that is , the degree to which home portray how resident are open and accessible and also how they are closed and out of contact with others .', 'The fabricated environment , according to this research , is a means by which the prevailing socio-cultural system is maintained .', 'At the same time , it is acknowledged that important reciprocal relationship exist between the fabricated environment , individual , and society .', 'Fashion in Bolivia ’ s cultural economy .', 'This article explores the development of Chola Paceña fashion in La Paz , Bolivia .', 'It traces the social and political lineage of the distinctive pollera dress , and its role in tradition that continue to underpin Aymaran social network and economy , while it is simultaneously becoming a symbol of their consumer power .', 'Bolivian gross domestic product ( GDP ) has tripled since 2006 , and this wealth has accumulated in the vast urban informal market which are dominated by people of indigenous and mestizo descent .', 'It is predictable that such a rise in consumption power should enable a burgeoning fashion industry .', 'However , the femininity represented by the design , the model and the designer place in sharp relief gendered and racialized construction of value , and how the relationship between tradition , culture and economy has been configured in scholarly work on creative labour , which has been predominantly based on the experience of post-industrial city in the global North .', 'A Scalable Clean Cooking Stove Matching the Cooking Habits of Ghana and Uganda .', 'A wide range of Improved Cook Stoves have been developed , designed to maximize efficiency and to minimize emission .', "Nevertheless , successful adoption described in this paper is to develop a new cook stove for urban household in Africa , which matches with local cooking habit and which at the same time is scalable which means it should match with 'The objective for the PTM part was to map the characteristic of cooking by measuring and observing preparation of the most typical local food dish .', 'At the same time , in order to overcome the early on in the design process to design a stove-Architecture that can be adopted in and easily adapted to multiple contexts .', 'For this purpose , PTM research was done in two context : Uganda and technical test .', 'We illustrate and discuss some notable feature of the adaptive design in the paper .', 'Women ’ s behaviour in public space and the influence of privacy as a cultural value : The European style , Amerindian people ’ s everyday clothing is almost indistinguishable from that of other resident of North America .', 'Until recently their culturally distinct clothing has been mainly reserved for ceremonial occasion such as powwow and religious ritual .', 'This bifurcation of clothing style and contexts parallel the dichotomy between ‘ traditional ’ and ‘ assimilated ’ Native identity that has been imposed by the dominant society .', 'The dichotomy is a double bind : adopting ‘ traditional ’ identity , Native people are cast into a static ahistorical frame , while appearing ‘ assimilated ’ era cultural distinctiveness .', 'In both case , Native people can not effectively stake claim to a place in contemporary society .', 'Whereas Jennifer Kramer and Rosemary identity subvert colonial oppression through nation-building initiative that contribute significantly to fluid and multi-levelled construction of intertribal Native nationhood .', 'To demonstrate this
