Czechoslovak Republic was established in 1938 , Košice experienced a vigorous development .', 'Being the second largest city in Slovakia , it became an important centre of economy , trade , education and culture in the new state .', 'The number of its citizen increased fast .', 'In 1921 Košice had 52,898 inhabitant , and by 1938 the number went up to 80,000 .', 'Košice joined Europe and the rest of the world with an extended airline from Prague through Bratislava in 1924 .', 'The railway built earlier had a great influence on industrial development .', 'The large increase in the number of inhabitant was connected with the large construction boom and consequent significant regional growth of Košice .', 'New district originated and modern architecture entered the centre .', 'New essential office and municipal service were built , such as new and modern centre for five brigade , new state school , church , synagogue , hotel , restaurant , department store , cinemas , sport facility , swimming pool and flat for the new state employee .', 'The interwar architecture of Košice meanwhile very evidently copied the same developmental phase as are seen in the architecture of the European metropolis .', 'This positive developmental phase lasted approximately until 1938 .', "The exhibition entitled `` The Provincial Exhibition of the Czechoslovak East '' took place in Košice in August 1938 .", "It was the first large general exhibition in Slovakia , which presented the result of the young state 's development between 1918 and 1938 , mainly in Slovakia and in all field : culture , health service , industry , business and sport .", 'To host this exceptionally significant occasion , the town chose the large premise of a Higher School of Economics in the north-western part of the town .', 'Favourably located near the town centre , the venue was a pleasant and quick destination for walking as well as motorized visitor , and the already functioning tram directly connected it with the existing railway .', 'The adequate size of the area spreading over 174,000 m2 - the exhibition part itself being 80,000 m2 - helped to fully unfold the exhibition programme in both aspect of area and space .', "The ground-plan disposition of the exhibition developed along two ax , parallel with today 's Letná street and Komenského street .", 'The main entrance to the exhibition hall was from Letná street .', 'The exhibition class measured 350 metre and was dominated by the main two-storeyed pavilion of the Czechoslovak State at the end .', 'Other exhibition pavilion mainly bordered the left side and were to form the foundation of the future Technical University .', 'This part housed the business , trade and industrial exposition , as well as rental pavilion in an area of around 26,000 m2 .', 'Other exposition , technical and agricultural , were added at a reasonable spatial and architectural distance .', 'An amusement park with various interesting attraction was situated at the northern part of the exhibition over an area of 15,000 m2 ( restaurant , light fountain , music pavilion , parachute tower , death wall , big wheel and others ) .', "The exposition Cultures , which featured art , health service , folk culture , educational training , theatre , society ' activity , printing and various museum field , was situated in the north-eastern part of the exhibition area in the existing building of Northern State Public School .", 'The ground floor housed the exposition of Slovak Industrial Education .', 'The pavilion of Slovak Land showed an integrated picture of Slovakia and its development since 1918 .', "Also present were the exposition of the republic 's capital - Prague , Brno , Bratislava and Uzhgorod .", 'Košice had a separate pavilion .', "Prague 's exposition was the richest .", 'Its installation predominantly captured the relation between Prague and Slovakia as well as other Slovak townsfrom day gone by .', 'The exposition Land and People was one of the largest .', 'It covered all field that were closely related to agriculture , including the advanced Slovak collective farming and wood industry , exposition of land reform and Slovak mining .', 'Folklore was also part of the exposition , exhibiting the characteristic Slovak folk costume , song and custom .', 'The exposition Technology and Industry displayed the industrial development and technical progress of Slovakia over the 20 year of its independence .', 'It embraced all field , including state railway , surface route , water route , radio , air service and electrification .', 'Czechoslovak mail had a separate exposition .', 'Part of the exposition Cultures was a department dedicated to fine art and music .', 'All significant sculptor and painter were represented .', 'The world-known Slovak gothic style enjoyed a special attention ; its exposition was installed in an improvised medieval church .', 'The selection of construction and material for the newly proposed project depended on whether the Technical University would use these after the end of the exhibition or if they were to be dismantled and transferred to another place , or used as construction material .', 'The goal was to fit the construction budget , which meant building as cheaply as possible while at the same time follow the architectural criterion that were adequately significant for this jubilee exhibition .', 'Individual exhibition pavilion were built in three way : the four main pavilion , which were to be used by the Technical University after the end of the exhibition ( the Czechoslovak State , Slovak Land , Land and People , Technology and Industry ) had a bearing construction and ferro-concrete ceiling , an enclosure construction built of brick , beam filling made of board and wood wool and plastering done from the outside .', 'The standardised pavilion for rental area of various exhibitor ( The Capitals , The Town of Košice , Electrical Plant , Gas Company and Water Works , Business and Trades ) , which were designated for business , trade and industry , and the pavilion for forest management were built exclusively of wood and glass .', 'The pavilion of various private firm were built of various construction material in such a way that they could be easily dismantled .', 'Notwithstanding ; several had appealing and characteristic exterior architectural conception .', 'Glass for the glass-covered area was simply loaned for economic reason .', 'With regard to the future premises of the Technical University of M. R. Štefánik in Košice , the reconstruction of the main exhibition pavilion of the Czechoslovak State was planned to start in the autumn , right after the end of the exhibition .', "It was supposed to be one of the main building of the university 's future premise .", 'Other exhibition pavilion were also in consideration , for example the pavilion of the Slovak Land , naturally added with necessary construction and technical adjustment .', 'Only the bare framework was to be used .', 'Wall were to be built in brick and temporary window were to be exchanged for new one , and central heating was to be installed into the technology building .', "Also planned was the new construction of the main building of the rector 's office , administration and pavilion for technical tool , etc .", 'The exhibition visitor were startled by the volume and richness of the exhibition .', "The gate of the country 's exhibition of the Czechoslovak East in Košice closed on September 4 , 1938 .", 'The exhibition , seen by 340,000 visitor had fulfilled its mission .', 'Czech architect Miloslav Kopřiva significantly contributed to the realisation of the Exhibition of the Czechoslovak East in Košice .', 'It was he who designed the conception - the idea of the whole exhibition area , which he composed around two urban ax .', 'He also proposed some pavilion .', 'Several condition had to be respected when designing the main exhibition pavilion .', 'This meant that the creation was to be of such a constructional and dispositional design that only minimal adjustment would facilitate the transformation of the pavilion into future building of the Technical University .', "Despite a very tied budget , Kopřiva together with other Košice architect , like Rudolf Brepta , the project designer of the main pavilion of the Czechoslovak State , L'udovít Oelschläger , Ernest Friedmann and V. Sipos , created a remarkable work in its time , which both fulfilled the intended goal and allowed these building to still serve the university 's need .", 'Ergonomics methodology for comparative 'Discovering and Applying the Urban Rules of Life to Design Sustainable and Healthy Cities .', 'The city and its urban biome provides an extreme laboratory for studying fundamental biological question and developing best practice for sustaining biodiverse and well-functioning ecological community within anthropogenic built environment .', "We propose by studying urban organism , urban biotic community , the urban biome , and the interaction between the urban biome and peri-urban built and natural environment , we can ( 1 ) discover new `` rule of life '' for the structure , function , interaction , and evolution of organism ; ( 2 ) use these discovery to understand how novel emerging biotic community affect and are affected by anthropogenic environmental change in climate and other environmental factor ; and ( 3 ) apply what we have learned to engage resident of the urban biome , and design city that are more biologically diverse , are provided with more and better ecosystem service , and are more equitable and healthier place to live .", 'The built environment of the urban biome is a place that reflects history , economics , technology , governance , culture , and value of the human resident ; research on and application of the rule of life in the urban biome can be used by all resident in making choice about the design of the city where they live .', 'Because inhabitant are directly invested in the environmental quality of their neighborhood , research conducted in and about the urban environment provides a great opportunity to engage wide and diverse community of people .', 'Given the opportunity to engage a broad constituency-from basic researcher to teacher , civil engineer , landscape planner , and concerned citizens-studying the translation of the rule of life onto the urban environment will result in an integrative and crosscutting set of question and hypothesis , and will foster a dialog among citizen about the focus of urban biome research and its application toward making more equitable , healthy , livable , sustainable , and biodiverse city .', 'VR Design of Public Facilities in Historical Blocks Based on BP Neural Network .', 'In view of China ’ s economy achieves rapid development , technology and science change with each passing day and gradually integrate into our life .', 'Accustomed to the intelligent age , higher requirement caused by the design of public facility is proposed .', 'The public facility of the historic block are not only the effective guarantee of people ’ s life , but also the embodiment of the urban culture .', 'Therefore , it is necessary to take the initiative to respond to the rapid change of the demand brought by the urban change and create a pleasant cultural space .', 'However , the historical block is large in scale and rich in detail , and the design of its public facility requires not only a broad range of material resource , but also a plethora of manpower .', 'In order to through real-time design evaluation and greatly improves the design efficiency of public facility in historical block .', 'Biophilia as Evolutionary Adaptation : An Onto- and Phylogenetic Framework for Biophilic Design .', 'Biophilia is a human personality trait described initially by Erich Fromm and later by E.O .', 'Wilson , both of whom agree that biophilia has a biological basis and that it is fundamental to develop harmonious relationship between human and the biosphere .', 'This review aims at establishing a definition of biophilia as an evolutionary process .', 'To this end , the most significant study of evolutionary psychology were considered , to outline the fundamental characteristic of a hypothetical biophilic temperament/personality and to reconstruct a plausible history of biophilia as an evolutionary process .', 'This process considers different typology of Nature ( wilderness , rural , and urban ) and human culture ( Paleolithic , Neolithic , and Burg ) and leads us to consider environmental preference and psycho-physiological recovery in relation to the threshold of time spent in contact with Nature .', 'Unfortunately , modern people , especially child , lack direct and frequent contact with Nature and this can have negative consequence on their physical and mental health .', 'Biophilic design , considering the evolutionary root of this architectural approach , is an effective way of planning/designing interior and urban environment to stimulate the innate biophilia of the individual .', "Bringing the vertical dimension into a planar multilevel autoregressive model : A city-level hedonic analysis of homebuyers ' utility and urban river attribute .", 'Throughout history , urban river have been regarded as valuable natural element that satisfy various human need and affect where people reside .', "With the increasing expansion of modern city along the vertical dimension , how urban river affect housing value and homebuyers ' purchasing decision in a 3-D context has attracted a significant amount of attention from researcher , environmental practitioner , urban planner , and policymakers .", "In this paper , we attempt to estimate how homebuyers ' utility are affected by various river attribute and their interaction using the vibrant high-rise apartment housing market in Guangzhou ( south China ) as a case study .", 'An appropriate 3-D weight matrix is identified using ex ante Monte Carlo simulation combined with ex post validation on the basis of information criterion .', 'By using the identified 3-D spatial weight scheme in a multilevel autoregressive modelling framework , an intricate combination of multidimensional spatial heterogeneity and spatial dependence can be sufficiently accounted for .', "Our analytical result reveal that river view and riverfront location are considered as negative utility by Guangzhou 's homebuyers , showing the significant negative impact of river pollution .", 'Yet , the proximity to urban river is regarded as a positive utility , revealing that homebuyers enjoy a sense of being close to nature and an emotional bond with traditional water culture .', 'The black-odorous river water itself devalues apartment price and adds the negative utility of river view and riverfront location .', 'Riparian greening would command a price premium , as well as mitigate the negative utility of river view and riverfront location .', 'Although the availability of walking path and sitting bench along river stretch is generally regarded as a positive utility , it may worsen the negative impact of river view , but enhance the positive impact of river proximity .', "These result provide deeper managerial insight into how different river attributes influence apartment buyer ' utility and thus help environmental manager ( in collaboration with housing developer ) design urban river restoration initiative so as to create pleasant and attractive neighbourhood for prospective homebuyers .", 'Ecological damage and individualistic behavior : A study on the urban crisis in Surakarta City .', 'The city is the face of civilization supported by high Linking discipline and connecting the vernacular landscape to sustainability challenge .', 'After developing a systematic analysis of the vernacular phenomenon in different discipline , this paper presents a flexible model to understand the multiple factor and the different degree of vernacularity behind the many process that lead to the generation of material culture .', 'The conceptual model offers an open , polythetic and integrative approach to the vernacular by assuming that it operates in different dimension ( temporal , socio-political , sociological , locational , epistemological , procedural , economic and functional ) , and that the many attribute or characteristic included in those dimension are all relevant but not strictly necessary .', 'The model is intended to facilitate a more methodical and rigorous connection between the vernacular concept and contemporary discourse on sustainability , resilience , globalization , governance , and rural-urban development .', 'In addition , and due to its transdisciplinary character , the model will enable the development of comparative study within and between a wide range of field ( architecture , landscape study , design , planning and geography ) .', 'A prospective analysis of the use of the model in rural landscape reveals its potential to mediate between the protective approach that has characterized official planning during the last decade and emergent approach that advocate the reinterpretation of the vernacular as a new form to generate new collective identity and to reconnect people and place .', 'A mixed method approach to understanding streetscape preference in a multicultural setting .', 'Relationship between people and their environment are continually reconstituted through public space .', 'Culture and background are important influence on how people respond to their environment and , as population become more diverse , it might be expected that public space respond to more diverse preference .', 'In New Zealand , despite its bi-cultural history , it is largely European preference that have shaped public space .', 'However , with immigration and travel , the country is rapidly becoming multicultural , with Pasifika people and Asians making up larger proportion of the population alongside those who identify as Māori and European .', 'If public space are to respond to these changing demographic , there is little empiric evidence to inform urban designer and public space manager .', 'This article discusses the method used to examine street as one of the most relevant type of public space in New Zealand .', 'The methodology was deployed in two distinct stage , the first of which made use of ethnographic fieldwork and provided data on specific public space and their usage through a range of case study .', 'The second stage utilised online survey to probe people ’ s preference for a series of visualisation of street environment .', 'Most research on public space design has to date been focussed on one or the other of these method ( field research or visual preference survey ) .', 'The combination of method used in this research enables a deeper understanding of which public space attributes foster lingering and social activity among people from different cultural background .', 'This methodology is feasible and comprehensive , clearly identifying the important relationship between design , use and preference in multicultural society .', 'The finding will be of interest to other researcher , urban practitioner and city official .', 'Quintessentially billington : The evolution of structural art teaching at Princeton .', 'One of the most classic course at Princeton University ( CEE262 , Structures in the Urban Environment ) was founded by Professor David Billington ( 1927-2018 ) in 1974 .', 'The course , based on his scholarship , argues that the best designed structure ( bridge , building , and shell ) are a work of art - structural art .', 'The course integrates humanity with engineering through study of culture , people , and art as reflected in work of engineering .', "Professor Billington used alliteration to reinforce learning : The measure of structural art are efficiency , economy , and elegance ; and the structural artist 's design evolve from imitation , to innovation , to inspiration .", "The author are Princeton University faculty in who have continued teaching Billington 's classic course ( imitation ) , enhanced it with modern pedagogical approach ( innovation ) , and created new class and scholarship inspired by it ( inspiration ) .", "This paper , in essence , illustrates the many way that David Billington 's legacy and scholarship continue to thrive in creative approach that one can say are quintessentially Billington .", 'Management of wild edible fungi in the meseta Purépecha Region , Michoacán , México .', 'Ethnoecology is the study of the relationship between human and their environment and component , including fungi .', 'México is an exceptional setting for studying the interaction between human and fungi , since most of the native culture have interacted with these organism for thousand of year .', 'The state of Michoacán is particularly relevant , since nearly 11 % of the fungi specie recorded in Mexico occur there , 139 of which are edible .', 'The aim of this study was to analyze the interaction of the Purépecha native community with edible fungi and their environment , the position of mushroom in the local worldview , and the classification system , management form , and social and environmental problem associated with their use .', 'Semi-structured interview at regional market were conducted .', 'We conducted participant observation , proof interview in harvesting area , and workshop with the community .', 'Ethnoecological information was recorded for 21 edible fungi specie and the environment where people interact with these mushroom .', 'People called hongueros ( fungi handler ) identified the following environmental problem : A loss of local knowledge , a decreasing consumption of fungi among young people , land-use change , the illegal extraction of forest resource , deforestation , unplanned urban growth , uncontrolled fire , livestock raising , and agricultural intensification .', 'These issue affect fungi diversity , distribution , and abundance .', 'All these factor , in turn , affect decreasing economic income associated with this activity and change in the diet of the local people .', 'Information from this study will help local authority and people of the community to design management strategy for maintaining the environment and fungi , strategy which aim to contribute to the sustainable use of both fungi and forest .', 'On the role of temporality in the life of people with disability .', 'The author formulates conceptual conclusion , as well as recommended principle for social policy : social issue in international development agenda .', 'Identity is an important element of a nation to show who the citizen really are in the era of globalization .', "The existence of an urban kampong is often marginalized due to 'bad ' infrastructure and social condition .", 'But a kampong as the residence of common people in the city center is also recognized as a successful place in reflecting is a pioneer of a city characterized by the social life of non-elite class , coastal Islamic culture , and trading activity .', "The role as a spiritual-religious area has been continually attached to a kampong with story of the history of the city 's development , Kauman has many local culture that potentially become a city identity .", 'However , the condition of infrastructure and socio-cultural influenced community 's everyday life and encouraged the community participation in the making of place .", 'Smart city based on cloud computing and IOT .', 'A smart city means a standout among the
