common people .', 'Value shift in Vietnamese student studying in Russia .', 'Background .', 'The extension of intercultural contact in the present-day world calls for a thorough study of what effect these contact produce on the human personality .', 'When an individual is suddenly immersed in a different culture , his or her consciousness becomes a battlefield where new value conflict with the old .', "The person experiences an axiological shock , a `` value clash , '' which urges him or her to undertake a re-examination of his/ her value system as a whole .", 'Objective .', 'The objective of this study was to determine the change occurring in the value system of Vietnamese student obtaining their higher education in Russia .', 'Design .', 'A longitudinal study was performed involving 100 Vietnamese student in Russian university .', 'The measurement method used in the study were : 1 ) the modified M. Rokeach Value Survey ( Rokeach , 1973 ; Kudrjashov , 1992 ) , in which the original set of value was expanded by 20 additional value typical of the Vietnamese people ; and 2 ) the technique for assessing acculturation strategy developed by J.W .', "Berry ( Strategii mezhkul'turnogo vzaimodejstvija ... , 2009 ) .", 'Result .', "In the course of a year of residence in Russia , specific change ( or `` shift '' ) occurred in the value system of the Vietnamese student which proved to be statistically significant .", 'Among the goal value ( the same as terminal value , in the term of M. Rokeach ) which took on more weight were Productive Life and Materially Prosperous Life , while among instrumental value , Tidiness and Frugality became more prominent .', 'A difference between the value dynamic in male and female student was also established , with the value pattern of male student proving to be more dynamic .', 'The next finding was the difference in value dynamic between student coming from urban and rural settlement .', "There was one more quite unexpected finding : The value pattern changed more noticeably in respondent with an acculturation profile of `` Integration and Separation , '' than in those with profile of `` Integration and Assimilation '' and `` Pure Integration . ''", 'Conclusion .', 'Therefore we see that factor such as gender , type of environment ( rural/urban ) the individual comes from , and the strategy of acculturation used by the individual , act as mediator exerting their own influence upon the dynamic of his/her value pattern .', 'The Heritage Value of the Craft Sector in Fast-Growing Cities .', 'Culture is a key dimension in the history of city where the design of urban development strategy combines the aim to preserve the wealth of cultural heritage with the search for contemporary progress .', 'Along the century , art and craft have always occupied an important place in the life of city because they contribute to preserve local identity and tradition through skill , they provide job and contribute to the local economy , and they are a source of interest for cultural tourism .', 'Historically , artisan workshop are to be found in city , where the high concentration of people and product provides the perfect framework for buying raw material and selling the final product in market .', 'Today , workshop have often been substituted by industrialization and those left are increasingly being forced out of the city or to die to leave space to new business .', 'What is the place of handicraft today ?', 'Is there still a strong linkage between handicraft and place ?', 'And what has been the role of public policy in encouraging ( or discouraging ) this kind of activity in the past century ?', 'The article discusses these question and provides example taken from the observation of the historical and sociopolitical context of handicraft in India .', 'The conclusion reflects over handicraft as a marginalized sector with great potential to become a driver of sustainable development in city .', 'Use of Daylight and Aesthetic Image of Glass Facades in Contemporary Buildings .', 'The paper deal with the architecture of contemporary building in respect to their aesthetic image created by the use of natural light .', 'Sustainability is regarded as a governing principle of contemporary architecture , where daylighting is an important factor as it affects energy consumption and environmental quality of the space inside a building .', 'Environmental awareness of architecture , however , involves a much wider and more holistic view of design .', 'The quality of sustainable architecture can be considered in its aesthetic and cultural context with regard to landscape , local tradition , and connection to the surrounding world .', 'This approach is associated with the social mission of architecture , i.e .', 'providing appropriate space for living , facilitating social relation and having positive impact on people .', 'The purpose of the research is to study the use of daylight in creating an aesthetic image of contemporary building .', 'The author focuses mainly on public building largely dedicated to art and culture which satisfy high functional and aesthetic requirement .', 'The paper examines the genesis and current trend in the aesthetic image of modern building which use daylight as the main design strategy , focusing on the issue of glass facade .', 'The main attention is given to the shaping of representative public area which feature the glass facade .', 'The research has been based on a case study , critical review of literature review , observation and synthesis .', 'The study identifies and classifies different approach to using daylight in these area and highlight change in the aesthetic of architecture made of glass , which uses daylight as the main design strategy .', 'These change are primarily caused by the development and spreading of new glazing material and the use of digital method of design .', 'The influence of light and its mode depends on glass material but also on the local condition of the site , and has a significant impact on the relationship between architecture and its natural and cultural environment .', 'The subordination of architectural concept to the idea of natural lighting builds the relationship between form , function and the context of architecture , and is expressed in its structural , material and spatial property , and in the resulting aesthetic order .', 'Search for new architectural solution is defined by local topographical , climatic , biological and cultural condition .', 'The architecture subordinate to the conception of contribution of light corresponds to the aesthetic aspiration of sustainability .', 'On the problem of ethnic tolerance formation in multicultural student environment .', "This article is devoted to the urgent problem of formation of student ' interethnic tolerance in multicultural university environment .", 'The study was conducted on the basis of the Kazakh National Agrarian University , as the agrarian university student are mainly countryside representative .', 'Their example can show how transition from mainly mono-national ( Kazakh ) environment into multi-ethnic urban society impactû on their tolerant consciousness .', 'The study aims to determine the level of interethnic tolerance/intolerance in 1st year student and development of their tolerant consciousness formation criterion .', 'The methodological basis of the research is grounded on the concept of domestic and foreign pedagogy , cultural study , psychology and sociology which consider multidimensional tolerance appearance as growing and dynamic phenomenon .', 'Tolerance in this case acts as a subject of interdisciplinary study , as a phenomenon that integrates aspect of national culture characteristic exploration by a personality .', 'During the research the following method were used : Analysis and study of scientific literature on the researched topic and its systematization , pedagogical and psychological monitoring of interpersonal relation in student group ; design and organization of educational process using the developed teaching material ; observation and analysis of interethnic tolerance formation in student through the study of ethnic culture of the people of Kazakhstan with a view to identifying good practice and shortcoming , questioning student , public opinion poll ; at the end of the experiment the method of experimental data processing , analysis and synthesis of the result were used .', 'The criteria for the level of interethnic tolerance formation in student were developed .', 'In determining the extent of formation of interethnic tolerance is possible to allocate the following structure of level : Low , medium ( multicultural-oriented ) , high ( multicultural-valuable and personally meaningful ) .', 'An Introspective view of Sustainable Cohousing with the Malaysian Housing Concept .', 'Sustainable development strategy are becoming demanded in assisting in wealth distribution and improving living condition for mankind .', 'A sustained community is one of the sustainable development agenda that encourage community involvement and participation in contributing to sustainability .', 'Moreover , with the rapid population growth , especially in urban city as the proportion of urban dweller will reach two-thirds of the world population , this will lead to several problem including the social life changing intensely .', 'Sustainable Cohousing is one of the suggested answer for an innovative form of neighbourly accommodation .', 'Generally , Cohousing is formed by a group of people who are committed to living as a community and who actively participate in the design and operation to shape their own neighbourhood .', 'Through this concept , the community can decide how they can implement sustainability principle in term of social , economical and environmental term in their neighbourhood .', 'Therefore , it is important to bring back the sense of togetherness amongst the people and improve their social wellbeing through an effective neighbourhood .', 'The objective of this study is to isolate the basic concept of Cohousing and to identify the conceptual framework of Sustainable Cohousing that may apply to improving the sustainable living in Malaysia .', 'The research methodology was through identifying and reviewing the issue in existing literature on cohousing chosen from various dimension , such as principle and element , sustainable value , development model and so on , which can be suited with the Malaysian culture .', 'The finding of this research are useful for property development practitioner and policy maker in promoting sustainability through the new concept of modern housing .', 'Novelty fair .', 'Novelty fair examines mid-nineteenth-century people , thing and place generally understood to be discrete and unrelated : urban fair and the Great Exhibition , daguerreotype and ballad , satirical shilling book and government-backed design reform , blackface performer and middle-class paterfamilias .', 'A range of new and neglected source , drawn mainly from popular culture are used to inform the discussion .', 'The pivotal year between Chartism and the Great Exhibition emerge as far more contested than has previously been recognised and bourgeois form and strategy are revealed as being under stress in a period that has been seen as a triumphant one for that class .', 'Novelty fair will be of special interest to historian of Chartism , cultural historian interested in the Great Exhibition and design reform and those in the field of Victorian study , cultural study and visual culture more generally .', 'Know Your People : Social Research and Water Recycling System Design with Communities in the Amazon .', 'This paper sets out to answer the research question : What differences come about when water-recycling strategy are adapted to the local cultural context ?', 'It is argued that water management system should be circular metabolism , where wastewater is mobilized as a nutrition source .', 'The aim is to propose water-recycling strategy at a micro level that reflect this .', 'However , water-recycling system are dependent on a complex set of social factor as to their acceptance/refusal and correct/incorrect use by the end user .', 'This is particularly the case in Ecuador , where a plethora of variation in climate and culture means that each project is different .', 'This study proposes a qualitative methodology for the development of water-recycling strategy , where semi-structured interview are first carried out to determine the design parameter of the specific social context where the project is to be implemented .', 'Based on this , a water-recycling system can be proposed that is more likely to be readily accepted by the end user .', 'The paper works with four of case study , where the methodology is applied in three rural community and an urban suburb in the Napo province of Ecuador , located in the Amazonian region .', 'The result show that there were distinct difference in the water recycling strategy that were considered most appropriate for each case study .', 'As such participatory design approach can be said to be of great importance in the design of water-recycling strategy , where further work would necessary in working with the community member for the final system design .', 'Inter [ VENSTER ] re-re-use early modern intervention : Winning awareness for rehabilitation .', 'Rotterdam grew mainly because of its increasing harbor since around 1900 .', 'Serving the basic need for the inhabitant , it became the most industrial and modern city in the Netherlands .', 'In 1940 the city centre located more than 20 cinemas , which basically had the function to amuse people , instead of having a cultural purpose .', "In only one day in May 1940 , German bombs destroyed 28.000 house , 24 church , 13 hospital , 60 school , 12 cinema 's and 2 theatre .", 'During the 5 year of the German occupation the Rotterdam cultural protagonist invest money and idea to resolve the lack of a cultural centre in the city .', 'Soon after the ending of the war a multidisciplinary arthouse was realized with a cinema , a theatre , an art-gallery and a public bar .', 'It was the place where artist , artlovers , intellectual and politician could meet .', 'For a number of reason this postwar cultural centre became the building Ons Huis ( Our House ) , a cultural building in classical style that was financed by a rich harbor company owner .', 'It was built in the beginning of the 20th century to educate child of harbor worker in craftsmanship , art and culture .', "Ons Huis became since the 30 's already an alternative place for theatre and cultural flm screening .", "With the extension of cinema 't Venster , Ons Huis became a multidisciplinary arthouse that played an important role in postwar exhibition , debate and presentation on a higher cultural lever .", 'Mainly through a playful and modern design by young architect Bakema in 1947 , the 16 year older architect VandenBroek asked him to become his partner in his office , the follow-up of the world famous office Brinkman & amp ; vdVlugt .', 'Working as a complementary team they designed postwar architectural and urban icon in the new centre of the city .', 'Now in 2014 , 65 year after the architectural intervention , we can conclude that the modern intervention on the building was not only a first trail of a young and insolent architect .', 'By breaking away part of a classical building to win the aesthetic for its own contemporary design , he added the new program and complement also the aesthetic of the existing building .', 'His contrast was a legal action and in his re-use policy the intervention became an invitation for the new progressive user .', 'With the cinema extension and new multidisciplinary function of the building it played an important role in physical and social city development .', "In the 70s Lantaren 't Venster give birth to the first edition of Film International , which soon after became the International Film Festival Rotterdam , the biggest international and cultural event in the Netherlands .", "Although the arthouse function with its historical name Lantaren Venster is moved to a new contemporary building designed by Alvaro Siza , the existing building Ons Huis with Bakema 's and later extension still is an alternative and multidisciplinary platform for artist in the city centre .", "A smaller part of Bakema 's intervention is physically still present and some are still in use .", 'For the rehabilitation of his design and making visible the contrast of his and later intervention the building needs a good research to make visitor aware of the value of the layered heritage .', 'At least the documentation of the first modern intervention can be used for education about early modern intervention and winning public awareness to sustain the exchange of opinion .', 'Cultural norm of Japanese folk and traditional music .', 'Purpose The main purpose of this chapter is to discuss cultural norm in the process of handing down traditional folk music .', 'In doing so , I focus on learning what successor of the tradition think about the orthodoxy of their music and what they think is the ideal way to pass down cultural heritage .', 'In addition , considering that cultural norm are socially constructed in the moment , it should be also examined what leads people to have such notion .', 'Design/methodology/approach To achieve these purpose , I look at practice of handing down traditional folk music in Japan , developing five case study of various ohayashi .', 'I also analyze yosakoi , which is modernly arranged local folk music that is widely spread across the country in the form of community festival .', 'Finding The successor of tradition tend to consider tracing the root of their music as an obligation .', 'On the other hand , in the case of music with no exact origin , its successor seek to find their identity by learning lesson from local anonymous ancestor .', "Meanwhile , there are people who consider its economic value as a raison d'être for traditional music .", 'Originality/value What gives originality to this chapter is that I adopt an approach , employing regional and urban sociology method , of comparing the characteristic of the region in which local folk music is based .', 'Along with perspective on macro social change and the principle of music group formation , I also discuss the transformation of expertise in folk culture associated with the rise of institutional reflexivity .', 'The expanding art of the interwar period .', '`` Grab the Hand of 50,000 reader !', "Friend of the people , read the Musansha shinbun ( Proletarian Times ) '' exclaims the bold red headline on Yanase Masamu 's now iconic 1927 poster for the Japanese communist party newspaper ( see Plate 5 ) .", 'A large red hand , superimposed on the front page of a mock newspaper , reaches out to seize the hand of the reader in a gesture of solidarity .', "Inspired by the revolutionary graphic of the Russian avantgarde , Yanase 's dynamic political poster agitating for social revolution exemplifies the deep interpenetration of high art and mass culture that was expanding the boundary of artistic production during this time .", 'The period between the end of World War I in 1918 and the beginning of the Asia-Pacific war in 1937 , when Yanase was working , was a time of intense cultural and political foment in Japan .', "Encompassing the brief Taisho period ( 1912-1926 ) and the early part of Showa ( 1926-1989 ) , Japan 's interwar period1 represents a significant cultural juncture .", "Historian Jordan Sand has written that `` [ a ] familiar set of polarity typically serve to distinguish Meiji 'civilization ' [ bunmei ] from Taisho 'culture ' [ bunka ] as two moment in the development of the national character : Public Meiji/private Taisho , nationalist Meiji/cosmopolitan Taisho , self-sacrificing Meiji/self-cultivating Taisho , productionist Meiji/consumerist Taisho .", "`` 2 To be sure , what is designated as Taisho in this equation was already gestating in the final year of Meiji , particularly after Japan 's victory in the Russo-Japanese War in 1905 , when it seemed to many that the nation had finally reached a level of parity with other world power that could at least partially release its imperial subject from a total dedication to the national mission of producing a `` rich country , strong army '' ( fukoku kyohei ) .", 'And this Taisho ethos of individualism , internationalism , and consumerism continued well into the early Showa period through most of the 1930s , even as Japan experienced a devastating economic depression and began to mobilize for war .', 'By the late 1910s and early 1920s , impulse to Westernize , while still abundantly in evidence , were clearly less state-driven and less focused on national political goal .', 'There was still widespread inspiration from cultural trend originated in the European , North American , and Russian contexts , but it constituted a more selective and interpretive adaptation that was conceived in relation to indigenous cultural model .', 'Modernity in Japan was impelled by its own logic based on local contingency ; it paralleled rather than followed development in the West.3 Moreover , despite an increasingly ideologically driven rhetoric of ethnic homogeneity , the Japanese were still in fact quite diverse in term of regional location and class , not to mention the broadly differentiated experience of men and woman during this time , making it difficult to speak of a single Japanese experience of modernity .', 'The interwar period saw a great degree of man-made and natural turbulence .', 'Beginning with popular antigovernment riot after the Treaty of Portsmouth in 1905 , the Japanese people were increasingly inclined to bring their grievance into the public sphere through strike and riot , most notably the Rice Riots of 1918 , which highlighted the tremendous class inequality that lay just under the surface of national solidarity .', "In the international arena , Japan 's northern neighbor Russia experienced a bloody revolution in 1917 that brought social rebellion right to Japan 's border .", "Socialist and communist idea that identified social ill as rooted in an exploitative class structure were already filtering into Japan from abroad , appealing to the working class and fueling political activism among the younger generation of the nation 's intelligentsia , such as the talented painter Yanase Masamu .", 'This awareness of social issue emerged among a broad range of artist , mostly based in major urban center , which made them particularly sympathetic to leftist politics and strongly inflected their cultural production with a transgressive and contestative character .', "Right as the Taisho period was hitting its stride and modern time were in full swing , a mammoth earthquake on September 1 , 1923 , devastated the nation 's capital of Tokyo , along with the bustling nearby cosmopolitan port city of Yokohama and a large swath of their surrounding area .", 'No one in the region was left untouched by the Great Kanto Earthquake , as the calamity soon came to be known .', 'A vivid outpouring of grief , sympathy , nostalgia , anger , and samaritanism flowed from the artistic community , which labored to make sense of the shocking experience while actively assisting in the reconstruction effort .', 'Their response resulted in a body of work that testifies to the potency of this traumatic event in the collective Japanese imagination .', 'This was the dynamic and chaotic context into which many innovative Japanese art and design movement of the 1920s and 1930s were born .', 'And it was precisely the transitional and unstable nature of the interwar period and the range of cultural possibility it offered to artist and designer that fueled their imagination , compelling them to push the envelope of cultural production .', 'This included an unprecedented interest in more substantially integrating art into daily life , which increasingly brought high art aesthetic into the commercial sphere-a trend that would continue to influence the Japanese cultural field for decade to come .', 'Mi Reina : Latino landscapes in the Queen City ( Charlotte , N.C. ) .', 'It is late morning on a Thursday and I stop into a small convenience store to purchase an agua fresca ( fruit-juice drink ) ; I walk out with my drink in hand and a Club de Fútbol América cap .', 'I was interested in the cap because of the logo that it carried - one that depicted a soccer ball as the globe with the North and South American continent located between the letter C and A .', 'In my naïveté , I thought it might have been a cap for a new North American soccer team ; what sold me on the item was the enthusiasm of the clerk behind the counter .', "As it turns out , Club América is one of Mexico 's most successful team , having won ten professional championship .", "The country 's other success story , Chivas has eleven title to its credit .", "`` No me digas , '' I say ( You do n't say ) .", "`` De veras , '' she tells me ( It 's true ) .", 'So , I buy the cap .', 'It is a hot , bright August day ; I put my new cap on to shade my eye and walk over to the lonchera ( taco truck ) to get a plate of carnitas taco ( fried pork tacos ) .', "I chat with the cook ( `` hace un calor hoy día⋯ the heat today '' ) , I eat , and I get on with my day fully satisfied - hunger satiated , outfit complete .", 'I spent this late weekday morning conversing in Spanish , tooling around a commercial landscape in which Spanish-language signage appears on every available surface , and listening to Spanish-lang uage radio .', 'I am in Charlotte - Charlotte , North Carolina .', 'My morning in Spanish may not seem particularly interesting to people who live in major North American urban center like Los Angeles , New York , or even Atlanta , but for many North Carolinians , this represents a significant and unfamiliar trend .', "The landscape through which I traveled is essentially invisible to most Charlotteans ; this is an area often overlooked and forgotten by many within greater Charlotte due to the area 's aging auto-oriented infrastructure .", "As such , it does not exist within the mental map of many of the city 's middle- and upper-class resident whose life are oriented around often newer suburban landscape .", 'This is now the terrain of immigrant , many of whom are Latino , and their permanent settlement has begun to reshape this and several other area of Charlotte - a city better known for its namesake , Queen Charlotte of Mecklenburg-Strelitz , than for its thriving ethnic communities.1 In fact , the growing number of Latinos within the Queen City ( as Charlotte is often called ) and its surrounding area has given rise to some very visible form of resistance .', 'For example , the Charlotte Observer reported the appearance of an A-frame commercial roadside placard that encouraged driver to `` Honk if you hate Spanish .', '`` 2 The article ran at a time when increasing number of hate e-mail arrived at social service organization catering to Latinos and English-only initiative became fodder for city council debate .', 'In Charlotte and many of its neighboring town , the presence of a growing number of Latinos has given rise to a great deal of tension .', 'This tension stems in part from the fact that immigration is a relatively new phenomenon in this city and region .', "The southeastern United States has not been a significant part of global migration pattern historically , but this has changed since 1990.3 In fact , southern state have experienced the country 's most explosive Latino boom in the year between 1990 and 2005 , during which Latino demographic experienced triple digit growth : 394 percent in North Carolina alone , while many neighboring state saw growth rate of over 100 percent.4 One result of this new immigration trend is that the largest percent increase occurred in what Roberto Suro and Audrey Singer have called `` new Latino destination '' - city such as Atlanta , Orlando , and Charlotte.5 In this sense , the Solid South is melting into the air of multicultural modernity in way that challenge the region 's long-standing black/white cultural binary.6 State such as North Carolina , therefore , must confront the `` complex nature of race relation in a post-civil right era '' in which biracial framework are `` unable to grasp the pattern of conflict and accommodation among several increasingly large racial/ethnic group . ''", "7 Despite resistance from some sector of the local metropolitan population , Charlotte 's Latino community continue to grow .", "According to 2005 census study , Latinos now make up approximately 10 percent of both Charlotte 's and Mecklenburg County 's total population .", 'Other estimate hold that the Latino populace is at least double what the official record claims , given the endemic under-counting in census reporting .', "This recent growth , which has helped push the total Latino population to over 4 percent statewide , has also contributed to emerging Latino cultural landscape in several part of the city.8 `` Mí reina ( my queen ) , '' it seems , is becoming as common a phrase in some area of town as `` Queen City '' is in others .", 'Immigrant settlement ( both permanent and temporary ) has an impact on the social and physical landscape of urban and suburban area .', 'Such impact have been seen in place ranging from U.S. city such as Los Angeles to European center such as Duisburg-Marlox , Germany.9 One result of these impact has been the transformation of existing urban landscape in way that meet the cultural need of immigrant and that produce new urban borderland condition .', 'And , it is in these area that one is able to observe how identity construction can inform spatial reconstruction as immigrant inhabit and engage in the production of place in specific area .', 'This chapter examines how the border is now inhabited in place far from geopolitical demarcation .', "Charlotte 's relatively recent experience with Latino immigration puts in stark relief the emergence of a new set of border condition that illustrate how space , place , and identity intersect within the contemporary transnational landscape .", 'What one finds is a set of urban condition previously unfamiliar to most southern city - condition of invisibility , of exile , of heterotopic spatiality , and of emergent or prototopic urbanism .', 'Site of invisibility often occur in existing but overlooked part of the city such as the one described in the opening vignette of this essay ; such space are often characterized as former center of economic and social activity that have been surpassed by newer urban or suburban development elsewhere .', 'These sites become invisible to many simply because they fail to attract the attention of middle- and upper-income group .', 'Site of exile may overlap with invisible space or exist in more publicly visible location ; these location , such as a storefront church or a city park , emerge as socially symbolic site for specific transnational community .', 'These space become hybrid landscape in which immigrant sociospatial pattern mix with existing condition to create a new cultural borderland .', "Heterotopic spatiality refers to the heterogeneous sociospatial life ( represented by a mix of us and activity much more complex than allowed by conventional mixed-use zoning ) exhibited in many Latino immigrant landscape in which a vibrant public culture thrives despite the fact that many of the activity found there would be defined as `` nonconforming '' by local planning code .", 'Prototopic urban-ism refers to the theoretical premise that the spatial characteristic found in immigrant landscape represent a potential model for the reintroduction of fundamental aspect of urban life into aging auto-oriented area .', "Each of these condition will be explored further as interrelated part of Charlotte 's changing metropolitan landscape in order to identify urban characteristic that hold promise for the design of civic , public , and urban space .", "It is my contention that the sociospatial dynamic of Charlotte 's Latino landscape do not represent area in decline , but , rather , the emergence of a vibrant model of economic regeneration that may hold lesson for the redevelopment of other aging urban space .", 'These landscape illustrate a form of grassroots or organic urbanity that can not be captured by conventional planning , design , or development pattern .', 'Of particular importance , and a significant characteristic that differentiates the landscape explored in this chapter from mainstream planning norm , is rooted in the transnational and hybrid nature of such site .', 'Such landscape illustrate how North American midcentury urban fabric becomes infused with Latin American cultural attribute , thereby resulting in a sociospatial condition that is both border town and Main Street usa si mu lta neou sly .', 'Updating den Gamle by .', "Den Gamle By ( The Old Town ) was founded in 1909 as the world 's first open-air museum dedicated to urban history and culture .", 'With building , workshop and home from almost every town and city in Denmark it now is the national open-air museum of urbanity .', 'In the mid-20th century Den Gamle By also built up comprehensive collection of object and artefact , but after having been run as a traditional object-oriented museum for decade , Den Gamle By in the 1990s began to redefine itself as an open-air museum and develop new way of presentation .', 'Living history was initiated , new school-programmes were developed as well as special arrangement for elderly people suffering from senile dementia .', 'And a formal cooperation with the university was initiated .', 'In 2007 Den Gamle By launched a huge , new project aiming to update the museum .', 'The project is about to create two town-districts , one with townscapes from the 1920s and one with townscapes from the 1970s .', 'The first part of this updating will be finished in 2012 .', 'Sharebee : Encouraging Osusowake to promote community development .', 'Osusowake means to share food or other thing with neighbor and is a traditional communication style in the Japanese culture .', "People often osusowake ( share ) dishes they have cooked or thing they have received from others with a kind message such as `` Okimochi desuga ( I am happy to give you this ) . ''", 'Osusowake has functioned as a means of developing community .', 'However , the tradition of Osusowake or even simple neighborhood bonding no longer exists among people living in urban area .', 'Sharebee is an attachment to encourage people to osusowake and help organize urban residential community .', 'Staying too long at the fair : Philadelphia planning and the debacle of 1976 .', "In 1682 , 1776 , or 1876 , the optimism of Edmund Bacon 's remarkable 1959 vision for Philadelphia 's future- '' Philadelphia in the Year 2009 '' -would have surprised no one .", "From its founding , Philadelphia 's unfolding future were consistently dynamic , focusing the energy of colonial expansion , democratic governance , and industrialization in one urban crucible .", 'No other city in America exhibited each trend so dramatically .', 'It was the Centennial Exhibition in Philadelphia in 1876- with the glass and steel dome of its Memorial Hall , its display of telegraphy and the telephone , its prototype steam automobiles-that first demonstrated to Americans what an industrialized nation might really look like .', "Ed Bacon was an enthusiast of world 's fair and public exhibition , writing and speaking of them throughout his career to illustrate and promote trend in urban development , and working in the genre himself to advance a far-reaching planning agenda for Philadelphia in the postwar decade .", 'Philadelphia emerged from World War II burdened by creaking infrastructure and a housing shortage , its Center City business district underperforming against rival city .', "Deindustrialization was already noticeable by the mid-1950s , an emerging economic reality that foretold difficulty in achieving the social goal of a new and aggressive generation of reform-minded political leadership.1 Resident were embarking for the suburbs at a steady clip , with the city falling by 1960 from third to fourth in population behind Los Angeles.2 Bacon 's 50-year vision projected against this backdrop might have struck the reader as cheerful but unrealistic , even naïve .", 'But what good is a prophecy if it does not reveal a hidden future , a future obstructed ?', "Bacon 's future was a city revitalized , beautified , and modernized in time to host the nation 's Bicentennial celebration and a simultaneous 1976 Philadelphia World 's Fair .", "Imaginative planning was his method , enabling the political gatekeeper along with the citizen of the city to see with him decade ahead and to grasp the occasion of a fair to accomplish lasting change for the city 's built environment and its people .", "`` Philadelphia in the Year 2009 '' builds its case on this one powerful idea : A world 's fair could transform it into a model of humane urbanism.3 Considering his vantage point in 1959 , it is possible to imagine why Ed Bacon might predict the future of Philadelphia with such mesmerizing flourish .", 'The Philadelphia City Planning Commission ( PCPC ) , under his directorship , was in the midst of one of the longest winning streak any urban planning body had or has ever achieved .', 'With Penn Center , Society Hill , Independence Mall , the neighborhood of Eastwick and the Far Northeast each underway or finished , Bacon and his team of young planner were totally in their stride in 1959 , working to think , dig , and build the city out of its rut .', "The Market East transportation center , a pedestrian-friendly Chestnut Street , and a tourist-friendly Delaware waterfront were all on Bacon 's drawing board , too .", 'These were the varied piece , described in turn by each of the author in this volume , of a full urban-renewal portfolio advanced consistently over more than two decade by the PCPC .', "Postwar federal legislation enabled city official for the first time to broadly exercise eminent domain power , moving mass of resident and bulldozing whole section of the city , planning and building anew.4 Ed Bacon 's PCPC was certainly of its time in this respect and forceful in its place , stirring up both wonder and backlash .", 'The old industrial city , the city that had lain fallow through the Depression and World War II , was awakening slowly to the possibility of highrises and integrated transportation hub , and at the same time rediscovering its walkable character and the vernacular beauty of its historic neighborhood .', "Bacon 's idea was to liberate William Penn 's grid from over a century of industrial-age clutter and to make the city simultaneously auto- , pedestrian- , and investment-friendly .", 'Bacon understood the power of display and salesmanship as key to making his idea of the next Philadelphia into something tangible .', "In this spirit , his `` 2009 '' essay arrived on newsstand in 1959 .", 'Could new high-rise and a suburban-style shopping center downtown reverse massive job loss and a suburban exodus ?', "Whether the PCPC 's project were comprehensive enough remained an open question in 1959 .", "In this context , the Philadelphia World 's Fair could provide a shared goal , a focused way for Bacon to complete the project he wanted .", "Market East , the Chestnut Street pedestrian mall , and even the heliport and Kabuki dancer really pale in comparison , though , to his essay 's boldest claim .", 'In 2009 Philadelphia will not have any bad neighborhood , suburbanite will have moved back bringing their vitality and tax dollar with them , greenway will ring the city , transportation option will be rational and varied ; the entire metropolis will reflect the best and brightest idea that modern urban planning can deliver .', "Bacon 's prediction still astound with their self-confidence , and throughout the 1960s and into the 1970s , from City Hall to the hall of academia and elite architecture firm and banker ' office , from newsroom to neighborhood across the city , Philadelphians would grapple with the idea that a world 's fair could help deliver the future city they desired .", 'This chapter examines the fair-as-urban renewal formula that Ed Bacon worked with to promote his long-range planning objective in Philadelphia .', "The `` 2009 '' essay was just one of the many publication and speech he used to stimulate and sustain interest in the manifold project of the PCPC .", 'But here was a truly seductive model of development .', "If a world 's fair could leave useful permanent structure behind while simultaneously rejuvenating public faith in the city , then what was the downside ?", 'Ed Bacon and score of Philadelphians would take up this challenge , shaping it over a 15-year period to fit their own vision for the future of their city .', "From London 's 1851 Crystal Palace Exhibition to New York 's 1939 World 's Fair , such event periodically announced new era in technology and science , in business , and in culture .", 'As Bacon and other key player in Philadelphia intuited , they also offered host city opportunities to innovate in urban design .', "Starting with Brussels in 1958 a new generation of postwar world 's fair began , and the planning for the Philadelphia Fair took place as fair were held in Seattle ( 1962 ) , New York ( 1964 ) , Montreal ( 1967 ) , San Antonio ( 1968 ) , and Osaka ( 1970 ) .", 'The difficulty of the New York Fair and the success of the Montreal one especially played defining role as the Philadelphia planning process went forward .', "Learning and applying lesson from fair in other city and other era proved difficult for Philadelphia 's planner .", 'The chapter develops two main analytical point .', "First , world 's fair have historically proven as different and mercurial as the city and time period of their creation , and have rarely inspired large-scale urban renewal in host city in predictable , linear way .", "The historical lesson and legacy of world 's fair for urban planner were ( and remain ) decidedly ambiguous .", 'But by studying the period of gestation for a fair , and perhaps by extension any large-scale civic undertaking , we gain critical insight into the dominant conflict shaping the modern city .', "As the planning process moved into the 1960s and early 1970s , it became more and more evident that the Philadelphia World 's Fair of 1976-if it was to happen-would not recreate the 1876 Centennial Exhibition or launch an urban renaissance so much as reflect the clashing ambition of citizen caught in a declining American industrial metropolis .", "The final plan , to the extent there ever was one plan , deviated starkly in both intention and design from Bacon 's 1959 vision .", 'This leads to the second point .', "The deviation from Bacon 's `` 2009 '' vision shows two quite specific urban historical process working in conjunction : The decline of the `` master planner '' and by extension New Deal/Great Society urban liberalism , and the rise of a consensus-seeking planning model driven by the maturation of urban community-based protest movement .", "The evolving plan for the World 's Fair vividly show these trend defining one another , with plan for ( and protest against ) the Fair emerging from all quarter of the city , diluting the strength of Bacon 's 1959 vision , while at the same time adding element more desirable , more democratic , to the multiple community affected .", 'Between 1970 and 1972 planning for the Fair broke apart amid a prolonged season of racial strife , intergenerational resentment , federal disinvestment , and a creeping urban pessimism .', 'Combined with hesitant municipal leadership this climate of urban uncertainty clouded the vision of a fair-as-catalyst to a utopian `` Philadelphia in the Year 2009 .', '`` .', 'Assessing the built environment using gps , physical activity monitor and geospatial survey .', 'Understanding what aspect of the built environment contribute to health concern such as obesity is not an easy task , due to the scale of the built environment and inconsistency in community design , climate and culture .', 'It is therefore necessary to look at the detailed layer of the built environment to better understand what component may have the largest impact .', 'This can be a daunting task .', 'Through the use of participatory research method , geospatial tool and physical activity recording device , it is possible to create model of how people interact with their environment .', "This paper discusses how geospatial technology along with physical activity monitor have been used to determine if the urban forest , a component of the built environment , influences an individual 's decision to use a particular walking/running route in Ames , Iowa , USA .", 'Making a difference in challenging urban school : Successful principal .', 'The article reports upon finding from four multiple-perspective case study of successful principal in challenging urban context .', 'Each principal was described as making a significant difference to the quality of school education .', "The finding are obtained from the Polish part of the 'Leading Schools Successfully in Challenging Urban Contexts ' : Strategy For Improvement ' project .", "The research design consisted of two overlapping phase : the first was a literature review to ascertain 'what is known ' about the nature and effect of leadership in challenging urban contexts ; the second involved a case-study approach , collecting data from 36 school to explore the leadership strategy that are used by successful principal of school that face challenging urban context .", 'The analysis of the case identified that there were several interconnected strategy that are not only important , but essential for leadership success in these school .', 'They are related to setting the direction , developing people , redesigning the organisation and changing the culture of the school .', 'Each of them encompasses more specific competency , attitude and consideration .', 'Chan Kom tourism and migration in the making of the new Maya milpas .', "Tourism has proved to be an intriguing global platform within which `` host '' and `` guest '' combine and articulate their cultural baggage .", 'In the process , image and cultural representation are created and reinterpreted within the socioeconomic and ideological postulate of the tourism rationale .', 'At the same time , the phenomenon of tourism exemplifies the dissolution of cultural boundary , examined by many as the product of globalizing current .', "`` Crisis of representation '' has become a very popular expression among postmodernist discourse , within which it embeds the multiple meaning and symbol encapsulated in the unbordered nature of our cultural world ( Lyotard 1984 ; Jameson 1984 ; Harvey 1991 ; Marcus and Fisher 1986 ; Said 1978 ) .", 'The conceptual arena of this study is framed within this unbordering milieu applied to current globalizing trend , tourism and migration .', 'The focus of the study is the analysis of the phenomenon of tourism development in Mexico and the outmigration process among Maya community in the Yucatán Peninsula .', 'The analytical window of the ethnographic data is centered on the concept of labor and production and how these are transformed due to the articulation of migration and tourism .', 'Mexico greatly satisfies the global demand for vacationing in exotic place ; in particular , the Caribbean region provides tourist with the uniqueness of the sand beach and water color .', 'Cancún is the most acclaimed tourist emporium in this region .', 'Although Cancún represents American- style entertainment in an exotic landscape for many , it also becomes the gateway to Maya culture .', 'Waitress dressed with huipiles ( traditional female Maya dress ) , pyramid- shaped hotel , and shopping mall spiced with pre- Hispanic Mayastyle painting and sculpture are a few among the many remainder of the connection between Cancún and Maya culture .', 'The Maya community of Chan Kom and the international tourist emporium of Cancún are the two major cultural landscape in this study .', 'Although Chan Kom and Cancún are embroidered in the same current globalizing fabric , each represents different cultural contexts .', 'Chan Kom is located at the heart of the north- central part of the Yucatán Peninsula and is flanked by two impressive archaeological site .', 'It is located about 14 kilometer south of Chichén Itzá and about 90 kilometer west of Cobá .', 'Chan Kom is located 9 kilometer off the Mérida- Cancún highway , 132 kilometer from Mérida and 290 kilometer from Cancún .', 'Cancún represents a complex tapestry of different ethnic group , social class , and nationality that color the multicultural composition of our international tourist world .', 'Fascinated by the opportunity to experience the tropical exoticism , thousand of tourist visit Cancún annually .', "At the same time , attracted by the opportunity `` to advance , '' `` to modernize , '' and `` to prosper , '' hundred of Maya move to Cancún to become the underlying base of labor for the development of tourism .", 'Tourist and Maya have to cross different cultural and socioeconomic border in order to experience Cancún .', "In their travel , tourist and Maya migrant bring their cultural package with them , and they learn , from each other , to conceptualize the value and position of `` culture '' within the capitalist code of consumption .", "Through their experience as migrant in Cancún , Maya learn the crucial role that Maya cultural `` authenticity '' play in the economic success of the tourism enterprise .", 'Tourist brochure depicting the turquoise water and the white sand beach are quite often framed by pyramid , chacmols ( reclining figure with flexed knee ) , and other representation of the glorious ancient world of the Maya .', 'With this , tourist are symbolically invited not only to enjoy the paradisiacal landscape of Cancún but also to consider it as the entrance to the ancient Maya culture .', 'Most tourist vacation package include visit to major archaeological site such as Tulum and Chichén Itzá .', 'This has promoted the proliferation of artisan stand not only within the archaeological site but also along the way to the site .', 'The community nearest to Chichén Itzá ( i.e.', ", K'aua , Piste , X- Calacop ) have specialized in the production of wooden sculpture , replicas of ancient Maya design for tourist consumption .", "The knowledge acquired as migrant in Cancún- what can be considered `` human capital '' -is invested in the planning of economic strategy for local development , mainly focused on the exploitation of cultural attraction for the tourist clientele in Chan Kom .", "Inspired by Edward Said 's Orientalism ( 1978 ) , some study denounce the culture of tourism as a new form of colonialism ( Nash 1995 ) .", "Indeed , many indigenous people have come to view tourism as a `` new form of sugar '' ( Rajotte 1987 ) , that is , a new form of exploitation of the indigenous population by external force .", "Other study emphasize the detrimental impact of tourism among indigenous community , particularly in the loss of `` authenticity '' of culture .", "However , these critique render `` culture '' as static and deny people their history ( Greenwood 1989 ) .", "In contrast to these position , the present study explores the unbordering global condition of our world as it is expressed in Cancún 's tourist ideology .", "Cancún is sustained by the infrastructural support of Maya migrant labor and legitimized by the international tourist ideology as a search for the `` exotic other . ''", "This framework brings Chan Kom 's and Cancún 's cultural realm into dialogue and negotiation .", 'Certainly , the tourist culture embeds rule of production and consumption radically different from those encapsulated in the milpa ( cornfield ) ideology that Maya experience in their community .', 'The dialogue between Cancún and Chan Kom cultural ideology has different outcome .', 'Most peasant in Chan Kom reject Cancún influence by elaborating folk story denouncing the urban danger .', "On the other hand , migrant survive in Cancún by `` Mayanizing '' it , utilizing the ideological basis of their peasant Maya background .", 'And the current political leader in Chan Kom , with a long experience as successful migrant in Cancún , utilize their human capital to plan local development strategy .', "With this , Chan Kom 's political leader adapt the lesson in `` culture '' consumption learned in Cancún 's international tourism market to their community 's life .", "Thus , this analysis focuses on Chan Kom 's social fragmentation , provoked by outmigration to Cancún , which can not be understood without the interconnection between the social realms of Cancún and Chan Kom .", 'Restoration in mind : Placing ecological restoration in a cultural context .', 'Restoration is a cultural act , an interaction between human and nature that is mediated by social norm .', 'Sense of place , land tenure , source of livelihood and tradition of community organizing all mediate the relationship between people and place .', 'Culture differs from country to country , from watershed to watershed , making restoration a process that is very individual to a community and its watershed .', 'This study examines the human ecology of urban watershed restoration in two country : Canada and the Philippines .', "As we work to restore the world 's watershed , we must deepen our understanding of the social complexity of those watershed and accept that culture often designs restoration for us .", 'Memory , site , city : Rethinking about the city and architecture in the perspective of psychology and sociology .', 'Each city includes memory element .', 'As a precious resource , the city memory exists , change and continues in reality through visual material object and cultural sub-consciousness .', 'It is the basic context clue for urban people to apperceive , to experience themselves and their existent environment with the lapse and change of time .', 'Beginning with the concept of memory , this article analyzed the relationship of time , space , human being and environment .', 'It tried to use interdisciplinary research method and rethink about the essence of city and architecture in the perspective of psychology and sociology , so as to explore the deep Pissues of ideology and value conception in urban design and urban conservation of history and culture .', 'The 1876 centennial in Philadelphia : Elite network and political culture .', 'AT NOON on May 10 , 1876-after year of controversy , construction , and fuss-President Ulysses S. Grant and Emperor Dom Pedro of Brazil entered Machinery Hall to open the Centennial Exhibition of 1876 in Philadelphia .', "Since early morning , the day 's 186,000 attendee had been streaming through the gate .", 'The president and the emperor stood in front of thirteen acre of motionless machinery , all connected by pulley , shaft , wheel and belt to the giant Corliss engine in the central transept .', 'Several hundred invited guest , already waiting there , made room for the ceremonial party to climb upon the concrete base of the huge metal monster towering forty foot above their head almost to the trussed roof of the Hall .', 'Machinery Hall was one of five major building put up by exhibition organizer in Fairmount Park ; outside group built dozen more .', 'The Main Building was the largest in the world at the time-over a third of a mile long .', "Visitor marveled at the item on display : A typewriter , Hires root beer , the Statue of Liberty 's torch , the Westinghouse air brake , Fleischmann 's yeast , cable from the Brooklyn Bridge , Bell 's telephone , and Otis 's elevator.2 The Centennial was a resounding success , dramatically displaying Philadelphia 's wealth and industrial might .", "Over nine million people-nearly one-fifth of the country 's population-attended before its close in November .", 'It was the first international exposition held in the United States and probably the single most important cultural event of its era .', "Foreigner flocked to Philadelphia-inaugurating mass tourism to the United States-to see American industrial innovation and dozen of foreign exhibit from Britain , Norway , Belgium , Russia , Japan , China , Sweden , Germany , France , Italy , Canada , Mexico , Brazil , and `` two large Arab tent . ''", "This influx of visitor and national culture also opened Philadelphia andthe United States to a world of new influence ; the Japanese exhibit in particular stirred an Oriental design fashion in the United States.3 Beyond the pomp , the fanfare , the hotel receipt , and the visitor , the Centennial also helped restructure the city 's politics .", 'The event both cemented network of alliance among previously divided elite and marked the ascendance of a Republican hegemony in local political culture that would be virtually unchallenged for the next sixty year .', "The Republican regime that coalesced in the 1870s combined several element : party bossism centered in control of several city agency , an electoral machine that came to trade vote for public construction contract , business support based in ideological solidarity ( support for protectionist legislation ) , and reliance on rail- And port-related industry as the engine of the city 's economy .", "In Philadelphia 's case , the irony is that those Republicans who did the most to make the Centennial happen-large , reformist civic organization like the Union League that played crucial role in event planning and in promoting commitment to the Republican Party-did not necessarily enjoy the political fruit of their labor .", "Over time , the elite 's cultural and ideological commitment to Republicanism became a straitjacket , and they lost control of the polity they had helped build .", 'More broadly , I use the example of the Centennial to examine the role that cultural project play in urban governance .', 'These project , and the planning effort that produce them , contribute to the emergence and consolidation of governing regime out of situation of extreme political discord and fragmentation .', 'They connect process of elite network formation ( social capital ) and ideological consolidation .', "These two process in turn are the building block of hegemony in local governance-cultural and social leadership that shapes people 's political commitment and the extent to which they are willing to consider or pursue alternative to prevailing arrangement .", 'Sustainable city planning and building design : Case study .', 'There has been more than 150 year in the history of Western industrial civilization .', 'The industrial civilization had long depended on carbon based technology .', 'Building industry is a major area to have most of the energy drain .', "The sprawling city , typical 20th century 's practice have the major blame on producing waste gas that are affecting our environment .", 'The carbon based global economy dominates our daily life .', 'The already oversized Ecological Footprint for most of developed country , plus continuing using the non-renewable energy resource based technology , not only pay a heavy price on our environment and could lead to global ecological collapse .', 'Taking China as an example , China has strived for their modern image for the past decade .', 'People want to copy western living style , for instance , wider road ; garden house , landscaping village and high rise block in order to catch up with the modern living in the West .', 'Copying the West despite great climatic difference , not only destroy the harmony between the culture and the nature , at the same time overuse the energy resource , in consequence self-destruct the environment .', 'Destruction of huge part of agricultural land in China in the past two decade and contamination of farm land by all kind of industrial waste are result from boom of manufacturing industry .', 'China has paid high price on the environment in exchange to the fast economic development .', 'Air and water quality are poor , water shortage had already challenged the 1.3 billion people in China .', "This paper bases on proposal to Ningbo , a city along China 's east coast in Zhejiang Province among only in academic circle , not yet being discussed among official , on how successfully utilizing renewable resource in city 's strategic planning and in the building design .", 'This requires knowledge on waste treatment and on balancing resource management .', 'At the same time , it takes into consideration of cultural , traditional factor in Ningbo .', "How vernacular form of building design or urban pattern could find their perfect fit with China 's rapid economic development will also be discussed in this paper .", 'Compromising building regulation and user expectation in the design of high-rise domestic kitchen .', 'Purpose - The purpose of this paper is to discuss the significance and relevance of social and habitual behaviours of home occupant to the building design process .', "It argues that introducing quantitative measure such as daylight level alone may not result in a `` healthy and functional '' kitchen without appreciating or factoring-in the impact of the social role and user expectation of kitchen in high-rise and compact urban situation .", 'Design/methodology/approach - The study investigated three common type of apartment building in Hong Kong .', 'Case study suggested that it is crucial to include in a design process proper consideration of human behaviour byway of preferred approach andmodes of living , space usage , andweightings of end-user response that would influence architectural design in a direct and crucial way .', 'Finding - The study noted that daylight quality of a kitchen is perceived by most family to be not as important as building control official and designer thought it would .', 'Instead , it is found that social and cultural factor are more important parameter for user .', 'The study observed that designer rely on physical and quantitative approach such as daylight factor , window size and window-to-room area ratio to qualify a design solution and ignore the socio-cultural parameter .', 'Originality/value - The paper calls for designer and building control official to incorporate the study of functionality and socio-cultural preference of user group in the building design process .', 'The study envisages that an integrated design methodology would enhance the living environment .', 'Pleasure-based design approach to the built environment .', 'As an exercise in discipline cross-fertilisation , this paper applies the emergent practice of pleasure-based approach in product design to the design of the built environment .', "This analysis provides insight into human ' emotional response to the environment that is provided for them .", "Jordan 's four pleasure model , composed of physio- , socio- , psycho- and ideo-pleasures , is used to undertake this analysis .", 'From this analytical process it is evident that physio- , socio- and psycho-pleasures are drawn from generic element that relate to human as a kind , and that these commonality are deeply rooted historical and cultural reference point .', "Understanding these reference point , and the design principles that emerge from them , will enable those who provide the built environment to engage with the 'super-usability ' imperative that these pleasure-based approach have been drawn from and , in so doing , to develop human-centric solution that engender positive relationship between people and the environment that is provided for them .", "However , in the absence of a 'market ' , one area will remain problematic - that of personalised and individually constructed ideo-pleasure .", 'The merging of community sustainability with enhanced environmental performance : A local government case study .', 'The City of Port Phillip is an inner-metropolitan municipality within the urban area of Melbourne .', 'The City is on the shore of Port Phillip Bay , and has a population of over 80,000 resident .', 'It is a mixed use area of house , apartment , office , retail area and industry , with an emphasis on leisure and tourism attraction , drawing visitor from locally and overseas .', 'It has a strongly defined urban heritage , a community committed to art and culture and a diverse socio-economic demography .', 'Gentrification and rising property value have altered the physical and social character of the municipality in recent year .', "The Council places a high priority on Cultural Vitality , Social Equity and Environmental Responsibility ; three of the four 'pillars ' of its Corporate Plan .", 'This paper describes measure taken by the Council since 2000 to effectively integrate its range of environmental initiative with program to enhance the social well-being and connectedness of its citizen .', 'It emphasises the importance of integrating program that primarily address one element of the Corporate Plan but which , by proper planning and project management , can have beneficial synergy with others .', "Specific reference is made to program that the Council has recently or is currently undertaking , including : Sustainable Design Strategy , and its implementation through the planning permit process , The Sustainable Living at Home Program ( SLAH ) , in which households work co-operatively to reduce their 'environmental footprint ' , in term of energy and water consumption , travel behaviour , purchasing practice , etc.", ", Sustainable Community Progress Indicators ( SCPI ) , a community based program which measures how we are progressing to a more social environmentally , culturally and economically sustainable community , `` margin , memory and marker '' , a unique , State-funded program to improve mental health by enhancing people ' connectedness with 'place ' and community via story-telling and art installation , and Design-Ins and other consultation initiative , which aim to include all sector of the community in the development of more convivial and effective public place .", 'The paper concludes with the contention that sustainable city can be more readily achieved if local government take a holistic approach to the integration of physical , cultural and social measure to enhance the lifestyle of resident , worker and visitor .', 'Designing a DNA for adaptive architecture : A new built environment for social sustainability .', 'The paper explores innovative environmentally responsible and socially proactive way to build in developing country .', 'The proposed methodology was tested with the design of a Smart Village in Egypt , awarded the second prize in an international competition .', 'Our design approach is based on environmental and social sustainability and works as a genetic algorithm .', 'This process generates the sustainable architecture of the village using the behaviour of biological creature in artificial system .', 'The design ultimately ensures that our architecture is nurtured by renewable energy and built with re-cycled material .', 'The disposition of public space and the flexible organization of different function are conceived in order to stimulate social sustainability , allowing the community to be interdependent as much as an ecosystem .', 'Local culture , typology , material and climate build the DNA of both the village and its building .', "We apply concept from artificial life , using `` creature '' that follow simple low-level rule in order to get high-level group behaviour .", 'By combining the principle of artificial life and architecture , we get both high energy-efficiency and optimal placement of built unit on a specific site .', 'As in any ecosystem , a fractal , coherent , continuous fluctuation at every scale of the system is vital , and this kinetic flexibility is achieved at four level : 1 ) decentralized urban planning ; 2 ) reconfigurable space ; 3 ) modular building block ; 4 ) kinetic structure that respond to light , climate and people .', 'Composing the noise space : Musical architecture of urban culture .', 'In the recent climate change era of several tropical urban living and culture , many slum are built on the railroad track accompanying the overheating environment .', 'The people in that area can receive the noise radiation that was made from the railroad and the train wheel friction .', 'The design research aims to manage noise with high intensity into the white noise , which was fit and valuable to increasing human life performance in daily life .', 'It enhances through designing the attractive area at Malang urban area as the site and analyzing the environmental psychology approach according to adaptable barrier .', 'This study uses audio editing and music notation software , Adobe Audition and Cubase , to capture the sound to support the design .', "The result highlighted that musical architecture could bridge the need of the various people 's living space and noise that can not be moved and deleted .", 'The play of material , order , and composition of time that pay attention to the intensity and frequency of noise design project compose the rhythm of formal and spatial settlement design .', 'Ethic of smart city : Towards value-sensitive design and co-evolving city life .', 'The digital revolution has brought about many societal change such as the creation of “ smart city ” .', 'The smart city concept has changed the urban ecosystem by embedding digital technology in the city fabric to enhance the quality of life of its inhabitant .', 'However , it has also led to some pressing issue and challenge related to data , privacy , ethic inclusion , and fairness .', 'While the initial concept of smart city was largely technology-and data-driven , focused on the automation of traffic , logistics and process , this concept is currently being replaced by technology-enabled , human-centred solution .', 'However , this is not the end of the development , as there is now a big trend towards “ design for value ” .', 'In this paper , we point out how a value-sensitive design approach could promote a more sustainable pathway of city that better serves people and nature .', 'Such “ valuesensitive design ” will have to take ethic , law and culture on board .', 'We discuss how organising the digital world in a participatory way , as well as leveraging the concept of self-organisation , selfregulation , and self-control , would foster synergy effect and thereby help to leverage a sustainable technological revolution on a global scale .', 'Furthermore , a “ democracy by design ” approach could also promote resilience .', 'Research on commercial interior environment design based on computer aided design .', 'Modernism is a function-centered design idea , which holds that man is the basic starting point of design and emphasizes the unity of technology and art .', 'Modern commercial environment is one of the important component of modern city , and it is also an important place to show the commercial culture , urban style and feature of modern city .', 'The concept of computer aided design is applied to the design objectivity view that seeks to measure beauty or aesthetic in some quantitative manner .', 'Christopher Alexander has long discovered that beauty or coherence highly correlates to the number of subsymmetries or substructure and demonstrated that there is a shared notion of beauty—structural beauty—among people and even different people , regardless of their faith , culture , and ethnicity .', 'This notion of structural beauty arises directly out of living structure or wholeness , a physical and mathematical structure that underlies all space and matter .', 'Based on the concept of living structure , this paper develops an approach for computing the structural beauty or life of an image ( L ) based on the number of automatically derived substructure ( S ) and their inherent hierarchy ( H ) .', 'To verify this approach , we conducted a series of case study applied to eight pair of image including Leonardo da Vinci ’ s Mona Lisa and Jackson Pollock ’ s Blue Poles .', 'We discovered among others that Blue Poles is more structurally beautiful than the Mona Lisa , and traditional building are in general more structurally beautiful than their modernist counterpart .', 'This finding implies that goodness of thing or image is largely a matter of fact rather than an opinion or personal preference as conventionally conceived .', 'The research on structural beauty has social meaning , especially in Iran .', 'In this research , the marketplace is considered from a socio-commercial point of view .', 'In order to improve the efficiency of public space , it is necessary to identify their effective parameter of socialization , and utilize them towards the future design or improvement of built environment .', 'While the socio-cultural influence of a bazaar determines the development of human relationship around it , its environmental component are also effective in responding to ‘ physical need ’ of a populace , that is , the provision of necessity such
