'Background and aim : Rise of urbanization in last century has led to the formation of large city and the accumulation of human population in concentrated urban area .', 'Commercial center in large city are considered as the metropolitan critical area .', 'Commercial center in metropolis are prone to crisis and the accident in these center can lead to human , social , and economic disaster .', 'The presence of old texture , monument , cultural feature , large number of visitor per day , incompatibility of traffic route with some of these center , weak infrastructure and facility , etc .', 'increase the importance of crisis management in metropolitan commercial center .', 'In recent year , existence of some major weakness in crisis management in metropolis has revealed the need for complementary approach such as resilience engineering .', 'Resilience engineering is a new approach to measuring and maintaining safety in complex system , with the goal of maintaining the capacity of the organization at an acceptable level to face crisis and maintaining the ability of the organization to return to its pre-crisis state .', 'The purpose of this study was to design a questionnaire for crisis management assessment in commercial center , based on resilient engineering approach .', 'Several commercial center of Tehran were selected for this study .', 'Method : Management commitment , reporting culture , learning culture , transparency , preparedness , awareness , and flexibility were considered as the main criterion of resilience r engineering ( RE ) .', 'After identifying the main criterion , the questionnaire question were extracted based on literature review , field study , expert ’ opinion , and the use of contextual content analysis , .', 'Then a questionnaire with 97 question was designed according to expert ’ opinion .', 'This questionnaire was evaluated by 17 expert of safety and crisis management , using Delphi technique .', 'For initial screening of identified sub-criteria , a score between 1 to 5 was assigned for each of them and any sub-criteria with score of less than 3 was omitted .', 'The Delphi technique was applied in two round and a questionnaire with 68 question was approved in the second round .', "Kendall 's coefficient of concordance was used to calculate the consistency of expert ' opinion .", 'The ANP model was then used for weighting and prioritizing the sub-criteria .', 'The sub-criteria were compared in pair based Saaty ’ s 1-9 scale .', 'Reliability of the questionnaire was assessed by calculating the inconsistency rate .', 'If the inconsistency rate of the pairwise comparison is greater than 0.1 , it is better to revise the comparison .', 'DEMATE L technique was used to identify criterion interrelationship .', 'The matrix derived from the DEMTEL technique ( Interrelationships matrix ) is able to show the causal relationship between the effectiveness of the variable and their capacity to be influenced by the other factor .', 'The ANP analysis consists of four step .', 'Step 1 : Identifying the main criterion ; Step 2 : Identify interrelationship ; Step 3 : Determining the overall priority ; and Step 4 : testing the consistency .', 'Based on the calculation and the limit super-matrix , the final priority of sub-criteria were derived by the SuperDecision software .', 'In this study , TO PSIS technique was used to select s the best shopping center among other shopping complex in Tehran .', 'The 5-point Likert scale was used to score the shopping center based on each sub-criterion .', 'Finally , the research data were analyzed through multiple case study in 7 commercial complex using a researcher-made questionnaire to determine the level of resilience .', 'The data were analyzed using Excel and SPSS 18 software .', "Result : Based on the Kendall 's coefficient of concordance , the consistency rate of expert ' opinion in the first and second round were 0.317 and 0.637 , respectively .", 'The result showed that management commitment , preparedness , awareness , culture of reporting , flexibility , culture c of learning , and transparency ( which had normalized weight of 0.182 , 0.80 , 0.178 , 0.155 , 0 .', '128 , 0.100 , and 0.077 , respectively ) had the priority of 1 to 7 respectively .', 'The result of the management commitment sub-criteria analysis showed that setting and communicating the policy and objective of crisis management in the commercial complex by the manager was the first priority ( with the normalized weight of 0.168 ) .', "Issue such as the building structure and selecting the right people , the manager 's attention to the importance of building safety , preparing the plan , and providing the resource and equipment needed for the complex were the next priority .", 'For the culture of reporting sub-criterion , tendency of individual to report error and unsafe situation in the commercial center was the first priority ( with the normalized weight of 0.132 ) .', 'Therefore , organization should always pay attention to report provided by employee and customer .', 'For the culture of learning sub-criterion , the commercial center ’ use of previous accident and crisis to better respond to future event was the first priority ( with the normalized weight of 0.238 ) .', 'Learning from crisis simulation and practical exercise to build up teamwork experience for speeding up reaction to similar event were the next priority .', 'The result of this prioritization of learning culture sub-criteria indicate the importance of learning from past event to prevent similar event .', 'For the transparency sub-criterion , Identification of non-conformities and deviation of commercial complex from normal safety limit was the first priority ( with the normalized weight of 0.084 ) .', 'The inconsistency rate of the comparison was 0.084 , which is less than 0.1 .', 'For the preparedness sub-criterion , existence of a crisis management team in the commercial center was the first priority ( with the normalized weight of 0.161 ) and creating and communicating the emergency response document , deploying the safety management system , identifying related risk in commercial complex , developing and implementing the preventive program and plan , implementing the safety rule and regulation to inspect and retrofit structural and non-structural component of commercial complex , increasing their resistance against crisis , anticipating cooperation with foreign relief organization , alert system readiness , smart fire alarm system , performing maneuvering operation , and training of employee and tradepeople were the next priority , respectively .', 'For the awareness criterion , reporting of the complex safety problem was the first priority ( with the normalized weight of 0.142 ) .', 'Defining a transparent communication mechanism to report safety concern , increasing intergroup coordination and collaboration at a time of crisis , and how they perform their task against task description were the next priority , respectively .', 'For the flexibility criterion , sub-criterion of ability to control unforeseen environmental condition by management was the first priority ( with the normalized weight of 0.25 ) .', 'Employee decision-making without unnecessary waiting for management order was the next priority .', 'DEMATEL technique showed that the management commitment was the most effective criterion and had the least capacity to be influenced by the other factor .', 'The criterion of preparedness had the highest capacity to be influenced by the other factor .', 'The criterion of transparency had the highest interaction with other criterion .', 'Calculation of the final priority of the sub-criteria performed by the ANP technique showed that the sub-criterion of identifying non-conformities and deviation from safety boundary was the first priority ( with the normalized weight of 0.0448 ) , the commercial center ’ use of previous accident and crisis to better respond to future event was the second priority ( with the normalized weight of 0.34 ) , sub-criterion manager ability to control unforeseen environmental condition was the third priority ( with the normalized weight of 0.0293 ) , and simulating crisis and performing practical exercise to create teamwork experience and increase reaction speed was the fourth priority ( with the normalized weight of 0.0278 ) .', 'Conclusion : Based on the result of the research , in the crisis management of commercial complex based on the resilience engineering approach , management commitment and preparedness are the most significant criterion and transparency is the least significant criterion in creating resilience against crisis .', 'overall , the result showed that the designed crisis assessment questionnaire based on the seven principle of resilience engineering , is efficient and appropriate for assessing crisis management in commercial complex and this questionnaire can be used to know the current situation of crisis management in commercial complex .', 'Crossing professional habit for - 1938 ) .', 'The end of the Great war brought about many change in the European political , social and economic climate .', 'Monarchy were replaced with more democratic system , country lost their territory , and new sates based on national principle were established .', 'In 1918 , after a period of ethnic oppression and magyarization in the Hungarian part of the Habsburg Empire following the Austro-Hungarian Compromise , the Bohemian and Slovak people declared their independence and founded a new national state - the Czechoslovakia .', 'The period short after its foundation was one full of enthusiasm and joy stemming from the newfound freedom and opportunity for cultivation of national culture , identity and politics in democratic environment on the one hand , and challenge brought by the dissolution of the Austro-Hungarian economy and political system on the other .', 'As a result of establishing the new state , the need arose to define its nation by architecture and the issue of National Style reemerged .', 'After the brief period of Rondocubism preference , for some time , the official building retained certain expressive character and massive feature .', 'Even after giving way to Modernism , the sense of traditionalism was evident .', 'In the Slovak part of Czechoslovakia , bank building , as building of institution that once supported national-emancipatory aspiration of Slovak people , bank architecture often used well-established scheme and preferred more traditional design to convey desired message .', 'The institution in charge of monetary separation and management of the new currency was the Banking Office of the Ministry of Finance and subsequently the National Bank of Czechoslovakia ( since 1926 ) .', 'After the collapse of Austro-Hungarian Empire , all the building of branch office of the former central bank - the Austro-Hungarian Bank - were took over by the Czechoslovak government .', 'These were often extended , as were the case of branch office building in Bratislava , Košice and Žilina .', 'When they no longer fitted the formal or capacity criterion , three new branch office building were built on the territory of present-day Slovakia : a neo-renaissance building in Banská Bystrica ( Ladislav Skřivánek , 1930 - 1932 ) and two building in the style of regional modernism with note of traditionalism and classical feature in Ružomberok ( Vladimír Fischer , 1930 - 1932 ) and Bratislava ( Emil Belluš , 1936-1938 ) .', 'The article examines stylistic , ideological , formal , and layout requirement for an architectural concept of a central bank institution demonstrated on the example of branch office building built during existence of the First Czechoslovak Republic in the territory of the present-day Slovakia .', .', 'Ha Long Bay—the United Nations Educational , Scientific and Cultural Organization ( UNESCO ) World Heritage Site on Vietnam ’ s northeastern seacoast—is often considered one of the world ’ s most degradation .', 'Since 2014 , in order to protect the UNESCO World Heritage Site , the local authority has planned a project to demolish the floating village and move these community to the mainland .', 'The idea of zoopolis in contemporary architectural dimension .', 'In recent time , the idea of non-anthropocentric architecture has become one of the determinant of contemporary , conscious approach towards design as a process .', "Its characteristic feature is the extension of both , recognized as `` urban '' function , as well as the group of recipient on which the created space is to interact .", 'The direct connection between the notion of a city created by people ( polis ) and the animal world ( zoo ) was a long-lasting , multi-faceted process of broadening the meaning of animal subjectivity in culture , art and politics .', 'The very concept of zoopolis , appearing for the first time in the work of Donaldson and Kymlicka in 2011 , was initially applied to political science , in the context of place shared by man and domestic animal , where the city was understood as a political community of its inhabitant , including non-humans .', 'In the sphere of creating physical space , this concept appeared for the first time two year later thanks to Jennifer Wolch .', 'In term of zoopolis , the urbanized space will be a set of parallel world in which both people and nature live in the same area , whose multiple layer only sometimes cross or overlap .', 'The purpose of the work is to allow tracing the main determinant of the transformation process of contemporary policy from small point element to systemic action and identify the main feature of a non-anthropocentric city as a place for the emergence of new function and urban form .', 'Building in society : International study in the historic era .', 'Building in Society : International Studies in the Historic Era presents a series of paper reflecting the latest approach to the study of building from the historic period .', 'This volume does not examine building as architecture , but adopts an archaeological perspective to consider them as artefact , reflecting the need of those who commissioned them .', 'Study have often failed to consider the historical contexts in which the building were constructed and how they were subsequently used and interpreted .', 'The paper in this volume situate their interpretation in their social context .', 'Building can inform us about past culture as they are responsive and evolve to meet people ’ s needs over time .', 'The building examined in this volume range from the twelfth to the twenty-first century and cross continent including case-studies from America , Australia and Europe , the United Kingdom , Ireland , Scandinavia and the Mediterranean .', 'Theme include : Approach to the study of building , Building of Power , Buildings in Identity , Domestic Space and Urban and Village Spaces .', 'The essay consider building design , role , and how the building were altered as their function changed to coincide with the need and aspiration of those who owned or used the building .', 'This collection of paper emphasizes the need for further international multidisciplinary approach including archaeology , architectural history and art history in order to understand how idea , style , approach and design spread over time and space .', 'Together , these paper generate valuable new insight into the study of building in the historic period .', 'Inclusive placemaking : Building future on local heritage .', 'The original placemaking philosophy was based on the recognition that place is intrinsically tied to cultural value , one tested by generation of human interaction .', 'Its practice have created a growing body of knowledge of not leave room for character and distinctive beauty .', 'The result can be place that are again more a manifestation of planning principle and generalised design strategy than integrating urban culture and community .', 'Without inclusion of the attribute that people want to preserve , adapt , rehabilitate , or even reconstruct , public space may present a missed opportunity to produce satisfaction .', 'Placemaking practice might be expanded again , to advocate for more sustaining , organised complexity , and reconciling new urban community with adaptive place full of character .', facility modernization that entailed the redevelopment of an existing building in one of the most historic seafood market in Busan Metropolitan City .', 'Established during the Korean War ( 1950–1953 ) while Busan was the city with the most war refugee , the market is a significant historic place that is imbued with a unique culture created by the people who have sustained the market over the past 60 year .', 'This chapter highlights the significance of the market ’ s historical particularity and authentic sense of place , which are reflective of the people who have inhabited the marketplace .', 'It also problematizes the outward-looking nature of the Jagalchi Market Modernization , which is represented by the architectural design of the new Jagalchi Market building and the street framework of community resilience of the flat resident .', 'The government , non-government organization and community leader in some country were challenged to design and implement policy , program and system that could help local community to overcome various threat .', 'Change of situation in the community , such as relocation , was considered a threat .', 'In Indonesia , especially DKI Jakarta , in order to implement the Urban Environment Management Program , the government relocated the community who occupied illegal land to simple rental flat ( rusunawa ) .', 'People who were impacted by this policy had to adjust themselves to the new environment to make living , and some other chose to stay in a modest flat .', 'The concept of community resilience has been an interesting issue as it dealt with the ability of something , someone or even society in overcoming difficulty , to recover and return to normal condition at the right time .', 'This study was done to propose a conceptual framework for community resilience for the resident of modest rental flat and to determine a standard method to examine the community resilience among resident of modest rental flat who were established prior to the relocation policy ( Marunda , Rawa Bebek and Kapuk Muara Penjaringan ) .', "To measure the strength and direction of the independent variable 's contribution to the dependent variable , Variance Based Structural Equation Modeling was administered using the Smart-PLS program .", 'The proposed conceptual framework for community resilience among the resident of modest flat covered 8 ( eight ) aspect , namely : 1 ) economy ; 2 ) social ; 3 ) culture ; 4 ) human resource ; 5 ) ecology ; 6 ) physical ; 7 ) politics and government and 8 ) technology .', 'Those aspect should be taken into consideration in order to increase the capacity of modest apartment to stay .', 'For the government or policy maker and information planner , the proposed framework can be used as an input for policy making , determining the priority scale , fund allocation and the enhancement of the sustainable flat housing development program .', 'Change in the contemporary public .', 'Generally , river can be considered the center of the city ’ s evolution , but nowadays river connection among city , society , culture and the environment is unclear .', 'One of the city ’ s a solution to revive the forgotten river , through creating a cultural promenade on its shore .', 'Beirut River in Lebanon is a forgotten river that burdens Beirut city with a lack of any decent quality of life , a dead polluted space , a forgotten area fragmenting the city , which should be the main potential gathering space for nature , tourism and investment .', 'As a case study , this paper investigates Beirut River through urban and ecological analysis , aiming to design an urban strategy for reviving it by creating a cultural promenade enriched with public space and green area , United States of America [ `` die ruim buitelugsitkamer van die stad '' : 'n Oorsigartikel oor die denke en doelstellings van stedelike parkontwikkeling in die laat 19de en vroeg 20ste eeu in Europa en die Verenigde State van Amerika ] .", 'The city park was a constant in the ever-changing city and an effective antidote to the feverishness of city life .', "The current emphasis on the benefit of park is understandable in the light of environmental issue such as , inter alia , earth warming threatening humankind 's existence on the planet .", 'By the 1970s , there was already a substantial canon of literature on urban park .', 'Since then , a new generation of urban environmental historian has emerged with new interest and approach .', 'It is therefore prudent to revisit the thinking and aims inherent in the early establishment of the urban park of the late 19th and early 20th century in Britain and the United States of America .', "The aim of this paper is to explore both the view of middle and upper class urbanites in Britain and the USA on the mostly harsh living condition in their city , labelling them as `` evil '' ; and the establishment of park being seen as one solution to alleviate said condition .", "The paper also focuses on how idea on `` nature '' , `` progress '' , `` health '' , `` moral '' , `` romanticism '' , `` social control '' and `` middle class respectability '' underpinned view on public park as pristine rural environment that should be transferred to the city .", 'Lastly , the way landscape designer echoed the idea and aspiration of the middle class in the design of parks is considered .', 'Rapid industrialisation and urbanisation led to a lack of connection between urban resident and previous rural/natural area and their benefit .', 'The perception was that this , in turn , contributed to the decline in moral and physical health and the eroding of culture .', 'The rural environment was idealised and seen as inherently good and superior to city living .', 'If transferred to the city , it could create an ideal urban environment .', 'Fredrik Law Olmsted , the doyen of American park , fully supported these view .', 'By the turn of the 19th century , the permanence of the city was well established and perceived dichotomy between the urban and the rural resolved by a hybrid relationship .', 'As England was the leader in die development of park , it had a huge influence in the Western world with many country tapping into English idea on park .', 'However , from the 1850s there was thus a lively cross-fertilisation of idea on the urgency of park development .', 'The City Beautiful movement would have a significant influence on these dominant idea on park .', "The `` problem '' to which the provision of parks was expected to offer some relief , were easy to describe : ill-health , overcrowding and squalor .", 'The reason for addressing these problem were various .', 'The breathing space park could provide was seen as one solution to improve the health of those living in over-crowded condition .', 'During the middle to late 19th century the British government expressed concern about the lack of exercise amongst its citizen .', 'Initially , the park was seen as the ideal urban space for contemplative recreation and an escape from the harsh city environment .', 'However , by the turn of the 19thcentury park advocate called for active recreation .', 'They believed that there was a connection between poverty amongst the working class and a lack of fitness .', 'Fundamental to this was the hope that exercise in the park could contribute to a more productive working class .', 'By the 1930s park as space for exercise were well established in Europe and the USA .', 'This first era of park establishment in the Western world was heavily influenced by the interest of the city elite and middle class reformer .', "They viewed themselves as the keeper of respectability , `` civility '' and `` civilization '' and the driving force behind reform and progress .", "The target of `` improvement '' was the working-class and the ideal place the city parks .", "By `` civilizing '' the mass , there would be fewer encroachment on middle class sensibility .", "Moral reformer claimed that the health-giving character of park provided an alternative to `` urban vice '' by bringing the poor into visual contact with respectable bourgeoisie behaviour .", 'In addition , park offered strategic space to provide a safety valve for social upheaval .', 'By controlling how , when and where park were provided the middle class could supervise the working class in their non-work hour and attempt to control their behaviour .', 'Consequently , urban park became socially constructed space .', 'Park design reflected the ambition and belief of especially middle and upper class city dweller .', 'The vision was to introduce to the city spacious green space where city dweller could delight in the beauty of nature , fresh air and healthy exercise .', 'Generally , park designer demonstrated their conviction of the historical inevitability of the permanence of the city but also that city living could be pleasant .', 'Tapping into the 18th century English landscape gardening movement landscape architect applied the same basic use of tree , grass and water , suitably modified for mass usage .', 'The aim was to link green space to utilise the ecological value thereof and simultaneously create a work of art .', 'The layout were contrived with great insight into human need and behaviour , fostering gentle promenading and inducing the park visitor to forget their mundane concern .', 'Later park made provision for active recreation .', 'The characteristic of the design varied .', 'On the one hand the romantic idea of a pristine wilderness prevailed while on the other hand pastoral park were laid out .', 'Mostly it was a combination of both .', "Olmsted and Vaux opted to contrast wilderness vista with more subtle arrangement to express their vision of the `` picturesque '' .", 'Urban park became the ideal location for the erection of scientific and cultural exhibitionary complex , becoming the repository for glasshouse , monument , art gallery , museum and sculpture mostly commemorating conspicuous political and cultural people .', 'Two further prominent characteristic were the military parade ground and the elaborate entrance gate .', 'Hence park fulfilled an educational and ennobling function becoming an essential feature of the urban fabric .', 'They grew into powerful symbol of civic pride , community spirit and expression of civil identity .', "However , whilst park contributed to the improvement of living condition in the city , the reality of the city 's manufacturing and trading character prevailed .", 'Thus , it remained difficult to completely marry the agrarian deference for nature with the fundamental character of the city .', 'Australian Triumphal Arches and Settler Colonial Cultural Narratives .', 'Within the Western architectural canon , the triumphal arch has been used to embody symbolism and meaning in the urban ritual of parade and procession .', 'This paper examines temporary triumphal arch constructed in Australia between 1868 and 1954 , to celebrate visit by the British royal family and their representative .', 'Each of the arch selected for discussion incorporated Australian Indigenous people , building or artefact , which were curated to convey carefully crafted narrative of colonisation .', 'A raft of interpretation can be read into each of the arch because they are intentionally loaded with meaning and symbolism .', 'Particularly evident are the notion of protectionism and assimilation , which were central to the settler colonial narrative .', 'Understanding of the arch is framed by the interpretive information available about them–photographic documentation taken of the in situ arch , drawing and textual description .', 'This paper examines how the triumphal arch form enshrined Australian Indigenous culture into the narrative of colonial experience .', 'It explores how the triumphal arch presented particular representation of Indigenous culture , both through the allegorical narrative inherent in their physical design , and through the involvement of performer in the event .', 'Conjugating equity and ethic in relationship between community organization and higher education institution : How the Art Can Guide Us .', 'As a baby boomer , a child of “ civil right movement , voter registration effort , parental involvement in school , and urban renewal effort , to name a few .', 'Each of these effort to engage specific community has , over time , refined my understanding of how outside group can engage community struggling to empower themselves .', 'And each effort enlightened my analysis of practical organizing for local power to participate in , and control , the decision-making and political activity that shapes community ’ lives .', 'Some of these past organizing effort operated independently , and some joined together to accomplish greater goal such as electing candidate , changing law , protesting or influencing new policy .', 'These targeted effort to improve our democracy by creating unity and strength within community also created an impressive record of historic milestone and real social transformation that still teach us fifty year later .', 'Back then , in the 1960s , people were not only ready for change ; they were also ready to struggle for that change .', 'Unionizing , defeating segregation , and achieving voting right inspired powerful rallying call .', 'Equal education for all was desired and with it came more effective organizing .', 'Community became more supportive of each other .', 'Folk had a greater “ we ” consciousness , which helped to produce a shared aspirational and intentional energy , especially among marginalized and oppressed people .', "This common response to , and acceptance of , “ we ” consciousness helped support cultural influence that emerged in the period 's art as well .", 'Song , dance , language , literature , film , design , and other form of expression all became billboard for the aspiration that so many held .', 'Movement and community-focused art expressed the feeling of wanting better time and articulated the enduring sense of humanity and integrity that demanded better time ( Zohar , 2014 ) .', 'Developing “ we ” consciousness also included accepting people from outside segregated and traditional community who became ally and friend .', "But only after prolonged struggle and sweaty battle that drew blood and tear together did ally and friend become part of the “ we ” consciousness , adding new chapter to a community 's culture .", 'This level of solidarity , of collective identity , shared commitment and cause , demands a high cost , and not everyone who wants to work together or partner is willing to pay it .', "Tourist-trail design : The interpretation quality of built heritage as a motivating force for tourist 's route choice behaviour , Turkish Town , Alexandria , Egypt Case .", 'Cultural tourism is one of the largest and fastest-growing global tourism market that reveal new political , economic and social opportunity for the development of city .', "The central challenge in linking culture and tourism lie in reconstructing the past in the through 'interpretation ' .", 'It is defined as a process of communicating to people the significance of a place through stimulating their understanding .', 'Different approach could be used to achieve this goal .', 'A Tourist trail is one of the convenient approach for realizing interpretation .', "It is an essential tool for enhancing tourist ' experience and appreciation of old heritage by revealing the quality of a place .", 'Both physical and non-physical aspect of cultural area play a key role in supporting the interpretation quality of the heritage trail .', 'However , the design of tourist trail is directly affected by the quality of the built environment which determine the choice of pedestrian route .', 'This is considered to be the main concern of this research .', "This paper poses the question of how to design tourist trail based on examining the relation between the built heritage quality and the tourist ' route choice behaviour .", 'It applies its approach to the Turkish Town-a historical part of the City of Alexandria-as a well-defined conservation area in the City .', "To answer the paper 's question , a hypothesis was designed , taking in consideration the quality that is responsible for enhancing interpretation , and managing tourist 's experience of place .", 'Thus , the research follows a methodology comprised of a number of stage .', "The first stage investigates the quality of the built heritage that have a direct effect on tourist 's route choice .", 'This is done to extract a number of criterion used as a benchmark for the analysis process .', 'The second stage applies these criterion to the selected historical urban pattern .', 'This is achieved through two analytical method used during the evaluation process .', 'The first method is the Space Syntax Theory to measure spatial configuration of urban space using both angular segment analysis and visibility graph analysis ( VGA ) .', "The second method is a detailed field survey to examine each street segment 's characteristic , objectively , in term of its physical feature .", "The research ends by performing data manipulation and analysis to propose optimal route with interpretation quality that facilitate tourist ' navigation in the area as well as manage their experience .", 'The preliminary finding imply the importance of using computer aided analytical tool as decision support system for designing and manipulating tourist trail based on the built heritage quality .', 'Design and implementation of human mobility embedded system for urban planning of smart city .', 'The mobility model will help us to simulate the 'Formulation of design criterion based on recognition and comparison of user pattern of behavior , emphasizing on the role of climate in urban public space , case study : Shahr-E-Kord and Bushehr .', 'Introduction : Climate has always been one the main factor of designing urban space in Iran since past century .', 'By analyzing urban space it can be concluded that different city have different urban space due to climate difference .', 'One of the main reason of the difference in the type and orientation of urban space is the climate as one of the key factor in designing these area .', 'Regarding climate in designing is equivalent to involving the user of the space , basically because climate adjustment can encourage more people to use the designed space .', 'Hence , it can be said that climatic space are humanistic space as well .', 'Therefore , climate directly influence culture and plays a decisive role both in the body and behavior of the user .', 'Thus , it could have a very effective role in how people use or how they behave in designed space .', 'Material and method : A mix of several method has been used for more compatibility with research purpose .', 'This used library document and has a comparative-analytical method .', 'The basic data and the research background information have been gathered through documentative method and from library resource .', 'For the fieldwork , the descriptive method ( describing the phenomenon ) has been used .', 'Then , people pattern of behavior were studied by an interpretative-qualitative method in each climate to analyze and infer the discussion in order .', 'And at last , a comparative method has been used to analyze the result in order to set out urban design criterion .', 'In this comparative method , it was tried to compare people pattern of behavior in two cold-mountainous , and hot and humid climate , and to analyze its result to elicit criterion for urban space design considering the effect of climate on the user behavior .', 'In this research , the people behavior were studied , analyzed and compared in two different season of the year ( the hottest and the coldest season ) by the use of serial photography .', 'Thus , people different pattern of behavior in different climate and the way they use the space were investigated , by the observation a set of design criterion could be developed to be applied in the design/redesign of urban space to improve their quality .', '( Figure Presented ) The theory In general , people us of urban space may have two stage : 1 .', 'Presence in urban space .', '2 .', 'Tendency to continue to stay in the urban space .', 'There are two kind of quality in urban environment .', 'First , the quality which are the main requirement of people presence in public space , i.e .', 'primary quality .', 'Second , the quality encouraging people to stay in the space for a longer time .', 'Meanwhile , there are some quality like climatic comfort which play effective role in both primary and secondary quality .', 'This very important factor is in full adaptation with human physical characteristic and is the main requirement of people presence in the space .', 'It also plays an undeniable role in the way people use the space and behave there .', 'Climatic comfort can increase the number of opportunity to use the space .', 'If the space is designed with consideration of all aspect , including the user behavior , it can be used by all people in various period of time during the day , and in different season .', 'Result and discussion : Design guideline in hot and humid climate are formulated .', 'They emphasize on the role of climate to determine people pattern of behavior .', 'Here , regarding the achievement of local observation and the recognition , the design criterion are proposed at two different scale , the city scale and the site scale .', 'A ) The city scale : Location of the space in the shade : This is the most important factor affecting the use of space in hot and humid climate .', 'If the open space includes shaded part , people preference to stay there will increase .', 'Therefore , location in the shade can be considered as an important requirement for people use of space in this climate .', 'Other factor is natural ventilation and the space orientation parallel to the wind flows : This is the second factor affecting the use of public space in hot and humid climate .', 'Natural ventilation of open space happens by the airflow coming from the sea .', 'It helps the local reduce the high unpleasant humidity in this climate , so it encourages passersby to stop and stay in the space .', 'B ) The site scale : • To avoid designing vast urban open space in hot and humid climate .', '• Making orientation of the open space toward the sea to moderate the hot weather and reduce the humidity by the sea airflows .', 'Local observation also verify that successful space in this climate have perpendicular orientation to the sea to benefit from its cool airflow for natural ventilation .', 'Formulating design guideline in cold and mountainous climate emphasizes the role of climate to determine people pattern of behavior : Local observation in Shahr-E-Kord show that the two fallowing factor have determined the role of people use of space in cold and mountainous climate .', '1-Maximizing the direct sunshine : It is a positive point for the open space in the cold winter weather of mountainous climate , because it helps the space to be more welcoming and favorable for people .', '2-Not to be windward : This factor also has direct effect on how people attend and behave in the space .', "The researcher 's observation and note in cold and mountainous climate show that the space which are exposed to direct wind flow are not favorable for people .", 'A ) The city scale : • For designing open space and its proposed land uses , it is better to locate attractive us at the southern and east-southern side of the space , because it helps to provide favorable sunlight for the space during cold winter day and facilitates the use of space for people .', '• In the cold and mountainous climate , it is better to design urban space in form of small square because it reduces the entrance of wind flow and provides people with climatic comfort .', 'It must be mentioned that vast square in this climate can benefit from the increased direct sunlight and heat .', 'But the effect of the increased airflow in these space is highly unfavorable and disturbs the climatic comfort .', 'Thus , they are not recommended .', 'B ) The site scale : • It is better to design crowded space as semi-open space , because enclosed and covered space are more favorable in all season for their shelter from the sun , wind , rain and snow .', '• In cold climate , it is important to use type of plant which prevent space from undesired wind , while not casting shade during cold season , since tree can provide favorable shade for summer time .', 'Conclusion : The result and finding of this research are presented in a set of operational and applicable recommendation , some of which might seem unimportant .', 'But they are undeniably essential .', 'Simple solution for ordinary problem of existing urban space can lead to significant improvement in the space vitality and people social life .', "William White expresses the extract of his long term study in one sentence : `` people seat where the seating exists . ''", 'This sentence might seem clear and typical , but it is very important and can notably change the life of a city .', 'Thus , the simplicity of change does not mean that they are inconsiderable .', 'It might be possible to change the destination of a space simply by adding shelter and awning or providing sunny space in cold and mountainous climate and shaded space in hot and humid one .', 'Right to public space : Law , culture , and gentrification in the American west .', 'This book examines the role that public space play in gentrification .', 'Considering both cultural norm of public behavior and the municipal regulation of behavior in public , it shows how commonplace act in everyday public space like sidewalk , street , and park work to establish neighborhood legitimacy for newcomer while delegitimizing once authentic public practice of long-timers .', 'With evidence drawn from the formerly Latino neighborhood of Highland in Denver , Colorado , this ethnographic study demonstrates how the regulation of public space plays a pivotal role in neighborhood change .', 'First , there is often a profound disharmony between how people from different cultural complex interpret and sanction behavior in everyday public space .', 'Second , because regulation , code , urban design , and enforcement protocol are deliberately changed , commonplace activity longtime publicly accessible space .', 'Ecology and culture in the design of urban park .', 'Thomas Woltz , principal and owner of Nelson Byrd Woltz Landscape Architects ( NBW ) , describes the fundamental role of historical and ecological research in the firm ’ s design process .', 'As Woltz illustrates in four case study of urban park projects— Centennial Park in Nashville , Tennessee ; Powell Avenue Steam Plant Plaza in Birmingham , Alabama ; Memorial Park in Houston , Texas ; and Hudson Yards , New York— the firm considers every site a cultural landscape .', 'Through historical research and scientific analysis , NBW incorporates significant aspect of each site ’ s past into the park plan .', 'Trace of early settlement , the remains of industrial activity , and geological formation become allusion to the unique history of each landscape .', 'The “ ecology to culture continuum ” is a way of thinking about design that exemplifies NBW ’ s effort to engage people more closely with the landscape .', 'This sense of connection with the past and concern for conserving the environment for the future are essential quality of NBW ’ s cultural landscape .', 'The history of constructivism also increase the well-being of user of the bathroom .', 'New Mobilities for Accessible City : Toward Scenarios for Seamless Journeys .', 'While city increasingly attest to plan to make their resource connection with family , and culture .', 'For the researcher applying the new mobility paradigm , this requires a focus that is suited to capturing movement and its spatial and temporal coordinate and the basic need for a smart-car begins even before entering a car and is not confined to driving alone .', 'Activity before and during driving cyclically impact each other .', 'Moreover , we found that spiritual existence and constitutes one of the essential element in the transformation of urban and social reality .', 'The Convention recognizes that the process of globalization and social largest number of people in order to preserve it at an intangible level .', 'Design culture requires its observer to look beyond visual attribute and associate with the creation and dissemination material .', 'Culture is more than a pure visual representation and message transmission , rather culture formulate , format , circulates , contains and retrieves information , and that culture takes diverse form across time and space , constituting the common heritage of humanity and should be recognized and affirmed for the benefit of present and future generation .', 'This article therefore intends to discuss the importance of preserving Culture Diversity , the importance of local culture , to see how it can survive and project globally without losing its identity .', '3rd International study of Beijing .', "The purpose of this chapter is to explore the relationship between the local and global representation within the graphical component of Beijing 's wayfinding system and to explain how those component construct a cultural identity and a sense of place .", 'Although sign and map have been the most common and effective solution to orientation and wayfinding problem , wayfinding design is now concerned with more than just a function of providing direction .', 'Many international metropolis have been influenced by globalization , with one possible outcome being that city , especially those in developing country , will become standardised and homogenised with their distinctive local feature eroded by global value and dominant western culture .', "Effectively , this is leading to the standardisation of those city ' wayfinding system ( especially the graphical component of the wayfinding system , which this chapter is most concerned with ) .", "As capital of the People 's Republic of China , Beijing is recognized as the political , educational , economic and cultural centre of China .", 'Change are taking place rapidly in this ancient eastern city ; On the one hand Beijing is hastily expanding its modernisation by building many steel-framed high-rise building and keeping in line with international aesthetic standard ; On the other hand Beijing spares no effort to preserve its own traditional culture and ethnic trait , to keep a link with the past , by mean of renovating heritage site and putting up pseudo-traditional architecture .', 'Alongside the tremendous change in Beijing , the role and meaning of wayfinding system have also changed , especially road sign and doorplate whose role have been transformed from an initial household register to orientation reference , then onto the identification of a city .', 'This chapter investigates and explains the cultural significance behind the wayfinding system of Beijing , as well as the relationship between the local and the global reflected in the formation of this cultural significance .', "The chapter will achieve these aim by analysing and comparing various visual element and different design principle between the present wayfinding system of Beijing ( urban road sign and doorplate ) and the early wayfinding design of Beijing , as well as decoding these different mainstream political or cultural ideology that have greatly affected Beijing 's wayfinding design in different period .", 'Culture-driven product : Creating cultural engagement with historical heritage .', 'Under an increasingly borderless global economic environment , developing industry devoted to culture-driven product has become a dominant issue in local economic policy .', 'Attracting tourism by drawing attention to local culture , particularly through the consumption of culture-driven product , is a current trend in urban competitiveness .', 'Cultural product translate message , narrate memory and historical event , and establish an emotional connection with people .', 'We explore their use as a city marketing strategy for the former Tainan State Magistrate Residence .', 'These product can be integrated with other cultural zone to represent Tainan City .', 'The Tainan City government registered the Residence as a city-level historical heritage site , and completed its restoration and reuse plan in 2000 .', 'However , no practical marketing strategy has been formulated to promote the site and raise cultural awareness among local and tourist .', 'We conduct an empirical case study involving a one-day cultural learning tour of the Residence with 61 student participant , who share experience of rich identifiable cultural feature that are transformed into unique and irreplaceable cultural product ideation .', 'The finding provide a clear understanding of the dynamic relationship among cultural product , city heritage , and city marketing .', 'Such a relationship strengthens the potential of cultural storytelling through the design of cultural product for city image promotion and urban regeneration .', 'This relationship also enlightens designer , urban planner , and policy maker as to the importance of cultural communication through product .', "Old perception and new identity in Heidedal ' I am the name you call me and main objective of the KSELC are to assist people who wish to revitalise and develop their Khoekhoe language skill , and to create a teaching environment that will respect the Khoekhoe , but also the San 's heritage and culture .", 'Before the opening of the KSELC , research was conducted in term of a pre-testing and post-testing research design .', 'This was done through a survey of , first , Khoekhoe-related issue in Heidedal , such as identity , perception , attitude , view and meaning , and second , the expectation of the role or influence the KSELC would have in the promotion of awareness in Khoekhoe and San matter .', 'The data obtained during the survey are presented and interpreted in this article.Over the century , colonialism and apartheid have stripped the Khoekhoe of their culture , identity and language .', 'The democratic dispensation that has been in effect since 1994 addresses this historical injustice , and affords constitutional accommodation and recognition to the Khoekhoe and the San .', 'However , in most case a recognised leadership is no longer in place , while knowledge concerning the Khoekhoe culture , identity and language is extremely limited .', 'A whole new field has consequently opened up and much research , mainly amongst rural community , was conducted .', "After all , 'real ' Khoekhoe and San are 'supposed ' to be located in rural territory , in the countryside , far away from city .", 'The value of the current study lies in the fact that it focuses on the dynamic , complexity and expression of urban Khoekhoe revival .', "The urban context challenges our traditional understanding of the Khoekhoe and San - of the notion of a 'pure ' and 'genuine ' cultural identifier , as well as how identity may be formed , expressed and maintained .", 'Countermeasure for public environment design in cold area .', 'This paper shows some countermeasure for public environment design in cold area .', "It analyzes influence to people 's life from concept and climate character of cold area .", 'These measure include layout of architectural complex , rootleness of area culture character , and buildup of openning space energy .', 'The purpose is to create a comfortable living environment , and to guarantee quality of urban public environment space .', "The intertwinement of maryan nomad 's settlement with historical settlement of taleshan .", "Introduction : The variety of Iran 's ecological structure has created many cultural landscape .", "Cultural landscape illustrate a combination of man 's persistent life and the art of land modification by mean of natural environment and in the form of human settlement in the past age .", "Currently , the human society 's development in addition to the scientific progress , man 's increasing use of resource and negative consequence of tourism development without any correct design and optimal management in natural historical area , has led to the destruction of ecological and historical structure of cultural landscape .", 'The new consideration of general environmental protection has been the context for protecting biological historical area and settlement .', 'Natural and historical region of Talesh with special ecological characteristic is one of the most valuable and attractive area which has settlement of 4500 year old .', 'One of the valuable part of Talesh cultural landscape , especially in Agh-evlar Maryan studying region of Talesh countryside near Karganrood River , is the permanent and seasonal settlement of local nomad .', 'These settlement with special architecture , method of utilizing local material , correct location and particularly various time of building , have specific persistent and attract many tourist .', 'On the other hand , the development of new construction and villa building of surrounding city has led to the gradual destruction of cultural landscape of the region .', 'Identifying these settlement and the way of their being spread by mean of new technology of telemetry has created the basis for the general environmental protection of their cultural character .', 'In addition , the presentation of rule for developing the new building to match with the cultural landscape leads to stable tourism development .', 'Considering that cultural landscape is a combination of man , nature and history , we can conclude that all cultural landscape have originated from nature or have been developed in nature and the continuance of their life depends on the nature .', 'Natural resource such as natural structure of the earth ( geomorphology ) , groundwater structure ( underground stream , spring , aqueduct ) and surface water ( river , lake and sea ) , plantation structure ( tree , bush and covering plant specially the local one ) , wild life , weather , climate and other natural factor make a dynamic background on which humankind change , evolves and is permanently developing .', 'Material and Method : Taking the general purpose of the study into consideration and introducing the natural historical bed and Agh-evlar Maryan cultural landscape in term of a cultural landscape , in the process of study , an analysis of natural bed characteristic and the historical and archeological feature of the monument and works scattered throughout the plain and along Karaganrood river valley , has been carried out .', 'The criterion of analysis have been identified based on the modern definition of cultural landscape in international convention .', 'Due to the variety of cultural landscape in different country , the presence of different natural bed variable , human and cultural resource and what has been left from ancient civilization all over the world , the cultural landscape criterion have gradually got accomplished during several convention .', 'In this study , modern technology like satellite data processing and image analysis have been applied , in addition to field study and environmental interpretation , together with different scientific data such as geology , botany , hydrology , hydrogeology , Tectonic , etc .', "Study area : Special characteristic of Iran 's geographical region and the variety of its ecological structure have created many cultural landscape .", 'One of these valuable cultural landscape is located in the height of Talesh , called Taleshan .', "This special geographical area is located along the western coast of the Caspian Sea , from the north of Anzali Lagoon to Kura River 's delta and estuary in Northern Talesh .", "Their western border separate from Ardabil with Talesh Mountains ' ridge .", "The ethnic area of Talesh begin from Gilan 's Rudbar and it elongates from Eastern Kapurchal Tamghan and Salian town to Shirvan ( The Republic of Azerbaijan ) encompassing the whole eastern latern of Northern Alborz - Talesh Mountain and its coastal plain .", 'The most important water stream of the area is Karganrood River .', 'Talesh area has three important point in term of geographical position , influencing the formation of its settlement : A .', 'The foothill position and also the western mountain covered with forest , with the height of more than 10 thousand meter B .', "The crossing of Karganrood River - as the biggest river of Talesh - with a permanent stream of water and rocky bed , and also , the stream of Kalfarood which flows 6 kilometer down to the Southeast , and Navrood in the distance of 7 kilometer from the east C. The variety of area 's climate , considering its location on the skirt of Talesh Mountains on one hand , and its location on the Caspian Sea coast , on the other hand .", 'Actually it is located in two different type of mountainous climate with cold winter and mild summer in high yaylaki part like Agh-Oular Maryan and damp and mild climate around the low coastal part .', "Thus , the existing settlement in the area which were formed in the past century are created under the impact of these condition ; in fact , they show a part of Taleshan 's culture and civilization .", "Currently , the form and dispersion of village , the decampment route and Nomads ' seasonal encampment place have not changed since old time , although there have been the urbanization phenomenon which has led to the migration of villager ' and Nomads ' to dispersed city in coastal part .", 'Identification and location of these settlement as a part of cultural landscape is very important in general environmental protection of the area .', 'Determining the geographical limit of these settlement is also significant in determining the border of cultural landscape of natural and historical area of Taleshan .', "Discussion and Conclusion : Although there is an ambiguity in the date of Talesh height ' inhabitation , it is known that the first human group who got on these height were the rancher in search of fresh grassland , who migrated from the west .", 'Since the geographical condition did not let the rancher stay the whole year in one range , they designed a nomadic society .', 'Gilan Province consists of two part that are coast-plain and foothill-mountain in the west and the east .', 'In its western and southern part which are mountainous , ranching is common .', 'This activity has always been done in a nomadic way of go and return .', 'Because of the intimate connection between plain and mountain on one hand , and the impossibility of continuous and permanent use of height and their skirt on the other hand and also the optical utilization of them for the rancher because of the availability of grassland and water resource and good climatic and seasonal condition , these people has continued their nomadic style .', 'Nowadays , in addition to the semi-nomadic rancher , in warm season of the year , many villager and urban population use mountainous settlement for their pastime , and enjoy the clean and sedative air of the height .', "Considering the vastness of farming activity which limits the possibility of foddering the livestock because of the lack of pastureland , and also the plain inhabitant ' tendency toward height as the first place of their settlement , the connection between plain and mountain is made through these two way : A .", 'The encampment of farmer , especially the rice-planters , which begins from the last day of Khordad .', 'Their yaylaq is located in average height ( Mianband ) and they return to their permanent settlement for rice harvest in the middle of Mordad .', 'They often use the motorway for the one-day go-and-return .', 'This kind of encampment from rural and urban point of the area is based on the habit of escaping from warm low land , and it is also done for passing the free time and keeping a few big livestock .', 'B .', 'The encampment of rancher in the form of semi-nomads and shepherd without doing any farm of activity which is done in qishlak , mianband and yaylak .', 'The qishlaki area of the nomad is located in the west of the region until the beginning of the dense forest and in summer , qishlaki village are evacuated from population , because the nomad encamp to the height ( mianband and yaylaq ) and in winter the qishlaki villages get populous again as the nomad return .', 'Conclusion : The variety of environment and human activity in this area has led to the birth of nomadic lifestyle .', 'Although the first human group in Talesh height were looking for fresh grassland , because of the particular geographical condition of the area , seasonal settlement have occurred .', 'Also , the proficiency in ranching , natural condition of the area , keeping and raising the livestock , rich pasture , escaping from the warm weather of low land in summer and vice versa in winter have been the cause of persistence and survival of this phenomenon .', 'In general , the cause of nomadism and semi-nomadism in Talesh can be the following : 1 .', 'The need of yaylaq and mianband for getting pasture for livestock in warm season .', '2 .', 'Past record of settlement in height and downward motion and having field in yaylak and mianband .', '3 .', 'Existence of rich pasture in mianband and yaylaq and the need for using them .', '4 .', 'Proficiency in ranching and not having the knowledge of farming and gardening activity .', '5 .', 'Climatic and natural environmental condition .', '6 .', 'The old tradition of encampment .', '7 .', 'Using the clean climate of mountain often with ranching especially for rice-planting rancher .', 'The study of effective factor in limiting the development of green roofs in Iran based on hierarchical analysis .', 'Development of urban green space .', 'Green roof is one of the new approach to architecture and urban planning and sustainable development concept that can increase per capita green space , improving environmental quality and sustainable urban development .', 'The roof can be applied as a possible optimum utilization of land .', 'Green roofs can improve urban air quality , reduce waste volume level , reduce urban heat island effect , balance heat in internal and external environment , create natural habitat and biodiversity and increase operational life of the roof insulation , which is a positive step towards improving the quality of urban environment .', 'Green roofs and vertical garden can be traced back to the hanging garden of Babylon and were known to exist in the Roman Empire , a response to population pressure in urban area .', 'In Pompeii shop-keepers grew vine on their upstairs balcony , and the ancient historian Pliny wrote about tree being imported for green roofs .', 'The Romans also put tree on top of institutional building , such as the mausoleum of Augustus and Hadrian .', 'The Vikings layered the wall and roof of their home with turf to protect against wind and rain , and sometimes used seaweed to insulate roofs .', 'During the Renaissance , steeply terraced garden and green roofs were common in the city of Genoa .', 'Vertical garden , in the form of hanging garden also existed in pre- Columbian Mexico , India , and in some of the Spanish home of 16th - 17th century Mexico .', 'N Russia , hanging garden were favored in the 17th century Kremlin , and in the 20th century , green roofs and hanging garden grace home in Tashkent , Tbilisi , and Dushanbe and even at the airport in St. Petersburg .', 'Many contemporary designer owed their idea to Le Corbusier and of Green roofs that was clearly the philosophy of American Primary Schools is to eliminate the growth of building and stress in urban perspective .', 'In the early 60s AD , considering the context of reflection on comparing Chinese and Japanese temple-gardens .', 'Intercultural landscape : An Australian approach to cultural literacy .', "Introduction Australia has an indigenous culture with thousand of year of associative relationship to `` country '' and our contemporary urban centre are home to increasingly diverse population of people from all corner of the globe .", "For landscape architect and urban designer this presents both the challenge of multiple 'sense of place '' and the opportunity to create a unique notion of 'intercultural place ' that generate an environment that people of all culture can have associative relationship with .", "This paper explores the notion of Cultural Literacy and the impact of design decision on the cultural life of Australia 's diverse community .", 'Method Cultural Literacy can be understood as the ability to read , understand , find significance , evaluate and compare local culture .', "As Lefebvre [ 1996 ] states `` Cultural Literacy can be seen as the skill base associated with understanding both the encoding and decoding required to develop culturally meaningful product , place or program '' .", 'The paper will present a cultural literacy framework for seeing , planning and designing through an intercultural lens .', "Result By understanding the community multiple 'place narrative ' and seeing thing through an intercultural lens it is possible to plan and develop more inclusive and culturally sensitive public space .", 'Conclusion As culture is what gives meaning to our life then everything we do should have a cultural dimension .', 'Therefore , all planning is or at least should be cultural , and be at the very centre of thinking about city , not just about our social or civic life but also about the environment , infrastructure and economics of the city .', "The presenter will explore the potential of responsive planning and understanding the consequence and implication of urban planning on a community 's cultural life and highlight a range of Cultural Literacy tool for planner and urban designer .", "Pleasure garden in nineteenth-century New Orleans : `` Useful for all class of society '' .", 'British-born architect Thomas Kelah Wharton ( 1814-62 ) came to New Orleans in 1853 as superintendent for the construction of the Customs House , and for nine year , during a golden age of urban growth and prosperity , he wrote about contemporary life in the antebellum community.1 On 2 May 1854 , he described a rail excursion that he took with his family to Carrollton , a community several mile from downtown : The trip was delightful and the cool fresh breeze on the river bank quite invigorating after the heat and dust of a day in town .', 'We met pleasant friend in the garden and found every thing much changed , and not improved , since last May .', 'The abrasion of the River have made a new Levee , far within the old one , absolutely necessary .', 'Obliterating entirely one of the beautiful and far-famed garden .', 'The shade lane , too , of lofty oleander which last year was covered at this time with a perfect waste of blossom .', 'The pleasant walk on the river bank arched over with China trees.2 The lovely alley of Cape jessamine , and the white bell flowered Yucca , from which year ago I derived my first impression of the exuberance of southern vegetation , all , all , have vanished and in their place nothing but a long , bald , earthy , embankment , a wind dusty road , immense pile of cord wood ( for supplying the steamboat ) , with rail track in every direction to facilitate their transmission from point to point.3 Stagnant pool of muddy water between the old Levee and the new .', "In short , deformity for beauty , utility for poetry , but the grand river still redeems it all , and the fresh green wood on the distant bank , and the fresh pure air blowing across its restless current.4At first , this account appears to be little more than a description of a nineteenth-century open space in New Orleans-perhaps a public park- that had deteriorated significantly within a year , much to Wharton 's dismay .", 'Neither the space nor its description seems to be of much significance for American urban history .', 'What Wharton wrote about here , however , was Carrollton Gardens , a hotel in a landscaped setting created at the terminus of the streetcar line in the 1830s as an attraction to encourage the public to ride the streetcar and enjoy the refreshment and outdoor experience the garden offered.5 Such commercial space , together with similar example elsewhere in the country , are unexplored opportunity to investigate how nineteenth-century Americans perceived and used open spaces.Carrollton Gardens , in operation between 1835 and 1891 , falls midway in a continuum of similar commercial open space in New Orleans that offered food , outdoor recreation , or amusement , the earliest of which date from 1810 .', "Sifting through seemingly unremarkable artifact of everyday life such as newspaper advertisement , periodical article , photographic image , and even sheet music , we find numerous reference to open space similar to Wharton 's description .", "Known over time in nineteenth-century newspaper advertisement as `` pleasure garden , '' `` pleasure ground , '' `` house and garden of pleasure , '' and later as `` amusement parks , '' these commercial venture were scattered throughout the community .", 'Spatially , however , they were situated in an ill-defined middle ground between the public sphere and private property .', "Accessible to the public , albeit on the owner ' term , these enterprise offered attraction their owner thought the public would embrace.Early nineteenth-century pleasure garden in America were version of European example from the seventeenth and eighteenth century .", "By the end of the nineteenth century , they had evolved into amusement park , typological precedent for the `` theme park '' found throughout the world from the mid-twentieth century on.6 When one considers the wide variety of form taken today by such amusement-oriented venue ( not only theme park but also waterparks , family entertainment center , zoos , aquaria , `` exploratoria , '' science center , resort , and casino ) , the million of people who have patronized them , and the revenue they generate , the significance of pleasure garden as key precedent in the general evolution of these designed landscape becomes clear.7Substantial evidence , presented here for the first time , situates pleasure garden in several major nineteenth-century American city , and anecdotal evidence suggests example may well have existed throughout America , in commnities large and small , coastal and inland .", 'Investigation of these pleasure garden have been initiated primarily by music and theater historian because such space , both in Europe ( notably London ) and later in America , primarily offered musical and theatrical entertainment ; food , beverage , and leisure-related recreational activity were only of secondary importance .', 'Pleasure garden have been of marginal interest to landscape historian perhaps because the activity they offered are considered commonplace and therefore less worthy of study than more refined landscape expressions.8Five factor have contributed to the marginal treatment of pleasure garden in conventional discussion of American open space .', 'The first is the absence of visual evidence .', 'Examples-even plans-for pleasure garden that predate late nineteenth-century amusement park are largely nonexistent , and what documentation exists from earlier example is mainly narrative rather than illustrative , describing activity rather than spatial order or design .', "Second , designer of these space ( if we can even speak of them being `` designed '' ) remain anonymous .", 'Third , pleasure garden were private development , not municipal feature on public property ; as such , they resemble other commodity in that their commercial success ( and therefore longevity ) was determined by market force and fickle public taste .', 'Fourth , what was popular one season was often shunned the next .', "The raison d'être of pleasure garden was the regularly programmed `` entertainment '' ( including food , drink , theater , and music ) that usually occurred during favorable weather condition .", 'Similar attraction may have been present in public park on an occasional basis but were usually of less importance than the year-round active recreation and passive activity for which public park were designed .', 'Finally , a continuum leading from early pleasure gardens to more recent amusement park is not well established or widely acknowledged .', 'Early example have long since vanished , the prevailing secondary literature neglects them in favor of more prominent public park , and later amusement park generally do not figure significantly in contemporary discourse of public open spaces.9 As a consequence , pleasure garden have gone largely unstudied and underappreciated as a landscape typology.Nevertheless , a closer examination is warranted for several reason .', 'Pleasure garden precede other example of designed open space in America , and they occur much earlier than those well-documented effort , found from the mid-nineteenth century onward , to build public park in urban area .', "They are different , in both form and content , from open space of the `` rural cemetery '' movement , and their purpose are distinct from the lofty appreciation of the landscape encouraged by the transcendentalist , intellectual , and landscape painter of the nineteenth century .", 'Finally , these early example of the designed landscape are part of the evolution of American concept of landscape architecture , recreation , and open-space usage that would later find expression in public project as the profession of landscape architecture evolved from its mid-nineteenth-century origins.Commercial pleasure garden are one of at least five open-space model found in nineteenth-century New Orleans .', "As elsewhere , local pleasure garden were commercial place of public amusement , eating and drinking , sport , and entertainment , precursor to later `` concert saloon , '' brothel , theme and amusement park , and even private country club because of the activity they offered ( including amusement , sport , eating , and drinking ) and the policy in place regarding admission.10 The first notice of a pleasure garden appears in a newspaper advertisement from 1810 in a new residential area upriver from the colonial community ; by the century 's end , pleasure garden had evolved into the suburban beer garden , performance venue , and amusement park of Spanish Fort and West End along the shore of Lake Pontchartrain , precedent for twentieth-century Pontchartrain Beach ( for white ) and Lincoln Beach ( for `` colored '' ) .11 Until now , New Orleans pleasure garden have been discussed briefly , first as performance venue within the context of the community 's nineteenth-century musical history , and later as place where `` city people '' went in the `` expectation of pleasure .", '`` 12 Closer examination , however , reveals there is much more to learn here in term of urban history.Of the American city one might take as the focus for an analysis such as that proposed here , New Orleans stands out for several reason .', "This community 's pleasure gardens demonstrate how local convention of race and gender influenced access to and us of these recreational space .", 'They show European cultural influence on open-space design and recreational activity in an American community , demonstrating the persistence of such foreign influence through the nineteenth century .', 'They also reveal how technology and rising middle-class aspiration encouraged access to and use of these open space , enabling them to become commodity of consumption in the local marketplace .', 'The number of pleasure garden found in nineteenth-century New Orleans-around twenty have been identified throughout the larger community thus far-indicate their public popularity ; their importance as recreation and entertainment venue ; their geographical place in the urban fabric ; and the cultural , social , and economic role they played in public life .', 'In addition , their nineteenth-century trajectory demonstrates how external factor related to race , economics , and cultural heritage influenced organization , use , and content of these privately owned open space .', "Finally , information about local pleasure garden , seen as part of the larger context of open space in other nineteenthcentury American community , adds significantly to a broader knowledge of the country 's urban-landscape history.The map ( Figure 6.1 ) gives general location for pleasure garden in nineteenth-century New Orleans .", 'Though many have come to light , it is difficult to know exactly how many there were in nineteenth-century New Orleans .', "Information about their content and activity is inconsistent , and it is impossible to ascertain if all venue using the word `` pleasure garden '' or `` garden '' actually described open space or characterized theatrical attraction , musical entertainment , leisure activity , or decorative motif instead.Notably , the name of well-known European pleasure garden precedent occur locally in different location and at different time , suggesting both knowledge among local of European precedent and specific interest in using nominal association as a means of attracting customers.14 Notice in the New Orleans Emporium occur in July 1832 for legal matter related to a Louisiana Vauxhall Gardens on Common Street ; this may have been the predecessor to the New Vauxhall Garden , but no information exists as yet about its content or design .", 'There were at least two New Orleans property known as Tivoli : one is mentioned in 1808 , location unknown ; discussion on the other , found on the Carondelet Canal , follows.As elsewhere , the unifying factor among local pleasure garden is their entrepreneurial nature .', 'These private space were open to the public as business venture , and their existence and longevity responded to market force of capital , location , opportunity , and clientele .', 'Entrepreneurial characteristic explain their often short life span and differentiate pleasure garden from other nineteenth-century public open-space model such as neighborhood square , levee , and public park .', 'Available evidence among pleasure garden may be inconsistent , yet useful information about them emerges in four general category : Their administrative structure ( admission policy , conduct expected of patron ) ; the activity offered ( sport , musical and theatrical event , spectacle ) ; the accommodation provided ( food and beverage ) ; and their design ( plant material and structure ) .', 'Pleasure garden illustrate unique interpretation of public space in term of organization , access , and content , and their characteristic demonstrate evolving local practice concerning consumption , leisure activity , social interaction , cultural influence , and open-space design , thereby giving new
