relevance to their importance in nineteenth-century urban life.Social attitude in nineteenth-century New Orleans based in racial and cultural identity are just now being explored through lens of politics , culture , and music , and the practice that resulted from these attitude are complicated , complex , and confusing.15 Although legacy of these attitude exist today , their impact on publicly accessible space in nineteenthcentury New Orleans remain , until now , largely unexplored .', 'Urban design , socialization , and quality of life .', 'Architecture as a discipline is essentially integrative : connecting past , present and future , drawing on art , science and the social science , balancing qualitative with quantitative factor .', 'Good architecture and urban design contribute to making city both functional and attractive to resident and visitor .', 'While architecture is about the design of building , urban design is about the relationship between the building , the road and space that they front , and the people who make use of them .', 'The outstanding building project are those that are not only visually stimulating , but are also sensitive and respectful of their surrounding development and environment .', 'A well-designed city takes into consideration this important relationship between building and the beauty of the city as a whole .', 'Socialization is the process that prepares human to function in social life .', 'It should be re-iterated here that socialization is culturally relative - people in different culture are socialized differently .', 'The process of socializing or sociability in a city means acquiring the model of style life of that city .', "The process of socializing includes every daily activity of citizen ' life .", 'People have mutual relationship in this place and actualize it through presenting the municipal cultural and social activity and resolving the need of each other .', 'The municipal cultural and social realm has to develop the way of acquiring the necessary life skill gradually among the citizen .', 'These pattern can be taught through an effective and mutual relationship , this education should be presented to acquire the necessary ability considering the cultural value and norm of a society continually and constantly .', 'How to keep the image of the traditional block - Analysis of the strategy of renewal in china by comparing with the similar case in Australia .', 'By comparing the two different commercial pedestrian street ( the Queen Street Mall , Brisbane , Australia and the FuRong Street , JiNan , China ) in three concept : Tradition , Energy , Operation .', 'Thinking over the protection and inheritance of traditional urban scene and characteristic of regional space during the reconstruction of traditional block .', "China 's urbanization process has been more than thirty year since the eighty of last century , modern city begin to form .", "During these vicissitude , people fully experience the convenience and fast in modern city , however , they often cherish the warm and cozy of strolling in the lane , it is the regional space survived in the city updates usually that represents a city 's culture and history as sign .", "However , this `` sign '' fade away generally with the urban renewal and shantytown renovation , resulting in the characteristic of the city dissolved , the urban style have been assimilated increasingly .", 'Because of researching collaboratively with the HRP , an Australian architecture and urban design group , we have visited Brisbane , the capital of Queensland .', 'The Queen Street which is located in the central area of CBD have given us a deep impression .', 'Comparing with the FuRong Street in Jinan , the latter has more advantage in position , function , and historical background .', 'Thus it inspired our keen interest .', 'This paper will discuss the gain and loss in design and construction of traditional block by analysis and comparison .', 'Risk-based pipeline integrity management system : A case study from Colombia .', 'Historical data indicates that gas pipeline are a safe means of transportation , but to maintain these safety record , it is necessary to do more than just routine operation , inspection , and maintenance activity .', 'What is required in present day ?', "In short , it is a must to develop a corporate and organizational culture that includes in its scope continuous risk evaluation and mitigation within a 'PIMS ' ( Pipeline Integrity Management System ) .", 'A problem , common to all operator , is pipe aging : pipeline around the world are old and many are in poor condition .', 'But in the case scenario for many country in Latin America these old pipeline are within urban expansion area and are surrounded by many more people and building that were expected at the original design stage .', 'This is why operator must make additional effort to rectify such situation : conventional maintenance activity are not enough to guarantee pipeline integrity and public safety .', 'This paper presents how a Colombian pipeline operator has developed a PIMS based on semi-quantitative and quantitative risk assessment that has allowed focus on mitigation activity in most critical segment and has also allowed for design of customized action plan for each segment , to give more efficient risk control .', "A postcolonial perspective on cultural identity : The Balti people `` of '' Pakistan .", 'Purpose The aim of this paper is to explore issue of cultural identity of the people of Baltistan and any challenge they face in the nation state of Pakistan .', 'Design/methodology/approach The paper uses a postcolonial lens to offer a review and synthesis of issue of cultural identity of the Balti people of Pakistan .', "Finding The review demonstrates how the historical and socio-political context is intertwined with the Balti people 's cultural identity which remains hybrid as well as contextual in its construction .", 'It reveals that while the state of Pakistan has been able to assert its control over the Balti people and the region of Baltistan predominantly through military mean , the critical issue of cultural pluralism and the basic human right of the Balti people have remained generally ignored throughout the 63 year since partition .', 'Research limitations/implications The contention offered in this paper need to be refined through in-depth empirical study .', 'Future scholar may wish to examine the class and cultural politics at work in the emerging renaissance movement in Baltistan .', 'Scholar may also examine how the lack of economic development and investment in Baltistan may be forcing the Balti people to resign ( at least some element of ) their cultural identity to seek employment in urban area of Pakistan .', 'Originality/value The paper brings to the fore issue of cultural identity of the people of Baltistan , which have to a large extent remained ignored by Pakistan as well as internationally .', 'Internal development and restoration of old and inefficient city district .', 'Nowadays considering the rapid change in technology , growing need and city life transition , we are facing a complex and multidimensional problem of aging city historical texture .', 'This phenomenon is followed by either destruction of old building or being changed to low class building such as warehouse , work place , etc .', 'Settlement of poor and deprived people in these old city textures as well as inappropriate outer development policy of city where aged and historic texture are found have made these place an arena of social problem which has decreased the quality of life and consequently exposed the historical value of the area under extreme damage .', 'During the renovation and restoration implementation process especially that of inner city development , while we should keep efficiency , justice , environmental quality , security , hygienic , and beauty of city space in mind , identity and city life must be preserved and in order to reach a optimal city development , city environment and cultural heritage should be protected .', "In this approach , people 's connection with the memory , history and identity of the place , beautiful scenery , interesting and various adventure , individual 's relation with present culture and other people , and historical value are factor which are at the service of enriching present city life and culture not just a museum attitude for preserving some old monument .", "Reviving dying city place which carry people 's memory of a certain period of time is done with the intention of preserving , restoring and developing them and in the design proposed for them we should utilize those monument which enjoy a certain identity that by highlighting them , they affect the structure of the whole city .", "As a place , these city area are still enjoy many potentiality that with some planning and programming we can change them into revived and dynamic area ; an area that reminds us of the past and reflects the today 's compassion and identity .", 'For more compatibility , more profit , decreased environmental pollutant , and sustainable development , restoration and renovation process must be in compliance with the ecological structure of the region as well as the environmental resource .', 'With the help of modern regional planning and less expense in designing building , utilizing existing natural energy are possible .', 'That is , city need to be adapted to environmental situation , social and cultural structure if they want to survive .', 'In developing these area care should be given to the historical and structural dimension ; factor affecting texture , erosion and aging ; factor increasing these worn-out place ; considering different method for dealing with these building ; constructing inplace building using domestic and abroad experience ; exploiting all the necessary expertise ; and economical , social , political , administrative and cultural factors.Utilizing capacity found in unused land in these area , as well as reviving structural identity of these place , lead to historical continuity , cultural consistency , national spirit , and preserving identity , memory , and socio-cultural value .', 'Promoting qualitative and quantitative index with the viewpoint of considering dynamic , flexible , innovative , and creative solution are essential for a harmonious and dynamic restoration and renovation .', 'The fluidity of knowledge : An intertwine between architecture and culture .', "The paper links to the theme 'disciplines of design ' through seeking sustainability from the cultural aspect of the built environment .", 'The function of architecture in the built environment is one of the most important element to the existence of a community .', 'It is also evident that our community are facing crisis that the existing intellectual claim struggles to tackle .', "This paper argues that the fusion or the installation of culture as relevant entity in the framework of knowledge guiding the built environment is the key to the community 's sustainability .", 'The influence of culture will also reflect on the untapped knowledge and potential that can be generated in a whole body of effort made by the people to survive in housing related crisis .', 'In relation to the urban housing crisis the Lagos Nigeria situation is explored .', 'Urban housing is used as strategic vehicle for investigating the evolution of idea and different approach to the informal process involved in the issue relating to the general liveability of a community .', 'The paper highlights the strategy developed from the existing informal settlement that can influence decision that relates to the built environment .', 'Missing story in urban transformation : Forgetting the social history of Istanbul .', 'Most museum in Istanbul overlook social history of the city .', 'Istanbul is a metropolis that many culture live .', 'However , many culture are forgotten .', "When it is handled in the context of city transformation , Istanbul is becoming an `` image city '' with forgotten social history at the back stage .", 'Because of city transformation , many culturally diverse group are moving .', 'While a new economy develops around finance , design and cultural institution growing in city centre , many people are forced to change their settlement area .', 'Image take place instead of a culture that continue to live there for a long time with its authentic feature .', 'It is not enough to have object focus in an exhibition only .', 'The concept of social history provides for telling story and an environment possible for sharing and understanding .', 'Museum have crucial role in city transformation in the sense that they are both memory and forgetting place .', 'Do the museum legitimise displacement of people ?', 'How can a social history museum take action in city transformation ?', 'Is it possible to create awareness about displacement of people with museum and exhibition ?', 'The paper discusses necessity and function of social history museum and exhibition while city change rapidly .', 'Chinatown and the virtual classroom in singapore and hawai ?', 'i .', "The stated goal of the `` Remaking Asia-Pacific Study : Moving Culture '' project is to `` develop an innovative pedagogy for area study teaching and learning in an era of globalization '' by establishing `` multi-sited virtual classroom [ that ] will take area study to the area studied , creating a collaborative pedagogy to apprehend situation that are at once transnational , transregional and intensely local '' ( Tanabe 1999 , 1 , 3 ) .", "Our interpretation of this goal led to a web-based collaboration between student taking course in geography at the National University of Singapore ( NUS ) and the University of Hawai ' i at Manoa ( UHM ) on a comparative study of the Chinatowns in Singapore and Honolulu .", "Student in both location posted information on `` their '' Chinatown , including statement of personal experience , photographs and other graphic image , as well as quotation from interview with resident .", 'They discussed these with counterpart , and then worked in group on a comparative analysis of the two location .', 'Critical comparative work provides an opportunity to move beyond traditional area study approaches in that it consciously investigates similarity and difference across place rather than beginning from a starting point of single , autonomous location .', "`` Chinatowns , '' for example , are a common part of the urban landscape throughout the Asia Pacific region ; they are immediately recognizable as such and will inevitably be read as symptomatic of the presence of Chinese culture .", "Nevertheless they are created and are preserved under particular condition , and while Chinatowns in both Singapore and Honolulu , for example , functioned historically as Chinese ethnic enclave , the former exists within what is now a predominantly Chinese society and has been largely `` beautified '' to become an important tourist destination , while the latter continues to accommodate minority immigrant , albeit now predominantly Southeast Asian , maintaining its traditional role as a site of everyday commercial and interpersonal interaction , but remaining largely `` run down '' as it resists government effort at gentrification .", 'One of the aim of the project was to think about the problem and possibility involved in comparison .', "In the new language of post-area study , the interaction was designed to move beyond `` trait '' geography in area study frameworks-or geography that emphasize foundational elements- toward `` process '' -oriented geography that connect diverse area in new way .", "The distinction is nicely made in a paper produced for the Ford Foundation 's Crossing Borders initiative , and since it is no longer available online , we quote it here at length ( Appadurai et al .", "1997 , cited in Olds 2001,129 ; see also Morris-Suzuki 2000 ) : Much traditional thinking on `` area '' has been driven by conception of geographical , civilizational and cultural coherence which rely on some sort of trait list of value , of language , of material practice , of ecological adaptation , of marriage pattern and the like .", "However sophisticated these approach , they all tend to see `` area '' as relatively immobile aggregate of trait , with more or less durable historical boundary and with a unity composed of more or less enduring property .", '.', '.', '.', 'In contrast , we have begun to explore an architecture for area study which is based on process geography , and sees significant area of human organization as precipitate of various kind of action , interaction and motion , trade , travel , pilgrimage , warfare , proselytization , colonization , exile and the like .', 'These geography are necessarily large-scale , changing and tend to highlight variable congeries of language , history and material life .', 'Put more simply , the large region which dominate our current map for area study are not permanent geographical fact .', 'They are problematic heuristic device for the study of global geographic and cultural process .', 'Region , in our approach , are taken to be initial contexts for theme which generate variable geography , rather than as fixed geography marked by set theme .', "Our Chinatown project was conceived to help student to move beyond `` trait '' geography that see Chinatowns as material manifestation of culture , and toward thinking about how these landscape are shaped by `` process '' such as migration , racial ideology , and tourism .", 'This is not simply to replace cultural essentialization with the new universalizing framework of globalization , however , for even if exoticism and urban development combine to ( re ) make ethnic enclave into object of tourist consumption throughout Asia Pacific , a detailed comparison of Singapore and Honolulu Chinatowns shows that processes operate unevenly and combine contingently and that they are experienced and represented in very different way .', "Our project was structured to lead student toward a `` processual '' understanding of the respective Chinatowns , and for the most part we believe we were successful .", "Nevertheless , at time , interaction were hampered by traditional `` trait '' thinking as some of our student confused Chinatown and `` Chineseness '' and mobilized stereotype of Singaporean and Hawaiian cultural identity .", "In fact , at one point there was a clear breakdown in our collaboration , which we suggest was at least partly due to several unforeseen factor : first , since the vast majority of NUS student identified as Chinese and only a small minority of UHM student had any Chinese ancestry or exposure to Chinese culture , participant on the two side generally had differential investment and assumed authority in the topic at hand ; second , as a consequence of the increasing pressure of deadline , tension developed between participant operating in different academic culture , who were nevertheless equally dependent upon each other 's timely `` virtual '' cooperation ; and third , as pressure of time mounted and perhaps as mutual trust developed among participant in the web-based discussion , communication generally became more ingenuous , and some took offense , responding with public recrimination or partial withdrawal from the collaboration .", "Having set up the collaboration carefully and seen it develop in the right direction , the instructor were caught off-guard by this turn of event , and we found ourselves desperately trying to help student think more `` processually '' about the others of our collaboration .", "Remarkably , despite the climate of mutual suspicion , some student were able to use the critical tool of cultural analysis we had promoted in our respective class , but given more time and prior sensitivity to this problem , we might have helped other student avoid the trap of `` trait '' thinking and the sense of disappointment that they carried away from the collaboration .", 'Our collaboration raised difficult issue about how we represent and engage with different people and place , and it was a serious challenge for all involved .', 'We remain optimistic that web-based interaction can provide a valuable context for the mutual exchange of idea and questioning of belief that are taken for granted ( Rich , Robinson , and Bednarz 2000 , 266 ) , but we have become more sensitive to its limit and aware of the need for prior sensitization of participant and careful monitoring by instructor .', 'In other word , if `` virtual fieldwork .', '.', '.', "can allow student to carry theoretical concept into confrontation with empirical representation '' ( Warf , Vincent , and Purcell 1999 , 147 ) , it can also allow student to carry stereotypical conception into confrontation with virtual others .", 'We suggest that this is particularly likely where participant have differential investment in the object of collaboration , where time and other pressure are intense and unequal , and where educational culture are most different .', 'In the following , we recount the design of the project , reflect on some of these difficulty , and discuss the lesson for the project of remaking area study pedagogy .', 'Analysis of sound environment in coastiwise area of Haihe river and preliminary study on its soundscape design and soundscape expression method .', "Haihe river , as the mother river of Tianjin city , China , not only plays a vital role in social culture and psychology , but also provides a good place for people 's leisure and entertainment .", 'With the advance of landscape transformation in Haihe coastwise area , creating a comfortable acoustic environment becomes an important part of the overall transformation .', 'In this study , the sound situation of Haihe coastwise area including sound type , relationship among different sound , sound expectation and so on , was analyzed through physical measurement and social survey .', 'By doing that , the method of improving the acoustical environment of Haihe coastwise area and its overall soundscape design were hoped to be explored .', 'Furthermore , a suitable expression method of soundscape design in open area like Haihe coastwise area was tried to be found in order to build a communication platform for acoustic researcher , urban planner and the general public .', 'Human building + education .', "Today 's intensification of social and urban change coupled with issue of sustainability amplifies the demand for architectural solution that strengthen the balance between nature-made and man-made environment .", 'Wendell Berry ( 1990 ) , in his book What Are People For Calls into question the way human energy in recent history have been bent to the purpose of an extractive economy determined to dominate nature and increase the material wealth and security of our own specie .', 'Berry suggests that human welfare and meaning are located not in the value of the marketplace but in the relationship that can emerge among people and landscapes where care and continuity rather than commercial success are the central aim .', 'One approach to establishing co-laboration between the natural and built world is by encouraging educational experiment across the curriculum and across age group to [ explore ] possible direction we might pursue in our attempt to engender a more ecologically sustainable culture .', 'The architectural profession has undoubtedly embraced sustainability as the buzz word of the 21st century .', 'As such it has the responsibility to take a leading role in the immediate design innovation keeping in mind the economical and eco-friendliness aspect of a project without losing the archi-friendliness , as presented by University of Nebraska professor of architecture Martin Despang and graduate student Amber Ellet in their paper Generation P ( ost-fossil ) fuel to be included in the Eco Conference 2008 .', 'This investigation takes the form of an educational experiment exploring the potential of humanoid , haptic and neural network robotics to produce a set of responsive architectural strategy to accommodate a credible range of occupancy and program .', 'Strengthening the root .', 'Indigenous movement in Taiwan , intended to make both indigenous people and Taiwan as a whole more competitive , is promising Taiwan a brighter future through reviving the traditional wisdom of indigenous people , which can contribute significantly to the promotion of many highly promising venture such as eco-tourism and leisure culture .', 'The government is trying to design a new partnership that be defined in constitutional revision , with an entire chapter devoted to indigenous people , a significant step to safeguard the status of aboriginal in accordance with their will .', 'The Council of Indigenous Peoples ( CIP ) works legally as the coordinator of aboriginal affair among different ministry .', 'The council has began to take charge of management of some 250,000 hectare of land reserved for habitation and cultivation by aboriginal .', 'Exploring the Apparel Purchase Behavior of Urban Indian College-goers : A Qualitative Study .', 'The college-goers , as a market segment , are immensely significant in India in term of both magnitude and spending capacity and one of the most important item purchased by young people is apparel .', 'The apparel purchase behavior of the college-goers of Kolkata are explored in this paper in term of type of apparel purchased , purchase frequency , store choice , and influence of shopping companion .', 'Qualitative study with a purposive quota sampling design is used .', 'Kolkata being a cosmopolitan city with resident of different state speaking different language and belonging to different sub-cultures , the study helps explore the apparel shopping behavior of urban Indian college-goers in general .', 'Environmental science / environmental design .', 'Environmental science has formed the central part of ecological discourse in architecture .', 'It has been the primary force behind the work of various leader in the ecological design community [ 1 ] .', 'Gravity and the second law of thermodynamics set the stage for disseminating a vast array of scientific principle .', 'Energy is plotted .', 'Solar angle are graphed .', 'Thermal flow are mapped .', 'These science-based principle are fundamental to producing new green technology and various shade of green in the plan and section of our building [ 2 ] .', 'And the science behind the environment continues to prosper .', 'The challenge in architectural education however has been the development of more inclusive , creative , even conflictive understanding of ecology and environmental design that expand beyond the germane integration of environmental science principle and new green technology .', 'This paper represents an extension of work in relation to a graduate level design studio recently taught at Georgia Tech with the aim of presenting more complex definition and us of ecology in architectural practice as a complement to the science behind the environment .', 'Ultimately , the idea and strategy described here hold potential for new form of relationship between people , place , material and earth .', 'The paper is organized into two part .', 'The first part identifies three major concern : 1 ) the current predicament of peak global oil production ; 2 ) the re-occurring problem associated with the mind-set separation of culture and nature ; and 3 ) the untapped potential between ecology , creativity , and architecture .', 'The second part places these concern in practice , in the context of three green housing proposal located at Hulsey Yards , a 35-acre in-town , industrial urban site south of downtown Atlanta that is strategically placed along the Belt Line Atlanta Project , a 22-mile inner-city light rail loop and greenway currently the focus of a multi-million dollar study by the Georgia Department of Transportation [ 3 ] .', "People 's perception and behavior pattern in Amman 's public park and plazas .", 'This study aims to research the behavioral pattern in the various area public park and major urban plazas of the Greater Amman area .', 'During the past 40 year , study have focused on the identification of architectural and urban pattern and the artistic aspect of urban design .', 'Conversely , this research aims to identity the behavior and need of the user by introducing the hypothesis that the behavioral pattern in any designed space relies on the designer personal perception and understanding of the behavioral and usage pattern of the individual within it , the understanding of which positively reflects on both the spatial quality and the individual perception of it .', "To test the previous hypothesis , two urban plaza were selected , the Al-Hussien Sukaina Park located in a middle-income residential commercial district and the `` Culture A venue '' in a high-income commercial district .", 'Through analytical study and the utilization of questionnaire , the research concludes an overall preference of the simplicity of the former over the complexity of the design concept and element of the latter .', 'Concept of the landscape in contemporary France during the controversy over the pyramid in the courtyard of the Louvre Museum .', 'This paper was written to illustrate how the landscape of Paris is shaped not solely by political force , but also by the awareness and acceptance of the citizen of Paris .', 'The case of the glass pyramid at the Louvre Museum is used to illustrate this process .', 'When the pyramid was planned , the citizen themselves participated in a heated discussion on its construction .', 'Now , more than a decade later , the pyramid is considered an emblem of the museum .', 'By analysis of the controversy over the pyramid , we can consider how contemporary French society initially interpreted and eventually accepted a new artifact in the landscape of Paris .', 'During the initial controversy , and also after construction , some critic called the project a mark of the despotism of the man who initiated the Louvre remodeling project , President François Mitterrand .', 'However , it does not clarify the important question about this controversy : which concept of the landscape of Paris conflicted with the glass pyramid , and how was the new building accepted nevertheless ?', 'To answer these question , this paper analyzes the argument about the symbolism and the harmony of the new landscape that were raised in the controversy .', 'The argument about the symbolism concerned the urban space of Paris and the shape of the pyramid .', 'The spatial centrality of the Louvre in Paris was seriously considered .', "Under that condition , the interpretation of the `` Egyptian '' shape of the pyramid was always negative .", 'It reflected a prejudiced , exclusionary frame of mind advocating a heterogeneous culture .', 'The argument about the harmony of the landscape concerned the Louvre and the material of the pyramid .', "The Louvre was interpreted as a `` palace . ''", 'It paradoxically suggested that the Louvre has played important role in the history of modern France .', "The interpretation of the material of the pyramid emphasized its `` transparence . ''", 'It led to discrétion , meaning an absolute respect for the history that the Louvre had witnessed .', 'This analysis allows us to consider the origin of the controversy .', 'The Louvre was regarded as a symbol of the Republic , because of its history in the liberation during the Revolution .', 'The Louvre Museum itself has functioned as a representation of French culture , in term of collecting worldwide art work , interpreting them , and exhibiting them in the order which is required in French society .', 'The glass pyramid was planned not only in the historical place , but also in the mythic place of the establishment of France .', "Accordingly , the origin of the dispute appears to be whether the new building intruded on `` French culture . ''", 'How was the new landscape accepted after that ?', "To deny the interpretation of `` something foreign , '' the people who consented to the construction cited historical fact that justified the pyramid .", 'The opponent of the project countered by quoting historical fact in their own argument .', 'As a consequence , the glass pyramid was linked to many reference point in French culture .', 'In the background of the acceptance of a new landscape in Paris , there was an acquisition of cultural legitimacy .', "The landscape of Winnipeg 's Wildwood Park .", "This paper is a review of the history of the differentiated landscape of Winnipeg 's Wildwood Park-their origin and their transformation since the community 's establishment in the late 1940s by builder/developer Hubert Bird .", "Bird patterned his scheme after Stein and Wright 's Radburn garden-city fragment , but the uniquely evolved character of Wildwood Park owes as much to regional landscape , geomorphology , and local post-war culture as it owes to its famed antecedent .", 'As a unique and idiosyncratic community design , Wildwood Park merits attention and further study by planning historian and those interested in alternative neighbourhood form as social construction or cultural landscape .', 'In addition , it suggests many thing to designer of contemporary community , many of whom are currently looking to traditional pre-World-War-II grid-pattern neighbourhood structure and aesthetic as inspiration for ( presumably ) more socially cohesive neighbourhood .', "Whether such designer are inclined toward the garden-city precept for separation of automobile and pedestrian , or toward this contradictory `` new urbanist '' premise that car and people should cohabitate within community open space , Wild-wood Park has much to offer as precedent .", "Both its pedestrians-only park and its highly interactive lane that do mix people and cars-and particularly these two complementary landscape considered as a `` matched set '' -offer many interesting design lesson in matter of two-dimensional platting , three-dimensional neighbourhood structure and four-dimensional consideration for structural and landscape transformation that occur over the span of several decade .", 'Small is beautiful , big is subsidised : How our tax contribute to social and environmental breakdown .', "The supplement accompanying this issue of The Ecologist ( subscription and ordered copy only ) aims to make clear how public policy and taxpayer ' dollar have given shape to and maintain today 's corporate-dominated global economy , and how they have systematically undermined smaller-scale , more democratic mode of economic organisation around the world .", 'The current global architecture favours gigantism on many level : from the borderless worldwide trading arena itself to the huge transnational corporation ( TNCs ) that dominate it : from mammoth monocultural agribusiness to the urban metropolis in which concentrated population increasingly consume the same mass-produced good , entertainment and news report , and respond to the same globally-transmitted advertising message .', 'The systemic support given to this model stands in sharp contrast to the steady subversion of a more vernacular architecture - one comprising a diversity of economy which are smaller in scale , more decentralised and more dependent on local resource .', 'As Small is Beautiful : Big is Subsidised point out , the design of the global economy depends in part upon international agreement like the GATT and NAFTA , and on such supranational body as the World Bank , the IMF , and the World Trade Organisation .', 'But there is far more to the architecture of globalisation .', 'Transport infrastructure to facilitate long-distance trade are needed , as are communication network to homogenise people and culture worldwide , and to enable TNCs to monitor and co-ordinate their global enterprise .', 'Educational infrastructure are required to prepare child in every culture for their future roles as consumer , producer and corporate manager , and to implant in them the technophiliac worldviews of industrialism .', 'Research infrastructure are needed to provide industry with continual innovation to raise productivity , keep consumption high and draw ever more resource from the planet .', 'Regulatory body are required to limit the damage caused by corporate excess and to assuage public uneasiness about the pace of technological change .', 'A military infrastructure is needed to keep the less stable element of the architecture in place .', 'These support system are not paid for by the large enterprise that stand to benefit from them , but by ordinary taxpayer .', 'So too are the cost of environmental and social breakdown , which follow the industrial model everywhere it is imposed .', 'Small is Beautiful : BIG is Subsidised highlight example of the way larger scale is promoted by public policy in every corner of the world , from the most industrialised economy to the least .', 'In so doing , it not only disproves the notion that the trend towards ever-larger scale is inevitable , but shows that it is within our hand to move in a quite different direction .', 'Barrio and the Hispanic American city : cultural value and social representation .', 'This paper explores the historical development of barrio in Hispanic American colonial city .', 'Emphasis is placed on the physical , social and functional aspect that made the barrio a unique place of work , culture and residence .', 'Over time the barrio shifted in locaton from the edge to the middle of the colonial city .', 'Factor contributing to the decline of the barrio as a neighbourhood design type include new form of suburban development , modernization of urban code and regulation , transformation of city scale , and the change in work and residence location .', 'The paper concludes with an analysis of what possible contemporary effort might recreate the barrio as a placemaking element and a cultural enclave .', 'Lunar neighborhood : Architecture for extreme environment .', 'Student in a unique , graduate seminar program at the University of New Mexico that explored the role of architect in understanding and planning for the need of human in extreme environment present initial result of an engineering test case that pursed development of an international lunar space station housing 30 person over a two-year period .', 'Seminar participant , challenged with balancing both people and engineering factor , propose establishing a science station featuring modular neighborhood of three 10-person group sited under a radiation shielding dome in a near-side crater with Earth view .', "Central to the crater-based neighborhood design is an architectural and engineering philiosophy that incorporates creating familiar sight , sounds , and a shirt-sleeve lifestyle to enrich the crew ' lunar experience as mission in astronomy , extravehicular research , geology , and pre-mars base habitation are conducted .", 'The neighborhood concept is essential in achieving the multiple goal of safe , cost effective , and rewarding exploration , while maintaining healthy and creative social and cultural interaction among multi-national and skill-diverse crew .', 'Space for bathing , recreation , crew-arrival celebration , and problem solving are desired while the introduction of a new culture to the Moon occurs concurrently with human adaptation to a foreign environment .', "`` Neighborhooding '' feature regular event - such as meal , seminar , and a gathering place for descision-making - as required ritual .", 'To address population spread , architectural eco-care consideration were viewed as critical .', 'Engineering and construction objective comprise eco-considerations to protect the lunar environment through technique that maximize in-situ vitrification and dust mitigation building technology , as well as air- , heat- , water- , plant- , and waste-matter recycling .', 'Power need are met by a combination of solar array and a stand-alone , inherently safe nuclear unit .', 'Additional out-of-crater electrical need , primarily for science experiment , are met via radio isotopic thermoelectric generator technology .', 'Station access for crew rotation and resupply is available via a nearby landing site , and such event are celebrated .', 'Emerging area of concern remain , however , as this academic program , now in its second year , applies terrestrial , architectural and engineering principle and experience as an analog to the lunar environment .', "This one-of-its-kind seminar program is performed under the auspex of the University 's School of Architecture and Planning .", 'Active involvement of astronaut , architect , engineer , scientist , and space pioneer from U.S. industry , the national laboratory system , NASA , and academia has proven invaluable to this applied academic program .', 'Student from ten country attended , with significant Pacific Rim participation .', 'Academic discipline ranging from engineering to philosophy were represented , as were multi-national and multi-gender perspective , and that of the physically challenged .', "The program 's test-case application could serve as a template for future course , encouraging a multi-disciplinary approach to science project .", 'Program result could have application to architecture in extreme space and Earth environment , in multi-national and multi-cultural urban setting , and to sub-surface defense , intelligence , and science post .', 'Metropolitan Lima : area profile ..', 'This profile of metropolitan Lima , Peru , covers administrative division ; population growth ; age distribution ; ethnicity and religion ; housing and household ; education and health care ; economic activity , income , and consumption ; transport and communication ; and source of information .', "Nearly 30 % of Peru 's entire population and 42 % of its urban population live in Lima .", "The trend continues , yet Lima 's urban primacy is waning due to the growth of some regional center like Trujillo and Chimbote .", "Lima is still almost 10 time as large as the country 's next ranking city , Trujillo on the northern coast and Arequipa in the south .", "Peru 's main administrative division are the 24 department , of which the Department of Lima is one .", 'These department are further divided into 156 province .', 'Greater Lima consists of 2 such province , the province of Lima and the constitutional province of Callao .', 'Although the population of Lima continues to grow , its rate of growth slowed from about 5.5 % during the 1960s to about 3.9 % in the 1970s .', 'Current projection estimate a metropolitan population of 6.7 million by 1990 .', "On the whole , Lima 's age structure is somewhat older than that of the rest of Peru .", 'The median age of the population is 22.3 year , compared to a national figure of 20.4 .', 'The proportion of person over age 65 is only 3.6 % , lower than the national average of 4.1 % , due to the tendency of in-migration to concentrate people of intermediate age in the city .', 'Almost 400,000 inhabitant of greater Lima are bilingual in Spanish and an indigenous language .', 'As elsewhere in Peru , the dominant religion is Roman Catholicism .', 'Lima is a spread out city with few high rise building due to the danger of earthquake .', "Only 12 % of Lima 's household are found in apartment building .", 'As in other city of Latin America , the formal housing market is beyond the reach of a major segment of the population .', 'Consequently , much of the urban settlement has occurred through informal self-help construction .', 'Only 2.7 % of the metropolitan population over age 15 is illiterate , down from 5.4 % in 1972 and 7.7 % in 1961 .', 'In 1981 Lima had 93 hospital with a total of 12,640 bed .', 'In addition there were 102 health center and 10 sanitary post .', "Lima 's economically active population totaled 1.53 million in 1981 , 71 % of whom were men .", 'On average , each household has 1.8 income earner , and only 17 % have more than 2 .', 'A 1978 survey revealed that the family of Lima spend an average of 45.2 % of their income on food , 15.6 % on housing and utility , 9.8 % on transport and communication , 7.4 % on education , sport , and cultural activity , 7.3 % on clothing , and 7.0 % on furniture and housing maintenance .']

['Barrier to participation of Aboriginal people in cancer care : Communication in the hospital setting .', "Objective : To report Aboriginal patient ' view about effective communication between Aboriginal people and health service provider in Western Australian hospital setting .", 'Design , setting and participant : Qualitative study involving indepth interview between 1 March 2006 and 30 September 2007 with 30 Aboriginal people affected by cancer from across WA .', "Main outcome measure : Aboriginal patient ' view about the quality of communication within the hospital , factor impairing communication and suggestion for improvement .", 'Result : Factor crucial to effective patient - provider communication such as language , shared understanding , knowledge and use of medical terminology require attention .', 'Additionally , communication between Aboriginal people and health care professional needs to be understood within a broader sociocultural and political context .', 'Fear of the medical system and of being disempowered ; mistrust ; collective memory of the experience of colonisation and its aftermath ; lack of understanding of Aboriginal custom , value , lifestyle and the importance of family and land ; and experience of racism were key issue impairing communication .', "Health service provider ' inability to interpret non-verbal communication and the symbolism of hospital environment also posed problem .", 'Conclusion : Key area for the attention of health service provider in communicating and caring for Aboriginal people in the hospital setting include culturally sensitive and empathetic personal contact , acknowledgement and respect for Aboriginal family structure , culture and life circumstance , an understanding of the significant role of non-verbal communication , and the importance of history , land and community .', "Employing more Aboriginal health worker in hospital , and allowing Aboriginal people to participate at a decision-making level in hospital is likely to improve Aboriginal people 's access to cancer treatment , and would be important symbol of progress in this area .", 'Enhancing health care equity with Indigenous population : evidence-based strategy from an ethnographic study .', 'Background : Structural violence shapes the health of Indigenous people globally , and is deeply embedded in history , individual and institutional racism , and inequitable social policy and practice .', 'Many Indigenous community have flourished , however , the impact of colonialism continues to have profound health effect for Indigenous people in Canada and internationally .', 'Despite increasing evidence of health status inequity affecting Indigenous population , health service often fail to address health and social inequity as routine aspect of health care delivery .', 'In this paper , we discuss an evidence-based framework and specific strategy for promoting health care equity for Indigenous population .', 'Method : Using an ethnographic design and mixed method , this study was conducted at two Urban Aboriginal Health Centres located in two inner city in Canada , which serve a combined patient population of 5,500 .', "Data collection included in-depth interview with a total of 114 patient and staff ( n = 73 patient ; n = 41 staff ) , and over 900 h of participant observation focused on staff member ' interaction and pattern of relating with patient .", 'Result : Four key dimension of equity-oriented health service are foundational to supporting the health and well-being of Indigenous people : inequity-responsive care , culturally safe care , trauma- and violence-informed care , and contextually tailored care .', 'Partnership with Indigenous leader , agency , and community are required to operationalize and tailor these key dimension to local contexts .', 'We discuss 10 strategy that intersect to optimize effectiveness of health care service for Indigenous people , and provide example of how they can be implemented in a variety of health care setting .', 'Conclusion : While the key dimension of equity-oriented care and 10 strategy may be most optimally operationalized in the context of interdisciplinary teamwork , they also serve as health equity guideline for organization and provider working in various setting , including individual primary care practice .', 'These strategy provide a basis for organizational-level intervention to promote the provision of more equitable , responsive , and respectful PHC service for Indigenous population .', "Given the similarity in colonizing process and Indigenous people ' experience of such process in many country , these strategy have international applicability .", 'Using rapid-cycle quality improvement methodology to reduce feeding tube in patient with advanced dementia : Before and after study .', 'Problem : Despite lack of evidence that enterai feeding tube benefit patient with dementia , and often contrary to the wish of patient and family , patient with dementia who have difficulty swallowing or reduced food intake often receive feeding tube when hospitalised for an acute illness .', 'Design : We conducted a retrospective chart review of all patient receiving percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy or jejunostomy tube between March and September 2002 .', 'QI intervention including a palliative care consulting service and educational programme were instituted .', 'We conducted a second chart review for all patient receiving feeding tube between March and September 2003 .', 'Setting : 652 bed urban acute care hospital .', 'Key measure for improvement : We measured the number of feeding tube placed in patient with dementia , the number of feeding tube placed in patient with dementia capable of taking food by mouth , and the number of feeding tube placed in patient with dementia with an advance directive stating the wish to forgo artificial nutrition and hydration .', 'Strategy for change : Medical and allied health staff received educational programme on end of life care and on feeding management of patient with dementia .', 'A palliative care consulting team was established .', 'Effect of change : After the intervention , the number of feeding tube placed in all patient and in patient with dementia was greatly reduced .', 'Lesson learnt : Multidisciplinary involvement , including participation by the administration , was essential to effect change in practice .', "The intensive focus on a particular issue and rapid change led to `` culture shift '' within the hospital community .", 'The need to establish unified goal of care for each patient was highlighted .', 'Background : A growing body of research over the past decade has questioned the utility of placing feeding tube ( percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy ( PEG ) or jejunostomy ) in patient with advanced dementia.1 Study have found no evidence that feeding tube in this population prevent aspiration , 2 3 prolong life,4-6 improve overall function,7 or reduce pressure sores.8 Additionally , the quality of life of a patient with advanced dementia can be adversely affected when a feeding tube is inserted .', 'The patient may require wrist restraint to prevent pulling on the tube1 3 or may develop cellulitis at the gastrostomy site , develop decubitus ulcer , 1 be deprived of the social interaction and pleasure surrounding meals,9 10 and require placement in a nursing home .', 'Unfortunately , many doctor are unfamiliar with this literature or face barrier - attitudinal , institutional , or imposed by the healthcare industry - to applying its finding to their practice.11 Thus feeding tube are placed in patient who will not benefit from this intervention and whose quality of life in the terminal stage of their illness will be adversely affected .', "With the expected increase of elderly people with dementia,12 a great change in doctor ' knowledge , attitude , and practice is necessary to prevent even greater number of patient receiving this futile treatment .", 'Loneliness in older Chinese adult : A risk factor for elder mistreatment .', 'OBJECTIVES : To examine loneliness as a risk factor for elder mistreatment in an urban , community-dwelling Chinese population .', 'DESIGN : Cross-sectional descriptive study .', 'SETTING : Major urban medical center in NanJing , China .', 'Participant : Four hundred twelve subject aged 60 and older who presented to the general medical clinic .', 'The mean age of the participant was 70 , and 34 % were female .', 'Mean education level was 8.5 year of schooling .', 'Measurement : Loneliness was assessed using validated instrument , and direct question were asked regarding mistreatment experienced by older adult .', 'RESULTS : Elder mistreatment was found in 35.2 % of the participant .', 'After adjusting for confounding factor , feeling of often lacking companionship ( odds ratio ( OR ) =4.06 ; 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) =1.49-11.10 ) and feeling of sometimes being left out in life ( OR=1.69 ; 95 % CI=1.01-2.84 ) were positively associated with the risk of mistreatment .', 'Risk of mistreatment was also correlated with higher total loneliness score ( OR=2.74 ; 95 % CI=1.19-6.26 ) .', 'CONCLUSION : Loneliness appeared to be a risk factor associated with elder mistreatment in this older Chinese population .', 'Further prospective study are needed to confirm this finding .', 'An exploration of Chinese culture and tradition may yield insight into shaping a prevention framework for mistreatment of older Chinese people .', 'Estimating clinically relevant mental disorder in a rural and an urban setting in postconflict Timor Leste .', 'Context : Epidemiologic study undertaken in postconflict country have focused primarily on trauma-related disorder .', 'There is a need to include disabling psychotic disorder in order to plan clinical service in these setting .', 'Objective : To estimate the prevalence of key clinical disorder in Timor Leste ( East Timor ) , and to assess cultural factor that may influence help-seeking pattern .', 'Design , Setting , Participant : A 2-phase total population survey of 1544 adult in an urban and a rural area of Timor Leste .', 'Phase 1 involved a household informant survey using indigenous term to detect psychosis and a screen of all adult for posttraumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) and symptom of psychologic distress , including depression and anxiety .', 'In phase 2 , clinician interviewed all those identified by household informant and half of those who screened positive in order to assign DSM-IV diagnosis .', 'Disability , explanatory model , and perceived need were also assessed .', 'Main Outcome Measure : Phase 1 : Demographic characteristic ; trauma event and PTSD ( Harvard Trauma Questionnaire ) ; psychologic distress ( Kessler-10 scale ) .', 'Phase 2 ; Structured Clinical Interview for relevant DSM-IV diagnosis ; the Global Assessment of Functioning Scale and the World Health Organization Disability Assessment Scales ; and the modified Short Explanatory Model Interview .', 'Result : The household informant method in phase 1 detected mainly psychotic disorder , and the screen method detected PTSD and depression .', 'Phase 2 yielded a DSM-IV point prevalence estimate of 5.1 % ( including psychosis , 1.35 % ; and PTSD , 1.47 % ) .', 'Psychotic disorder were most disabling , primarily attributed to supernatural cause and treated mainly by traditional healer .', 'Those with depression and PTSD experienced substantial disability but had received little treatment .', 'They attributed their mental problem to social and traumatic cause .', 'Conclusion : Our 2-phase method proved effective for identifying the range of disorder relevant to planning clinical service in postconflict developing country .', 'The unmet need of the mentally ill in country such as Timor Leste pose a major challenge to psychiatry .', 'Physical functioning in elderly Europeans : 10 Year change in the north and south : The HALE project .', 'Objective : To examine age related change in physical functioning in elderly men and woman .', 'Design : Prospective , population based study .', 'Setting : Population of 15 rural and urban centre in 10 European country .', 'Participant : Altogether 3496 men and woman born between 1900 and 1920 who participated in the baseline survey of the HALE project in 1988-1991 .', 'The study population was examined again about five ( in 1993-1995 ) and 10 ( in 1999-2001 ) year after the baseline examination .', 'Main outcome measure : Physical functioning was measured by mean of a self administered questionnaire of activity of daily living ( ADL ) .', 'Dichotomised prevalence of disability and need for help in self care and mobility ADL were used as dependent variable in the analysis .', 'Result : Prevalence of disability and need for help tended to be higher in woman than in men and in mobility ability than in self care activity .', 'Disability and need for help increased with advancing age but ameliorated over time from one birth cohort to another .', 'In longitudinal analysis this beneficial time trend was independent of the effect of age , study , and region in self care disability in men and woman ( OR 0.85 , 95 % CI 0.75 to 0.97 and OR 0.64 , 95 % CI 0.43 to 0.97 , respectively ) and self care need for help in men ( OR 0.83 , 95 % CI 0.70 to 0.96 ) .', 'Mobility disability among men and self care disability among woman decreased more in the south than in the north .', 'Conclusion : While European population are aging , the proportion of elderly people with disability are decreasing .', 'These result suggest that dynamic of functioning may differ across culture .', 'Future study are needed to clarify which potentially modifiable and culturally determined factor protect against functional decline .', "Support and obstacle to cancer survival for Hawaii 's Native people .", 'PURPOSE : Investigator have suggested that high cancer mortality rate among Native Hawaiians are due to fatalistic attitude toward the disease , poor access to care , and lack of consideration of Native Hawaiian cultural value in Western approach to healthcare .', 'This study used qualitative method to examine these factor in Native Hawaiian cancer survivor .', 'METHEODS : Eight focus group were held on five island , attracting 45 Native Hawaiian cancer survivor from both rural and urban locale .', "The focus group explored survivor ' experience with cancer diagnosis , treatment , and recovery .", 'Participatory research method were used with researcher gaining community input on study design , incorporating appropriate Native Hawaiian cultural protocol into the focus group , and engaging participant in the interpretation of the data .', 'RESULTS : Similar to cancer survivor of other ethnicity , these individual demonstrated the following : success in accessing healthcare information , professional , facility , and insurance ; the ability to overcome the barrier confronted and proactive health behavior regarding screening , diagnosis , and treatment .', 'They also demonstrated way in which they were sustained through the cancer experience by Native Hawaiian tradition , such as helping others , gaining strength from Hawaiian spiritual beliefs , and relying on family for personal support .', 'Participant did not respond passively to their cancer diagnosis , and they expressed few fatalistic attitude .', 'Participant did give numerous example of other Native Hawaiians who did not seek screening or treatment for cancer because they lacked insurance , had poor access to care or felt alienated by Western healthcare .', 'CLINICAL Implication : The finding suggest that improving access to care and incorporating cultural value in health education and service can enhance survivorship and quality of life for Native Hawaiians with cancer .', 'These theme may have application for other minority group .', 'Community perception of human excreta as fertilizer in peri-urban agriculture in Ghana .', 'Although human excreta contain the necessary nutrient for plant growth , local authority in Ghana spend huge sum of money to dispose them as waste .', 'Reusing excreta for agricultural purpose saves expenditure for chemical fertilizer , improves soil fertility , reduces poverty and ensures food security .', "People 's attitude and perception about excreta vary between culture and even within specific culture .", 'This study aimed to explore attitude and perception among a peri-urban agricultural community towards sanitized human excreta and its use .', 'The study adopted an exploratory design and collected data from 154 randomly selected household using questionnaire and focus group discussion .', 'It was found that there is a general negative attitude to fresh excreta and the handling of it .', 'However , the resident accept that excreta can be used as fertilizer , but they are not willing to use it on their own crop or consume crop fertilized with excreta .', 'The study recommends open discussion in the community for a successful implementation of ecological sanitation .', 'Melioidosis at royal darwin hospital in the big 2009-2010 wet season : Comparison with the preceding 20 year .', 'Objective : To compare the unprecedented 91 case of melioidosis in the Top End of the Northern Territory of Australia from 1 October 2009 to 30 September 2010 with the 540 case in the preceding 20 year and postulate reason for this year of very high melioidosis incidence .', "Design , setting and participant : Review of prospectively collected data on all patient with culture-confirmed melioidosis at Royal Darwin Hospital , the Top End 's tertiary referral centre , since 1 October 1989 .", 'Main outcome measure : Population-based annual incidence of melioidosis ; difference in epidemiology , clinical presentation and outcome for 2009- 2010 compared with the preceding 20 year .', 'Result : In 2009-2010 , the estimated population-based incidence of melioidosis was 50.2 case per 100 000 in the Top End population overall , and 102.4 case per 100 000 in the Top End Indigenous population .', 'The proportion of patient acquiring melioidosis in the Darwin urban area increased from 49 % in 1989-2009 to 65 % in 2009-2010 ( OR , 1.96 ; 95 % CI , 1.20-3.19 ) .', 'Among the 49 Indigenous Australian patient with melioidosis in 2009-2010 , 63 % acquired the infection in Darwin , compared with 35 % of Indigenous patient in the previous 20 year ( OR , 3.17 ; 95 % CI , 1.62-6.24 ) .', 'Conclusion : In 2009-2010 , the Top End had the highest annual incidence of melioidosis documented from anywhere to date .', 'The prominent increase in case in Darwin was associated with above average rainfall in Darwin during December 2009 to February 2010 .', 'The increase in the proportion of Indigenous Australians who acquired melioidosis in Darwin may reflect movement of some Indigenous people into Darwin from remote community .', "The nature of , and reason for , 'inappropriate ' hospitalisation among patient with palliative care need : A qualitative exploration of the view of generalist palliative care provider .", "Background : Recent study have concluded that there is significant potential to reduce the extent of 'inappropriate ' hospitalisation among patient with palliative care need .", 'However , the nature of , and reason for , inappropriate hospitalisation within a palliative care context is under-explored .', "Aim : To explore the opinion of 'generalist ' palliative care provider regarding the nature of , and reason for , inappropriate admission among hospital inpatient with palliative care need .", 'Design : Qualitative study with data collected via individual interview and focus group .', "Setting/participants : Participant ( n = 41 ) comprised 'generalist ' palliative care provider working in acute hospital and community setting .", 'Setting : One District Health Board in an urban area of New Zealand .', "Result : The majority of participant discussed 'appropriateness ' in relation to their own understanding of a good death , which typically involved care being delivered in a 'homely ' environment , from known people .", 'Differing attitude among cultural group were also evident .', "The following reason for inappropriate admission were identified : family carers being unable to cope , the 'rescue culture ' of modern medicine , the financing and availability of community service and practice within aged residential care .", "Conclusion : On the basis of our finding , we recommend a shift to the term 'potentially avoidable ' admission rather than 'inappropriate admission ' .", 'We also identify an urgent need for debate regarding the role of the acute hospital within a palliative care context .', 'Intervention to reduce hospital admission within this population must target societal understanding of death and dying within the context of medicalisation , as well as take into account cultural and ethnic diversity in attitude , if they are to be successful .', 'Understanding death and dying in select first nation community in northern Manitoba : issue of culture and remote service delivery in palliative care ..', 'OBJECTIVES : The purpose of this study was to delineate and describe the local palliative care service available to resident of remote Aboriginal community in northern Manitoba ; to identify attitude and belief about death , dying and palliative care in these community ; and to explore obstacle related to palliative care service delivery from the perspective of culture and geographic isolation .', 'STUDY DESIGN : Forty-four in-depth semi-structured interview were conducted with a reputational sample of key informant including Aboriginal people resident in remote community , community elder and religious leader , doctor , nurse and allied health care provider working in First Nations Communities , as well as specialist service provider in Winnipeg .', 'Thematic qualitative analysis was done on the data collected .', 'Data collected from interview with northern physician and nurse was coded and analyzed .', 'Result : Currently , many Aboriginal people living in remote community are transported to large urban center to die , isolated from friend , family and their culture .', 'However , the majority of Aboriginal people and health care provider interviewed reported that Aboriginal people living in remote community would prefer to die at home .', 'The issue surrounding palliative care provision in remote Aboriginal community are cultural and geographic .', 'Culturally sensitive care requires that patient have access to family support and traditional service if requested .', 'Geographic isolation requires that : 1. patient-specific care plan be created for use in the remote community ; 2. effective line of communication are established between remote health care provider and urban specialist ; 3. health care provider and family care-givers be properly trained to fill their respective role ; and 4. appropriate guideline and resource be available in the community to support this type of care .', 'CONCLUSIONS : Providing the equipment , support and education necessary for home-based palliative care in remote Aboriginal community can be an effective way of addressing the medical , psycho-social , and spiritual need of these patient .', 'Internal migration and transmission dynamic of tuberculosis in Shanghai , China : an epidemiological , spatial , genomic analysis .', 'Background : Massive internal migration from rural to urban area poses new challenge for tuberculosis control in China .', 'We aimed to combine genomic , spatial , and epidemiological data to describe the dynamic of tuberculosis in an urban setting with large number of migrant .', 'Method : We did a population-based study of culture-positive Mycobacterium tuberculosis isolates in Songjiang , Shanghai .', 'We used whole-genome sequencing to discriminate apparent genetic cluster of M tuberculosis sharing identical variable-number-tandem-repeat ( VNTR ) patterns , and analysed the relation between proximity of residence and the risk of genomically clustered M tuberculosis .', 'Finally , we used genomic , spatial , and epidemiological data to estimate time of infection and transmission link among migrant and resident .', 'Finding : Between Jan 1 , 2009 , and Dec 31 , 2015 , 1620 case of culture-positive tuberculosis were recorded , 1211 ( 75 % ) of which occurred among internal migrant .', '150 ( 69 % ) of 218 people sharing identical VNTR pattern had isolates within ten single-nucleotide polymorphisms ( SNPs ) of at least one other strain , consistent with recent transmission of M tuberculosis .', "Pair of strain collected from individual living in close proximity were more likely to be genetically similar than those from individual who lived far away—for every additional km of distance between patient ' home , the odds that genotypically matched strain were within ten SNPs of each other decreased by about 10 % ( OR 0·89 [ 95 % CI 0·87–0·91 ] ; p < 0·0001 ) .", 'We inferred that transmission from resident to migrant occurs as commonly as transmission from migrant to resident , and we estimated that more than two-thirds of migrant in genomic cluster were infected locally after migration .', 'Interpretation : The primary mechanism driving local incidence of tuberculosis in urban centre is local transmission between both migrant and resident .', 'Combined analysis of epidemiological , genomic , and spatial data contributes to a richer understanding of local transmission dynamic and should inform the design of more effective intervention .', 'Funding : National Natural Science Foundation of China , National Science and Technology Major Project of China , and US National Institutes of Health .', 'Blood pressure change in Africa : Case study from Nigeria .', 'Study of migrant and comparison of rural versus urban community are potentially informative study design because they allow examination of genetically similar population subgroup exposed to diverse environmental condition .', 'These design have been underused in Africa , where recent urbanization has created many situation in which nearby community of common ethnicity and culture live under different social and economic circumstance .', 'The International Study of Hypertension in Blacks ( ICSHIB ) conducted several overlapping survey in Nigeria starting in 1993 .', 'These survey were based primarily in the rural village of Idere and the urban community of Idikan , both inhabited by people defined ethnically as Oyo Yoruba and sharing a common language and culture .', 'Survey team collected standardized blood pressure and anthropometric measurement , and some study participant provided 24-hr urine sample and questionnaire data on psychosocial stress and social integration .', 'Rural and urban group differed substantially in blood pressure and related characteristic .', 'Age-adjusted prevalence of hypertension ( blood pressure ≥ 140/90 mm Hg ) for participant aged 25 year and older was 7-8 % in Idere and 24-27 % in Idikan .', 'The distribution of overweight , sodium/potassium ratio , perceived stress , and social integration scores all contributed to lower hypertension risk in Idere .', 'The effect and interaction of these identified risk factor remain poorly understood , even among people who share a common genetic background , similar diet , and many other lifestyle feature .', 'Nonetheless , the rural-urban distinction is sufficiently salient to engender a nearly threefold difference in hypertension prevalence .', 'This disparity in disease prevalence demonstrates the sensitivity of human being to the environmental determinant of disease and provides a sobering example of the difficulty in identifying subtle genetic effect , which can be easily overwhelmed by small difference in environmental exposure .', 'Experienced harm from other people ’ s drinking : A comparison of Northern European country .', 'Objective : This study addresses how experienced harm from other people ’ s drinking varies between six Northern European country by comparing 1 ) the prevalence of experienced harm and 2 ) the correlate of harm.Method : The data comprise 18–69-year old who participated in general population survey in Denmark , Finland , Iceland , Norway , Sweden , and Scotland during the period 2008–2013 .', 'Comparative data were available on five type of harm : physical abuse , damage of clothes/belongings , verbal abuse , being afraid , and being kept awake at night.results : This study shows that harm from other ’ s drinking are commonly experienced in all six country .', 'Being kept awake at night is the most com-mon harm , while being physically harmed is the least common .', 'The proportion that reported at least one of the five problem were highest in Finland and Iceland and lowest in Norway , but also relatively low in Sweden .', 'Across country , the level of harm was highest among young , single , urban resident , and for some country among woman and those who frequently drank to intoxication themselves.conclusioions : The study revealed large difference in the prevalence of harm in country with fairly similar drinking culture .', 'However , the correlate of such experience were similar across country .', 'Possible explanation of the finding are discussed , including difference in study design .', 'An ecological perspective of breastfeeding in an indigenous community .', 'Purpose : To describe the sociocultural pattern that promote breastfeeding or weaning in the Ojibwe community , which has very low breastfeeding rate compared to the general population .', 'Design : A focused ethnographic approach with an ecological framework provided community level data .', 'Semi-structured interview ( N=52 ) were conducted in an urban Ojibwe community and with three group of woman : health or social service provider , woman currently breastfeeding , or people who acted as resource .', 'Method : Data were analyzed using an ethnographic approach .', 'Group summary were compiled and community-level pattern were identified .', 'Finding : Four pattern were identified that encompassed the influence of ( a ) Ojibwe and mainstream culture ( tradition ) , ( b ) communication-related barrier from a variety of source ( mixed message ) , ( c ) socioeconomic issue ( life circumstance ) and ( d ) social support ( nurturing and supporting ) .', 'Conclusion : The value and practice of the studied group were not always congruent with those of the larger mainstream culture .', 'Successful breastfeeding promotion and intervention program based on culturally relevant perspective are needed .', 'Health is a spiritual thing : Perspective of health care professional and female Somali and Bangladeshi woman on the health impact of fasting during Ramadan .', 'Objective .', 'To explore perspective of health care professional and female Somali and Bangladeshi Muslim woman on practice related to fasting during Ramadan , the impact of fasting on health and the role of health professional during Ramadan .', 'Design .', 'A cross-sectional qualitative study was conducted .', 'Two culturally specific focus group were conducted with six Somali and seven Bangladeshi Muslim woman who observed Ramadan and lived in an inner-city neighbourhood of Toronto , Canada .', 'Individual semi-structured interview were conducted with 22 health care professional practicing in this inner-city area ( three of whom were Muslim ) .', 'Data were analysed using thematic qualitative analysis .', 'Result .', 'Both Muslim woman and health care professional recognised the spiritual significance of the Ramadan fast .', 'Muslim participant considered the fast to be beneficial to health overall , whereas health care professional tended to reflect on health concern from fasting .', 'Many health care professional were not fully aware of fasting practice during Ramadan and some found it challenging to counsel patient about the health effect of fasting .', 'Muslim woman expressed disagreement regarding which medical intervention were permitted during fasting .', 'They generally agreed that health care professional should not specifically advise against fasting , but instead provide guidance on health maintenance while fasting .', 'Both group agreed that guideline developed by the health care and faith community together would be useful .', 'Conclusion .', 'There are a variety of health belief and observance among female Muslim Somali and Bangladeshi woman and a range of knowledge , experience and opinion among health care professional related to fasting during Ramadan and health .', 'Overall , there is a need for improved communication between member of the Muslim community and health professional in Canada about health issue related to fasting during Ramadan .', 'Strategy could include published practice guideline endorsed by the Muslim community ; patient education material developed in collaboration with health and religious expert ; or further qualitative research to help professional understand the beliefs and observance of Muslim people .', 'Measuring psychoneurotic behavior in cross-cultural survey .', 'In recent year , a number of study have appeared which attempt to measure neurotic disorder among population sample in different cultural setting .', 'The problem of how to define and measure psychiatric disorder in untreated group , and especially in culture to which the investigator are not native , is , however , far from resolved .', 'The present report describes an effort to study psychological stress among the Serer of Senegal .', 'We describe a method we used to develop a questionnaire to tap symptom of psychiatric distress , and which would be geared to the reality of place and setting .', 'By mean of a factor analysis of the response to this questionnaire by more than 400 subject , we identify four dimension by which the Serer express neurotic disturbance .', 'Further analysis presented in the report demonstrate that these are not merely way of expressing symptom based on physical illness , that they are able to discriminate between ill and well people in the Serer frame of reference , that they possess domain validity , and that they demonstrate important similarity and difference with factor obtained using similar technique in different cultural setting .', 'From a methodological point of view , we illustrate the importance of using a multidimensional approach in such study .', 'Aging and disability in China : Cultural issue in measurement and interpretation .', 'Aging is no longer an issue of concern only to industrialized country .', 'Recent estimate project that the year 2000 there will be 590 million people aged 60 or older worldwide .', 'Of these 590 million approximately 61 % will be living in lesser developed country .', 'Thus , these country will shortly face critical decision concerning the impact of these aging population on state plan for economic development .', 'China , the country with the largest anticipated number of elderly in the world provides an
