instructive case of how one developing country is attempting to balance the need of the elderly with those of the union as a whole .', 'In particular the rapid aging of the Chinese population has prompted official concern about the financial implication of providing health care to increasing number of disabled or frail elderly .', 'This paper reports the effort of one study to determine the extent of disability and frailty among the urban elderly and the strategy they and their family member have develope to cope with it .', 'The research was conducted between June 1987 and January 1988 in two neighborhood of Canton , the capital of Guangdong Province .', 'Two hundred household , each containing at least one member 70 year of age or older , were randomly selected from household registration list .', 'In each household a 1-2 hr interview was conducted with the elder ( or , in the case of those too disabled to participate , proxy ) on the following topic : personal background , proximity andcontact with kin , household composition and organization , health and functionality , use of medical service , work history , income source , daily activity , and attitude regarding intergenerational relation .', 'The paper is divided into five part addressing the following topic : ( 1 ) China and research on aging , ( 2 ) comparative data-problematic aspect , ( 3 ) experience of age-associated disability in China .', 'Epidemiological and microbiological profile of infective keratitis in Ahmedabad .', 'Context : Study of patient attending tertiary care ophthalmology institute at Ahmedabad .', 'Aim : To study the microbiological etiology and epidemiological factor associated with suppurative keratitis .', 'Setting and Design : A total of 150 corneal scraping were evaluated from patient presenting with corneal ulcer at a tertiary ophthalmology center , Ahmedabad from July 2007 to June 2008 .', 'Material and Method : Scraping were subjected to Gram stain , potassium hydroxide preparation and culture for bacterial and fungal pathogen .', 'Socio-demographic data and risk factor were recorded .', 'Result : Ninety percent ( 135/150 ) people with corneal ulcer had trauma as predisposing factor for keratitis .', 'Trauma due to wooden object was the leading cause ( 46/135 ) followed by vegetable matter and stone injury ( 23/135 ) .', 'Microbial etiology was established in 59.3 % ( 89/150 ) of scraping .', 'Out of 89 positive isolates , 65.1 % ( 58/89 ) were bacterial while 34.9 % ( 31/89 ) were fungal .', 'Among the bacterial isolates , 60.3 % ( 35/58 ) were Gram-positive cocci while 39.7 % ( 23/58 ) were Gram-negative bacilli .', 'The most common bacterial isolate was Staphylococus aureus ( 32.7 % , 19/58 ) followed by coagulase-negative Staphylococci ( 25.8 % , 15/58 ) and Pseudomonas ( 18.9 % , 11/58 ) .', 'Among the 31 fungal pathogen , Aspergillus specie was the most common ( 35.4 % 11/31 ) , followed by Fusarium specie ( 22.5 % , 7/31 ) .', 'Conclusion : Trauma with wooden material is the most common predisposing factor for suppurative keratitis .', 'Male were more affected than female .', 'Bacterial ulcer were more common than fungal in area in and around Ahmedabad .', 'Staphylococcus aureus and Aspergillus were the commonest bacterial and fungal isolates respectively .', 'Geographical variation persists in microbial etiology of suppurative keratitis .', 'Prevalence of pulmonary tuberculosis in western China in 2010-11 : A population-based , cross-sectional survey .', 'Background : Progress in tuberculosis control in China has been the slowest in western area , which have the highest prevalence .', 'We assessed the prevalence of pulmonary tuberculosis in the Xinjiang province , China , 10 year after introduction of a control programme based on directly observed treatment , short course .', 'Method : In this population-based , cross-sectional survey , we used a multistage stratified random cluster sample design to estimate the prevalence of smear-positive and bacteriologically confirmed ( either smear positive or culture positive , or both ) pulmonary tuberculosis among adult ( aged ≥15 year ) in Xinjiang who had been resident in their household for the last 6 month .', 'The screening strategy and diagnosis followed WHO guideline .', 'We estimated prevalence by combining inverse probability weighting and multiple imputation of missing data .', 'We compared our prevalence survey estimates with the one from the 2010 China national pulmonary tuberculosis survey and the one from a provincial pulmonary survey done in Xinjiang in 2000 .', 'The new smear-positive pulmonary tuberculosis notification rate in 2011 in Xinjiang was obtained to allow the calculation of patient diagnosis rate ( PDR ) .', 'Finding : Between Sept 1 , 2010 , and July 31 , 2011 , 31 081 individual were eligible , of whom 29 835 ( 96·0 % ) participated in the survey .', 'We identified 50 ( 0·2 % ) smear-positive and 101 ( 0·3 % ) bacteriologically confirmed pulmonary tuberculosis case .', 'The weighted prevalence of smear-positive pulmonary tuberculosis was 170 ( 95 % CI 103-233 ) per 100 000 people and of bacteriologically confirmed pulmonary tuberculosis was 430 ( 249-611 ) per 100 000 people .', 'Compared with 2000 Xinjiang survey estimate , the prevalence of smear-positive pulmonary tuberculosis has decreased by 26·4 % ( from 231 [ 95 % CI 148-314 ] per 100 000 people ) , whereas the prevalence of bacteriologically confirmed pulmonary tuberculosis has increased by 17·8 % ( from 365 [ 237-493 ] per 100 000 people ) .', 'In each age group and sex , the pulmonary tuberculosis prevalence was higher in the 2010-11 Xinjiang survey than in the 2010 national survey .', 'The PDR in 2011 was 0·34 ( 95 % CI 0·25-0·44 ) .', 'Interpretation : Despite progress in other part of China , the prevalence of pulmonary tuberculosis in Xinjiang remains high .', 'The very low PDR suggests poor access to diagnosis and care .', 'Further study are needed to understand the barrier to diagnosis and care of this population , and effort are urgently needed to enhance tuberculosis screening in this area .', 'Funding : Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region Health Bureau .', 'Open Access article distributed under the term of CC BY-NC-ND .', 'Jigsaw : Engaging community in the development and implementation of youth mental health service and support in the Republic of Ireland .', 'Background : Irish young people exhibit high level of psychological distress , but community-based service and support are often unavailable or inaccessible .', 'Aim : To describe effort to engage community in systematic and data-based process of planning , programme design , implementation , and evaluation .', 'Method : Details system-building initiative in five community ( four county and a distressed urban site ) that will serve as a springboard for full national deployment .', 'Result : Extensive community engagement and planning has occurred in all site , system change effort grounded in detailed business plan have begun , and process and outcome evaluation is underway .', 'Conclusion : Need and 'Creating and sustaining a culture of innovation at each site was challenging , requiring leadership and continuous dialogue .', 'Developing a culturally competent and socially relevant sexual health 'Study design : Qualitative study with interview .', 'Method : Community and research informant ( n=10 ) were interviewed informally to identify survey topic .', 'A sexual health survey was constructed combining local knowledge from informant with a review of sexual health literature for the Arctic and other Indigenous location .', 'The draft survey was distributed to community partner for commentary and revision .', 'After translation into Danish and Greenlandic , cognitive interview were conducted with 11 Nuuk resident , identified through snowball sampling , to both pilot test the survey and exchange social and cultural knowledge relevant to sexual health in Nuuk .', 'The utility of this process was evaluated against implementation of the final survey to Nuuk resident enrolled in Inuulluataarneq ( n=149 ) .', 'Result : Theme saturation was reached by the ninth interview .', 'STI risk and self-efficacy , co-occurrence of alcohol use and sex and STI knowledge were identified as most relevant .', 'Question about community efficacy , culture/community involvement and identity were most sensitive .', 'Upon implementation of the final survey , 146 of 149 participant answered all survey question .', 'Two Elder participant refused to answer question about sex .', 'Some question had low response variability but still added to our contextual understanding and helped to build rapport with participant .', 'Conclusion : Combining an iterative process with community-based participatory research principle and cognitive interview technique was an effective method for developing a sexual health survey with Nuuk resident .', 'Social environment and substance misuse : A study of ethnic variation among inner London adolescent .', 'Objective .', 'To explore data was analysed using chi-square and McNemar test .', 'Familial , religious and peer influence closely correlated with ethnicity .', 'Bangladeshi young people showed lower level of peer and higher level of religious and familial involvement and lower level of substance use .', 'White young people reported higher level of peer , lower level of religious and familial involvement , and a higher level of substance use .', 'Black African and Black Caribbean young people lay between the two extreme .', 'Conclusion .', 'The finding suggest that young people with lower level of familial and religious influence , or higher level of peer influence , have higher level of substance consumption than other young people .', "Health education initiative need to promote personal decision-making skill within the context of the young people 's individual culture .", 'Cultural diversity should be recognised within local health education needs assessment .', 'Common mental disorder among I Disorders ( SCID-I ) ( n=544 ) .', 'Psychiatrist interviewed a subsample ( n=78 ) .', 'Setting Four Aboriginal Medical Services and the general community located in urban , regional and remote area of Southern Queensland and two Aboriginal Reserve located in New South Wales .', 'Participant Indigenous Australian adult .', 'Outcome measures Cultural acceptability of SCID-I interview , standardised rate of CMD , comorbid CMD and concordance with psychiatrist diagnosis .', 'Result Participant reported that the SCID-I interview were generally culturally acceptable .', 'Standardised rate ( 95 % CI ) of current mood , anxiety , substance use and any mental disorder were 16.2 % ( 12.2 % to 20.2 % ) , 29.2 % ( 24.2 % to 34.1 % ) , 12.4 % ( 8.8 % to 16.1 % ) and 42.2 % ( 38.8 % to 47.7 % ) , respectively-6.7-fold , 3.8-fold , 6.9-fold and 4.2-fold higher , respectively , than those of the Australian population .', 'Difference between this Indigenous cohort and the Australian population were less marked for 12-month ( 2.4-fold ) and lifetime prevalence ( 1.3-fold ) .', 'Comorbid mental disorder was threefold to fourfold higher .', 'In subgroup living on traditional land in Indigenous reserve and in remote area , the rate was half that of those living in mainstream community .', 'Moderate-to-good concordance with psychiatrist diagnosis was found .', 'Conclusion The prevalence of current CMD in this Indigenous population is substantially higher than previous estimate .', 'The lower relative rate of non-current disorder are consistent with underdiagnosis of protective factor .", 'A larger study with random sampling is required to determine the population prevalence of CMD in Indigenous Australians .', 'Perspective on enhancing physical activity and diet engage in modifying dietary behaviour , and the central role of communal eating of traditional 'Asian ' food in their cultural life .", 'Barrier to increasing physical activity included cost , personal safety and lack of time outside of long working hour and carer commitment .', 'However , increasing walking activity was regarded as feasible by both community and health professional participant .', 'Respondent emphasised using a social approach for potential intervention , undertaking activity with family or friend and with bilingual community peer to facilitate engagement , perspective on enhancing physical activity and diet among South Asians in urban deprived community at high risk of chronic disease and to inform development of culturally appropriate health promotion HIV-positive status remain low and are considered to be related to stigmatisation .', "Determining the factor that influence a person 's decision to disclose a positive status is essential to understanding the process of and way to improve disclosure rate .", "This study investigated the factor that influence the disclosure of a person 's HIV-positive status and focused on socio-demographic factor , stigma and discrimination , religion , culture , fear of abandonment and rejection as well as knowledge of the disease that may all influence disclosure rate .", 'A facility based descriptive cross-sectional research design with a quantitative approach was applied using convenience sampling .', 'The sample comprised 150 individual which was 12.5 % of the study population .', 'A self-administered questionnaire comprising mainly closed-ended question , with a limited number of open ended question was designed , tested and utilised .', 'Statistical association were determined between the demographic factor and response to the question .', 'The open ended question were analysed thematically by mean of content analysis to extract meaning .', 'The result revealed that fear of stigmatisation , especially among the male participant , was a major reason for delayed or non-disclosure .', 'The result of the total study sample also showed that the level of education influenced the fear of stigmatisation ; those with secondary school level education were most afraid of this ( 29 % ) .', 'There was a statistically significant association between fear of blame or discrimination and disclosure to the sexual partner .', 'This fear was most often cited by the participant who had never married ( 19 % ) .', 'The participant who feared blame or discrimination the most reported having no income ( 23 % ) .', 'The finding of this study indicate that numerous factor influence HIV disclosure .', 'Stigma of individual who are HIV-positive remains a barrier to partner to attend voluntary counselling and testing together to minimise the fear of blame .', 'Disability culture in West Africa : Qualitative research indicating barrier and progress in the greater opportunity .', 'This article presents interview conducted with community leader from the Greater Accra region of Ghana in 2009 , examining the current view of person with disability in the country .', 'Using qualitative analytic method , these interview were coded for theme and examined in relation to historical perception of disabled person in Ghana .', 'The result suggest that there appears to be a growing acceptance that people with disability have right as human being and that the Disability Rights Bill is a positive step in the right direction for Ghana .', 'There was no consensus , however , on what these basic right entail , and who is responsible for enforcing and funding new policy .', 'A potential barrier to progress included non biologically based belief about what causes disability , which were reported to resonate strongly with many Ghanaians .', "'people make assumption about our community ' : Sexual health amongst teenager from black and minority ethnic background in East London .", 'Objective .', '( 1 ) To explore sexual behaviour and relationship amongst Black and minority ethnic ( BME ) teenager in East London .', '( 2 ) To examine how these relationship are shaped by culture , gender , peer norm and religion .', '( 3 ) To describe the implication for sexual health policy and practice in urban , multicultural area .', 'Design .', 'This report draws primarily on the qualitative arm of a mixed method study which collected data from 126 young people , aged 15-18 , largely through focus group in the London boroughs of Hackney , Newham and Tower Hamlets .', 'Result .', 'Previous research has reported culture influencing the patterning of risk/protection amongst BME group .', 'Our data suggest that this is mediated by gender , religion and youth .', "Religion reportedly influenced young woman 's sexual behaviour in multiple way .", 'Young people described gendered norm in meeting and flirting with partner , and the role of mobile phone and peer pressure .', 'Conclusion .', 'Our paper suggests culture , gender , religion and youth influence BME teenager in aspect of sexual relationship , and that these social marker may have different contextual meaning for individual .', 'The multiplicity of factor affecting attitudes/behaviour requires a range of contraceptive , counselling , screening and sex education service available for all teenager , although delivery pattern may differ in response to differing need .', "‘ They are n't really black fella but they are easy to talk to ’ : Factor which influence Australian Aboriginal woman 's decision to disclose intimate partner violence during pregnancy .", 'Objective intimate partner violence is a significant global health problem but remains largely hidden .', 'Understanding decision about whether or not to disclose violence in response to routine enquiry in health setting can inform safe and responsive system .', 'Elevated rate of violence and systematic disadvantage found among Indigenous woman globally , can impact on their decision to disclose violence .', 'This study aimed to test , among Indigenous woman , a model for decision on whether to disclose intimate partner violence in the context of antenatal routine screening .', 'Design we employed Qualitative Configurative Analysis , a method developed for the social science to study complex phenomenon with intermediate sample size .', 'Data were drawn from single semi- structured interview with Indigenous woman 28+ week pregnant attending antenatal care .', 'Interview addressed decision to disclose recent intimate partner violence in the context of routine enquiry during the antenatal care .', 'Interview transcript were binary coded for condition identified a priori from the model being tested and also from theme identified within the current study and analysed using Qualitative Configurative Analysis to determine causal condition for the outcome of disclosure or non-disclosure of violence experienced .', 'Setting five Aboriginal and Maternal Infant Health Services ( two urban and three regional ) , and one mainstream hospital , in New South Wales , Australia .', 'Participant indigenous woman who had experienced partner violence in the previous year and who had been asked about this as part of an antenatal booking-in visit .', 'Of the 12 participant six had elected to disclose their experience of violence to the midwife , and six had chosen not to do so .', 'Finding pathway to disclosure and non-disclosure were mapped using Qualitative Configurative Analysis .', 'Condition relevant to decision to disclose were similar to the condition for non-Aboriginal woman found in our earlier study .', "Unique to Aboriginal woman 's decision to disclose abuse was cultural safety .", 'Cultural safety included element we titled : Borrowed trust , Build the relationship first , Come at it slowly and People like me are here .', 'The absence of cultural safety Its absence was also a factor in decision not to disclose experience of violence by this group of woman .', "Key conclusion cultural safety was central to Indigenous woman 's decision to disclose violence and process for creating safety are identified .", 'Other form of safety which influenced disclosure included : safety from detection by the abuser ; safety from shame ; and safety from institutional control .', 'Disclosure was promoted by direct asking by the midwife and a perception of care .', 'Non-disclosure was associated with a lack of care and a lack of all four type of safety .', "Experience of institutional racism were associated with Indigenous woman 's perceived risk of control by others , particularly child protection service .", 'Implication for practice policy to ask abuse question at first visit and model where continuity of care is not maintained , are problematic for Aboriginal woman , among whom relationship building is important as is ample warning about question to be asked .', 'Strategy are needed to build cultural safety to counter widespread racism and promote safe opportunity for Indigenous woman to disclose intimate partner violence and receive support .', 'Element of cultural safety are necessary for vulnerable or marginalised population to fully utilise available health service .', 'A pilot study on integrating videography and environmental microbial sampling to model fecal bacterial exposure in peri-urban Tanzania .', 'Diarrheal disease are a leading cause of under-five mortality and morbidity in sub-Saharan Africa .', 'Quantitative exposure modeling provides opportunity to investigate the relative importance of fecal-oral transmission route ( e.g .', 'hand , water , food ) responsible for diarrheal disease .', "Modeling , however , requires accurate description of individual ' interaction with the environment ( i.e.", ', activity data ) .', 'Such activity data are largely lacking for people in low-income setting .', 'In the present study , we collected activity data and microbiological sampling data to develop a quantitative microbial exposure model for two female caretaker in peri-urban Tanzania .', 'Activity data were combined with microbiological data of contacted surface and fomite ( e.g .', "broom handle , soil , clothing ) to develop example exposure profiles describing second-by-second estimate of fecal indicator bacteria ( E. coli and enterococci ) concentration on the caretaker 's hand .", 'The study demonstrates the application and utility of video activity data to quantify exposure factor for people in low-income country and apply these factor to understand fecal contamination exposure pathway .', 'This study provides both a methodological approach for the design and implementation of larger study , and preliminary data suggesting contact with dirt and sand may be important mechanism of hand contamination .', 'Increasing the scale of activity data collection and modeling to investigate individual-level exposure profile within target population for specific exposure scenario would provide opportunity to identify the relative importance of fecal-oral disease transmission route .', 'How do care home staff understand , manage and respond to agitation in people with dementia ?', 'A qualitative study .', 'Objective Little is known about how care home staff understand and respond to distress in resident living with dementia labelled as agitation .', 'The aim of this study was to describe how care home staff understand and respond to agitation and the factor that determine how it is managed .', 'Design We conducted a qualitative thematic analysis .', 'Setting We recruited staff from six care home in South East England including residential and nursing home of differing size run by both the private and charity sector and located in urban and rural area .', 'Participant We interviewed 25 care home staff using purposive sampling to include staff of either sex , differing age , ethnicity , nationality and with different role and experience .', 'Result We identified four overarching theme : ( 1 ) behaviours expressing unmet need ; ( 2 ) staff emotional response to agitation ; ( 3 ) understanding the individual helps and ( 4 ) constraint on staff response .', 'Staff struggled with the paradox of trying to connect with the personhood of resident while seeing the person as separate to and , therefore , not responsible for their behaviour .', 'Staff often felt powerless , frightened and overwhelmed , and their response were constrained by care home structure , process and a culture of fear and scrutiny .', "Conclusion Responding to agitation expressed by resident was not a linear process and staff faced tension and dilemma in deciding how to respond , especially when initial strategy were unsuccessful or when attempt to respond to resident ' need were inhibited by structural and procedural constraint in the care home .", "Future trial of psychosocial intervention should support staff to identify and respond to resident ' unmet need and include how staff can look after themselves .", 'Adolescent , sex and injecting drug use : Risk for HIV infection .', 'In this paper we present data on the HIV-related risk for adolescent growing up in an area where injecting drug use is prevalent and HIV infection has been identified among local injecting drug user .', 'We report on young people ’ knowledge , attitude and perception of drug use and injector ; HIV and AIDS ; sex , safer sex and condom use .', 'These adolescent had an extensive and practically oriented knowledge of illicit drug and drug injector .', 'The majority of adolescent contacted had an unsophisticated but approximate understanding of HIV transmission dynamic and how to guard against infection .', 'Our data suggest that many adolescent find issue relating to sex awkward , embarrassing and difficult subject for discussion .', 'In a final section we consider some of the policy implication of our work focussing in particular on the prevention of injecting , the promotion of condom use , and the necessity of avoiding a focus upon risk group .', 'Illicit and injecting drug use among Indigenous young people in urban , regional and remote Australia .', 'Introduction and Aim : To examine pattern of illicit drug use among Australian Indigenous young people , identify correlate of frequent use separately in urban , regional and remote setting and characterise those who inject .', 'Design and Method : Cross-sectional design at 40 Indigenous event .', 'Self-complete survey were administered to Indigenous people aged 16–29 year using mobile device .', 'Result : 2,877 participant completed the survey .', 'One in five reported using cannabis at least weekly in the previous year , but the use of other drug was less prevalent .', 'Pattern of drug use were largely similar across region , although more participant in urban and regional area reported using ecstasy ( 12 % vs 11 % vs 5 % ) and cocaine ( 6 % vs 3 % vs 1 % ) and more reported weekly cannabis use ( 18 % vs 22 % vs 14 % ) .', 'Injecting was rare ( 3 % ) but those who did inject reported a high incidence of needle sharing ( 37 % ) .', 'Methamphetamine ( 37 % ) , heroin ( 36 % ) and methadone ( 26 % ) were the most commonly injected drug , and injecting was related to prison experience ( AOR 5.3 95 % CI 2.8–10.0 ) .', 'Discussion and Conclusion : Attention is needed in relation to cannabis use , particularly among those Indigenous young people living in regional and urban setting .', 'Also , although injecting is uncommon , it is associated with prison involvement .', 'Priority must be given to reducing the number of Indigenous youth entering justice setting , delaying the age at first entry to justice setting , and reducing the risk of BBV acquisition while in custody through , for example , prison-based NSP , BBV education , and Indigenous-specific treatment that emphasises connection to country and culture .', '[ Bryant J , Ward J , Wand H , Byron K , Bamblett A , Waples-Crowe P , Betts S , Coburn T , Delaney-Thiele D , Worth H , Kaldor J , Pitts M. Illicit and injecting drug use among Indigenous young people in urban , regional and remote Australia .', 'Drug Alcohol Rev 2016 ; 35:447–455 ] .', 'Prescription drug misuse among young adult : Looking across youth culture .', 'Introduction and Aim : Youth culture play a key role in the social organisation of drug trend among young people ; the current prescription drug misuse trend is no different .', 'The author evaluated whether pattern of prescription drug misuse differed across several youth culture .', 'Design and Method : Using field survey method and time-space sampling during 2011 , the author assessed the pattern and prevalence of prescription drug misuse among young adult who are socially active in various urban youth culture ( n=1781 ) .', 'Result : The prevalence of lifetime prescription drug misuse is highest within indie rock scene ( 52.5 % ) , electronic dance music scene ( 52.1 % ) , lesbian party ( 53.8 % ) and alt scene ( 50.9 % ) .', 'Prescription drug misuse was lowest among young adult in hip-hop scene ( 25.0 % ) .', 'These finding were upheld in logistic regression analyses that accounted for demographic difference across youth culture : indie rock scene ( adjusted odds ratio=2.11 ) , electronic dance music scene ( adjusted odds ratio=2.20 ) , lesbian party ( adjusted odds ratio=2.30 ) and alt scene ( adjusted odds ratio=2.65 ) all reported statistically significant ( P < 0.05 ) higher odds of misuse than college bar scene .', 'Recent prescription drug misuse mirrored pattern for lifetime misuse .', 'Discussion and Conclusion : The differing prevalence of prescription drug misuse across distinct youth culture suggests that the trend has not diffused equally among young people .', 'The differing prevalence across youth culture indicates that the most efficacious strategy for youth intervention may be targeted approach that account for the subculturally rooted difference in attitude and social norm .', 'Evaluating Schwartz Center Rounds® in an urban hospital center .', 'Purpose – Schwartz Center Rounds® ( SCRs ) bring multidisciplinary caregiver together to discuss authentic patient case from the social and emotional perspective .', 'The monthly session provide a forum to share personal thought and feeling .', 'The purpose of this paper is to learn why people attend SCR , understand what is gained from the experience , and identify key element to use in measuring the program ’ s effectiveness .', 'Design/methodology/approach – This qualitative descriptive study used four focus group and three telephone interview for data collection .', 'Purposive sampling resulted in a multidisciplinary sample of 30 participant .', 'Thematic analysis was conducted with complete transcript by all researcher .', 'Finding – All party viewed SCR as beneficial .', 'Six theme emerged during data analysis : culture change , exposing emotion , walking in another ’ s shoe , inequality of topic , influence of rule and boundary , and personal impact .', 'Institutional culture was positively influenced through SCR .', 'Research limitations/implications – Limitations include a single institution and restricted data gathered from physician .', 'Future research should focus on identifying outcome measure to evaluate the long-term impact of SCR on healthcare organization .', 'Practical implication – This study confirms that the SCR program should be continued at the study organization , and expanded to increase availability to all staff .', 'The growth of this program in healthcare organization across the country is encouraged .', 'Originality/value – This research provides support for healthcare organization to offer SCR and highlights how the emotional aspect of patient care can be acknowledged , explored , and discussed .', 'Knowledge of AIDS , Use of Condoms and Results of Counselling Subjects with Asymptomatic HIV2 Infection in The Gambia .', 'A questionnaire administered to subject seen during a serological survey in The Gambia revealed that knowledge of AIDS and HIV infection was limited .', 'Male , those with a secondary education and people who lived in urban area had a better understanding but only 17 % of woman seen in rural area had any knowledge of the condition .', 'Only 8 % of the subject seen had used condom in the preceding 12 month ; during this time half of them had done so on less than five occasion .', 'Subject with a secondary education were more likely to have used condom .', 'A counsellor met 31 asymptomatic seropositive subject identified during this survey on two occasion .', 'In the majority , the information given caused anxiety rather than modification of behaviour and , at the time of the second interview , only one subject had discussed the situation with the partner and begun using condom .', 'Some of the cultural factor which may affect the outcome of counselling in an African society are discussed in the light of these finding .', 'Alteration of cortisol homeostasis may link change of the sociocultural environment to an increased diabetes and metabolic risk in developing country : A prospective diagnostic study performed in cooperation with the Ovahimba people of the Kunene region/northwestern Namibia .', 'Context : Diabetes mellitus is increasingly affecting Africa .', 'Objective : Urbanization of the Ovahimba people in Namibia is associated with an increased prevalence of disorder of glucose metabolism , and may thus be attributed to change of cortisol homeostasis .', 'Design : A prospective , cross-sectional , diagnostic study was applied .', 'Setting : The study was conducted in the field .', 'Location of the Diabetes Epidemic : Africa and Namibia .', "Participant : Ovahimba people : group 1 `` urban '' n = 60 , 42 female , 46.3 ± 11.3 year ( town ) ; group 2 `` rural '' n = 63 , 44 female , 51.1 ± 12.0 year ( seminomadic ) .", 'Intervention : oGTT , sunrise and sunset saliva cortisol , metabolic parameter , questionnaire .', 'Main Outcome Measure : The prevalence of disorder of glucose metabolism ( DM , IGT , IFT ) .', 'Result : The prevalence of disorder of glucose metabolism differed significantly : urban group n = 17 ( 28.3 % ) vs rural group n = 8 ( 12.7 % ) ( P = 0.04 ) .', 'The saliva cortisol concentration also differed significantly : sunrise 0.34 ± 0.18 vs 0.12 ± 0.15 μg/dL , sunset 0.18 ± 0.20 vs 0.07 ± 0.09 μg/dL , area under the curve 6.16 ±3.48 vs 2.28 ± 2.56 μg/dL∗24 h ( all P < 0.001 ) .', 'Further metabolic parameter were unfavorably changed in the urban group : hip circumference ( P < 0.001 ) , waist circumference ( P < 0.001 ) , body mass index ( P = 0.014 ) , systolic BP at rest ( P < 0.001 ) , diastolic BP atrest ( P = 0.002 ) , systolic BP after exercise ( P < 0.001 ) , heart rate after exercise ( P = 0.007 ) , fasting glucose ( P < 0.001 ) ,2-h-glucose by OGTT ( P = 0.002 ) , triglyceride ( P = 0.04 ) , HDL-cholesterol ( P = 0.014 ) , prevalence of the metabolic syndrome ( P < 0.001 ) .', 'Physical activity was higher in the rural group , and intake of fast food and sweet were higher in the urban group .', 'Conclusion : Urbanization of the Ovahimba people is associated with an increasing prevalence of disorder of glucose metabolism and other unfavorable metabolic parameter .', 'Besides change of lifestyle , this may be attributed to an increased cortisol exposure of the Ovahimba people living in an urban environment .', 'Belief system in faith-based human service program .', 'Using a grounded theory design and method , 65 key informant in 15 faith-based organization having promising program in four urban area were interviewed .', 'Respondent were asked what makes their direct service program faith-based .', 'A story emerges , motivated by mission-driven vision tied to force beyond local program and steeped in deep tradition .', 'A major implication of the finding is that in teaching people about the various practice of diverse religious group , we are only giving them the visible element .', 'While the expressed value of act and faith are integral in the faith-based discussion , they do not tell the full story .', 'The deep driver of human behavior and practice are found in the specific belief and interpretation of individual who are involved either as leader or participant in faith-based organization .', 'For many of these individual in faith-based organization , mission and accountability to God trumps secular or professional expectation .', 'A randomized clinical trial comparing use of rapid
