rapid molecular result of Staphylococcus aureus would impact emergency department clinician antimicrobial selection for adult with cutaneous abscess .', 'design .', 'We performed a prospective , randomized controlled trial comparing a rapid molecular test with standard of care culture-based testing .', 'Follow-up telephone call were made at between 2 and 7 day , 1 month , and 3 month after discharge .', 'setting .', 'Two urban , academic emergency department .', 'patient .', 'Patient at least 18 year old presenting with a chief complaint of abscess , cellulitis , or insect bite and receiving incision and drainage were eligible .', 'Seven hundred seventy-eight people were assessed for eligibility and 252 met eligibility criterion .', 'method .', 'Clinician antibiotic selection and clinical outcome were evaluated .', 'An ad hoc outcome of test performance was performed .', 'result .', 'We enrolled 252 patient and 126 were randomized to receive the rapid test .', 'Methicillin-susceptible S. aureus–positive patient receiving rapid test result were prescribed beta-lactams more often than control ( absolute difference , 14.5 % [ 95 % CI , 1.1 % –30.1 % ] ) whereas methicillin-resistant S. aureus–positive patient receiving rapid test result were more often prescribed anti–methicillin-resistant S. aureus antibiotic ( absolute difference , 21.5 % [ 95 % CI , 10.1 % –33.0 % ] ) .', 'There were no significant difference between the 2 group in 1-week or 3-month clinical outcome .', 'conclusion .', 'Availability of rapid molecular test result after incision and drainage was associated with more-targeted antibiotic selection .', 'All right reserved .', "Social determinant of self-reported health for Canada 's indigenous people : a public health approach .", 'Objective : In Canada , indigenous people suffer from a multitude of health disparity .', 'To better understand these disparity , this study aims to examine the social determinant of self-reported health for indigenous people in Canada .', "Study design : This study uses data from Statistics Canada 's Aboriginal Peoples Survey 2012 .", 'Method : Multinomial logistic regression model were used to examine how selected social determinant of health are associated with self-reported health among off-reserve First Nations and Métis people in Canada .', 'Result : Our analysis shows that being older , female , and living in urban setting were significantly associated with negative rating of self-reported health status among the indigenous respondent .', 'Additionally , we found that higher income and level of education were strongly and significantly associated with positive rating of self-reported health status .', 'Compared with indigenous people with an education level of grade 8 or lower , respondent with higher education were 10 time ( 5.35–22.48 ) more likely to report ‘ excellent ’ and ‘ very good ’ health .', 'Respondent who earned more than $ 40,000 annually were three time ( 2.17–4.72 ) more likely to report ‘ excellent ’ and ‘ very good ’ health compared with those who earned less than $ 20,000 annually .', 'When interacted with income , we also found that volunteering in the community is associated with better self-reported health .', 'Conclusion : There are known protective determinant ( income and education ) and risk determinant ( location of residence , gender , and age ) which are associated with self-reported health status among off-reserve First Nations and Métis people .', 'For indigenous-specific determinant , volunteering in the community appears to be associated with self-perceived health status .', 'Thus , addressing these determinant will be necessary to achieve better health outcome for indigenous people in Canada .', 'Next step include developing indigenous-specific social determinant of health indicator that adequately measure culture , connection , and community .', 'Predictor of patient-related benefit , burden and feeling safe in relation to hospital admission in palliative care : A cross-sectional survey .', 'Background : Research exploring patient experience of palliative care in the hospital setting has previously been limited to negative aspect of care .', 'However , recent study have shown that patient with palliative care needs experience benefit being in hospital .', 'Little is known about how experience of benefit and burden vary according to socio-demographic and illness-related factor and how these experience influence patient preference to return to hospital .', 'Aim : To identify factor influencing experience of benefit and burden and the predictor associated with a preference to return to hospital in palliative care .', 'Design : Cross-sectional design using a questionnaire survey .', 'Setting/participants : In total , 116 hospital inpatient admitted with palliative care need in an urban hospital in New Zealand .', 'Recruitment was from an oncology ward , four general medical ward and a respiratory ward .', 'Result : Those living in more deprived area experienced more benefit being in hospital ( F ( 4 , 109 ) = 3.15 , p = 0.017 ) , while younger people ( F ( 4 , 109 ) = 4.44 , p = 0.00 ) and those from Asian or Pacific culture ( F ( 2 , 111 ) = 7.78 , p = 0.000 ) experienced more burden .', 'Those with a non-cancer diagnosis felt less safe in hospital ( p = 0.04 ) .', '‘ Feeling safe ’ was a significant ( B = 0.14 , p = 0.03 ) predictor for a preference to return to hospital .', 'Conclusion : Deprivation , diagnosis , age and ethnicity influenced experience of benefit and burden in hospital .', '‘ Feeling safe ’ was a significant predictor for a preference to return to hospital .', 'Further research is needed to understand why certain patient factor influence experience of hospitalisation and how ‘ feeling safe ’ can be replicated in other care environment .', 'The lung diseases diagnosis software : Influenza and Tuberculosis case study in the cloud computing environment .', 'This research paper describes study of the lung diseases diagnosis software with Influenza and Tuberculosis as the case study .', 'Influenza is a highly contagious infection of the respiratory tract .', 'In Indonesia , numerous number of Avian-Influenza ( H5N1 ) case occurred in rural area , such as case in Garut , Jawa Barat in 2006 which started in Cikelet district causing 14 infected-cases and 5 death-cases and has put Garut in an emergency situation until 2010 .', 'The H5N1 detection in rural area requires fast yet accurate diagnosis result to enable immediate curative action .', 'The most accurate result is provided by RT-PCR ( Reverse-Transcription Polymerase-Chain-Reaction ) , which is high investment , and usually locates in urban area .', 'Another diagnostic tool , rapid diagnostic test , is most common tool but gives inaccurate result because of its low sensitivity and specificity .', 'In case of Tuberculosis , Indonesia ranks number 3 , after India and China , as a country with most number of infected-people .', 'Symptom are chronic-cough with blood-tinged-sputum , fever , night-sweats and weight-loss .', 'Tuberculosis is diagnosed by identifying Mycobacterium-tuberculosis organism in clinical sample .', 'When this is not possible , probable diagnosis may be made using imaging X-ray or scan , tuberculin skin test and/or Interferon-Gamma-Release-Assay ( IGRA ) .', 'The main problem with tuberculosis diagnosis is difficulty in culturing this slow-growing organism in laboratory , which may take 4 to 12 week for blood or sputum-culture .', 'The requirement is to create a first-hand diagnostic tool which allows paramedic mobility to rural area for Influenza/Tuberculosis diagnostic purpose .', 'The study first introduces lung auscultation method , then analysis and preliminary design of lung disease diagnosis software .', 'To enable each Lung Health for Public Council ( Balai Besar Kesehatan Paru Masyarakat ) and Health Service Office ( Dinas Kesehatan ) within province/region/country as data owner to maintain its own data , and to provide the data confidentiality as well , the cloud computing environment is then applied .', 'A cross-sectional analysis of the relationship between diabetes and health access barrier in an urban First Nations population in Canada .', 'Objective This study explores the relationship between health access barrier and diabetes in an urban First Nations population in Canada .', 'Design Data from a self-identified urban First Nations population were collected using respondent-driven sampling ( RDS ) .', 'As no clear approach for regression modelling of RDS data is available , two logistic regression modelling approach , including survey-based logistic and generalised linear mixed model , were used to explore the relationship between diabetes and health barrier of interest , including access to healthcare , food , housing and socioeconomic factor .', 'Setting Hamilton , Ontario , Canada .', 'Participant This cross-sectional study used data collected from the Our Health Counts study , in partnership with the De dwa da dehs nye > s Aboriginal Health Centre , which recruited 554 First Nations adult living in Hamilton using RDS .', 'Result After adjusting for covariates , multivariable regression technique showed a statistically significant relationship between a self-reported diagnosis of diabetes and a lack of culturally appropriate care among urban First Nations people ( OR : 12.70 , 95 % CI 2.52 to 57.91 ) .', 'There was also a trend towards a relationship between diabetes and not having a doctor available in the area , feeling that healthcare provided was inadequate and a lack of available healthcare service in the area .', 'Conclusion Urban First Nations people who felt the health service they received was not culturally appropriate were more likely to have diabetes , compared with those who did not feel the service they received was culturally inappropriate .', 'Establishing more healthcare service that integrate First Nations culture and tradition could improve access to care and the course of treatment for urban First Nations peoples living with diabetes .', 'No commercial use is permitted unless otherwise expressly granted .', 'Locating community among people with schizophrenia living in a diverse urban environment .', 'Increasing the community participation of people with severe mental illness is a primary goal of recovery-oriented service .', 'Despite this emphasis , the construct of community remains understudied and poorly articulated .', 'This study provides an in-depth examination of the experience , belief , behavior , and space that constitute community participation for a highly diverse group of people with schizophrenia who are urban dweller .', 'An in-depth , longitudinal qualitative design was employed with 30 individual with schizophrenia residing in inner-city neighborhood in Canada ’ s largest city .', 'For these individual , community participation is a dynamic process , shaped by illness and non-illness-associated social relationship and space , self-concept , and the resource accessible to the person .', 'The complexity of factor that are associated with “ community ” for people with schizophrenia , with overlay of culture , poverty , victimization , and discrimination , calls for a critical examination of the community rhetoric employed in practice and policy contexts .', 'Changing epistemology under condition of social change in two Arab community in Israel .', 'The study of epistemic thinking focus on how people understand and coordinate objective and subjective aspect of knowing and make sense of multiple and discrepant knowledge claim .', 'Typically described in term of normative development , cross-cultural study show difference in epistemic development and characteristic of epistemic thinking .', 'This study focuses on within-culture variation of epistemic thinking , with the assumption that social change will produce change in development .', 'Arab society in Israel has undergone notable change over the last half century .', 'In this cross-sectional research design , cross-generational comparison and rural–urban comparison were used as proxy for longitudinal social change .', 'Three generation of Muslim Arab woman in a village in Israel ( 20 adolescent , 20 mother and 20 grandmother ) and 20 Muslim Arab adolescent from a large , mixed city in the same region responded to six dilemma invoking epistemic thinking .', 'Village adolescent were more subjectivist than their mother and grandmother .', 'Sociodemographic characteristic representing greater exposure to diverse people and idea accounted for generational difference .', 'Both urban and rural adolescent tended towards subjectivist perspective , and they did not differ .', 'Parent ’ education level emerged as the sociodemographic variable most consistently related to epistemic thinking .', 'Epistemic thinking mediated the relationship between generation and gender role/cross-sex relation value .', 'All right reserved .', 'The perception of the benefit of herbal medicine consumption among the Thai elderly .', 'Objective : To determine how the Thai elderly perceived the benefit of herbal medicine consumption and to study related variable influencing their perception .', 'Design : A cross-sectional study was used .', 'Participants/settings : 419 participant were chosen by systematic stratified sampling ; people between 60-96 year of age ( mean age 70.2 year ) ; 68.3 % female , and 31.7 % male of Chonburi Province ( Thailand ) .', 'Measurement : To determine the elderly perception about the benefit of herbal medicine consumption , a scale from one to four based upon 12 simply worded item check list was used among the others .', 'The questionnaire were conducted in June to August 2008 in 3 different region ( urban , suburban and rural area ) .', 'Result : 97.4 % having used herbal medicine in many way .', 'Most of the elderly used the local herbal together with conventional medicine .', 'They believed that herbal could reduce expense ( 51 % ) , cure disease ( 41.9 % ) , relieve symptom ( 35.4 % ) , and provide good health ( 33.6 % ) .', 'A 16.7 % of the elderly had the strongest opinion regarding the use of herbal medicine as substitute for conventional medicine .', 'They also strongly agreed on using them as nutrient ( 39.8 % ) .', 'The study found significant correlation among level of education , stress level , happiness level , and perception of benefit of herbal medicine consumption .', 'Conclusion : This study indicated that level of education , happiness , and stress could influence the perception of herbal medicine consumption .', 'Knowing how people perceive herbal medicine , its use , and local culture can help practicing health professional , among other thing , to avoid side effect from prescription and so maintain or promote the elderly health status .', 'The experience of HIV reactive patient in rural Malawi -- Part I .. Malawi has a population of 9 million people with AIDS the leading cause of death in the 20-40 age group .', 'The HIV positive prevalence rate , estimated at 23 % in urban area and 8 % in rural area , is one of the highest in the world ( AIDSEC , 1994:1 ) .', 'Evaluation of counselling practice showed poor result with counsellor feeling ineffective and inadequate .', 'Patient are mostly tested on medical indication but patient who do not see the benefit of knowing their HIV status increasingly refuse testing .', 'The counselling practise as it is known in the Western world is a foreign concept for patient living in rural Malawi .', 'The high stigma of AIDS complicates support of the patient .', 'The goal of the research study was to describe a model of counselling that would meet the need of an AIDS patient in rural community in Malawi .', 'A qualitative research design that was explorative , descriptive and contextually specific to rural Malawi was used for the study .', 'In order to describe a counselling model it was important to understand the illness experience of HIV reactive patient .', 'The patient are seen in group context congruent with the African culture and therefore the experience of the primary care giver of AIDS patient is explored as the other major factor in the phenomenon examined .', 'One phase of the research is described in this article namely exploring and describing the experience of the HIV reactive patient in rural Malawi .', 'Result show that patient are in an advanced stage of AIDS when they are diagnosed and complain of weakness and an inability to do work , including an inability to do their daily chore .', 'This causes a feeling of desperateness that is worsened by the perception that support system are inadequate .', 'Support system are mostly identified as parent , partner and sibling to assist mainly with the physical care and financial support .', 'Despite the fact that the family is very important to patient there is a reluctance to acknowledge their HIV status .', 'Patient fear being rejected once it is known that they have AIDS -- not only because AIDS is a sexually transmitted disease , but also because it is perceived that financial and other support will be withheld if it is known that patient have AIDS and will therefore die and not be able to return the support provided .', 'Patient feel they have no future once a diagnosis of AIDS has been made which result in refusal of testing , as they do not see the benefit of knowing their HIV status .', 'Assessing the coping ability of the patient within the household as part of an overall assessment is one proposed strategy that could be taken .', 'Secondly the patient is encouraged to take a more active role in the counselling process , which could be achieved by narration .', 'The family should be incorporated into the counselling process as early as possible .', 'Sense of coherence , academic performance and professional vocation in Certified Nursing Assistant student .', 'Background : The sense of coherence ( SOC ) of the salutogenic health model explains why people in stressful situation are able to maintain or even improve their health .', 'There are some study on which measure are more effective to reduce stress in Nursing assistant student .', 'There are no study that link SOC with the two key aspect in the prevention of stress in Nursing assistant student : the motivation of pursuing this profession and the academic level .', 'Objective : To explore the salutogenic paradigm among Nursing assistant student in a region of Spain ( Comunitat Valenciana ) .', 'Design : Cross-sectional , analytical and exploratory study carried out in 2016 .', 'Method : Student of the first year of Nursing Assistant certification .', 'Self-administered questionnaire to collect the variable : Sense of Coherence ( SOC-13 instrument ) ; professional vocation ; Self-reported grade of the academic record .', 'Result : The mean score for the total SOC measurement was M = 56.38 ( SD = 12.236 ; 71 ) .', 'Regarding the SOC component , the average score was for Manageability M = 16.45 ( SD = 4.53 ; 24 ) ; Comprehensibility M = 19.27 ( SD = 5.642 ; 30 ) and Meaningfulness M = 20.65 ( SD = 4.48 ; 23 ) .', 'Student who lived in rural environment presented a weaker SOC ( M = 54.05 ) , compared to those who were located in urban environment ( M = 56.83 ) and large city ( M = 56.15 ) .', 'The student who reported a choice of study motivated by professional vocation presented a stronger SOC , scoring also a remarkable academic performance ( p < 0.05 ) .', 'Conclusion : Strong level of SOC in Nursing assistant student , are related to a greater motivation to study something desirable , and to obtaining high academic performance , despite being a demanding and high-stress profession .', 'Therefore , a strong SOC seems to contribute to being more resistant to stress .', 'The environment that provide and facilitate greater external resource such as health , education , culture , association , leisure and recreation , for the community , have higher global level of sense of coherence .', 'Organizational value in general practice and public involvement : Case study in an urban district .', 'A multiple case study design was used to explore dimension of organizational value in general practice with respect to developing public involvement .', 'The study was undertaken in an urban district in England with data collected through in-depth individual and focus group interview with service provider and service user .', 'Four general practice organization were randomly selected for study after sorting all in the district according to their record of developing involvement activity .', 'The case study provide evidence of how organizational value can differ markedly in general practice in relation to idea of public involvement , with consequence for the quantity and quality of activity for involving local people and service user .', 'The difference manifest themselves in the belief and attitude of service provider about the purpose of the organization and the type of relationship that are appropriate with service user and local people .', 'Service user appear to be very perceptive to the underlying ethos and purpose to their practice organization and this affects their responsiveness to initiative for their involvement .', 'The dimension of the different value found in the study appear to be essentially the same as a number of established empirical finding of variation in value in general practice : an orientation to a narrow medical role and to general practice as a business are associated with a low valuation of involvement ; an orientation to teamwork and to a broader social role appear more congruent with the development of involvement .', 'Power is a critical issue in this setting with evidence in the study of the dominance of the medical practitioner in establishing organizational value and the nature of public involvement activity .', "Understanding rural caregiver ' experience of cancer care when accessing metropolitan cancer service : A qualitative study .", 'Objective To explore the experience of cancer caregiver who live in rural Australia and travel to a metropolitan cancer health service to access cancer treatment .', 'Design A qualitative study using semistructured , audio-recorded interview conducted between December 2017 and July 2018 with caregiver and social worker .', "Thematic analysis using interpretative descriptive technique performed on textual interview data within a critical realist paradigm to develop understanding of rural caregiver ' lived experience .", 'Setting Participant were from rural area attending a metropolitan cancer centre in Australia and social worker .', 'Participant 21 caregiver ( 16 female ) of people with cancer living in rural Australia within a minimum distance of 100 km from the metropolitan cancer centre where they access treatment , and five social worker employed at a metropolitan cancer service with experience of working with rural patient and caregiver .', 'Result Thematic analysis developed two overarching theme : theme 1 : caregiving in the rural setting describes the unique circumstance in which caregiving for a person with cancer takes place in the rural setting at considerable distance from the cancer service where the person receives treatment .', "This is explored in three category : Rural community and culture ' , Life adjustment ' and Available support ' .", "Theme 2 : accessing metropolitan cancer service captures the multiplicity of task and challenge involved in organising and coordinating the journey to access cancer treatment in a metropolitan hospital , which is presented in the following category : Travel ' , Accommodation ' and Health system navigation ' .", 'Conclusion Caregiver who live in rural area face significant challenge when confronting geographic isolation between their rural home environment and the metropolitan setting , where the patient accessed cancer treatment .', 'There is a need for healthcare service to identify this group to develop feasible and sustainable way to provide intervention that have the best chance of assisting rural caregiver in supporting the patient while maintaining their own health and well-being .', 'The culture of condom : Culturally grounded variable and their association with attitude to condom .', 'Objective : To examine attitude toward condom and their association with culturally grounded beliefs among young South African adult .', 'Method : A questionnaire survey undertaken in three different location ( urban , rural , and mixed ) , including 1100 participant , and implementing both a cross-validational and a bootstrap multivariate design .', 'Outcome measure were intention to use a condom at next sex and condom salience ( i.e.', ', confidence in the protective value of condom ) .', 'Culturally grounded predictor included traditional belief about illness , beliefs in ancestral protection , endorsement of AIDS myth , and mortality salience ( CONTACT ) .', 'Result : Participant exhibited strong endorsement of indigenous belief about illness and ancestral protection , and moderate endorsement of AIDS myth .', 'Participant who viewed condom as important for HIV prevention were more likely to show strong endorsement of both belief in ancestral protection and traditional belief about illness .', 'Participant who strongly endorsed AIDS myth viewed condom as less important and also had lower intention to use score .', 'Finally , participant who knew HIV positive people , and/or people who had died of HIV-related illness , had higher condom salience and higher intention to use score .', 'Conclusion : Result challenge the assumption that culturally grounded variable are inherently adversarial in their relationship to biomedical model of HIV prevention , and offer insight into how traditional beliefs and cultural construction of HIV/AIDS might be used more effectively in HIV education program .', 'Effect of national culture on BMI : A multilevel analysis of 53 country .', 'Background : To investigate the association between national culture and national BMI in 53 low-middle- and high-income country .', 'Method : Data from World Health Survey conducted in 2002-2004 in low-middle- and high-income country were used .', 'Participant aged 18 year and over were selected using multistage , stratified cluster sampling .', 'BMI was used as an outcome variable .', "Culture of the country was measured using Hofstede 's cultural dimension : Uncertainty avoidance , individualism , Power Distance and masculinity .", "The potential determinant of individual-level BMI were participant ' sex , age , marital status , education , occupation as well as household-wealth and location ( rural/urban ) at the individual-level .", "The country-level factor used were average national income ( GNI-PPP ) , income inequality ( Gini-index ) and Hofstede 's cultural dimension .", 'A two-level random-intercepts and fixed-slopes model structure with individual nested within country were fitted , treating BMI as a continuous outcome variable .', 'Result : A sample of 156,192 people from 53 country was included in this analysis .', 'The design-based ( weighted ) mean BMI ( SE ) in these 53 country was 23.95 ( 0.08 ) .', 'Uncertainty avoidance ( UAI ) and individualism ( IDV ) were significantly associated with BMI , showing that people in more individualistic or high uncertainty avoidance country had higher BMI than collectivist or low uncertainty avoidance one .', 'This model explained that one unit increase in UAI or IDV was associated with 0.03 unit increase in BMI .', 'Power distance and masculinity were not associated with BMI of the people .', 'National level Income was also significantly associated with individual-level BMI .', 'Conclusion : National culture has a substantial association with BMI of the individual in the country .', 'This association is important for understanding the pattern of obesity or overweight across different culture and country .', 'It is also important to recognise the importance of the association of culture and BMI in developing public health intervention to reduce obesity or overweight .', 'Whitewashing indigenous water right in Canada : How can we indigenize climate change adaptation if we ignore the fundamental ?', '.', 'Climate change is a global reality , with its associated impact largely manifesting through irregularity related to the water cycle ( Lemmen et al.', ', 2008 ) .', 'Climate study worldwide indicate that our rapidly changing environmental condition are expected to alter precipitation quantity , intensity , frequency and duration as well as decrease water runoff and groundwater and increase water temperature , which will subsequently increase the risk of waterborne pathogen in drinking water reservoirs ( de Loë and Plummer , 2010 ; Harper et al.', ', 2011 ) .', 'Drinking water quality and contamination of water - from source to tap - with pathogen ( e.g .', 'bacteria ) , agricultural pesticide , sewage and waste effluent and algal growth and production as a result of climatic change are also raising national and international concern ( Delpla et al.', ', 2009 ) .', 'Canada is not exempt from these irregularity or concern ; adverse change in Canada ’ s water resource , including ocean , stream , wetland and river and their impact on the human and natural landscape are evident and unsettling ( Lemmen et al.', ', 2008 ; Egginton et al.', ', 2011 ) .', 'While climate change adaptation and mitigation strategy are imperative , Canada is experiencing considerable challenge in term of the identification of such strategy and their operationalization , especially among pocket of the population who are already particularly vulnerable through , for example , poverty , unemployment , loss of traditional culture , substandard education system and inadequate health care .', 'This vulnerability includes many Indigenous ( First Nations , Inuit and Metis ) 1 people in Canada given that they have been subjected to colonial and racist policy and practice for generation , which have resulted in living condition akin to those in developing country ( Ford et al.', ', 2010 ) .', 'Broken promises associated with historic Treaty and land/water right , loss of control over natural resource , poverty , unemployment , loss of traditional language and culture as a result of the abuse at residential schools,2 substandard education system and inadequate health care are only some of the injustice that Indigenous people in Canada face today ( Miller , 1991 ; Fournier and Crey , 1997 ; Castleden , 2007 ) .', 'With respect to Indigenous people ’ distinct relationship to the land and water found within their traditional territory , ‘ whether by conscious design or institutional neglect , … [ they ] face some of the worst environmental devastation in the nation ’ ( Mascarenhas , 2007 , p. 570 , citing Robert Bullard , an internationally recognized expert in environmental racism ) .', 'As a result of this colonized reality , many Indigenous community in Canada are especially vulnerable to ( and often have limited financial and resource capacity to ) not only absorbing the shock from rapidly changing anthropogenic environmental condition but also to effectively manage their water and other natural resource as a result of said change ( Bergkamp et al.', ', 2003 ; Furgal and Seguin , 2006 ; Harper et al.', ', 2012 ) .', 'Indigenous people , especially those living in rural , remote , coastal and northern part of Canada ( roughly 50 per cent of the Indigenous population ) ( Figure 11.1 ) , are experiencing the greatest impact of and are more susceptible to the negative impact of climate change than their non-Indigenous counterpart ( Ford et al.', ', 2010 ; Cunsolo Willox et al.', ', 2012 ) .', 'This is generally attributed to the fact that they are more often natural resource-dependent and more closely connected to the land and water than non-Indigenous people who are now overwhelmingly ( 80 per cent ) located in urban area .', 'At the same time , according to the 2011 National Household Survey , approximately 1.4 million people in Canada ( 4.3 per cent of the Canadian population ) identify as Indigenous ( Statistics Canada , 2013 ) ; this figure is approximately 20 per cent more than what was tracked in the 2006 census , making Indigenous people in Canada the fastest growing and youngest in the country - a stark contrast to the national population , which is ageing and urbanizing .', 'The lived experience of many Indigenous people , subjected to decade of gross environmental and social injustice and health inequity - and now emerging climatic pressure - warrant national and international attention and viable action ; but any action taken must be on their term .', 'This chapter offers an overview of the history of colonization in Canada , including Indigenous Title to land , Indigenous Rights ( specifically water right ) and Treaties in order to illustrate the complexity of Indigenous-settler relation as just one of the many barrier facing Indigenous people with respect to adaptive capacity in a changing climate .', 'Collaborative and selfgovernment in Canada is also touched on with respect to managing water resource in the context of climate change .', 'To illustrate this , we profile a case study demonstrating the potential of Indigenous grassroots initiative , such as community-based water resource management , as a high impact strategy for increasing adaptive capacity regarding climate change effect ; such community-based approach seek to ensure a healthy environment , social equity and viable livelihood ( Armitage , 2005 ) .', 'The chapter concludes with a call for more collaboration among such water resource monitoring and management organization in an effort to mobilize local , regional and national agenda focused on water right and equity in the context of our rapidly changing climate .', 'A point prevalence study of alcoholism and mental illness among downtown migrant .', "Since the 1960s the bulk of America 's mentally ill have been deinstitutionalized to the community .", 'A number of these people now live in the downtown area of large city in close association with the established vagrant culture which includes a significant portion of alcohol abuser .', 'The bizarre and impoverished nature of the life of these formerly institutionalized mentally ill citizen , coupled with their propinquity to government and business establishment , creates a social policy dilemma .', 'A point prevalence study design was used to ascertain the demographic , physical , mental illness and alcohol abuse characteristic of a sample of a vagrant population which inhabits the downtown area of an American Northwest urban community .', 'Analysis of the data of a sample of vagrant who frequent an emergency shelter and a single residence occupancy hotel demonstrated that the two group were similar .', 'Participant were predominantly male , white and in their mid thirty .', 'Forty percent had never married and over 50 % were high school educated and possess labor skill .', 'Grouped data indicates that , in view of the dearth of literature describing the relationship of mentally illness and alcohol abuse , the psychiatric and alcohol use behavior of deinstitutionalized population requires further study .', "Using Q-methodology to identify rural woman 's viewpoint on succession of family farm .", 'In the world , the majority of farm are family-based .', 'However , migration of young people from rural to urban area , and a lack of farm successor negatively impact on the continuity of family farming .', 'The pattern of migration is unbalanced in term of gender : woman are more likely to leave rural area than men , which has negative consequence for rural development .', "The objective of this study was to identify rural woman 's viewpoint about the element that would facilitate them to eventually take over the family farm .", "Q-methodology was used to identify rural woman 's viewpoint .", 'Data were collected individually from 28 woman , face-to-face with each woman , using a transportable board game to enable friendlier dynamic .', "Our finding showed five woman 's viewpoint : rural attractiveness , family support , recognition , working and living condition , and financial autonomy .", 'The identification of these different viewpoint could provide insight that can be used to design public and private intervention aimed to favor female heir to take over the family farm .', 'Culture , consent and confidentiality in workplace autoethnography .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to examine the author ’ s experience as a school teacher and a lesbian .', 'It considers the culture and discourse of power in the school and the ethical implication of telling the author ’ s story .', 'Utilizing autoethnography as a method of inquiry , it draws on a critical incident to explore the incompatibility of the author ’ s private and professional identity , and reflect on the impact of homophobic and heteronormative discursive practice in the workplace , on health , well-being and identity .', 'Design/methodology/approach : This research is grounded in an interpretivist philosophy .', 'It utilizes writing about the self as a method of inquiry .', 'Finding : This research examines the incompatibility of the author ’ s private and professional identity and offer insight into the step that those in position of power will take to protect and perpetuate the heteronormative discourse of rural life .', 'Research limitations/implications : This research presents the perspective of only one lesbian teacher in a rural context .', 'Consequently , generalization are inappropriate and recommendation are difficult .', 'Whilst the absence of clear ethical regulation presents an infinite number of possibility for autoethnographers , the silence that surrounds the prescription of the ethic of autoethnography leaf those of us at the beginning of our research career without clear guidance .', 'Originality/value : This research specifically addresses a dearth of research examining the experience of the rural lesbian ( or gay ) teacher in the UK .', 'Headteachers of rural school must ensure that their school are inclusive and welcoming environment for teacher , and their equality policy are living document that are not simply cast aside in the face of rural parent power .', 'Young people in the countryside deserve access to the full pool of teaching talent and should have access to the diverse role model that their urban and suburban counterpart are beginning to enjoy .', 'Preventing first time homelessness amongst older Australians .', "This study examines older people 's homelessness in Australia , with a particular focus on the experience of becoming homeless for the first time in later life .", "The study seeks to gain a national understanding of older people 's homelessness and to inform prevention strategy by drawing on intervention undertaken in a range of geographically and socially diverse location across Australia .", 'The research is partnered with Assistance with Care and Housing for the Aged ( ACHA ) agency throughout Australia .', 'This program , currently funded through the federal Department of Social Services ( previously funded by the Department of Health and Ageing ) and operating through community and government agency , is purposively designed to assist disadvantaged older people who are at risk of homelessness or are homeless .', 'It aims to facilitate their ongoing independence within the community by facilitating access to appropriate and affordable housing and by linking older people where appropriate to community care and support service .', 'This practice model corresponds strongly to contemporary homelessness prevention practice .', 'The paradigm of housing alongside appropriate support underpins the ACHA program and thus provides not only a specialised focus on vulnerable older people but also a link with contemporary homelessness initiative .', "There has been longstanding criticism of a lack of attention to older people 's homelessness .", 'However , in Australia there has been increasing recognition of this distinctive form of social exclusion .', "Leading on from recommendation in the Australian Government 's 'White Paper ' on homelessness ( FaHCSIA 2008 ) , legislative change to the Aged Care Act 1997 identify older people experiencing homelessness or at risk of becoming homeless ( Part 2.2 , Section 11-3 ) as a special need group that receive priority access to residential aged care .", 'In addition , there has been funding of specialised aged care facility that provide care for formerly homeless people who have complex health need .', 'Of particular importance is the acknowledgement of homelessness in the aged care reform package , Living longer .', 'Living better .', '( DoHA 2012 ) , which has resulted in increased funding for outreach service to older people in housing crisis in rural area .', 'This initiative signal a clear recognition that housing is an aged care issue .', "Historically , with the exception of the small ACHA program , Australia 's housing and ageing portfolio have operated separately .", 'There have been consistent call by gerontologist that housing and ageing policy need to be coupled .', 'The homelessness policy attention has largely focused on older people who live with a range of complex care needs linked to their homeless history where independent housing is not seen as appropriate .', 'There is also a clear need to consider older people experiencing homelessness for the first time in their later year in the policy arena .', 'Notwithstanding the significant and growing number of older people experiencing either first time homelessness or housing crisis in later life , there is little empirical evidence about the nature of the problem in Australia and the driver of first time homelessness among older people nationally .', 'In the absence of a national evidence base there are limitation in the capacity to achieve homelessness prevention objective for this group .', 'Research aims : This study aims to contribute to the evidence base about homelessness prevention for older people experiencing homelessness or housing crisis in later life .', "Building on the existing evidence drawn primarily from Australia 's two largest capital city , Sydney and Melbourne , this study examines older people 's homelessness and preventive strategy in geographically , culturally and economically diverse area of Australia .", 'It draws on new empirical material gathered in five Australian state and across 31 agency working with older people in housing need .', "Specifically , the study undertook to : → Review Australia 's knowledge of older people 's homelessness in the context of international literature .", 'Consideration of the research literature in Australia and other western country provides an understanding not only of the living circumstance of vulnerable older people but also the distinctive characteristic of homelessness as it is experienced by older people .', 'In particular , the pattern of long-term and first time homelessness is highlighted as a theme in the literature .', '→ Consider insight from gerontology .', "In particular , the framework of life course theory-our rich knowledge of the role of home and place and their integral nature to older people 's wellbeing , and agency or the purposive action of older people in managing their lives-are discussed .", "This discussion seeks to build recognition of older people 's homelessness within gerontology .", "Social gerontology is rich in understanding of older people 's living environment and the circumstance of older people experiencing disadvantage and deprivation .", 'These insight are important to homelessness scholarship and provide important conceptual guidance .', 'This discussion is then linked to homelessness prevention .', 'It is argued that homelessness prevention needs to be tailored to the diverse and complex nature of exclusion as it is experienced by older Australian .', "→ Empirically seek an understanding of older people 's homelessness across a range of locale in Australia .", 'In partnership with ACHA agency the research involved two phase data-mining and semi-structured interview .', 'Client record were mined for three month at the end of 2012 providing quantitative and qualitative data on 561 older people in housing crisis .', 'The material gained included demographic data , housing history , critical housing incident and living arrangement .', 'In conjunction , interview with 20 ACHA worker and stakeholder were undertaken .', 'The interview sought to gain a rich understanding of the circumstance in different locale and housing market contexts , and consider issue such as culture , gender and access to service .', 'The project was exploratory in nature .', 'The analysis of the data was conducted utilising the gerontological and homelessness prevention framework outlined above .', "→ Provide a detailed analysis of the nature of older people 's homelessness .", 'This was an iterative process utilising the quantitative and qualitative data with the aim of outlining pathway into homelessness in later life .', 'This provides a useful framework for policy and planning process .', "In addition the empirical research involved gaining insight into the intervention strategy utilised to address older people 's homelessness .", 'Prevention was a particular focus of this analysis .', 'This research project , with its multiple foci , draws on a large amount of individual client case record and insight from interview with professional skilled in working with vulnerable older people in housing crisis .', 'It provides a rich and illuminating understanding of homelessness for older Australian .', 'The inclusion of urban , rural and remote area of Australia in this study not only provides an understanding of different geography and their respective structural contexts but also encapsulates an understanding of the interplay of gender and culture .', "Key finding : Older people 's homelessness in Australia is predominately about experiencing homelessness for the first time in later year .", 'Previous research in Australia has intimated the importance of first time homelessness among older people .', 'However , these study have been small exploratory study .', "This study , the largest study to date in Australia on older people 's homelessness , confirms this distinctive pathway .", 'Pathway to homelessness The study identified three pathway into homelessness for older Australian : 1 .', 'People with a history of conventional housing .', '2 .', 'People who live with ongoing housing disruption .', '3 .', 'People with a transient housing history .', 'Each pathway has distinctive characteristic and is easily identifiable .', 'Within each pathway there is diversity of experience .', 'While this study is primarily concerned with first time homelessness it is considered important to outline and understand all later life homelessness event in Australia so that we can form a clear picture .', 'The focus of the study was people with a conventional housing history who presented to ACHA with a range of critical housing incident .', 'On the whole people with a conventional housing history had been renter , mainly in the private market .', 'In order of frequency the critical incident were grouped as : → Being served a Notice to Vacate ( NTV ) .', '→ Being unable to continue living with family .', '→ Lack of affordable housing option .', '→ Inaccessible housing design making it unsafe to continue residency .', '→ Breakdown in a relationship .', 'The impact of a breakdown in intergenerational housing arrangement and resulting homelessness risk for older people is an important finding in this study .', 'Older people face a housing crisis when they are unable to continue living with family due to carer stress , overcrowding , tension and breakdown and , in a small number of case , elder abuse .', "The inability of Australia 's housing , particularly the private rental market , to facilitate older people ageing in place was another significant finding .", 'Physical access issue were a dominant reason for older people to be in housing crisis .', 'Notice to Vacate ( NTV ) and lack of affordability were also common critical housing incident .', 'This latter finding reinforces our understanding of the deprivation and vulnerability older people reliant on the pension experience while managing private rental payment .', 'In addition , this finding highlights the need to consider accessibility as part of the provision of affordable housing in Australia .', 'The other pathway identified in the study , both with very distinct characteristic , relate to ongoing housing disruption and transience .', 'Health care experience and birth outcome : Result of an Aboriginal birth cohort .', 'Objective : The aim of this study was to investigate the relationship between perceived discrimination in perinatal care and birth outcome of woman giving birth to an Aboriginal baby in South Australia using method designed to respect Aboriginal culture and community .', 'Design and setting : Population-based study of woman giving birth to Aboriginal infant in South Australia , July 2011–June 2013 .', 'Woman completed a structured questionnaire with an Aboriginal researcher .', 'Study measure include : standardised measure of perceived discrimination in perinatal care ; maternal smoking , cannabis use and exposure to stressful event and social health issue ; infant birthweight and gestation .', 'Participant : 344 woman ( mean age 25 , range 15–43 year ) living in urban , regional and remote area of South Australia .', 'Result : Half of woman ( 51 % ) perceived that they had experienced discrimination or unfair treatment by hospital or health service providing care during pregnancy and soon after childbirth .', 'Woman experiencing three or more stressful event or social health issue were more likely to perceive that care was discriminatory or unfair .', 'Aboriginal woman who perceived that they had experienced discrimination in perinatal care were more likely to have a baby with a low birthweight ( Adj Odds Ratio 1.9 , 95 % CI 1.0–3.8 ) or small for gestational age ( Adj Odds Ratio 1.9 , 95 % CI 1.0–3.5 ) , adjusting for parity , smoking and cannabis use .', 'Conclusion : The study provides evidence of the ‘ inverse care law ’ .', 'Aboriginal woman most at risk of poor infant health outcome were the least likely to perceive that they received care well matched to their need .', 'Building stronger evidence about what works to create cultural safety in perinatal health care is an urgent priority .', 'Transmission of tuberculosis and predictor of large cluster within three year in an urban setting in Tokyo , Japan : A population-based molecular epidemiological study .', 'Objective Molecular epidemiology is a promising tool for understanding tuberculosis transmission dynamic but has not been sufficiently utilised in Asian country including Japan .', 'The aim of this study was to estimate the proportion of TB case attributable to recent transmission and to identify risk factor of genotype clustering and the development of large cluster within 3 year in an urban setting in Japan .', 'Design and setting Long-term cross-sectional observational study combining the characteristic of patient with culture-positive TB notified in Shinjuku City , Tokyo ( 2002-2013 ) , with genotype data of Mycobacterium tuberculosis .', 'Primary outcome measure Genotype clustering rate and association between genotype clustering status and explanatory variable .', 'Result Among 1025 case , 515 were localised within 113 genotype cluster .', 'The overall clustering rate was 39.2 % .', 'Significantly higher rate were found in patient aged < 40 year ( adjusted odds ratio ( aOR ) =1.73 , 95 % CI 1.23 to 2.44 ) , native Japanese individual ( aOR=3.90 , 95 % CI 2.27 to 6.72 ) , full-time worker ( aOR=1.63 , 95 % CI 1.17 to 2.27 ) , part-time/daily worker ( aOR=2.20 , 95 % CI 1.35 to 3.58 ) , individual receiving public assistance ( aOR=1.81 , 95 % CI 1.15 to 2.84 ) and homeless people ( aOR=1.63 , 95 % CI 1.02 to 2.62 ) .', 'A significant predictor of large genotype cluster within 3 year was a registration interval ≤2 month between the first two case in a cluster .', 'Conclusion Our result indicated that a large proportion of patient with culture-positive TB were involved in the recent TB transmission chain .', 'Foreign-born person still have a limited impact on transmission in the Japanese urban setting .', 'Intensified public health intervention , including the active case finding , need to focus on individual with socioeconomic risk factor that are significantly associated with tuberculosis transmission and cluster with shorter registration interval between the first two case .', 'Illness concept among people with epilepsy and their caregiver and preferred treatment method in a suburban community in Southeast Nigeria [ Concept de la maladie parmi des personnes présentant une epilepsie et leurs soignants et le modality thérapeutiques préférées dans une communauté semi urbaine du sud-est du Nigeria ] .', 'BACKGROUND : Epilepsy , one of the world ’ s most prevalent chronic disease is still regarded as a supernatural disease in many part of the world .', 'These superstitious and cultural belief tend to influence treatment seeking behavior of people living with epilepsy ( PWE ) and their caregiver .', 'STUDY DESIGN : People living with epilepsy in a semi-urban community in Southeast Nigeria were identified in a two phase door-to-door cross-sectional descriptive study .', 'Those identified and their caregiver were further interviewed to determine their concept of the disease , their treatment ( actual and preferred ) and what informed treatment .', 'Result : We found 29 case of active epilepsy , 16 ( 55.2 % ) male and 13 ( 44.8 % ) female .', 'Witchcraft was held as a major cause of epilepsy in the community accounting for 36.2 % ( n=17 ) of the response .', 'The three major treatment modality used were spiritual ( healing church ) , traditional ( herbal medicine ) and orthodox treatment with antiepileptic drug .', 'Spiritual treatment was the preferred treatment modality , though most ( 89.7 % ) have used traditional ( herbal medicine ) treatment at one point in the course of the disease .', 'Belief on epilepsy and information on the disease obtained mostly from non-medical source informed treatment .', 'CONCLUSION : The epileptic population studied preferred spiritual treatment though use of traditional treatment was also common .', 'Treatment seeking behavior was greatly influenced by their belief and information on the disease obtained mainly from non-medical source .', 'Research method with gay , lesbian , bisexual , and transgender population .', "Take an in-depth look at what works-and what doesn't-in research with GLBT population !", 'This essential book examines the usefulness of current framework for research with GLBT population and highlight the necessity for greater complexity in the conceptualization and design of research with these population .', 'It will help you understand the need for more inclusive and representative sample and the need to protect the privacy of GLBT research participants-and way to accomplish these goal .', "In addition , Research Methods with Gay , Lesbian , Bisexual , and Transgender Populations considers the advantage and limitation of having an `` inside '' perspective when conducting research with these population .", 'It also explores the myriad way in which this research can be used to better understand issue facing GLBT community .', "Specifically , Research Methods with Gay , Lesbian , Bisexual , and Transgender Populations discusses : • eight strategy that `` outsider '' can use to overcome barrier to doing their work • the challenge of finding and studying older member of gay and lesbian community • the special challenge that studying gay drug user pose to the researcher • factor affecting research with urban Black and African-American GLBT population • sampling issue , including way to overcome the challenge of conducting research with sexual minority adolescent , issue related to dealing with institutional review board , and lesson derived from empirical article in the Journal of Gay & Lesbian Social Services • unique feature of AIDS service organization to consider when developing an evaluation strategy • ethical standard for research and evaluation with GLBT population • and a great deal more !", "From the Foreword , by Anthony R. D'Augelli : `` In social science research , the effort to extract durable principle of social causality from the apparent randomness of everyday life requires the construction of reliable , if tentative , knowledge that is significantly more informative than mere speculation .", 'With our ever-increasing knowledge base , increasingly sophisticated and powerful quantitative and qualitative methodology , and with an ever-expanding cadre of researcher , our ability to discern pattern of development of GLBT people from birth to death , the unique quality of their relationship , and the impact of community and culture on the way in which their sexuality are manifested , will come into sharper focus .', 'In this way , research becomes a tool by which GLBT people transcend invisibility and marginalization .', 'As new research accumulates , the unique contribution that GLBT life make to our understanding of the nature of human development will be documented in way never before thought possible .', '`` Within the larger context of social science research on GLBT population , this book describes the current status of social service researcher in their quest for methodological sophistication and conceptual complexity .', "The work of the contributor to this volume exemplifies the progress that has been made since the first research report on this topic were published . ''", 'Turin 1984-1994 : Ten year of experience in pharmacoepidemiology [ Una citta italiana laboratorio per dieci anni di farmacoepidemiologia : Torino 1984-1994 ] .', "In coincidence with the official beginning of pharmacoepidemiology as a new discipline , in 1984 , and in parallel with its ever increasing development , an experience started in Turin , whose subsequent development took the form of a veritable 'urban laboratory of pharmacoepidemiology ' ( ULP ) .", "The story of this uninterrupted research can be seen as an 'in vivo review ' of how , instrument and method above all , are developing ; in accordance with the cultural project of a team which sees in its role , within the National Health Service ( NHS ) , a privileged place - although it is not always easy - for developing new research design .", 'Starting from a descriptive perspective , study for special population ( such as elderly people , child , etc . )', "and then ad hoc study ( on pregnancy , on 'very old people ' , etc . )", 'began to develop , and their result have been described in a series of article ( available on request ) .', "The main reason for a strongly participative research is to translate every result into an experience of dialogue with the different interlocators involved ( physician , chemist , citizen 's group ... ) .", 'The individual result obtained , are more originally meaningful taken as a whole for the different project related to a single story in which the culture of drug , and its rationale use , along with an epidemiological and evaluative frame of mind , has entered ( thanks to its duration in time and to a diversification of strategy and interlocators ) the everyday practice and the concreteness of a real society .', 'Communication and education as vaccine against the spread of acquired immune deficiency syndrome ( AIDS ) in Africa ..', 'Attention is focused on the segmentation of the audience ( urban , rural , urban slum ) and message , and on how appropriate communication and educational strategy can be adopted to create awareness of AIDS among the African population .', 'It is important to determine the scope , nature , and content of the message in addition to the delivery of these message through proper channel .', 'Channel of communication vary in reach and influence , and different segment of the population vary in the capacity to absorb information .', 'Rural people are considered susceptible because of their penchant for continually using injection for treatment of any ailment ; the source of concern is unsterilized needle and syrinx .', 'The semantics of AIDs is discussed to emphasize the problem of how to identify AIDs among the multiplicity of language in individual country .', 'For instance , in Nigeria there may be 150-400 language , and these language lack systematically developed metalanguage and specialized vocabulary .', 'The view that local language use must be one way , linear is accepted , and the difficulty surmounted .', 'Local language may be used to transmit information of a nontechnical nature .', 'The literate minority should have access to detailed information on cause , mode of transmission , symptom , treatment or management , but not everyone needs this extent of detail .', 'The rural and urban resident should know about the incurability of the disease , the mode of transmission , its symptom , and what should be done if someone is suspected of having an HIV infection .', 'Already the Hausa of Nigeria have a term for AIDs , Karya-Garkuwa , which suggests a disease that breaks down the mechanism of the biological functioning of the body .', 'Communicator must be knowledgeable and able to effectively transmit fact not myth .', 'Of the 3 mode of transmission ( sex , blood , mother to child ) , sexual transmission is the most important .', 'Blood route are through transfusion , contaminated blood product for hemophilia patient , contaminated needle and syrinx of intravenous drug user , unsterilized needle and syrinx used for medical treatment , knife for circumcision or body marking , razor blade in barber shop , and toothbrush .', 'All medium should be used as well as community based informal and political channel .', 'Traditional communication mode in rural area are required .', 'A multidisciplinary team of expert in modern and traditional medium and instructional communication design and operation is needed .', 'Knowledge , beliefs , attitude and perceived risk about COVID-19 vaccine and determinant of COVID-19 vaccine acceptance in Bangladesh .', 'Bangladesh govt .', 'launched a nationwide vaccination drive against SARS-CoV-2 infection from early February 2021 .', 'The objective of this study were to evaluate the acceptance of the COVID-19 vaccine and examine the factor associated with the acceptance in Bangladesh .', 'In between January 30 to February 6 , 2021 , we conducted a web-based anonymous cross-sectional survey among the Bangladeshi general population .', 'At the start of the survey , there was a detailed consent section that explained the study ’ s intent , the type of question we would ask , the anonymity of the study , and the study ’ s voluntary nature .', 'The survey only continued when a respondent consented , and the answer were provided by the respondent themselves .', 'The multivariate logistic regression was used to identify the factor that influence the acceptance of the COVID-19 vaccination .', 'A total of 605 eligible respondent took part in this survey ( population size 1630046161 and required sample size 591 ) with an age range of 18 to 100 .', 'A large proportion of the respondent are aged less than 50 ( 82 % ) and male ( 62.15 % ) .', 'The majority of the respondent live in urban area ( 60.83 % ) .', 'A total of 61.16 % ( 370/605 ) of the respondent were willing to accept/take the COVID-19 vaccine .', 'Among the accepted group , only 35.14 % showed the willingness to take the COVID-19 vaccine immediately , while 64.86 % would delay the vaccination until they are confirmed about the vaccine ’ s efficacy and safety or COVID-19 becomes deadlier in Bangladesh .', 'The regression result showed age , gender , location ( urban/rural ) , level of education , income , perceived risk of being infected with COVID-19 in the future , perceived severity of infection , having previous vaccination experience after age 18 , having higher knowledge about COVID-19 and vaccination were significantly associated with the acceptance of COVID-19 vaccine .', 'The research reported a high prevalence of COVID-19 vaccine refusal and hesitancy in Bangladesh .', 'To diminish the vaccine hesitancy and increase the uptake , the policymakers need to design a well-researched immunization strategy to remove the vaccination barrier .', 'To improve vaccine acceptance among people , false rumor and misconception about the COVID-19 vaccine must be dispelled ( especially on the internet ) and people must be exposed to the actual scientific fact .', 'This is an open access article distributed under the term of the Creative Commons Attribution License , which permits unrestricted use , distribution , and reproduction in any medium , provided the original author and source are credited .', 'Exploring the behavioral determinant of COVID-19 vaccine acceptance among an urban population in Bangladesh : Implication for behavior change intervention .', 'Background While vaccine ensure individual protection against COVID-19 infection , delay in receipt or refusal of vaccine will have both individual and community impact .', 'The behavioral factor of vaccine hesitancy or refusal are a crucial dimension that need to be understood in order to design appropriate intervention .', 'The aim of this study was to explore the behavioral determinant of COVID-19 vaccine acceptance and to provide recommendation to increase the acceptance and uptake of COVID-19 vaccine in Bangladesh .', 'Method We employed a Barrier Analysis ( BA ) approach to examine twelve potential behavioral determinant ( drawn from the Health Belief Model [ HBM ] and Theory of Reasoned Action [ TRA ] ) of intended vaccine acceptance .', 'We conducted 45 interview with those who intended to take the vaccine ( Acceptors ) and another 45 interview with those who did not have that intention ( Non-acceptors ) .', 'We performed data analysis to find statistically significant difference and to identify which belief were most highly associated with acceptance and non-acceptance with COVID-19 vaccine .', 'Results The behavioral determinant associated with COVID-19 vaccine acceptance in Dhaka included perceived social norm , perceived safety of COVID-19 vaccine and trust in them , perceived risk/susceptibility , perceived self-efficacy , perceived positive and negative consequence , perceived action efficacy , perceived severity of COVID-19 , access , and perceived divine will .', 'In line with the HBM , beliefs about the disease itself were highly predictive of vaccine acceptance , and some of the strongest statistically-significant ( p < 0.001 ) predictor of vaccine acceptance in this population are beliefs around both injunctive and descriptive social norm .', 'Specifically , Acceptor were 3.2 time more likely to say they would be very likely to get a COVID-19 vaccine if a doctor or nurse recommended it , twice as likely to say that most people they know will get a vaccine , and 1.3 time more likely to say that most close family and friend will get a vaccine .', "The perceived safety of vaccine was found to be important since Non-acceptors were 1.8 time more likely to say that COVID-19 vaccine are `` not safe at all '' .", "Belief about one 's risk of getting COVID-19 disease and the severity of it were predictive of being a vaccine acceptor : Acceptor were 1.4 time more likely to say that it was very likely that someone in their household would get COVID-19 , 1.3 time more likely to say that they were very concerned about getting COVID-19 , and 1.3 time more likely to say that it would be very serious if someone in their household contracted COVID- 19 .", 'Other response of Acceptor on what makes immunization easier may be helpful in programming to boost acceptance , such as providing vaccination through government health facility , school , and kiosk , and having vaccinator maintain proper COVID-19 health and safety protocol .', 'Conclusion An effective behavior change strategy for COVID-19 vaccine uptake will need to address multiple belief and behavioral determinant , reducing barrier and leveraging enablers identified in this study .', 'National plan for promoting COVID-19 vaccination should address the barrier , enablers , and behavioral determinant found in this study in order to maximize the impact on COVID-19 vaccination acceptance .', 'This is an open access article distributed under the term of the Creative Commons Attribution License , which permits unrestricted use , distribution , and reproduction in any medium , provided the original author and source are credited .', 'Building a sustainable rural physician workforce .', 'Chapter 1 : Characterising Australia ’ s rural specialist physician workforce : the professional profile and professional satisfaction of junior doctor and consultant : Objective : To assess difference in the demographic characteristic , professional profile and professional satisfaction of rural and metropolitan junior physician and physician consultant in Australia .', 'Design , setting and participant : Cross-sectional , population level national survey of the Medicine in Australia : Balancing Employment and Life longitudinal cohort study ( collected 2008–2016 ) .', 'Participant were specialist physician from four career stage group : pre-registrars ( physician intent ) ; registrar ; new consultant ( < 5 year since Fellowship ) ; and consultant .', 'Main outcome measure : Level of professional satisfaction across various job aspect , such as hour worked , working condition , support network and educational opportunity , comparing rural and metropolitan based physician .', 'Result : Participant included 1587 pre-registrars ( 15 % rural ) , 1745 physician registrar ( 9 % rural ) , 421 new consultant ( 20 % rural ) and 1143 consultant ( 13 % rural ) .', 'Rural physician of all career stage demonstrated equivalent professional satisfaction across most job aspect , compared with metropolitan physician counterpart .', 'Some example of difference in satisfaction included rural pre-registrars being less likely to agree they had good access to support and supervision from qualified consultant ( odds ratio [ OR ] , 0.6 ; 95 % CI , 0.3–0.9 ) and rural consultant being more likely to agree they had a poorer professional support network ( OR , 1.9 ; 95 % CI , 1.2–2.9 ) .', 'In term of demographic , relatively more rural physician had a rural background or were trained overseas .', 'Although most junior physician were woman , female consultant were less likely to be working in a rural location ( OR , 0.6 ; 95 % CI , 0.4–0.8 ) .', 'Conclusion : Junior physician in metropolitan or rural setting have a similar professional experience , which is important in attracting future trainee .', 'Increased opportunity for rural training should be prioritised , along with addressing concern about the professional isolation and poorer support network of those in rural area , not only among junior doctor but also consultant .', 'Finally , making rural practice more attractive to female junior physician could greatly improve the consultant physician distribution .', 'Chapter 2 : General physician and paediatrician in rural Australia : the social construction of professional identity : Objective : To explore the construction of professional identity among general physician and paediatrician working in non-metropolitan area .', 'Design , setting and participant : In-depth qualitative interview were conducted with general physician and paediatrician , plus informant from specialist college , government agency and academia who were involved in policy and program for the training and recruitment of specialist in rural location across three state and two territory .', 'This research is part of the Training Pathways and Professional Support for Building a Rural Physician Workforce Study , 2018–19 .', 'Main outcome measure : Individual and collective descriptor of professional identity .', 'Result : We interviewed 36 key informant .', 'Professional identity for general physician and paediatrician working in regional , rural and remote Australia is grounded in the breadth of their training , but qualified by location — geographic location , population served or specific location , where social and cultural context specifically shapes practice .', 'General physician and paediatrician were deeply engaged with their local community and its economic vulnerability , and they described the population size and dynamic of local economy as determinant of viable practice .', 'They often complemented their practice with formal or informal training in area of special interest , but balanced their practice against subspecialist availability , also dependent on demographic .', 'While valuing their professional role , they showed limited inclination for industrial organisation .', 'Conclusion : Despite limited consensus on identity descriptor , rural general physician and paediatrician highly value generalism and their rural engagement .', 'The structural and geographic bias that preferences urban area will need to be addressed to further develop coordinated strategy for advanced training in rural contexts , for which collective identity is integral .', 'Chapter 3 : Sustainable rural physician training : leadership in a fragile environment : Objective : To understand Royal Australasian College of Physicians ( RACP ) training contexts , including supervisor and trainee perspective , and to identify contributor to the sustainability of training site , including training quality .', 'Design , setting and participant : A cross-sectional mixed-methods design was used .', 'A national sample of RACP trainee and Fellows completed online survey .', 'Survey respondent who indicated willingness to participate in interview were purposively recruited to cover perspective from a range of geographic , demographic and training context parameter .', 'Main outcome measure : Fellows ’ and trainee ’ work and life satisfaction , and their experience of supervision and training , respectively , by geographic location .', 'Result : Fellows and trainee reported high level of satisfaction , with one exception — inner regional Fellows reported lower satisfaction regarding opportunity to use their ability .', 'Not having a good support network was associated with lower satisfaction .', 'Our qualitative finding indicate that a culture of undermining rural practice is prevalent and that good leadership at all level is important to reduce negative impact on supervisor and trainee availability , site accreditation and viability .', 'Trainee described challenge in navigating training pathway , ensuring career development , and having the flexibility to meet family need .', 'The small number of Fellows in some site pose challenge for supervisor and trainee and result in a blurring of role ; accreditation is an obstacle to provision of training at rural site ; and the overlap between service and training role can be difficult for supervisor .', 'Conclusion : Our qualitative finding emphasise the distinctive nature of regional specialist training , which can make it a fragile environment .', 'Leadership at all level is critical to sustaining accreditation and support for supervisor and trainee .', 'Chapter 4 : Principle to guide training and professional support for a sustainable rural specialist physician workforce : Objective : To draw on research conducted in the Building a Rural Physician Workforce project , the first national study on rural specialist physician , to define a set of principle applicable to guiding training and professional support action .', 'Design : We used element of the Delphi approach for systematic data collection and codesign , and applied a hybrid participatory action planning approach to achieve consensus on a set of principle .', 'Result : Eight interconnected foundational principle built around rural region and rural people were identified : FP1 , grow your own “ connected to ” place ; FP2 , select trainee invested in rural practice ; FP3 , ground training in community need ; FP4 , rural immersion — not exposure ; FP5 , optimise and invest in general medicine ; FP6 , include service and academic learning component ; FP7 , join up the step in rural training ; and FP8 , plan sustainable specialist role .', 'Conclusion : These eight principle can guide training and professional support to build a sustainable rural physician workforce .', 'Application of the principle , and coordinated action by stakeholder and the responsible organisation , are needed at national , state and local level to achieve a sustainable rural physician
