for example a ) space , environment , architecture , b ) everyday practice and experience .', 'c commodity and consumption .', 'Mexico City is a place where indicator of globalisation are materialised .', "The economic development of the last 30 year provoked urban transformation process , which can be recognised as an `` intensification of urban space '' and processes of `` new centrality '' .", "The architectural and ethnographic research of specific urban space provide access to both `` micro '' and `` macro '' vision of the local and the global of the metropolis .", 'In this article example of qualitative research of urban transformation in Mexico City are presented in three concrete urban space .', "Manila 's urbanism and Philippine visual culture .", 'City are site and crucible of creativity and destruction .', 'How we order and imagine ourselves is revealed by the visible form of our built environment .', 'City are the ultimate material expression of human desire and design .', 'They are also force of energy and field of tension that structure our everyday imaginings and activity .', 'How we move , think , act , interact , create and maintain our life is bounded by what city provide us .', 'How we make common-wealth and differentiate ourselves from others also determines what city are and might be for us .', 'This issue explores the urbanism that is Manila in all its vital contradiction .', 'A mega-urban region of over 20 million soul , it is both dynamic and discordant , creative and destructive .', 'Like most global mega-cities , Manila is dangerous to its own citizen – polluted , dense , violent , and poor , with inadequate and badly maintained infrastructure and public utility , but it is also a fecund incubator of cultural idea , project and network .', 'This issue explore both side of this Janus-faced city – its urbanism and its visual culture .', 'Two common thread run through the article in this issue : first is the dialectic of private and public , and second is the cultural traffic that informs place-making across time through the constant movement of people around the world-system and in the ever-pragmatic syncretic and local appropriation of cultural idea , tradition and artefact into new configuration , story and view .', 'As these contribution take issue with visual culture , we have given pride of place to photo , image and artworks experience , performance and movement of aesthetic object lodged in and across institution , tradition and collective consciousness .', 'Situationist City .', 'The avant-garde Parisian group the Situationist International ( 1957-72 ) critiqued post-war urbanization and the rise of spectacular society : reductive functionalism , government power , conservative bourgeois attitude , modernist town planning , commodity fetishism , advertising , passivized leisure , and personality cult .', 'They viewed these as facet of a broader existential problem : alienation .', 'Everyday life was characterized by boredom , predictability , and powerlessness , and lacking opportunity for creativity or adventure .', 'They believed urbanism offered great potential for emancipation and revolution .', "Their ambition was to stimulate the raising of everyday consciousness , and the ongoing development of new , unalienated way of living focused around play , through the reappropriation and recuperation of urban space , culture , politics , and technology for everyday use and to enable the expansion of people 's desire .", "They critiqued zoning , traffic planning , the banishment of Paris 's poor to the suburban periphery , and the social segregation of new town , and proposed instead unitary urbanism as an ongoing , playful , lived critique of modernist city .", 'They developed new , phenomenologically informed method for studying and mapping urban environment .', 'In their design proposal , most famously New Babylon , ambience could be adjusted and space reshaped by user to suit their changing desire or create new sensation , in a constantly evolving collective game .', 'The World Urban Forum III : Vancouver .', "`` Better information for better city ! ''", 'is the call that leads this special issue .', 'Urban indicator and performance measurement are the answer , aiming to improve local performance on key trend and contribute to solving global problem .', 'Better information , according to the rational model that predominates in urban policy , is the surest path to improve action .', 'The World Urban Forum ( WUF ) III , meeting in Vancouver in June 2006 , considers dimension , challenge , and practice in the use of urban indicator in the Vancouver region .', "Patrick Geddes , writing in the early day of the town and regional planning movement , insisted upon the value of what he called a synoptic view , `` a seeing of the city and this as a whole ; like Athens from its Acropolis '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. 6 ) .", 'Working from a synoptic view did not simply mean gazing down on the city from atop a hill .', "Geddes strove to help people express `` simultaneity '' of their own being .", "Understanding that people living in a given region have a multitude of different perspective , simultaneity of being meant `` one-ness with the social ideal , the scientific development and the physical condition of [ their ] own time and place '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. x ) .", 'He believed a region could be created and planned to aid people in accomplishing all these thing .', "As one of the forefather of town and regional planning , Geddes himself was a maker of `` great map and diagram and chart '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. xiii ) -but his most lasting contribution to the profession and practice of planning was his notion of the Civic Exhibition .", "Geddes was less concerned about expert training to make great plan and planner than he was `` concerned that the ordinary citizen should have a vision and a comprehension of the possibility of his own city '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. xi ) .", "A periodic Civic Exhibition , during which citizen could gather in a festive atmosphere to peruse plan , gaze at large map and model , discuss and interpret these publicly , was one part of Geddes 's key contribution to this goal .", "The other part was his drive to create a permanent and public centre for Civic Studies in every town in the form of an `` Outlook Tower '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. xi ) .", "The Outlook Tower was to be the `` incipient Civic Observatory and Laboratory together '' in which the Science of Cities was advanced to its proper rank amongst academic and life pursuit ( Geddes , 1949 , p. 96 ) .", "The institution Geddes sought to create placed `` its effort towards correlation of thought and action , science and practice , sociology and moral , with its watchword and endeavour of `` Civic Survey for Civic Service '' '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. 69 ) .", "Fastforward to late 2004 , when the Urban Studies Program at Simon Fraser University 's downtown campus initiated the Regional Vancouver Urban Observatory ( RVu ) , with a vision akin to that of Geddes .", "In the context of the new millennium , RVu was established as the first local observatory within UN-Habitat 's Global Urban Observatory network in a developed country .", "The Global Urban Observatory was established in 1997 to institutionalize UN-Habitat 's pioneering work in the generation and tracking of urban indicator , initiated with the Urban Indicators Programme in 1993 .", 'Following the creation of the Habitat Agenda at the Habitat II Conference in Istanbul in 1996 , the mission was set for the Global Urban Observatory-to create and maintain a Global Urban Indicators Database that would permit UN member state and their city to monitor and report on urban trend on a regular and reliable basis .', 'The Millennium Development Goals , established by UN member state in 2000 , and the indicator established for tracking these eight goal in 2003 , update the mission of the Global Urban Indicators Database ( UN-Habitat 2004 ) .', 'The MDGs represent a global compact for poverty alleviation and sustainable development , to be attained by 2015 .', "RVu 's work to date is being presented to the international community for the first time at the World Urban Forum III .", 'The work thus far has constituted both expert-based and public participatory component .', 'Expert affiliated with RVu have conducted regional and international research on urban indicator-related work , with some bearing on the Vancouver region and on specific indicator used by a range of project in the major area of urban capital : health , economy , environment , governance , culture , and infrastructure .', 'Work in progress toward these research article was presented at the first RVu public event , Focusing ouR View , in October 2005 ; and the best finished result are presented in this issue of Cities .', 'Key to the design of Rvu , and in particular its public participatory process , are presented in the first article in this issue , Urban Indicators and the Integrative Ideals of Cities , by Meg Holden .', "The paper presents the practice in progress of RVu 's stance on urban sustainability as a community-based struggle to learn , indicator as a means for long-term learning , and the role of value-based citizen participation , within a theoretical perspective .", "Sustainable development , as a framework for long-term planning , has value in the Vancouver region for its `` constructive ambiguity '' ( Robinson , 2004 , p. 374 ) , its pointer toward greater linkage among environmental , social , and economic priority , without forcing a premature set of quantitative trade-off .", 'This integrative , vague , idealistic thrust also leaves sustainable development open to clash with incremental , specific , and realist demand competing for time on the public agenda .', 'Indicator can help bridge the gap ; the article in this issue begin to explain how .', 'One article presents a bridge from the perspective of environmental economics , illustrating the complexity of measuring natural capital but also the need and precedent for this .', 'The next article presents a way of thinking about indicator of governance for sustainable development from a starting point of allocating equal value to democratic inclusion of each citizen .', 'Moving from the individual to the group , the final two article ask for greater attention to socially , culturally and demographically-specific case : new immigrant and Aboriginal people .', "Nancy Olewiler offers an economist 's perspective on the design and utility of an urban indicator project , with a particular focus on natural capital .", 'Her article , Environmental Sustainability for Urban Areas : The Role of Natural Capital Indicators , expands on one of the theme from Holden , the difference between descriptive indicator , which proliferate in policy contexts , and diagnostic indicator , which are rare .', 'Olewiler presents the Driving Force-Pressure-State-Impact-Response framework and reminds us of the need to consider different indicator at each point in the chain .', "Her treatment of natural capital indicator issue locally includes useful information on Greater Vancouver 's adjacent Fraser Valley Regional District .", 'She looks south to the city of Santa Monica , California for an example of natural capital indicator development and institutionalization .', 'Building on a theme introduced by Holden , Olewiler reminds us that indicator alone are not enough ; effective indicator are those presented in a reasoned context with a clear path to action .', 'Indicator belong at the beginning , not the end , of a good governance process .', 'The next article specifies much more clearly what might be meant by the notion of good governance .', 'In Designing Good Urban Governance Indicator : The Importance of Citizen Participation and its Evaluation in Greater Vancouver , political scientist Kennedy Stewart makes the case for inclusion of governance consideration in any definition of sustainability .', "The political aspect of sustainability is poorly developed , compared to economic , environmental , and social aspect and this article moves the thinking ahead through treatment of democratic theory , along with work on defining 'good governance ' advanced by the United Nations .", 'Stewart draws on evidence of voting pattern in the Vancouver region to raise the spectre of systematic disenfranchisement , that seems to be on the rise .', "As Canada 's only unamalgamated major metropolitan region , led by municipal appointment rather than direct election , advance in sustainable development policy made by the Greater Vancouver Regional District are at risk if voting trend can not be reversed .", 'Stewart calls for stepwise moral reasoning , based on the premise of universal equal right to rectify this wrong .', "The final two article examine the limit of belonging to the project of sustainability in the Vancouver region , from the perspective of the region 's newest resident and its ancestral resident .", 'Robert Fiedler , Nadine Schuurman and Jennifer Hyndman , in Hidden Homelessness : An Indicator - Based Approach for Examining the Geographies of Recent Immigrant At-Risk of Homelessness in Greater Vancouver , focus on the dimension of risk of homelessness amongst one particularly vulnerable group , new immigrant .', 'This investigation brings to the fore the interaction of policy , economics , and culture in explaining the complexity of homelessness and immigration trend in the region .', "Since about half of the region 's population growth in the foreseeable future will come from international immigration , and an increasing proportion of new arrival face socio-economic difficulty upon arrival , understanding these interaction is key to sustainability in a context of increasing cultural diversity and decreasing affordability of housing .", 'First Nations researcher Nathan Cardinal puts an Aboriginal lens on indicator in his concluding article , The Exclusive City : Identifying , Measuring and Drawing Attention to Aboriginal and Indigenous Experiences in an Urban Context .', 'Along with immigrant , Aboriginal group constitute fast growing demographic cultural group in British Columbia .', "Constructed fiction and everyday reality in Ralph Erskine 's Byker .", 'During a long process that went from the late 1960s until the peak of Thatcherism , British-Swedish architect Ralph Erskine designed and built a unique modern housing development in the working-class community of Byker in Newcastle .', "With a particular emphasis on citizen ' participation , the project resettled close to 12,000 people from crumbling Victorian row house into new public housing unit distributed between a meandering perimeter wall and a series of smaller-scale cluster .", "Erskine 's project proved to be distinctively flexible in adapting to significant social change during a particularly turbulent period in UK 's history .", "From the progressive deindustrialization of North England and Thatcher 's erosion of working-class culture to British city ' growing racial diversity and its complex fallout .", 'Such adaptability relates to the distinct position that Byker holds in-between two opposing architectural paradigms of the 20th Century .', 'On the one hand , the modern tradition and its ambition to produce new urban and architectural form stemming from social utopia ; on the other , the 1970s countercultural ethos and its critique to top-down modernist design culture .', "In this paper , I argue that this paradoxical nature induced Byker 's adaptability to social change .", "To get closer to the complex reality of everyday life without compromising modernity 's utopianism , Erskine produces a realist project based on an illusion .", 'A vernacular village of epic scale emerges as the impossible English incarnation of the negotiated built utopia of social democracy that he had experienced in Sweden .', 'Cultural Identity of the Cities—The Use of Narrative Design in Urban Spaces .', 'The Narrative process build history .', 'It exploits the ability of different human sensory experience to trigger the imagination , evoke emotion , and capture universal cultural truth and aspiration .', 'City need to use narrative to recreate a system of relationship between urban space and people .', 'This paper explores the narrative design strategy for urban space and proposes the “ Perception-Interaction-Make sense ” narrative design model .', 'The paper presents a case study of Iranian regional culture in the context of a workshop at Alzahra University in Tehran , Iran .', 'The work also provides a vision of data as a tool for urban narrative in the era of smart city .', 'The value of this thesis is to provide a theoretical reference for the construction of regional distinctive culture in a global context , as well as a theoretical guide for the sustainable development of urban culture in urban renewal .', 'Smart Creative Cities and Urban Regeneration Policy : Culture , Innovation , and Economy at Nexus .', 'Learning from Lyon Metropolis .', 'In 1995 , the English planner Charles Landry and Franco Bianchini published “ The Creative City ” , focusing on three intertwined topic : the cultural , social , and economic impact that arises from creativity in city ; the need to promote integrated urban planning levering on knowledge from other discipline ; and the active inclusion in urban planning process of ordinary , often marginalized people .', 'A few year later , Landry issue “ The Creative City .', 'A Toolkit for Urban Innovation ” , a book in which he challenges and further develops his idea by proposing them as a “ toolbox for urban renaissance.', '” At the beginning of the twenty-first century , the American economist Richard Florida delivers what is considered a milestone on the subject of the creative city : “ The Rise of the Creative Class ” , in which he emphasizes the characteristic of people performing creative activity in city , as well as the condition that city must offer in order for the “ creative class ” to be attracted and settle in them .', 'The Smart Creative City is a more recent concept .', 'It grew out of economic science , especially the so-called Experience Economy .', 'Regarding specifically the economic development of city , creativity , art , and culture represent strategic asset in the urban regeneration process , and the socioeconomic feature of smart creative city can be considered the most evident and critical one .', 'This study thus spring from the recognition of the relevance of smart creative city , and of an integrated and visionary planning approach to urban regeneration—itself creative .', 'This analysis has been conducted focusing on selected experience developed by Lyon metropolis , aiming at understanding whether and how the municipality is levering on creativity , art and culture within its urban regeneration programme .', 'This objective is addressed through a mixed-qualitative methodology that investigates the political discourse and adopts a descriptive case study approach to analyse policy process , driver , and obstacle that are fostering or limiting that vision in the local context of Lyon .', 'The research responds to the question posed , showing both the transformative capacity and the trade-off of explicitly integrating cultural and artistic project and event , as urban “ innovative ” regeneration device , within the “ common ” planning and design practice of the municipality of Lyon .', 'Coming to Rest : Aesthetic of Cosmopolitanism and Mobility in Marseille .', 'This article traces the history of cosmopolitanism in Marseille as well some of the major aesthetic development in its Vieux Port over the last century .', 'I consider a series of moment from the Vichy government ’ s destruction of the Vieux Port in an effort to stamp out resistance during WWII , to the transformation of La Criée aux Poissons from a fish market to a theater in the 1970s , to the recent pedestrianization of the shoreline and the construction of the Museum of European and Mediterranean Civilizations .', 'The Vieux Port ’ s aesthetic transformation have reflected prevailing sentiment about the meaning of Marseille ’ s past and its hope for the future .', 'While the recent prevalence of cosmopolitanism in Marseille ’ s year as European Capital of Culture and its urban revitalization effort is striking , the concept has been used as a narrative for the city ’ s revitalization since at least the 1970s .', 'Whereas some have argued that the space of cosmopolitanism are hyper-mobile , abstract non-spaces , I argue that Marseille ’ s cosmopolitanism is historical and linked as much to space of immobility as space of mobility .', 'Far from distancing itself from history and tradition , Marseille has incorporated its ancient past into a cosmopolitan culture-led urban renewal project .', 'Ethnographically examining pedestrian traffic around the port reveals that the space where people come to rest are as essential as the space of constant movement and flow in charting cosmopolitanism in the city .', "Alterlivability speculative design fiction and the urban good life in starhawk 's fifth sacred thing and city of refuge .", 'This article responds to two diverging notion of “ livability ” : the normative New Urbanist imaginary of livable city , where the urban good life manifest in neoliberal consumer culture , green gentrification , and inaccessible infrastructure , and the feminist and disability concept of livable world , such as those in which nonnormate life thrives .', 'Whereas the former ought to broaden its notion of “ lives worth living , ” the latter would benefit from a more specific theory of design-the making and remaking of more livable world .', 'In response , this article offers the concept of “ alterlivability , ” a design philosophy grounded in permaculture ethic .', 'Drawing on two novel by ecofeminist writer Starhawk-The Fifth Sacred Thing ( 1994 ) and City of Refuge ( 2016 ) -the article explores the genre of speculative design fiction for its insight into prototyping more livable future in the Anthropocene .', "Starhawk 's novel illustrate alterlivability as a set of political commitment , design methodology , and spatial form that place disabled , racialized , and poor people at the center of alterlivable world .", 'Creating great place : Evidence-based urban design for health and wellbeing .', 'This book provides a bold vision and roadmap for creating great place .', 'Imagining and designing urban environment where all people thrive is an extraordinary task , and in this compelling narrative , Cushing and Miller remind us that theory is a powerful starting point .', 'Drawing on international research , illustrated case study , personal experience , as well as fascinating example from history and pop culture , this practical book provides the reader with inspiration , guidance and tool .', 'The first section outline six critical theory for contemporary urban design - affordance , prospect-refuge , personal space , sense of place/genius loci , place attachment , and biophilic design .', "The second section , using their innovative 'theory-storming ' process , demonstrates how designer can create great place that are inclusive , sustainable , and salutogenic .", "Creating Great Places is an insightful , compelling , and evidence-based resource for reader who want to design urban environment that inspire , excite , and positively transform people 's life .", 'Leading change through your creative class .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to share how a professional service firm transposed Richard Florida ’ s “ Creative Class ” concept from the urban environment into a corporate one for the purpose of organisational change .', 'The validity of Florida ’ s concept is not here reviewed ; rather , the paper is a case study on how his theory – that talent , technology and tolerance compose the high-value triptych driving a city ’ s growth and attractiveness – can be appropriated by HR to trigger profound change in corporate governance and culture .', 'Design/methodology/approach : The paper provides a return on experience of a project that was implemented at Mazars , an international mid-cap of 20,000 people in 86 country , over the course of one year .', 'Approximately , 50 individual participated in the initiative , lead by the firm ’ s HR leadership team , which used an under the radar approach based on a revamped version of Owen ’ s Open Space Technology .', 'From an academic perspective , the approach is inspired by Argyris ’ action science , and more specifically a derivation of the “ double loop learning ” where the initial intent of the research might be modified by intermediary finding .', 'Finding : The paper offers a model for identifying the member of the “ creative class ” in a corporate environment and a tested approach for integrating the “ creative class ” into the exclusive and institutional exercise of setting strategy .', 'The cumulative effect of this “ unofficial ” operation is the creation of unique thought leadership and project , some of which have now been officially adopted in the four-year strategic plan and institutionalized in the new governance system , result difficult to achieve through conventional approach .', 'Research limitations/implications : The case study , which is still in progress , has been implemented in a non-conventional organisation in a very specific industry .', 'Originality/value : To the author ’ knowledge , this is the first application of Richard Florida ’ s urban renewal theory in the corporate environment .', 'This is an example of innovative HR management responding quickly and effectively to the digital , disrupted business landscape .', 'It is designed in the modern managerial spirit of test-and-learn , structured as an agile initiative in an open-source world .', 'It provides a prototype to be replicated and tested in other environment .', 'Choreographing the city : Can dance practice inform the engineering of sustainable urban environment ?', '.', 'In this paper , we aim to demonstrate that choreographic practice has the potential to offer new insight into the engineering of sustainable urban infrastructure and environment .', 'Identifying urban mobility as an ideal starting point to discuss the potential overlap between engineering and choreographic thinking , we briefly outline the notion of sustainability as it pertains to a key area of city engineering–urban transport .', 'Arguing that transport is one of the most critical issue in creating socially and environmentally sustainable urbanism , we draw on study of engineering to show how its working culture and epistemology prevent it from undergoing the transformation that would allow it to effectively address the issue posed by sustainable transport .', 'The focus of the paper is what we believe to be a comprehensive survey of the few conceptual and practical experiment that have been undertaken in using choreographic technique to explain or design the way people move in city , in scholarship and design practice .', 'We conclude by arguing that there is great potential to expand on these experiment as way to address the cultural and epistemological limit within engineering , and calling for practice-based research that shows what impact this would have on its process and outcome .', 'The role of woman in the culture of dwelling : Urban space at play in the project of Jacoba Mulder and Marjory Allen , Lady Allen of hurtwood .', 'There are many female architect and urban planner who have contributed to the development of discipline aimed at improving the daily life and social relation of many citizen throughout the twentieth century , most notably in the design and construction of domestic and urban space .', 'The Dutch urban planner Jacoba Mulder and the English landscape architect Marjory Allen , Lady of Hurtwood , did so in the second post-war period in Amsterdam and London , respectively , both engaging in the design for a new habitability of the public space , a space “ of the ” public that they wanted to make accessible to everyone , especially child and young people .', 'Prominent figure in pioneering experience , they had the opportunity to practice an interstitial planning capable of realizing safer and more liveable urban space .', 'Today , their reinterpretation can inspire interesting insight into contemporary city design and wider general reflection on the culture of dwelling and the design competence of woman .', 'A competence that , be it “ expert ” or “ common , ” can make public space more habitable for all .', 'Fabricăm : Participatory urban intervention in a post-communist context .', 'This chapter discusses the Fabricam ( We build ) project and report on the development of a participatory process , with a .', 'public space ) and a lack of culture for engaging in communal self-organization and action .', 'As such , the hypothesis is that engaging citizen in each step of the design process facilitates three suggestion .', 'The first is to renounce any specialized approach that is based on an acritical confidence in the power of science and technology to solve the complex problem of today ’ s world , particularly those that concern the environment and the poor .', 'The second is to adopt an approach based on a “ culture of care ” for nature and for the most vulnerable people , and third approach is to include people ( especially those who are weakest ) in transparent decision-making process that affect the quality of their life .', 'Starting from these suggestion , and from Renzo Piano ’ s statement that , at present and in the future , “ the mission of architecture is to save the outskirt ” through “ a huge work of mending ” , we believe that researcher should , with humility , make use of the ‘ urban-mending ’ approach when dealing with the complexity of regeneration project .', 'At the level of both the architectural project and urban planning , they should adopt an integrated , interdisciplinary approach that is lighter and more sensitive than those used in the past .', 'This will help them to face up to the multidimensionality and complexity of redeveloping peripheral area .', 'All stakeholder , especially the weakest people in society , should be empowered and involved in public decision making and planning implementation .', 'Finally , genuine participation of the marginalized , excluded and disaffected inhabitant of peripheral area ( i.e.', ', the outcast ) can be achieved using a “ deliberative-democratic ” approach .', 'A theory of urbanity : The economic and civic culture of city .', 'City provide for people , not just functionally in term of job , obligation and practical pursuit , but also , and above all , emotionally .', 'We like some city and detest others .', 'Despite shared rationalization and common mode of administration and design , each city has its own culture .', 'A culture is typically human in that it contains all dimension of the human , personal condition -- from the lowest to the most sublime .', "Urban culture comprises both economic and civic culture , and is the source of a city 's vitality .", "For today 'Throughout the age , city have provided the environment in which people fulfill these need .', 'Anton Zijderveld discusses urban preference , the organization and ramification of urbanity , the modernization of urban culture , the uneasy alliance between urbanity and the interventionist state , and the cultural dimension of urban renewal .', 'Zijderveld sees the economic and civic culture of the city as the centerpiece of contemporary urban management and contemporary urban democracy .', 'In this sense , the new technology is an ally of the new urban renewal .', 'Most postmodern treatise on the end of the cityare impressionistic and unsystematic .', 'In contrast , Zijderveld puts the qualitative dimension of city life into focus , catching its pulse and cultural rhythms in a systematic context that prior study have lacked .', 'Afterword : Planning with Culture .', 'City are at the heart of the political , economic , social and cultural process that shape and define the contemporary world .', 'Indeed , most people on the planet now live in city .', 'For some commentator , the ‘ urbanization of the world ’ has the potential to pull people out of poverty , foster innovation and create the condition for liberation .', 'Utopian ideal have long been influential in attempt to design and build city that are equitable and democratic as well as aesthetically pleasing .', 'Many observer , however , are less optimistic , fearing that the dominance of the urban poses a considerable threat not only to the social and environmental sustainability of individual city , but also to the future of the world .', 'They argue that the degraded and indulgent landscape of the city are the locale of displacement , disadvantage and inequality , irrevocably depleting the world ’ s resource and putting the very viability of the planet at risk .', 'At the same time as such debate are being played out , however , it is important to remember that city are also the space of everyday lived culture and the most intimate of experience .', 'They are resonant with memory and their place elicit a range of emotional response and attachment that are collective as well as individual .', 'City and urban development are thus replete with opportunity and difficulty , simultaneously site of hope and fear .', 'The task for urban scholarship is to engage with such complexity and contradiction in order to understand city at both their micro and macro level .', 'The challenge for urban planner is to utilize the insight of this scholarship to ensure their practice is nuanced , sensitive and capable of shaping urban landscape that are just and sustainable and support the dignity of all urban dweller .', 'Cultural planning and sustainable development .', 'A decade or more has elapsed since the notion of cultural planning was distinguished from the more functional planning for art and culture within amenity , heritage , land use and economic resource planning system .', 'The ‘ cultural turn ’ in town and spatial planning which emerged from the 1970s and 1980s has taken longer to establish itself than say in geography ( Barnes 2001 , Crang 1997 ) , political economy ( Soja 1999 ) and sociology ( Chaney 1994 ) .', 'Planning as a hybrid practice has adopted culture - at least partially - to better inform more sustainable approach to scarce land use and amenity need and to respond to diversity and planning culture .', 'On the other hand it has also rediscovered culture in order to address aspiration and vision of city planning itself as a ‘ work of art ’ ( Boyer 1988 , Munro 1967 , Talen and Ellis 2004 ) .', 'Different approach and rationale for cultural planning have therefore emerged , rather than a single grand theory or conceptual model ( see also Bianchini , Chapter 22 , this volume ) .', 'This is in part due to the epistemological and definitional difference evident in these approach towards ‘ culture ’ and ‘ planning ’ and their combination , and in part to cultural politics that views the very idea of planning for culture as inherently instrumental in maintaining cultural and growth hegemony - both market and state-led .', 'Kunzmann ’ s aspiration ( above ) towards creativity in planning also conflates the practice of town planner withcomplex notion of city culture , environment and identity .', 'The notion of the creative city has also extended the cultural planning sphere to the creative industry ( ‘ economy ’ ) and issue of place-making , design quality and sustainability .', 'Place-making - like New Urbanism ( CEU 2004 ) - whilst usefully focusing on the street , urban design , mixed-use , local accessibility , ‘ sense of place ’ and so on , can also be seen as a rejection or failure of planning in term of the wider scale and the whole , distributed population ( Evans 2010 ) .', 'Everywhere is a ‘ place ’ , not just the valorized space which tend to feature in place-making agenda and guidance ( APA 2011 , Markusen and Gadwa 2010 ) , and which are preoccupied with town centre and regeneration site ( physical , economy ) at the expense of the everyday , residential area and cultural activity ( people ) .', '“ A crisis in the urban landscape , ” “ the origin and theory of type , ” and “ legitimacy and control ” from the evolution of urban form : Typology for planner and architect ( 2010 ) .', 'A second prominent idea is that , as a culture , we have forgotten what is good and we need to be reminded through examples.3 lf only we could show people that dense urbanism is attractive and healthy and socially interesting , they would come to demand it everywhere .', 'If only we could all develop a shared ideal about what is livable and good , as We know how to design city .', 'Designer can whip out attractive watercolor drawing that envision a rejuvenation of our sad urban landscape of strip mall , car dealership , fast food kiosk , ragged garden apartment , wide parking-dominated street , and isolated subdivision .', 'If the new urbanism had not already offered us clear example of better design , we have but to walk the street of Paris or Savannah , Georgia , or St. Petersburg , Russia , to breathe in ancient and timeless lesson from our ancestor .', 'Social behaviour and urban space : A study of performative identity in Skegness , U.K ..', 'Many coastal town and seaside resort in the UK rely on design or arts-related development to underpin regeneration strategy , believing that public art or flagship building are beneficial in developing a sense of place and community identity .', "This paper challenges the assumption that arts-based intervention create a focus for public culture and thereby enhance a community 's character and sense of well-being .", 'It argues that the current enthusiasm for designled regeneration typically result in the introduction of new or expanded cultural ambition to coastal community , rather than reflecting and supporting existing culture and way of life .', 'In providing elite cultural attraction new development are often incompatible with local aspiration and identity .', 'The research is based on the proposition that through the replication of everyday practice in specific location a sense of identification or belonging emerges for the actor involved and the identity of a place becomes visible .', 'A study of urban performativity was undertaken in the seaside town of Skegness in the UK utilising a range of data collection method including participant observation , behaviour mapping and tracking .', 'These technique facilitate an understanding of how people interact with each other and with the built environment as they go about their everyday activity .', 'The paper concludes that everyday performance are key determinant in shaping place identity and study of urban performativity should be used to complement conventional urban analysis technique for generating design initiative in urban space .', "`` Beyond the commerce of man '' : Street vending , sidewalk , and public space in a mountain city in the Philippines .", 'Baguio City is the fabled mountain city of the Philippines created by the fledging American administration at the beginning of the 20th century .', "Internationally renowned urban planner Daniel Burnham was commissioned to design a recreational city ( sitting at an altitude of 5,000 foot ) replicating a `` little America '' in the tropic on grazing land appropriated from upland indigenous Ibaloi people .", 'Drawing from the theoretical insight of Henri Lefebevre and Michel de Certeau , this article examines how American colonialist notion of space and urban aesthetic have remained salient in modern day Baguio City .', 'In particular , I argue how these vector impact on the subaltern commercial enterprise of street vending as carried out on the public sidewalk of an iconic thoroughfare in the city , Session Road .', 'Street vendor and the specter of street vending are embedded in an array of contending spatialized practice .', "Not only do they have to contend with the city 's legalist anti-peddling ordinance but they must negotiate with its privileged status as a cosmopolitan city of refuge and as a confluence between highland indigenous and lowland culture .", 'In short , I show how sidewalk vending as practiced in Baguio City is powerfully mediated through the assemblage of the vector of economics , weather and culture .']

['Development and implementation of Mobility-as-a-Service – A qualitative study of barrier and enabling factor .', 'Mobility-as-a-Service ( MaaS ) has been argued as part of the solution to prevalent transport problem .', 'However , progress from pilot to large-scale implementation has hitherto been slow .', 'The aim of the research reported in this paper was to empirically and in-depth investigate how , and to what extent , different factor affect the development and implementation of MaaS .', 'A framework was developed , with a basis in institutional theory and the postulation that formal as well informal factor on different analytical level ( macro , meso and micro ) must be considered .', 'The research was organised as a multiple case study in Finland and Sweden and a qualitative approach was chosen for data collection and analysis .', 'A number of factor with a claimed impact on the development and implementation of MaaS was revealed .', 'At the macro level , these factor included legislation concerning transport , innovation and public administration , and the presence ( or not ) of a shared vision for MaaS .', 'At the meso level , ( the lack of ) appropriate business model , culture of collaboration , and assumed role and responsibility within the MaaS ecosystem were identified as significant factor .', "At the micro level , people 's attitude and habit were recognised as important factor to be considered .", 'However , how the ‘ S ’ in MaaS fit ( or not ) the transport need of the individual/household appears to play a more important role in adoption or rejection of MaaS than what has often been acknowledged in previous paper on MaaS .', 'The finding presented in this paper provide several implication for public and private sector actor .', 'Law-making authority can facilitate MaaS development by adjusting relevant regulation and policy such as transport-related subsidy , taxation policy and the definition of public transport .', 'Regional and local authority could additionally contribute to creating conducive condition for MaaS by , for example , planning urban design and transport infrastructure to support service-based travelling .', 'Moreover , private actor have key role to play in future MaaS development , as both public and private transport service are needed if MaaS is to become a viable alternative to privately owned car .', 'Thus , the advance of MaaS business model that benefit all involved actor is vital for the prosperity of the emerging MaaS ecosystem .', 'Improving traffic behaviour and safety through urban design .', 'Recent experiment in mainland Europe and more recently the UK have found that removing the traditional separation between traffic and people in urban area can make street safer and less congested .', 'Removing standard kerb , barrier , highway sign and road marking force motorist to use eye contact with other road user and pedestrian , for which they need to be travelling at less than around 30 km/h .', 'As this paper report , the result is slower , more careful traffic , increased safety for cyclist and pedestrian and a more attractive urban environment overall-in which local architecture and culture prevails over standard traffic infrastructure .', 'Reshaping the motor car .', 'In previous work on aesthetic and the urban road environment , the author drew attention to the growing visual disparity between the modern automobile and its urban setting , and suggested a new design approach which would provide some measure of visual integration of car into the urban landscape , and make them less alien to pedestrian .', 'Here , the author broaden their critique , exploring the cultural implication of car design , and how car might be used more effectively to promote mobility while reducing their impact on the urban environment .', 'They argue that conventional fantasy of freedom , speed and power on which the outward form of the modern automobile is presently based , are inappropriate during a period of growing congestion , urban traffic blight , climate change and diminishing fuel resource .', "The role and function of the automobile must change , and this in turn implies a change in 'car culture ' .", 'Certain process are already at work , which will assist change in the proposed direction independently of what people actually want .', 'The author propose additionally a reshaping of the external form of the private car to reflect a new and more environmentally appropriate role , helping , we suggest , to decouple its image from outworn fantasy , and bringing it into the public realm as a more sociable apparatus for modern living .', 'Exploring the distance people walk to access public transport .', 'A shift from private motorised transport to more active transportation can , among other thing , deliver significant health benefit .', 'The main disadvantage of active transport ( in particular walking ) for most people compared to private motorised transport is the limited range .', 'Public transport ( PT ) can complement the use of active mode and extend their range .', 'Therefore , there might be potential to increase physical activity through an increase in PT use .', 'This article takes a closer look at how walking relates to the use of PT by examining existing literature on the topic .', 'It aims to study how far people walk to and from PT and what key factor influence this .', 'Scopus , Transport Research International Documentation and Web of Science have been searched systematically for relevant article , conference paper and book .', 'After screening of title and abstract , 41 relevant publication were identified .', 'Study were included if they quantified the amount of walking ( measured as either distance or time ) that is directly related to the use of PT .', 'Study that quantified walking using general measure of daily physical activity or daily walking or that used stated preference design were excluded .', 'The PT system considered in this paper are mass transport system in urban area , either road- or rail-based , with fixed schedule and stop .', 'Demand responsive transport service , which can offer door-to-door travel , are not considered , as these system can to a large extent eliminate the need to walk .', 'In the identified publication , a large variety of walking distance and time have been reported , and these seem to be highly context-specific .', 'The paper establishes the evidence for the wide range of factor that influence walking related to PT , which have been categorised as personal , PT-related , environmental , and journey-related .', 'The different method that have been used are discussed by critically analysing their advantage and limitation .', 'Only a limited number of these method used allow for an accurate assessment of the walking distance to and from PT .', 'The paper concludes with suggestion for future research , such as a need for more accurate measurement of walking and research in different geographical area to shed light on underlying influence of culture and climate .', 'An introduction to sustainable transportation : Policy , planning and implementation : Second edition .', 'City around the globe struggle to create better and more equitable access to important destination and service , all the while reducing the energy consumption and environmental impact of mobility .', 'An Introduction to Sustainable Transportation illustrates a new planning paradigm for sustainable transportation through case study from around the world with hundred of valuable resource and reference , color photo , graphic and table .', 'The second edition build and expands upon the highly acclaimed first edition , with new chapter on urban design and urban , regional and intercity public transportation , as well as expanded chapter on automobile dependence and equity issue ; automobile city and the car culture ; the history of sustainable and unsustainable transportation ; the interrelatedness of technology , infrastructure energy and functionality ; and public policy and public participation and exemplary place , people and program around the globe .', 'Among the many valuable addition are discussion of autonomous vehicle ( AVs ) , electric vehicle ( EVs ) , airport city , urban fabric , urban heat island effect and mobility as a service ( MaaS ) .', 'New case study show global exemplar of sustainable transportation , including several from Asia , a case study of participative and deliberative public involvement , as well as one describing life in the Vauban ecologically planned community of Freiburg , Germany .', 'Student in affiliated sustainability discipline , planner , policymakers and concerned citizen will find many provides practical technique to innovate and transform transportation .', 'Understanding international road safety disparity : Why is Australia so much safer than the United States ?', '.', 'Despite similarity to the US in term of transportation , land use , and culture , Australia kills 5.3 people per 100,000 population on the road each year , as compared to the US rate of 12.4 .', 'Similar trend hold when accounting for distance driven and the number of registered car .', 'This paper seeks to understand what is behind the road safety disparity between these two country .', 'The result suggest that a number of inter-related factor seem to play a role in the better road safety outcome of Australia as compared to the US .', "This includes Australia 's strategy related to seat belt usage and impaired driving as well as their effort to help curb vehicle speed and reduce exposure .", 'Design-related difference include a much greater reliance on roundabout and narrower street cross-sections as well as guideline that encourage self-enforcing road .', 'Policy-related difference include stronger and more extensive enforcement program , restrictive licensing program , and higher driving cost .', 'Combined with a more urban population and multimodal infrastructure , Australia tends to discourage driving mileage and exposure while encouraging safer mode of transportation such as transit , at least more so than in most of the US .', 'Australia also enacted their version of Vision Zero – called the Safe System Approach – more than a decade before similar policy began cropping up in US city .', 'While it is difficult to attribute recent road safety success to any specific policy , Australia continues to expand their lead on the US in term of safety outcome and is a road safety example worthy of consideration .', 'Bicycle sharing in Asia : A stakeholder perception and possible future .', 'Despite public bicycle sharing program ( PBSP ) gaining global attention as important climate smart transport strategy to support sustainable , low carbon society in European and North American city , its uptake in Asia , except for China , has been unexpectedly limited .', "Moreover , while existing scheme in other region could provide a better understanding about bicycle sharing , the need to improve our understanding of PBSP 's role in catering for the local transportation mobility and accessibility need and requirement as well as identifying strategy to make PBSP better adapted to local Asian condition is in order .", 'To date , there has been limited information and analytics to inform low-carbon local planning especially from the perspective of variious individual .', 'To address this gap , this paper aims to advance our understanding of bike sharing scheme in Asia by examining motivator , constraint and opportunity , and their contribution towards achieving sustainable urban mobility outcome .', 'Using a survey-based research design approach , this study examines the perception of various individual on the perceived benefit , and identify factor which have facilitated or constrained the implementation of PBSP .', 'In essence , result show that technical constraint were perceived to be the most restrictive and dominant barrier while there is general consensus that different type of facilitator support bikeshare implementation ; also , environmental benefit top the list of benefit while the lowest scorer is economic benefit , providing vital and important information to inform design , marketing and communication strategy for PBSP implementation within the Asian setting .', 'This paper enhances our understanding of the challenge involved in bikeshare implementation as a first step in planning for a smarter society .', 'It also attempts to build the evidence base to comprehend the localization of bike sharing scheme .', "Understanding how PBSP can be locally implemented can have long-term positive effect through creating a cycling culture and changing people ' travel behavior .", 'Published by Elsevier B.V .', 'Investigating learning and diffusion strategy for sustainable mobility .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to examine the concept of learning and diffusion within the context of urban development and sustainable active mobility .', 'A model is proposed , which treats learning as a diffusion process in a dynamic way , so that key strategy and their effect are investigated over time .', 'Specifically , the question being examined is how learning and information technology strategy can change the mindset of people to be more physically active in their mobility around a city .', 'This is carried out by developing a system dynamic ( SD ) computer simulation model , where learning strategy that promote walking can be tested prior to implementation .', 'Design/methodology/approach : Based on the specific key stage of knowledge , persuasion , decision , implementation and confirmation , the proposed SD model incorporates individual citizen and group level learning and diffusion process in a unified integrated approach .', 'The SD model gives a clear picture on how learning and changing mindset occur in the context of a city , whereby we can explore the main driver to learn new sustainability related habit .', 'A case study is used to contextualize and demostrate the active mobility issue , in order to develop practical scenario for promoting a walking mindset .', 'This is done in order to demonstrate the capability of the model and show its practicality .', 'Through the model we investigate the relationship among variable such as awareness , contact , communication and adoption and evaluate their impact on city policy to promote a walking mindset .', 'Finding : The developed SD model exhibit important dimension , such as social learning , motivation to change behaviour and an analysis of the effect of plausible strategy for promoting sustainable active mobility .', 'The author have proven that through simulation experimentation , we can significantly accelerate the shaping and diffusion of a walking mindset , by influencing individual and community learning via the introduction of Information and Communication Technology in conjunction with an awareness campaign strategy .', 'Research limitations/implications : The diagrammatic representation and the quantification of the factor that contribute to active mobility give rise to better understanding of how policy maker could promote a walking culture in a city .', 'The implication are that the proposed SD model could be used by city planning authority as a framework for shaping mindset towards active and sustainable mobility .', 'Originality/value : This paper contributes to the further understanding of learning , diffusion of new idea and strategic planning within the city context .', 'Through the proposed SD model , a number of strategy are formulated and tested using scenario planning , sensitivity analysis and optimization , in order to develop a walking mindset and an urban culture of sustainability .', 'The right to walk in city , a comparative review of Macau , Lisbon and Las Vegas .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to analyze walking activity and recent effort at street user as well as the establishment and the nurturing of a culture of walking .', 'Research limitations/implications : A fivefold international walkability research agenda with implication for the implementation of safety , construction and maintenance criterion ; and responsible funding program .', 'Practical implication : This paper has twofold implication for stakeholder with direct set of recommendation include the need to augment endogeneity , the need to make city for people and not for automobile and commitment to resolving pedestrian safety concern .', 'Originality/value : This paper discusses the factor affecting street vibrancy from both a stakeholder ’ s and a user ’ s perspective .', 'The fundamental and inalienable right to walk is analyzed using the WPPFUS framework ( walking level , purpose , primacy of walking , facility , unique feature and safety concern ) .', 'Applying social norm to high-fidelity pedestrian and traffic simulation .', 'Smart city are founded on complex interaction among architectural and urban design , sensor , actuator and crowds of people with their device .', 'In this context , simulation becomes essential to study the effect of the technology and to understand how to improve its effectiveness on the social environment .', 'The majority of the current pedestrian and traffic simulation adopt a bird-eye view and are driven by statistical model .', 'While this is enough in many case , e.g .', 'to study traffic flow under common condition assuming average case , it is not appropriate when a higher level of fidelity is required .', 'Simulated people need to show both a plausible behavior and mechanism to coordinate with human participant in a natural way .', 'Much of this coordination happens silently and is driven by social norm , that may vary according to culture and context .', "In this paper , we propose an approach to represent social norm in multi-agent system that enables implicit coordination driven by observation of others ' behavior .", 'This is applied specifically to the case of pedestrian movement .', 'In order to allow for a more effective participation of human in the simulation , our approach does not use central coordinator or coordination protocol , but rather each agent takes its own decision so to make more realistic interaction .', 'A software architecture and initial experimental result are presented and discussed .', 'Green connector : Off-shore example .', 'Ecologically sound bikeways and pedestrian path routinely get people to transit stop in Europe and part of Latin America .', 'Why not here ?', 'Skeptic contend that experience imported from Europe or from country south of the equator reflect different history , culture , and politics , and thus are not really relevant to the U.S. transportation scene .', 'In truth , world-class transit service , whether in Copenhagen or Curitiba , are largely a product of conscientious and carefully crafted public policy and planning vision .', 'They often require personal sacrifice ( e.g.', ', less living space and fewer car per capita ) in return for public gain ( cleaner air and equality of access ) .', 'Key element of transportation system design , such as the physical integration of neighborhood walkway and railroad station , are in fact eminently transferable to the U.S. and anywhere else .', 'What it takes is political will and good planning practice .', 'Benchmarking model for culture of urban traffic-safety management in India : interpretive structural modeling framework .', 'Purpose : Researcher have studied process of improving road traffic-safety culture by explicitly evaluating the socio-psychological phenomenon of traffic-risk .', 'The implicit traffic-system cue play an important role in explaining urban traffic-culture .', 'This paper aims to ascertain an interpretive framework of the alternative process of road traffic safety culture is antecedent to promote traffic-safety behaviour in Indian urban context .', 'Subsequently , the author discussed the reason for those relationship exists .', 'Design/methodology/approach : Four expert of the urban traffic-safety domain participated in total interpretive structural modelling ( TISM ) study by completing an interpretive consensus-driven questionnaire .', 'The drafted interpretive model was evaluated for road user proactive action orientation about the traffic-safety decision .', 'Finding : The evolved directed graph ( digraph ) of the culture of urban traffic-safety management was a serial three-mediator model .', 'The model argued : In the presence of traffic-risk cue , people may become apprised to safety goal that initiate traffic-safety action .', 'Consequently , expectancy-value evaluation motivates the continuation of traffic-safety intention that may lead to the implementation of adaptation plan ( volitional control ) , thus habituating road user to traffic-safety management choice .', 'Practical implication : The modeller of traffic psychology may empirically estimate and test for the quality criterion to ascertain the applicability of the proposed mechanism of urban traffic-safety culture .', 'The decision-makers should note the importance of arousal of emotion regarding traffic-risk , reduce the impact of maladaptive motivation and recursively improve control over safety action for promoting safety intervention .', 'Originality/value : The author attempted to induce an interpretive model of urban traffic-safety culture that might augment extant discussion regarding how and why people behave in an urban traffic system .', 'Designing healthy mobility in city : how urban planning can promote walking and cycling [ Alltagsmobilität in Städten gesund gestalten : wie Stadtplanung Fuß- und Radverkehr fördern kann ] .', 'Mobility is a prerequisite for satisfying essential human need .', 'Work , education , social participation : all these activity generate regular journey .', 'Particularly in city , however , the “ side effect ” of mobility such as traffic jam , traffic accident , air pollution , noise and the resulting health effect are also evident .', 'The planning of settlement structure , the necessary infrastructure , and the design of urban space are task of urban planning .', 'Urban planning can have a decisive influence on the mean of transport people choose , the distance they travel , and the environmental and health effect associated with these choice .', 'This article examines how urban planning can promote alternative to motorized individual travel .', 'It focuses in particular on active mobility , such as cycling and walking .', 'The paper begins by presenting the fundamental effect of everyday mobility and the resulting traffic on health .', 'It then gives an overview of the potential for promoting active mobility in Germany and how urban planning and the factor it regulates , such as settlement density or mix of us , influence mobility decision .', 'An overview of current initiative and an in-depth presentation of planning strategy in the city of Barcelona and
