example show , however , that promising initiative are not realised through spatial planning and the creation of infrastructure alone .', 'Rather , they are cross-sectoral measure aimed at changing the mobility culture in city .', 'The influence of urban form and socio-demographics on active transport : A 40-neighborhoods study in chengdu , china .', 'In China , a centralized planning culture has created similar neighborhood across the country .', 'Using a survey of 1,048 individual conducted in 2016 in Chengdu—located in a carefully conceptualized typology of neighborhood forms—we analyzed the association between individual and neighborhood characteristic and active or non-motorized transport behavior .', 'Using several multiple logistic and multi-level model , we show how neighborhood were categorized and how the number of category or neighborhood type affected the magnitude of the association with active transport but not the direction .', 'People taking non-work trip were more likely to use active compared with motorized mode in all neighborhood type .', 'Neighborhood type was significant in model but so too were many other individual-level variable and infrastructural and locational feature such as bike lane and location near the river .', 'Of the 3-D physical environment variable , floor area ratio ( a proxy for density ) was only significant in one model for non-work trip .', 'Intersection density and dissimilarity ( land-use diversity ) were only significant in a model for work trip .', 'This study shows that to develop strong theory about the connection between active transport and environment , it is important to examine different physical and cultural context and perform sensitivity analysis .', 'Research in different part of China can help provide a more substantial base for evidence-informed policymaking .', 'Planning and design recommendation were made related to active transport need to consider how neighborhood , built environment , and personal characteristic interact in different kind of urban environment .', 'Modality environment : A concept for sustainability and vitality in the multi-modal city .', 'This paper reviews an idea of vital local high-street place with their walking space and economy founded in interface between neighbourhood and city ( between walking and public transport/bicycle movement infrastructure ) .', "It then extends this idea to higher scale , considering interface between city and region , which have already been theorised as 'mobility environment ' ( Bertolini & Dijst 2003 ) focusing on place and modal transfer point in new regional city of high mobility .", 'High-streets and mobility environment are both central place and our way of describing them suggests a new definition of central place as interface between normative ( but also technically-infrastructually supported ) political space ( neighbourhood , city and region ) .', 'It also clarifies the role of scale in place theory and we will deal with this in a following paper .', "Here we introduce idea of 'modality place ' and 'modality environment ' .", "The 'modality environment ' is concerned with areal and network transportation form in whole fabric and resulting condition of sustainability and urbanity .", 'Modality environment are understood in term of transportation network and the social and functional factor ( like sustainability and urbanity ) they produce .', 'Modality environment are seen as lived environment built around movement infrastructure grid that distribute everyday urban function .', 'Ideally modality environment would be simple clear grid that distribute all or close to all the function of everyday life so that a walking grid or a bicycle grid that gets adult to work , their child to school and includes shopping and recreation would be walking or bicycle modality environment .', 'They would be expected to have high level of direct visibility-legibility in the way urban element present themselves to a mobile community .', 'Modality environment would also include the central place ( like high-streets or mobility environment like station ) at which people would transfer to other modality environment .', "We will use a notion of 'movement culture ' to indicate the convergence of land us and mobile community mediated in information-rich network .", 'We are concerned first with how modality environment ( for cycling or walking for example ) may afford more sustainable lifestyle .', 'We are concerned in addition with the way they can be designed to include central place as zone of urbanity and vitality and as socially and culturally mixed centre .', 'We start not with a principle of accessibility of/from node in an extensive space but with the idea that particular social and political territory ( community and polity ) are already articulation of distinct modality environment .', 'We demonstrate using the case of the Amsterdam metropolitan area .', 'Transit-oriented-development ( TOD ) suitable for China .', 'Transit-oriented development ( TOD ) combines transit infrastructure with urban land utilization in way that optimize the long-term benefit of urban mass transit ( UMT ) .', 'TOD has been successfully implemented in the USA , Europe , Singapore , Hong Kong and many other place ; however , its practice in China is so uncommon that few people understand it well .', 'Although it is worthwhile to study the foreign TOD model , Chinese city can not simply copy these example because of how its politics , economic condition , and regional culture differ from the country where TOD has previously been used .', 'Chinese city should analyze the successful TOD case to determine how the various aspect of TOD apply to condition existing in China and ultimately develop TOD design and procedure appropriate for China .', 'Eco-mobility Approach for a Sustainable Neighbourhood Road Infrastructure within a Mixed-use Community : The Searchlight on Festac Town , Amuwo Odofin , Lagos .', 'In major city in Nigeria , the current mode of transportation are generally chaotic and unsustainable .', 'We therefore have to rethink how to adopt the seamless integration of sustainable transportation alternative .', 'Poor maintenance is one of the factor adduced to be responsible for the current deteriorated state of mobility corridor and the existing road infrastructure .', 'Overpopulation and increasing socio-economic activity of Festac Town exerts undue pressure on the infrastructure , thereby accelerating deterioration .', 'The study is underpinned by Eco-mobility principle .', 'This study is aimed at assessing the eco-mobility approach for a sustainable neighbourhood road infrastructure within a mixed-use community .', 'Developing a sustainable mobility strategy that brings the neighborhood streets back to the people is an objective which this study pursue .', 'A multi-staged sampling technique was adopted for the study .', 'On-site qualitative approach was majorly employed through the interview conducted assessing the major mobility corridor and street from 1st to 7th avenue .', 'A sample frame of 15 major road with outdoor open space along the selected road all within the selected avenue and major street road .', 'The instrument for data collection were oral interview and personal/physical observation .', 'The activity profile , locational data and geospatial coordinate of each avenue were imported into ArcGIS ( Version 10.5 , ESRI ) for various land-use analysis .', "The sustainable eco-mobility strategy will reduce transportation impact , create civilized street that meets environmental design standard of commuter 's safety and comfort that are compatible with the unique urban structure and culture of metropolitan Lagos .", 'This study evaluated the issue relating to sustainable eco-mobility , the connection between climate change and transportation system , the impact of urban mobility on public health and wellbeing .', 'It further outlined policy framework to be considered in other to have a sustainable neighbourhood street mobility network within a mixed-use community .', 'Easy Ride : A Secure Carpooling Mobile Application for Travellers .', 'The advancement of technology has opened pathway for the rapid development of urban ecosystem .', 'However , the population in urban area is expected to increase exponentially which may lead to severe mobility problem .', 'Various measure have been implemented by policy maker to mitigate the mobility problem and to provide better transportation facility to people .', 'Although the effort are still in infancy stage , they are expected to yield positive result in the long run .', 'In relation to this , the research proposes a mobile application called Easy Ride as an initiative to create an efficient carpooling ecosystem which brings huge advantage to the community in term of transportation .', 'Connecting people and creating a strong culture of sustainability will be the primary purpose of this application as it serves a path for people to reach out and connect with more traveller .', 'Besides fostering social network , this application is defined to be cost-effective as it helps the driver and passenger to share the overall travel expense .', 'On the other hand , this research describes the agile methodology that has been chosen for the entire development of the application .', 'The system was further tested and validated to determine the efficiency of the overall functionality and design .', 'The finding indicate that the proposed system has the potential to meet the expectation of the traveler and to enhance their daily lifestyle .', 'Impact of rail technology in 21st Century U.S. Cities .', 'This presentation analyzes the impact of transit technology on the urban environment and evaluates land use , station design , and transit cost as a means of projecting the best option for intermodal station and transit-oriented development .', 'Several commuter rail , AMTRAK , and freight rail corridor may be used in the future to accommodate heavy , light and/or high-speed rail system in the United States .', 'Diesel/electric locomotive , which populate urban rail corridor , have heavy load requirement and are industrial and/or utilitarian in appearance .', 'However , diesel multiple unit ( DMUs ) with lighter weight , increased fuel efficiency , ease of accessibility , additional capacity , enhanced performance and lower cost are competing for their market share .', 'Currently , monorail , people mover , and streetcars - along with the traditional light and heavy rail system - have public acceptance to enrich the urban environment surrounding the existing corridor , and enhance commuter experience .', 'Many city , however , are at a crossroad regarding transitioning from an automobile culture to a rail culture .', 'Therefore , local city willingly embrace opportunity for better environment .', 'Challenge with system integration .', 'It has been debated which of the APM/ATS major subsystem , Rolling Stock or Automatic Train Control ( ATC ) , is most critical to project delivery ; when in fact , it is neither .', 'In truth , the critical element is not the subsystem itself but the successful integration of the two along with the other key system component from PDS ( Power Distribution System ) to fixed facility to fare collection .', 'Without particular attention and effort by owner and supplier as to how the various component physically and functionally interact as a comprehensive system , the end result could range anywhere from significant project delays to unacceptable safety condition .', 'Growing trend in the transit industry are adding to the already existing complexity of system integration .', 'These growing trend include changing requirement .', 'Just as technical requirement are becoming more and more onerous , so too are commercial requirement ; in particular , project schedule .', 'Owner-required shortened project design-build lifecycles are resulting in less time to thoroughly account for all subsystem interface .', 'Another aspect to be explored occurs in brown field application when 21st century technology must replace ( or even interact ) with non-compatible , decade old equipment still in operation .', 'Finally , as the economy becomes more and more global , so too does the APM/ATS industry .', "The `` one stop shop '' for APM/ATS system are being replaced by multiple sub supplier from various part of the world .", "As a result , system integrator must ensure that all party are `` speaking the same language '' in term of commercial and technical terminology as well as business and ethnic culture .", 'These change have had a substantial impact on the integration effort required on any given transit project .', 'This paper will examine the pitfall that accompany these growing trend as well as the method and practice that can help avoid them .', 'Traffic restraint and APMs : Local strategy for curbing urban sprawl .', 'The frustration of traffic congestion , loss of open land in urban area , and many other ecological and economic concern are driving a search for alternative to urban sprawl .', 'The challenge is to design development that is compact and sustainable , yet environmentally compatible despite our predominant car culture .', 'The root of the problem lies in the space required by automobile , which result in paved environment relatively devoid of landscaping - a significant drawback for residential development , which is pivotal to the to the use of public transit .', 'Advanced transit engineering solution alone are not enough to induce the public to choose more compact development for residential purpose .', 'Solution can be found in various form of traffic restraint .', 'These may be made more restrictive for higher density , if accompanied by appropriate transit system .', 'In the case of new development , APM shuttle and loop , with their capability of short headway and around-the-clock operation , are ideal tool for creating urban infill with compact , auto-free , and landscaped community .', 'While in most area of the U.S. , the centrifugal momentum of urban sprawl continues to trump initiative aimed at more compact development , it is a gross simplification to assume that sprawl is the inevitable outcome of technological progress , free choice and the free market .', 'Notwithstanding the powerful , sprawl-inducing incentive of land speculation in outlying area , wherein profit are often measured by a factor of five ( RERC , 1974 , ) sprawl would have never occurred in its present and growing dimension without massive government and corporate-sponsored investment and subsidy that have encouraged private motoring , and a tax code in which an anti-urban bias has played a central role .', 'The past and present influence of these investment and subsidy , and the potential for shifting our future financial support toward new priority , can not be dismissed in any discussion of the subject .', "The `` Iron Law of Urban Decay '' is a creation of political choice and not of nature .", 'The most effective tool we could employ for curbing urban sprawl would be a shift of government investment in urban infrastructure , away from highway and toward a variety of form of public transit network .', 'If moratorium were placed on the construction of new highway and utility infrastructure on the urban fringe , sprawl would quickly begin to loose its momentum .', 'This would need to be followed by change in those zoning law that currently literally force strip-commercial and large-lot-residential development .', 'But these would be political , and not just planning design decision , for land speculation , particularly in concert with new transportation access , has long been one of the most lucrative and politically protected enterprise of the powerful .']

['Making by making strange : Defamiliarization and the design of domestic technology .', 'This article argues that because the home is so familiar , it is necessary to make it strange , or defamiliarize it , in order to open its design space .', 'Critical approach to technology design are of both practical and social importance in the home .', 'Home appliance are loaded with cultural association such as the gendered division of domestic labor that are easy to overlook .', 'Further , home are not the same everywhere - even within a country .', "People ' aspiration and desire differ greatly across and between culture .", 'The target of western domestic technology design is often not the user , but the consumer .', 'Web refrigerator that create shopping list , garbage can that let advertiser know what is thrown away , cabinet that monitor their content and order more when supply are low are central to current image of the wireless , digital home of the future .', 'Drawing from our research in the United States , the United Kingdom , and Asia , we provide three different narrative of defamiliarization .', "A historical reading of American kitchen provides a lens with which to scrutinize new technology of domesticity , an ethnographic account of an extended social unit in England problematizes taken-for-granted domestic technology , and a comparative ethnography of the role of information and communication technology in the daily life of urban Asia 's middle class reveals the way in which new technology can be captured and domesticated in unexpected way .", 'In the final section of the article , we build on these moment of defamiliarization to suggest a broad set of challenge and strategy for design in the home .', 'Beyond binary choice : Integrating individual and social creativity .', 'The power of the unaided individual mind is highly overrated .', 'Although society often thinks of creative individual as working in isolation , intelligence and creativity result in large part from interaction and collaboration with other individual .', 'Much human creativity is social , arising from activity that take place in a context in which interaction with other people and the artifact that embody collective knowledge are essential contributor .', "This paper examines : ( 1 ) how individual and social creativity can be integrated by mean of proper collaboration model and tool supporting distributed cognition ; ( 2 ) how the creation of shareable externalization ( `` boundary object '' ) and the adoption of evolutionary process model in the construction of meta-design environment can enhance creativity and support spontaneous design activity ( `` unselfconscious culture of design '' ) ; and ( 3 ) how a new design competence is emerging - one that requires passage from individual creative action to synergetic activity , from the reflective practitioner to reflective community and from given task to personally meaningful activity .", 'The paper offers example in the context of collaborative design and art practice , including urban planning , interactive art and open source .', "In the effort to draw a viable path `` beyond binary choice '' , the paper points out some major challenge for the next generation of socio-technical environment to further increase the integration of individual and social creativity .", 'Library as coworking space : Understanding user motivation and perceived barrier to social learning .', 'Purpose : This paper aims to inform design strategy for smart space technology to enhance library as environment for coworking and informal social learning .', 'The focus is on understanding user motivation , behaviour , and activity in the library when there is no programmed agenda .', "Design/methodology/approach : The study analyses gathered data over five month of ethnographic research at The Edge - a `` bookless '' library space at the State Library of Queensland in Brisbane , Australia , that is explicitly dedicated to coworking , social learning , peer collaboration , and creativity around digital culture and technology .", "Finding : The result present five persona that embody people 's main usage pattern as well as motivation , attitude , and perceived barrier to social learning .", 'It appears that most user work individually or within pre-organised group , but usually do not make new connection with co-present , unacquainted user .', 'Based on the personas , four hybrid design dimension are suggested to improve the library as a social interface for shared learning encounter across physical and digital space .', 'Originality/value : The finding in this paper offer actionable knowledge for manager , decision maker , and designer of technology-enhanced library space and similar collaboration and coworking space .', 'Introducing ATMs in India : A contextual inquiry .', 'This paper presents a method and result of an ethnographic study aimed at building an understanding of Automatic Teller Machine ( ATM ) adoption in Mumbai , India .', 'The study combined field observation and semi-structured interview ( N = 43 ) of early ATM adopter , bank customer who do not use ATMs , and people who used the ATM for the first time as part of our research .', 'Data were analysed to identify specific cultural trait that may affect the adoption of ATMs in urban India .', "Result demonstrated the unique role of the cultural context in affecting user ' expectation and behavioural possibility , thus determining people 's response to the machine .", 'This led to the conclusion that an understanding of cultural bias and metaphor can facilitate technology diffusion and acceptance informing design localisation and supporting the development of strategy to motivate and train user .', 'HCI & sustainable food culture : A design framework for engagement .', 'The current food practice around the world raises concern for food insecurity in the future .', 'Urban / suburban / and peri-urban environment are particularly problematic in their segregation from rural area where the natural food source are grown and harvested .', 'Soaring urban population growth only deteriorates the lack of understanding in and access to fresh produce for the people who live , work , and play in the city .', 'This paper explores the role of Human Computer Interaction ( HCI ) design in encouraging individual user to participate in creating sustainable food culture in urban environment .', 'The paper takes a disciplinary perspective of urban informatics and present five core constituent of the HCI design framework to encourage sustainable food culture in the city via ubiquitous technology : the perspective of transdisciplinarity ; the domain of interest of people , place , and technology ; and the perspective of design .', 'The role of ICTs in creating the new social public place of the digital era .', 'Nowadays , Information and Communication Technologies ( ICTs ) have spread extensively in everyday life in an unprecedented way .', 'A great attention is paid to the ICTs while ignoring the social aspect .', "With the immersive invasion of internet as well as smartphones ' application and digital social networking , people become more socially connected through virtual space instead of meeting in physical public space .", "ICTs are categorized in this paper into four element which are as follows : Wi-Fi network , digital interactive medium façades , interactive public display , and smartphones ' application in public space .", 'These element will play major role in the public space classified into five domain which are as follows : Culture and art , education , planning and design , game and entertainment , and information and communication .', 'Based on this classification various example and proposal of ICTs intervention in public space are presented to encourage good old fashioned social interaction by creating the new social public place of this digital era .', "Accordingly , this study will help to find design principle that can be adopted in the design of future public space to meet the need of the digital era 's user with the new concept of social life respecting the rule of place-making .", 'Uncovering inconspicuous place using social medium check-in and street view image .', 'There is a Chinese proverb , “ if your wine taste really good , you do not need to worry about the location of your bar ( 酒香不怕巷子深 ) ” , which implies that the popular place for local resident are sometimes hidden behind an unassuming door or on unexpected street .', 'Discovering these unassuming place ( e.g .', 'restaurant ) of a city will benefit the understanding of local culture and help to build livable neighborhood .', 'Previous work has been limited by the lack of appropriate data source and efficient tool to evaluate the popularity , ambiance and physical surroundings of place in large-scale urban area .', 'In addition , how to characterize place with respect to different group of people remains unclear .', 'In this work , we propose a data-driven approach using social medium check-in and street-level image to compare the different activity pattern of visitor and local , and uncover inconspicuous but interesting place for them in a city .', 'We use check-in record as a proxy of the popularity of a particular type of place , and differentiate visitor and local based on their travel and social medium behavior .', 'In addition , we employ street-level image to represent the physical environment of place .', 'As a result , we discovered a number of inconspicuous yet popular restaurant in Beijing .', 'These restaurant are located mostly in deep alley of Old Beijing neighborhood , where the physical environment are not particularly appealing ; however , these place are frequently visited by local for social engagement .', 'We also discovered beautiful but unpopular outdoor place in Beijing .', 'These place are potential recreational area for all group of people and could be improved regarding urban design and planning to make these public infrastructure more attractive .', 'This work demonstrates how multi-source big geo-data can be combined to build comprehensive place-based representation for different group of people .', 'Connected learning in the library as a product of hacking , making , social diversity and messiness .', 'Learning is most effective when intrinsically motivated through personal interest , and situated in a supportive socio-cultural context .', "This paper reports on finding from a study that explored implication for design of interactive learning environment through 18 month of ethnographic observation of people 's interaction at “ Hack The Evening ” ( HTE ) .", 'HTE is a meetup group initiated at the State Library of Queensland in Brisbane , Australia , and dedicated to provide visitor with opportunity for connected learning in relation to hacking , making and do-it-yourself technology .', 'The result provide insight into factor that contributed to HTE as a social , interactive and participatory environment for learning – knowledge is created and co-created through uncoordinated interaction among participant that come from a diversity of background , skill and area of expertise .', 'The insight also reveal challenge and barrier that the HTE group faced in regard to connected learning .', 'Four dimension of design opportunity are presented to overcome those challenge and barrier towards improving connected learning in library building and other free-choice-learning environment that seek to embody a more interactive and participatory culture among their user .', 'The insight are relevant for librarian as well as designer , manager and decision-makers of other interactive and free-choice-learning environment .', 'Library as transitory workspace and spatial incubator .', 'Growing flexibility in work arrangement , particularly in the knowledge industry , and the ensuing possibility for teleworking are challenging the traditional way of conceptualizing and designing public space and public service .', 'As an example of this development , public and university library are studied from the point of view of teleworking .', "Although work still only accounts for a small amount of the activity that take place in library , its transformation can be seen as a 'weak signal ' of newly emerging spatial arrangement .", 'In addition to the home and workplace , teleworkers are using a network of public , semi-public and private space ( so-called third place ) for different type of working .', "The research used the concept `` spatial portfolio '' to address this phenomenon of spatial modality .", 'The new role of public library within this context is discussed .', 'In addition to their traditional function of lending book and providing space for reading newspaper and magazine , library are now becoming more multifunctional , providing space for different activity , including work .', 'This new phenomenon has been studied empirically by conducting a qualitative interview and observing teleworkers in two public library and one university library in the City of Helsinki , Finland .', 'The objective was to find and analyze different profile of worker in library , thus providing input for future planning and design of these space , as well as the urban fabric around them .', 'The result show that a considerable range of activity within research and education , art and culture , information technology , business and finance , and social service and government are performed in the library , all of which are in part supported by the new concept and policy of the city .', "Library can be seen as 'transitory workspace ' where people work at least a couple of hour per week and for different reason such as free wifi connection and location .", "Also , library might be considered 'spatial incubator ' or rather place able to attract people who start up their own activity .", 'These concept contribute to define a new way of appropriating library .', 'Minecraft as a tool for engaging child in urban planning : A Case study in Tirol Town , Brazil .', 'The purpose of this paper is to explore the potential of Minecraft ’ s game environment for urban planning with older and younger child in a public school in Tirol town , Brazil .', 'Minecraft is employed as an innovative tool to tackle the present lack of engagement and involvement of key societal actor such as child and young people in urban planning .', 'Thus , how can game support child to co-design their future city ?', 'Which heritage value do they represent graphically in the game environment ?', 'Geogames are game that provide a visualization of a real spatial context and in this study , Minecraft is the tool which we use to explore youth engagement .', 'We designed two experiment , which tested Minecraft as a geogame environment for engaging young people in urban planning .', 'These experiment were conducted with child , who emerged as active emancipated actor to bring their value to the planning practice .', 'The playtesting result revealed the potential of Minecraft to keep child engaged in the design workshop , as well as their relevant ludic ability to co-create walkable , green , and interactive place .', 'New research question arose about the potential of creating a culture of planning among child in order to motivate other social actor to share responsibility for sustainable development and management .', 'Extending boundary with meta-design and culture of participation .', 'Human-computer interaction ( HCI ) has refocused many research effort within computer science from a technology-centered view to a human-centered view .', 'The development so far , however , have seen human mostly as user and consumer rather than as active contributor and designer .', 'This paper provides a conceptual framework based on meta-design and culture of participation that democratize design and allows all stakeholder to evolve system to fit their need .', 'It establishes a new extended discourse for HCI research in which information technology are interwoven with human life in all aspect of our existence ( at home , working , teaching , learning , and being a citizen ) .', 'Specific socio-technical environment instantiating the framework in different application domain are described , including : ( 1 ) environment for people with cognitive disability , ( 2 ) table-top computing system for framing and solving complex urban planning problem , ( 3 ) modeling the building of the world in 3D , and ( 4 ) using Smart Grids to support energy sustainability .', 'These example show how metadesign and culture of participation are design approach that allow researcher and practitioner to extend boundary by allowing all stakeholder to have more control over their artifact and by providing opportunity to encourage and to support contribution by many people in personally meaningful activ ities .', 'Minor urbanism : Everyday entanglement of technology and urban life .', 'In the complicated intercourse between technology and culture , the model and metaphor we deploy in projecting vision for how this relationship will-or should-evolve are essential to the process .', 'The tendency towards envisioning stable , seamless , uniform and universally available medium , communication and information system , and infrastructure is as old as the field of ubiquitous computing ( ubicomp ) itself , as are critique identifying the blind spot of these vision .', 'As an alternative to the most recent iteration of these visions-cloud computing-I introduce the notion of minor urbanism , a conceptual vehicle for understanding the complex assemblage of actor , practice and situation brought into being by real-world ubicomp .', 'I then describe the emergence of white-label ATMs as an example of such an assemblage , one that articulates an alternate ontology for describing contemporary entanglement of people , technology and space in the context of everyday urban life .', 'I conclude by introducing a work of design fiction that richly illustrates these entanglement and indicates a strategy by which the public imaginary of near-future urban technology can be shaped along these line .', 'Site-specific mobility and connection in Korea : bang ( room ) between public and private space .', "Although social and cultural research on mobile communication is exploding , many study take a technical view of the mobile phone as a personal networking device that connects people 'anywhere , anytime . '", 'There has been little cultural research that has examined the uptake of mobile application that are anchored to specific site , especially outside European and American locality .', 'To address this , we analyse medium experience in the living space of the Korean bang ( room ) culture .', 'There are specific social space , such as DVD bang , sauna ( Jjimjil ) bang , karaoke ( norae ) bang , and PC bang .', 'We position mobile technology along an increasingly blurred border between work and leisure , and we conceptualise the use of mobile phone for the symbolic creation , demarcation , and integration of public and private space in a digitally connected urban environment .', 'This analysis provides an understanding of the socio-culturally specific rationale and desire behind technology design and adoption in the South Korean context .', 'Advance in social and organizational factor .', 'An exploration of how ergonomics can contribute to the solution of important societal and engineering challenge , Advance in Social and Organizational Factors discusses the optimization of sociotechnical system , including their organizational structure , policy , and process .', 'It includes coverage of communication , crew resource management , work design , design of working time , teamwork , participatory design , community ergonomics , cooperative work , new work paradigms , organizational culture , virtual organization , telework , and quality management .', 'The book provides research on urban infrastructure and how to shape urban space , including stadium and museum .', 'It covers warning system in car , voice-based interface , and the positive effect on manufacturing process available from health informatics and management system .', 'Several chapter examine the role human factor can play in counter-terrorism effort and in interpreting deceptive behavior .', 'They provide suggestion on how to improve enterprise resource planning system and stress the importance of lifelong learning , personalized learning , and work-life balance .', 'The book also highlights issue with special population , detailing how to design and adapt product and work situation for these group .', 'In addition to exploring the challenge faced in optimizing sociotechnical system , the book underlines theme that play a role in all the challenge and how they are linked to each other .', 'It concludes with an exploration of emotional ergonomics and the important positive effect of making people happy and healthy .', 'With chapter author from around the globe , the book supplies a broad look at current challenge and possible solution .', 'From social butterfly to urban citizen : The evolution of mobile phone practice .', 'Early 21st century society are evolving into a hybrid of real and synthetic world where everyday activity are mediated by technology .', 'The result is a new generation of user extending their everyday experience into these emerging digital ecology .', 'However , what happens when user re-create their human identity in these space ?', 'How do the tool of new technology such as the mobile phone allow them to capture and share their experience ?', 'In order to address these issue , this chapter presents the finding from a three-year study into mobile phone use in urban culture .', 'The study revealed that for a new generation , the mobile phone was integral in the formation of fluid social interaction and had accelerated urban mobility .', 'User once restrained by pre-made plan were able to spontaneously traverse the city and suburb , swarming between friendship group and activity .', 'Distinct user archetype emerged from these mobile phone driven sub-cultures whose practice brought about fundamental change in social more with respect to engagement and commitment , to notion of fluid time versus fixed time and , ultimately , to urban mobility .', "Connectivity had become central to what it means to have a social identity and user responded to this by merging bit of data to create their `` ideal digital self '' through which they communicate socially .", "Yet , recent development in mobile phone design reveal the potential for a new generation of people to recontextualize their use in a way that moves beyond `` the social '' as they utilise sensor and data capturing and sharing functionality in new mobile device to augment their `` social butterfly '' identity with an ideology of a `` socially conscious urban citizen . ''", 'CulTech2015 : Cultural diversity and technology design .', 'With globalization and technological advance , people are increasingly coming into contact with others from different cultural background , particularly in place-based and virtual community .', "Yet , cultural diversity - the diversity of community member ' cultural background - offers both significant benefit and challenge in the design , usage and evaluation of technology .", 'In this one-day workshop , we explore the role of cultural diversity in potentially informing , supporting , challenging or impacting the design of Information and Communications Technology ( ICT ) within community contexts .', 'To delve into this complex and multi-faceted space , we welcome workshop submibions that 1 ) engage broadly with the role of culture within technology design and usage for , with and by community , as well as 2 ) proposal for approach , tool , conceptual and methodological framework , case study and best practice in community-based design that exploit cultural diversity as an abet and seek to encourage intercultural interaction .', 'Our goal is to bring together academic and practitioner from different domain such as computer science , urban design , interactive art , anthropology and social science who share a common interest in exploring the design space of ICTs , culture and community .', 'Understanding social media-enabled participation and resilience in urban farming community .', 'The role of technology in urban farming have recently been a subject of examination in sustainable humancomputer interaction ( HCI ) .', 'Few have suggested that social medium can support citizen engagement due to its accumulative power for collective action .', 'However , little has been known about how such a provision takes place and what kind of participation can lead to the resilience of a community .', 'This paper presents a field report which seeks to reveal the nature of participation in a social media-enabled urban farming community .', 'Through an interpretive case study , the finding demonstrate interconnectedness of the community involving people , place , and technology .', 'Three area of contribution are outlined : a wider application of design framework for sustainable food culture , the role of social medium for social participation through urban farm , and the route to building community resilience from social media-enabled participation .', 'Participation - Basic concept and research challenge .', "Nearly four decade ago , Participatory Design emerged as an area of research with a strong focus on the political dimension , emphasizing people 's democratic right to influence their own working condition .", 'During recent year the context of use for information technology has spreads from the workplace to our home , urban setting , rural area , art , culture and almost all aspect of everyday life .', "The goal of this workshop is to shed light on the basic concept of 'participation ' in relation to other core concept ( such as democracy , emancipation and power ) in order to address the challenge in the new domain .", 'At a more general level , the goal of the workshop is to identify some of urgent research question the PD community is facing today and in the near future .', 'Lesser-known world : Bridging the telematic flow with located human experience through game design .', "This paper represents a new theorization of the role of location-based game ( LBGs ) as potentially playing specific role in people ' access to the culture of city [ 22 ] .", 'A LBG is a game that employs mobile technology as tool for game play in real world environment .', 'We argue that as a new genre in the field of mobile entertainment , research in this area tends to be preoccupied with the newness of the technology and its commercial possibility .', 'However , this overlooks its potential to contribute to cultural production .', 'We argue that the potential to contribute to cultural production lies in the capacity of these experience to enhance relationship between specific group and new urban space .', 'Given that developer can design LBGs to be played with everyday device in everyday environment , what new creative opportunity are available to everyday people ?', 'Playing for fun or gambling for money : a qualitative longitudinal study of digitally simulated gambling among young Danes .', 'Purpose : The study aims to explore the type of simulated game and gambling platform used by adolescent , adolescent ’ s experience , motivation and behavior vis-à-vis simulated gambling and the potential interrelationship between simulated and monetary form gambling .', 'Design/methodology/approach : Data was obtained from a qualitative longitudinal panel study with three wave of individual interview .', 'A cohort of 51 young Dane , with varying level of gambling involvement , were interviewed three time , with a 10-12 frequency from 2011 to 2014 .', 'In total , 149 interview were conducted over the 4-year period .', 'Finding : Enjoying social interactional effect appeared to be the main reason young people engage in simulated gambling game .', 'The study documented characteristic of both a catalyst pathway and a containment pathway emphasizing that for some young people simulated gambling may increase the likelihood of involvement in real money gambling while it may decrease it for others .', 'Research limitations/implications : The sample was relatively limited and it involved participant from only one of the five Danish region .', 'The sample reflects the culture , rural/urban configuration and gambling market of a specific geographic region .', 'Practical implication : Some form of simulated digital gambling may provide player with excitement and unrealistic conception of winning chance , which , in turn , may encourage participation in real form of gambling .', 'This may call for regulatory policy aiming at the structural feature of simulated gambling product and their rapid global spread .', 'Consumer campaign aimed at both young people themselves and their parent may be considered .', 'Originality/value : Few study have provided insight into the meaning and motivation of young people engaged in simulated gambling .', 'The current study is among the first to explore adolescent ’ s experience , motivation and behavior vis-à-vis simulated gambling and the potential interrelationship between simulated and monetary form gambling .', 'Design and development of wechat applet for Qi Culture Communication .', 'In promoting the development of urban cultural industry , and promoting the realization of the Chinese dream .', 'This paper introduces the function , interface design , development and implementation technology of the small program in detail , and shows the effect of the small program .', 'The small program has achieved the design goal of comprehensiveness , interest and interaction , and has mentioned in urban construction in recent year .', 'It creates efficient , fast , flexible and clear intelligent response to the need of different aspect and different level , creating a person and learning , and relies on the platform of lifelong education and lifelong English learning to improve the lifelong English learning ability of community member , thereby driving the continuous development of the entire community .', 'Therefore , it is becoming more and more important to build English learning community in smart city .', 'This article elaborates the basic strategy of community in China .', 'The scientific design of the construction provides a feasible path for the research of this article from theory to practice .', 'Finally , in the form of questionnaire survey and interview , the status quo of the construction of English-speaking community in smart city in China was investigated .', 'Based on the information and data of the survey item , the problem in the construction of English-speaking community in smart city were raised .', 'It also analyzes and summarizes key issue such as basic cognition , system architecture , and resource guarantee , providing a realistic basis for the further development of this thesis .', 'The survey result show that about 19 % of the community resident think that the construction of a learning community has little to do with themselves , and they should actively mobilize the enthusiasm and enthusiasm of community resident to participate in community activity .', 'Perception of urban space through the lens of Pokemon Go .', 'Augmented reality game have created a paradigm shift on social pattern and spatial experience , particularly in urban environment .', 'The impact of space experience during gameplay is underpinned by the interrelation between system and rule in gaming and urban theory .', 'Augmented reality game such as Pokemon Go ( PG ) have activated the social pattern , pedestrian movement and public engagement in urban space by overlaying the data of augmented space on urban space .', 'Current study suggested that spatial engagement through the augmented reality can inform alternative design approach within the public realm .', 'This present study particularly build on the premise that augmented reality influence the use of dormant space and creates accidental gathering space during PG gameplay .', 'Taking Desa Park City , an urban residential area that is activated by PG as a case study , this paper examined the interface of physical space , augmented reality and the user engagement of space .', 'Observation of 33 activated urban space are mapped to compare the spatial quality activated by the augmented space .', 'The finding suggested that the algorithm of PG frames the engagement of user within the urban space , which are linked to the setting of the physical space such as large scale structure , seating , accessibility and level of privacy .', 'The paper argued that the relationship between real , augmented and perceptual space offer alternative user experience and social pattern in engaging with urban space , contributing potential design strategy to activate otherwise dormant urban space and its potential to unify people from different culture group through the global universal perception of space .', 'It provided an alternative method to study the social pattern of urban space based on the algorithm of game , which can be used to observe different type of space and culture interlaced with virtual space .', 'Designing playful situation for stranger in urban area .', 'Playful interactive game system are seen as a new and exciting way to enhance social interaction .', 'Although positive result have been reported from previous intervention , many of these game have focused on limited contexts involving player who are already familiar with each other .', 'Research shows that familial experience are markedly different from those between stranger , as player have different attitude and motivation towards interaction .', 'In this workshop we focus on the method , tool , and medium involved when designing game that encourage prosocial behavior between stranger .', 'We invite the game research community to critically reflect on the complexity of creating such system for co-located people .', 'Furthermore , we also invite proposal that illuminate how difference in culture , age , gender , and context may affect the design of playful prosocial artifact .', 'International Symposium on Technology and Society , Proceedings .', 'The network ; uncovering social medium reaction pattern to protest event ; detecting opinion in a temporally evolving conversation on twitter ; identifying similar opinion in news comment using a online congratulatory message ; banzhaf index for influence maximization and modeling social medium content with word vector for recommendation .', 'The Co-creation of the city .', "Is it possible to imagine novel form of urban planning and of public policy regulating the way in which people use city space by listening to citizen ' expression , emotion , desire , and vision , as they ubiquitously emerge in real-time on social network and on other source of digital information ?", 'This chapter presents the theoretical and methodological approach , the investigation and research phase , the design and prototyping process constituting the ConnectiCity initiative , a collaborative , multidisciplinary series of project in which artist , scientist , anthropologist , engineer , communicator , architect , and institution participated to the design of innovative ubiquitous and pervasive system which were able to transform the way in which the concept of urban planning and city-wide decision-making are defined .', 'Novel form of urban life were imagined , in which city became the time/space continuum for multiple , stratified layer of information expressing the idea , goal , vision , emotion , and form of expression for multiple culture and background , producing new opportunity for citizenship : more active , aware , and engaged in the production of urban reality , and in the transformation of city space into possibilistic framework .', 'Ambient medium for the third place in urban environment .', 'As ambient computing blend into the fabric of the modern urban environment developing a positive interplay between people , place , and technology to create enlivened , interactive city becomes a necessary priority in how we imagine , understand , design , and engaging , and promote a sense of well being as well as belonging .', 'The indian neighbourhood user and designing for mobile internet .', 'With a population of over 1.1 billion people , India has an internet penetration of just 3 % while mobile phone penetration is above 22 % [ 7 ] .', 'This paper looks at the potential of mobile internet for closing this gap .', 'With nearly half the population of internet user using the cyber cafe as one of the platform for accessing the internet , the study focuses on understanding internet usage by looking at the culture of internet use mainly through cyber cafes in various contexts of the Indian neighbourhood .', 'The contexts as location of the cyber cafes were chosen based on the socio cultural nature of the neighbourhood within the urban fabric .', 'The study also looks into understanding internet non user who may be potential future user .', 'The aim of the study was to arrive at a set of broad design guideline for mobile internet through user research .']

['What are the benefit of interacting with nature ?', '.', 'There is mounting empirical evidence that interacting with nature delivers measurable benefit to people .', 'Review of this topic have generally focused on a specific type of benefit , been limited to a single discipline , or covered the benefit delivered from a particular type of interaction .', 'Here we construct novel typology of the setting , interaction and potential benefit of people-nature experience , and use these to organise an assessment of the benefit of interacting with nature .', 'We discover that evidence for the benefit of interacting with nature is geographically biased towards high latitude and Western society , potentially contributing to a focus on certain type of setting and benefit .', 'Social scientist have been the most active researcher in this field .', 'Contribution from ecologist are few in number , perhaps hindering the identification of key ecological feature of the natural environment that deliver human benefit .', 'Although many type of benefit have been studied , benefit to physical health , cognitive performance and psychological well-being have received much more attention than the social or spiritual benefit of interacting with nature , despite the potential for important consequence arising from the latter .', 'The evidence for most benefit is correlational , and although there are several experimental study , little as yet is known about the mechanism that are important for delivering these benefit .', 'For example , we do not know which characteristic of natural setting ( e.g.', ', biodiversity , level of disturbance , proximity , accessibility ) are most important for triggering a beneficial interaction , and how these characteristic vary in importance among culture , geographic region and socio-economic group .', 'These are key direction for future research if we are to design landscape that promote high quality interaction between people and nature in a rapidly urbanising world .', 'People need in the urban landscape : Analysis of Landscape And Urban Planning contribution .', 'The article published in Landscape and Urban Planning during the past 16 year provide valuable insight into how human interact with outdoor urban environment .', 'This review paper explores the wide spectrum of human dimension and issue , or human need , addressed by 90 of these study .', 'As a basis for analysis , the major theme tapped by the finding were classified into two overarching group containing three category each .', 'The Nature needs , directly linked with the physical feature of the environmental setting , were categorized in term of contact with nature , aesthetic preference , and recreation and play .', 'The role of the environment is less immediate in the Human-interaction group , which includes the issue of social interaction , citizen participation in the design process , and community identity .', 'Most significantly , the publication offer strong support for the important role nearby natural environment play in human well-being .', 'Urban setting that provide nature contact are valuable not only in their own right , but also for meeting other need in a manner unique to these more natural setting .', 'In addition , although addressed in different way , remarkable similarity exist concerning these six people requirement across diverse culture and political system .', 'Urban resident worldwide express a desire for contact with nature and each other , attractive environment , place in which to recreate and play , privacy , a more active role in the design of their community , and a sense of community identity .', 'The study reviewed here offer continued evidence that the design of urban landscape strongly influences the well-being and behavior of user and nearby inhabitant .', 'Cultural difference in attitude towards urban park and green space .', 'Understanding how different cultural and ethnic group value and use urban park is crucial in developing appropriate design and management strategy for urban greenspaces .', 'However , little is known about how Turkish people respond to and use urban park in their daily life .', 'This study explores public attitude towards urban park in the Turkish cultural context through a questionnaire survey ( n = 300 ) carried out in two popular urban park of Isparta , Turkey .', 'The result revealed some universal similarity to , as well as some distinct difference from , other culture in attitude towards urban park .', 'People in Turkey use urban park generally for passive recreational activity such as picnicking , resting and relaxing , in contrast to Western country where urban park are generally used for walking , dog walking , sport activity and exercise .', 'In contrast to a common concern about personal safety in urban park , this study determined a positive perception of safety among Turkish people .', 'Appreciation of natural feature , experienced benefit , the need for recreational facility and concern for general cleanliness and maintenance were found as universally similar attitude in urban park .', 'Community garden and sustainable land use planning : A case-study of the Alex Wilson Community Garden .', 'An analytical account of the history and aspiration of the Alex Wilson Community Garden in Toronto provides an ideal opportunity to examine the connection between two typically distinct enterprise : ecological restoration and community gardening .', 'These are both important contemporary ecological movement , but are rarely combined in a single project that demonstrates the principle of sustainable land use and community planning .', 'The garden is named in memory of Alex Wilson , a landscape designer , community activist and writer who worked and lived in Toronto , Canada .', 'During his life , Wilson established a community garden which was eventually replaced by conventional urban development .', 'After his death in 1993 , friend and colleague decided to honour his memory by establishing a permanent community garden in his name .', 'The Alex Wilson Community Garden opened to the public in June 1998 .', "The case-study explores how the garden reflects Wilson 's work by linking community gardening and ecological restoration .", "These feature are unified in Wilson 's work as a means of nurturing relationship between people , community and the landscape-relationships that are social , economic and ecological .", "In his book , The Culture of Nature : North American landscape from Disney to the Exxon Valdez ( 1991 ) , Wilson argues that 'we must build landscape that heal and empower , that make intelligible our relation with each other and the natural world ' .", 'The Alex Wilson Community Garden illustrates in a practical manner the principle espoused by Wilson through its design , planning and functioning .', 'The case-study report on the innovative approach to landscape design taken in the garden , which reconstructs the natural and cultural history of southern Ontario , featuring lake-shore , agricultural and woodland section .', 'The garden has been planted exclusively with native plant specie , and is expected to have a positive impact on local biodiversity .', 'The planning process which led up to the design of the garden was participatory in nature , encompassing friend and colleague of Alex Wilson , local resident and city planning official , and made use of a number of planning tool not usually applied in an urban setting , including the granting of a conservation easement .', 'The garden also addresses emerging issue associated with globalisation and large city by providing food production opportunity for local resident , including a low-income housing complex and a nearby drop-in centre .', 'Ecological monitoring and assessment of the naturalised area will be carried out by local resident .', 'Preference and emotion perception of ornamental plant specie for green space designing among urban park user in Iran .', 'The main objective of the present study was to explore preference and eumotion perception of people in Rasht and Ardabil ( Iran ) to some ornamental plant in order to help designing appropriate urban green landscape .', 'The study surveyed urban park user in the two city in 2017 to identify and compare the most important factor underpinning the viability of public open space from the perspective of user ( mental aspect ) and the extent to which these mental factor match the visual feature of the selected space ( visual aspect ) .', 'A random sample of 232 individual was taken from student in Ardabil ( 119 person ) and Rasht ( 113 person ) .', 'A considerable part of the participant ( 37.2 % ) reported a feeling of tranquility when they saw flower , while 28.8 % of the participant reported a feeling of love .', 'Flower-bearing plant specie were more appealing to the participant than leafy ornamental plant .', 'Red was the most preferred flower color ( 52.1 % ) followed by violet ( 18.6 % ) and orange ( 11.4 % ) among the ornamental specie commonly used in the design of green space , while tulip ( Tulipa gesneriana ) ( 29 % ) , rose ( Rosa hybrida ) ( 25 % ) , and Easter lily ( Lilium longiflorum ) ( 19 % ) were in the first top rank of preference , respectively .', 'Coleus ( Solenostemon scutellarioides ) and garden croton ( Codiaeum variegatum ) were also reported among preferred specie .', 'The result support the assumption of similarity in preference and requirement of citizen of large city and despite great diversity in geography , culture , and ethic , people in large city exhibit similar emotion perception .', 'The study finding are expected to support public authority and urban planner to effectively design and manage urban green space to meet user ’ need .', 'Community attachment and resident attitude toward old masonry wall and associated tree in urban Hong Kong .', 'Mature urban tree dwelling on old masonry wall are a rare urban ecological and landscape treasure .', "These 'stonewall ' tree denoting synergy between nature ( tree ) and culture ( masonry ) are worth preserving .", 'This study aims to identify factor influencing public attitude toward this important but threatened natural-cum-cultural asset in a compact city milieu .', 'Evidence is solicited from a face-to-face questionnaire survey involving 800 citizen of Hong Kong .', 'Result indicate that Hong Kong people generally appreciate the existence of stonewall tree .', 'Younger adult harbored doubt about their value , whereas the older one were more sympathetic .', 'Local resident of the suburb that host the majority of stonewall tree registered stronger commitment than non-local resident .', 'Community attachment had positive effect across both resident group , but length of tenure was not a key factor .', 'This suggests that affinity for stonewall tree is a function of the affective bonding between people and the community where they live .', 'Deep engagement with the local community elevated the desire for preserving the wall and associated tree .', 'The finding are important for understanding public perception and enlisting support from the larger society for preserving the urban asset against mounting pressure for urban development and renewal .', 'Perceived health benefit and willingness to pay for park by park user : Quantitative and qualitative research .', 'Whilst a growing body of evidence demonstrates people derive a range of health and wellbeing benefit from visiting park , only a limited number of attempt have been made to provide a complementary economic assessment of park .', 'The aim of this exploratory study was to directly estimate the perceived health and wellbeing benefit attained from park and the economic value assigned to park by park user in Victoria , Australia .', 'The research employed a mixed method approach ( survey and interview ) to collect primary data from a selection of 140 park user : 100 from two metropolitan park in Melbourne and 40 from a park on the urban fringe of Melbourne , Victoria .', 'Our finding suggest that park user derive a range of perceived physical , mental/spiritual , and social health benefit , but park use was predominantly associated with physical health benefit .', 'Overall , our exploratory study finding suggest that park user are willing to pay for park , as they highly value them as place for exercising , socialising , and relaxing .', 'Importantly , most people would miss park if they did not exist .', 'The finding aim to provide park manager , public health advocate , and urban policy maker with evidence about the perceived health and wellbeing benefit of park usage and the economic value park visitor place on park .', 'Virtual garden computer program for use in exploring the element of biodiversity people want in city .', 'Urban ecology is emerging as an integrative science that explores the interaction of people and biodiversity in city .', 'Interdisciplinary research requires the creation of new tool that allow the investigation of relation between people and biodiversity .', 'It has been established that access to green space or nature benefit city dweller , but the role of specie diversity in providing psychological benefit remains poorly studied .', 'We developed a user-friendly 3-dimensional computer program ( Virtual Garden [ www.tinyurl.com/3DVirtualGarden ] ) that allows people to design their own public or private green space with 95 biotic and abiotic feature .', 'Virtual Garden allows researcher to explore what element of biodiversity people would like to have in their nearby green space while accounting for other function that people value in urban green space .', 'In 2011 , 732 participant used our Virtual Garden program to design their ideal small public garden .', 'On average garden contained 5 different animal , 8 flower , and 5 woody plant specie .', 'Although the mathematical distribution of flower and woody plant richness ( i.e.', ', number of specie per garden ) appeared to be similar to what would be expected by random selection of feature , 30 % of participant did not place any animal specie in their garden .', 'Among those who placed animal in their garden , 94 % selected colorful specie ( e.g.', ', ladybug [ Coccinella septempunctata ] , Great Tit [ Parus major ] , and goldfish ) , 53 % selected herptiles or large mammal , and 67 % selected non-native specie .', 'Older participant with a higher level of education and participant with a greater concern for nature designed garden with relatively higher specie richness and more native specie .', "If city are to be planned for the mutual benefit of people and biodiversity and to provide people meaningful experience with urban nature , it is important to investigate people 's relation with biodiversity further .", 'Virtual Garden offers a standardized tool with which to explore these relation in different environment , culture , and country .', 'It can also be used by stakeholder ( e.g.', ", city planner ) to consider people 's opinion of local design .", 'Comparative analysis of utilisation of open space at neighbourhood level in three Asian city : Singapore , Delhi and Kuala Lumpur .', "Planner and urban designer place high value on public open space , because of the latter 's contribution to the quality of life and social interaction of resident in an urban development .", 'Many urban theorist consider open space as an important component of a healthy urban environment .', 'It is well established in the literature that the utilisation of public space varies from context to context .', 'This article investigates whether the utilisation of open space at the neighbourhood level is more associated with the physical and functional property of open space or if it varies across different culture and contexts of city .', 'This research adopts the method of comparative analysis , involving three case study from different culture , and climatic and geographical contexts .', 'In each of these three city , the opinion of resident and visitor about public open space were obtained and observation survey were conducted to measure the utilisation of these space .', 'The research found that the utilisation of public space at various level of neighbourhood significantly differs between city because of the local context , such as culture , social value and climate , instead of just being due to the physical and functional property of open space .', 'Rational planning of public open space by exploring the effect of environmental factor on human recreation – A case study in Shanghai , China .', 'Along with the urbanization , the rapid increase in urban population has become one of the most important global environmental issue .', 'The natural space were continually replaced by built-up area .', 'There is a growing recognition that public open space ( POS ) in urban area could offer many desirable human well-being possibility by interaction with nature .', 'In the current study , we conducted a survey in POS to investigate resident ’ recreation feature and environmental factor affecting their recreation perception .', 'The result show that diversified activity type including both active enjoyment and passive activity were required in urban POS by people in Shanghai , which was different for people from some other country and culture .', 'Furthermore , the result have revealed how landscape and environmental factor of POS affect resident ’ recreation perception .', 'Crime situation , quiet atmosphere , and environmental sanitation have been the three most critical variable of POS concerned by people .', 'For the natural environment in POS , even the diversified specie of plant were concerned by most resident , the vegetation density received the relatively lowest preference rating .', 'Overall , planning of a large open grassland with tree patch on the edge is desirable in POS , where visitor could not only get close to nature but also some recreational activity could be carried out .', 'All the finding in this study could give insight into the design and management of urban POS that are favorable for natural place and the health of people in urban area .', 'Attitude and preference towards element of formal and informal public green space in two South African town .', 'Different type of public urban green space ( PUGS ) contain various natural ( such as tree , pool , flowerbed ) and artificial element ( such as bench , play equipment , fountain ) which contribute to the enjoyment and experience of user .', 'However , which elements user most require , appreciate or notice has rarely been examined as the basis of their choice for specific PUGS , especially in poorer neighbourhood and country , where formal PUGS may be limited .', 'The study was carried out in two town in the Eastern Cape province of South Africa , both characterized by high poverty and unemployment level , low literacy rate and many people living without basic infrastructure and service .', 'To understand the meaning people , have for specific PUGS element , formal and informal PUGS and peri-urban municipal commonage were assessed with respect to the natural and artificial element present .', 'A survey of 360 household was conducted across two town by targeting PUGS user and household within 100 m from the designated PUGS .', 'Approximately 63 % of the respondent visited PUGS , with informal PUGS being the most frequented .', 'However , they were strong negative feeling towards some natural element because of their unkempt nature .', 'Issue of safety , cultural restriction and lack of recreational facility were mentioned as some of the specific deterrent against visiting the closest PUGS among different user and age group .', 'Most respondent emphasized the need for PUGS that are well laid out with maintained lawn , recreational facility and open vegetation .', 'Thus , the current design and available feature within the studied PUGS do not meet local preference and need and thus do not contribute to enjoyment as much as they could .', 'Attention need to be given to understand and incorporate the element that invoke positive attitude among urban resident .', 'Traditional versus modern ?', 'Perception and preference of urban park user in Iran .', 'This study involved four park in Iran-two modern one located in Tehran and two historical , traditional example , one in Kashan and one in Esfahan-in order to ask what are the key factor contributing to the satisfaction of visitor to the two type of park and also to compare user ’ s perception and value of the different type .', 'An extensive questionnaire survey was conducted in each park , with a target of 300 response , using a random sampling technique .', 'Respondent were asked to rate the importance of a number of factor , while thinking about the park they were visiting , using a 5-point Likert scale .', 'Descriptive and inferential statistical analysis was undertaken .', 'The result of the score revealed difference between the two type of park .', "A factor analysis of the pooled result revealed that the key aspect contributing to a visit were named as ‘ having fun and enjoying oneself ' , in a place with ŉo barrier to using the park ’ and ‘ leaving one ’ s care behind ’ followed by ‘ relaxing in the presence of natural beauty ’ .", 'A further Nonmetric Multidimensional Scaling analysis was undertaken to determine the main factor affecting the difference in preference for each type of park in relation to the key demographic variable .', 'This revealed that the modern park were preferred over the traditional one for three significant set of factors-recreation , accessibility and culture-and that there was a tendency for the historical park to been favoured by more educated people .', 'The conclusion are that the modern park support the main preferred activity to support the quality of life of the population-not through their design per se but because they offer many more recreational opportunity .', 'There is potential to include traditional element such as water features more into park .', 'Park planner can take the finding and use them to help improve the quality of the park over time .', 'The effectiveness of public park management and design for sustainable livelihood in Malaysian context .', 'Public Park is an important element for societal development because it can offer a wide range of recreational activity to reduce stress for free .', 'In other word , it may also function as an open communal center that can build integrity and sense of belonging among the people since it acts to define the shape and ambience of a city and its neighborhood .', 'Nonetheless , the design of public park , especially in current urban area are facing many problem due to factor such as unavailability of proper monitoring and management system to identify the level and trend of consumerism of public park .', 'Till present , there is no detailed study conducted to elucidate on the appropriateness of public park design to meet the need of local context .', 'Henceforth , the objective of this paper is to study the context of existing public park in Malaysia and identify problem relating to design , management and effectiveness from user ’ s perception .', 'To conduct this study , the research will adopt case study method as research strategy .', 'Since the focus of this study is on social physical phenomenon and to understand how human social culture correlates with the design and management of public parks-two research paradigms which are interpretivism ( hermeneutics ) that translates human ideology and structuralism ( semiotic ) to read any physical structure or architectural design are adopted as research methodology .', 'Data collection method will be from site observation , recorded documentation and questionnaire are used to gather all the evidence on the selected public park design .', 'Finding indicate that the design of local public park failed to fulfill user satisfaction due to design imperfection and poor management .', 'Therefore , this study will propose a suitable guideline as future reference to design a better and sustainable management for public park in the Malaysian context .', 'The Effects of Artificial Lake Space on Satisfaction and Restorativeness of the Overall Environment and Soundscape in Urban Parks .', 'Several study have proven that soundscape in blue space is conducive to human health and well-being , but few study have explored which blue space characteristic would contribute to a better soundscape and visiting experience .', 'Therefore , an on-site questionnaire investigation was conducted at two artificial lake in Xi ’ an , China .', 'The eight Perceived Sensory Dimensions ( PSDs ) as a landscape assessment tool were applied to identify the characteristic of artificial lake space in urban park .', 'The result showed that ( 1 ) In artificial lake space , overall environment and soundscape reached a very satisfactory level in general , while the respondent ’ perceived level of overall restorativeness and soundscape restorativeness as just medium , which indicated that the quality of artificial lake space need to be improved .', '( 2 ) According to people ’ s perception , artificial lake space had the most obvious characteristic of prospect , social and space ; serene and nature were medium ; refuge , rich in specie , and culture were the least .', '( 3 ) The eight PSDs of artificial lake space , except for social , were positively correlated with soundscape satisfaction , overall satisfaction , soundscape restorativeness , and overall restorativeness .', 'Moreover , among them , serene was the most significant characteristic in artificial lake space .', 'These finding could be instructive to the design of urban park with artificial lake for improving user ’ visiting satisfaction and restorativeness .', 'Social carrying capacity and emotion dynamic in urban national park during the COVID-19 pandemic .', 'The COVID-19 pandemic has changed the mobility , accessibility , and behavior of visitor dramatically .', 'Under the impact of COVID-19 , the social carrying capacity and emotion dynamic in park and recreation area are expected to change due to the uncertainty of health risk associated with visitor ’ behavior .', 'This study conducted an on-site visitor survey at Leiqiong Global Geological Park , a national park located in urban-proximate area
