in Haikou , China .', 'This study aims to examine factor impacting visitor ’ perceived crowding and emotion under varying level of visitor use in urban national park in the context of COVID-19 .', 'Study result suggest that visitor have the highest level of motivation for scenery and culture viewing and are generally satisfied with the environmental quality and design and COVID-19 prevention strategy and implementation effort within the park .', 'Moreover , this study suggests that the level of crowding and COVID-19 prevention strategy and implementation can affect visitor ’ emotion in urban natioanl park significantly .', 'These finding highlight the importance of enforcing the social carrying capacity limit and COVID-19 prevention strategy for urban park and protected area to mitigate physical and mental health risk during the COVID-19 pandemic .', 'Management implication : This study is one of the pilot study that examines the social carrying capacity and emotion dynamic in urban national park under the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic .', 'Study result identify the threshold of social carrying capacity and visitor ’ positive emotion based on the indicator of People Per View ( PPV ) .', 'Moreover , COVID-19 prevention strategy ( e.g.', ', mask-wearing and social distancing ) can reduce visitor ’ perceived crowding and enhance positive emotion .', 'These finding suggest that urban national park should monitor visitor use level based on the social carrying capacity framework to reduce visitor ’ perceived crowding and maintain positive emotion in the post-COVID-19 era .', 'Man-environment relationship of public square case study in dutch square melaka .', 'The square is one of the major constituent element of open public space in urban design .', 'It is seen as the core of a city which function as a focal point in the public space network , providing a space for the community social interaction .', 'However , many of the new public space in the 20th century has been a void setting and unsuccessful to create a public open space for social interaction that is vibrant with life .', 'The notion of square was adopted from the European culture as far back as 17th century and has been adapted in Malaysia .', 'This could be seen in today ’ s square design in Malaysia .', 'However , the behaviour pattern indicate otherwise as the present day square design does not respond to the local climatic context with lack of shaded area .', 'Hence , people tend to avoid social interaction in public square during daytime due to undesirable weather condition .', 'Therefore , the aim of this study is to determine the positive aspect of traditional square that has been successful in supporting the community social interaction , and establishing a general guide for the design of new square as a public open space in Malaysian context .', 'Amongst the consideration to be derived from this adaption is the Malaysian local context in term of historical significance , culture and climate .', 'Dutch Square in Melaka Historical Town was chosen as the case study , because it represents a model of traditional square as a public open space that still functions in term of attracting people to this day .', 'A combination of quantitative and qualitative approach were used in this study .', 'Behavioral mapping allowed for statistical analysis where as observation and still photography as the descriptive to support the outcome of behavioural mapping .', 'Therefore , the data collected are more reliable and able to be cross checked for further examination of the finding .', 'Finding showed that the relationship of the urban context and social behaviour are associative with one another .', 'The square plays an important role to provide a setting in the built environment and the behaviour pattern and activity to determine the success of the square as an open public space .', 'The aim is to provide an appropriate public open space in the built environment that is robust and meaningful to the community .']

['Factor affecting compliance with residential standard in the city of Old Salt , Jordan .', 'The aim of this paper is to examine the factor which impact on the extent to which urban housing complies with residential standard in the city of Old Salt based in Jordan .', 'The research found that the level of compliance with residential standard is quite low and can vary from one standard to another and from one house to another due to difference in the socio-economic characteristic among people .', 'The finding of multiple regression analysis reveal that there is a good level of public awareness of residential standard , but this does not result in complete compliance with residential standard .', 'Factor , such as household income per month , household size , finance facility , municipal administration culture , monitoring , enforcement and the uncertainty of residential standard have a significant impact on the extent of compliance with planning standard .', 'Suggestion for improved urban planning practice which address these issue are summarised in the paper and include reassessed current residential standard through comprehensive legal framework , linking residential standard with urban design approach , changing planning practice , developing information system to produce effective monitoring system of construction process and enforcement mechanism , the development of local staff including planner , designer and environmental engineer , supported partnership between private and public sector , and the use of participatory planning and citizen involvement .', 'Reviving the rule system .', 'An approach for revitalizing traditional town in Mahgrib .', 'The rule system is defined for the purpose of this paper as the underlying system of rule and code which Islamic culture has established for itself to guide and control societal activity , including decision and activity related to design and construction .', 'Within each particular region , the local custom are normally a part of the governing rule system .', 'The author argues for the revival and adaptation of the traditional rule system by maintaining its positive attribute , and incorporating modern technology and change in the lifestyle of the people in specific locality .', 'He suggests a policy for the government of the Maghrib country - Tunisia , Algeria , Morocco - for initiating the process of reviving the rule system and outlines the necessary step for implementing such a policy .', 'In pursuit of humane and sustainable housing pattern on the island of Cyprus .', "The newly developed urban environment often shows extensive neglect of local value and a lack of design promoting environmental quality in our city and town within the 'economic ' concept of a city .", 'Most housing environment , particularly those produced on the basis of mass production system , are missing vital aspect of sustainability and lack environmental and humane quality , both at urban and architectural level .', 'It is essential to focus on the requirement of sustainable development , both as a philosophy of planning and design and during the process of making and managing our environment .', 'Current urban and architectural development practice in Cyprus can not be considered sustainable .', "However , traditional settlement on Cyprus , such as the vernacular pattern , are excellent example to learn from as they represent a long-established culture and good use of local value and resource , matched with local skill meeting people 's need .", 'This paper first focuses on what sustainability means in term of housing environment by highlighting the quality of traditional housing pattern in Cypriot settlement .', 'Second , it provides a critical evaluation of newly developed housing pattern on the island in term of the environment and tradition .', 'Finally , it proposes principle of sustainable planning and design whose main aim is to create building that are sensitive to people and the environment and are culturally specific .', 'The transitional space in the traditional urban settlement of Cyprus .', 'The interaction between public and private , people and environment , open and closed , inside and outside , and part and whole are important design criterion in traditional environment .', 'This interaction and indissoluble whole of the fabric , transitional space , which is described as the overlapping of indoor and outdoor space , has great importance .', 'In different culture , transitional space have different name : arcade , engawa , vestibule , eiwan , and hayat .', 'It is commonly named sündürme in Cyprus .', 'Sündürme is the essential component that determines the spatial pattern and formal configuration in the traditional architecture of Cyprus .', 'At the same time , it is the forthcoming transition device between traditional and contemporary environment of Cyprus .', 'Through open and renewed interpretation , sündürme has the potential to be a cultural transition that can achieve continuity of traditional value and maintain physically and socially satisfying environment .', 'Furthermore , any planning and designing strategy that considers the potential of sündürme in new housing development as a shared image of all community living on the island could contribute to the sociopolitical process .', 'Under this scope , this study points out the cultural and architectural role of sündürme and describes its spatial , functional , and climatic characteristic by referring to the formal analysis result of 154 house .', 'The study aims to draw attention to the importance of sündürme in the development of living environment towards achieving better living condition and a higher quality of living environment , while maintaining the spirit of the social and cultural lifestyle of the past and possibly integrating them with the requirement of our time .', 'The urban sustainable structure of the vernacular city and its modern transformation : A case study of the popular architecture in the saharian Region .', 'The community vernacular city is the example of the popular architecture in arabmuslim world foundation to create a sense of belonging and attachment to the land .', "It is a reflection of people 's tradition , culture , aspiration , need , and their future .", 'In the past , the local community with its belief and creative ability was an integral part of the design and building process .', 'As a result , the architectural product has succeeded in expressing the identity of this community and maintaining element of continuity and distinction .', 'There is a lot of typical historic Islamic city , recently its urbanization has been advanced with the demolition of townscape and historic monument under the modern European style urban planning Today , most design and construction process are based on imported trend , and the product is foreign and does not express community value , and local urban space have lost their identity .', 'This contradiction represents the key issue of the identity crisis in the contemporary Arab city.Arab architecture is suffering from the absence of value and principle derived from the architectural heritage , ignorance of local climate and material , in addition to the lack of integrating modern technology with local value .', 'Tradition must be respected but development is the key of our existence .', 'Development and tradition could move in parallel .', 'Architectural style and technique could also be developed with respect to their original ideal .', 'New road construction has demolished many traditional house in old town .', 'This paper describes these phenomenon in oriental and west world and we based on case study transformation of the city of Bechar during the last 50 year , indicating in particular how the city has moved from an introversion sustainable city ( the vernacular tissue or the old ksar ) to the ex-colonial and rather provincial city into a urbanisation that is open to and influenced by the financial flow of international capitalism and that is seeking further integration into the world economy .', 'This research targets a deeper understanding of the urban structure and heritage , studying the different cause of tradition remodelling in local urban space and find out a way that understanding traditional design principle and sustainability material , our object is to motivate the architect to conserving the local identity , to find an approach that blends between tradition and modernity to revive the urban sustainable vernacular city .', 'Published by Elsevier Ltd .', 'Cultural heritage and development : the M ’ hamid Oasis in Southern Morocco .', 'Purpose : The M ’ Hamid Oasis is the last of the palm grove in the Drâa Valley , in Southern Morocco .', 'The 13 village ( ksar/ksour in Arabic ) in M ’ Hamid share many sociological , urban , and architectural similarity with the ksour located in the pre-Saharan valley .', 'These similarity range from environmental threat , such as extreme climate , to the current social and economic model .', 'As a result , the settlement are being abandoned , and the tangible and intangible heritage of the Drâa Valley is in a progressive disappearance .', 'The paper aims to discuss these issue .', 'Design/methodology/approach : To deal with the complexity of this problem , a progressive approach beginning at the territorial scale must be developed .', 'In this regard , a lasting solution can be found only by promoting development that integrates nature , culture , and architecture , as well as by finding a new balance of these element within the current social and economic requirement .', 'Finding : This paper presents part of the research conducted by the team of the Terrachidia Association , which allows an overall understanding of the place .', 'To this aim , the new social and economic context of the Drâa Valley is pointed out , as well as the characteristic feature of M ’ Hamid architecture and urbanism .', 'In this regard , the principle and requirement of its conservation are presented , and the project of the Terrachidia Association is also described .', 'Finally , the project ’ s impact is assessed and the result of the set of intervention are evaluated .', 'Practical implication : Since 2012 , the activity of the Terrachidia Association has focussed on the study , promotion , preservation , and restoration of the architectural and cultural heritage of M ’ Hamid .', 'The main activity of the association focusses on the organization of workshop , which are attended mainly by university student and professional from around the world .', 'Social implication : In total , 13 workshop were organized since 2012 , thanks to the engagement of the local population .', 'In this period , around 300 participant from more than 15 different country attended these workshop , working with approximately a 100 local craftsman .', 'All of them share a similar commitment to the work that Terrachidia is developing .', 'These workshop allow the participant to know place and people in a way hardly achievable through conventional tourism .', 'At the same time , this awareness is also achieved in the local population , and cultural exchange strengthens its identity .', 'Originality/value : The purpose of the workshop organized by Terrachidia is manifold , and the participant actively take part in the restoration works while they interact and exchange experience with a reality that is generally unknown in western society .', 'The local population also benefit from this cultural exchange by strengthening their identity , which is linked to architecture , and demonstrating the economic possibility of conservation through responsible tourism .', 'And these aim are achieved through a self-managed project , which benefit all involved .', 'A cultural heritage framework for preserving Qatari vernacular domestic architecture .', 'Architecture and urbanism in the Arabian Gulf region , and specifically in the State of Qatar , offer many scene to observe the loss of urban identity and cultural heritage in the various component of the built environment , including residential architecture .', 'Many people attribute this to rapid development in globalization and the adoption of Western standardization in planning and design practice .', 'Conversely , in the field of architectural sociology , scholar argue that socio-cultural factor such as privacy , gender segregation , and hospitality are the important variable for determining the spatial form of Islamic residential architecture .', 'This research study aims to investigate the degree to which the shaping of the spatial form in a sample of Qatari vernacular courtyard house embeds socio-cultural factor based on morphological analysis of human behavior and activity in domestic space .', "The study utilizes space syntax analysis to explore the spatial connectivity of four Qatari vernacular courtyard house related to domestic function as a realization of inhabitant ' system of activity and a manifestation of culture as a way of life .", "The study 's finding shed light on the spatial formation of Qatari vernacular courtyard house as a realization of socio-cultural imperative , thus reflecting the essence of societal formation in the domestic architecture of old Qatari settlement .", 'The insight from this research study can help to contribute to a cultural heritage-framework for the preservation of distinctive Qatari Vernacular Residential Architecture based on the analytical criteria of housing spatial form , socio-cultural factor , and the interrelation between both .', 'Traditional Market Design towards Cohesion between Social Sustainability and Bioclimatic Approach .', 'Traditional market have its significant cultural , functional , and socio-economic value , which reflect the main pillar for an effective sustainable development .', "Traditional market are place which show the community lifestyle , culture and heritage that 's why it has a strong rootedness to its local people .", 'By relating space to culture , a relationship between historic and contemporary design decision can be achieved .', "Most of the Arabian Cities are undergoing continuous development through different quality of expression in term of economy , culture , and global outlook in the old city 'centres .", 'Nowadays sustainable development has become an essential intervention in the capital city .', "However , sustainable solution should not concern themselves only with utilizing technology , but also with respecting a community 's social , cultural , historical , and environmental aspect .", 'Traditional souqs ( market place ) are centralized as an iconic inherits in the historic old quarter of the city .', 'The research problem arises from that some of the current traditional market in the Arab region do not promote social cohesion as they have been developed without consideration for local identity and lifestyle .', 'The question then becomes how to maintain the relationship between the spatial , social and environmental aspect in renovating traditional market .', "The importance of the research is derived from the need of applying a critical study for traditional market ' architecture with pre-existing cultural value .", 'The aim is to reach appropriate sustainable solution that facilitate the integration of socio-bioclimatic requirement , quality of the space , and culture identity in developing sustainable traditional market .', "This study examines and employs a descriptive qualitative and quantitative research strategy for one of the oldest traditional market in Riyadh 's city old center `` Al-zall souq '' , to explore the impact of change in the old center , through deriving a typological formation analytical framework which asses ; morphological language , socio-cultural and bioclimatic aspect .", 'This study comes out with a complete vision tracing the lifestyle and the cultural value of the society , to end up with a group of suggestion and recommendation that helps in the design decision taken to create an integrated cultural sustainable market .', 'A study of built morphology and cultural imagery—a case of bengaluru pettah : Historic core of the city .', 'City are composition of complex matrix of neighbourhood held together by the movement network .', 'The local neighbourhood is very important to understand how people conceive the city in their mind .', 'The representative memory captures the element related to spatial identity of a place , but more often than not , these representation are pictorial image superimposed upon the fabric resulted from the standardized tool used for analysing the spatial quality and its attribute .', 'The recognition of the finding to capture element related to experience of spatial identity problematizes from well-established urban design spatial theory .', 'On the other hand , Indian city is a collective of people , place and event .', 'These neighbourhood may not be central to social or business relationship nor centre for historic monument , but the activity , user , event , location and spatial condition that support them are very different—together key to the legibility of the city .', 'More often than not , the impact due to the city ’ s regeneration process sustain the test of time and manifest into a deeper system for building an image of the place .', 'Hence , embedded meaning and meaningful association over time become crucial for the built morphology .', 'One such neighbourhood is Pettah1—the old core of city of Bangalore .', 'Bengaluru was one of the key trading centre of the south during the pre-colonial era .', 'The idea of a town structured around Pettah ( market ) , Kote2 ( fort ) , Kere3 ( lake and tank ) and Totha4 ( garden and park ) was an unquestionable matrix of natural occurrence and cultural practice .', 'Decade to follow many influence on to the town added a layer of new structure , and every stage of progress enunciated the past with a new skin of element .', 'It is this value of city ’ s memory that lie buried within us carrying forward our past into its present fabric .', 'Hence , the study reveals the need to radically departure from the routine of recording legibility and imageability through mental , sensory and visual mapping and to record in term of space , event , time , activity as well as sense of public-ness .', 'Ultimately , the finding also brings optimism into urban design practice , offering new insight into how to record mosaic of an area in an Indian city that will capture the strong perceived and conceived imagery of a place and hence sensitive responsive proposal that will aid to carefully conceive a system for the future .', 'Sustainability and identity of traditional Anatolian citadel .', "Concept such as `` system as a whole '' and `` a generating system '' whose origin lie in Cybernetics , have long been used by theoretician to describe the building/people interaction .", 'System theory sees the building as a climate modifier ( a filter ) , a behavioral modifier ( Container of activity ) , a socio-cultural modifier ( aesthetic object and symbol of cultural identity ) , and a resource modifier ( cost ) .', "The above mentioned building function have constituted the framework of the `` sustainability '' issue which was held in the U.N. Rio conference in 1992 .", "This study argues , `` sustainable system '' as an issue of traditional urban form which has been regarded as optimum , impressive and objective solution to design problem under the constrains of extreme climate , with limited technology and material available .", 'These form have long been seen as a model for the integration of architecture and society where a mode of living in symbosis with natural life has been established .', 'The social class constructing community , the culture , the social behaviour of the community , effect in different scale in forming their environment , this will give a different identity to a community .', 'This paper , therefore aims to critically examine the concept of tradition/sustainability/identity and assess objectively to the traditional urban street façades located in several gcoghraphic region of Anatolia .', 'Anatolia displays a rich variety in term of its architecture and urban structure not only because of its geographical location but also because of the influence of several civilisation varying from the remains of ancient Hittite and Urartean to the archaeological ruin of the Hellenistic period and the post Roman period , the manifest vestige of Christian/Byzantine age , and the manifestation of the Seljuk and the Imperial Ottoman period .', 'Antalya , Ankara , Bursa , Erzurum , Diyarbakir , Niǧde , Trabzon and Urfa citadel are selected as sample area that have distinct architectural form and urban pattern originating from Roman , Byzantine , Arabic , Turkish tradition , still reflecting the characteristic and the segmented labyrinthine urban texture that bears the mark of the Ottoman period .', 'Examining 1 ) the typological variety of the urban street façades and 2 ) the identification of the specific and distinctive characteristic of the selected citadel of Anatolia which reflect the richness and density of its social , economic , cultural environment will contribute considerably to the richness of the urban design knowledge .', 'The uniformity concept of urban design : Impact of cultural tradition on the meaning of Balinese town .', 'This study considers the conception of religion , tradition , and culture in the urban design process , to produce design that become the identity of city in Bali .', 'A socio-semiotic approach is used to explore popular account of the conception of tradition operating in urban spatial arrangement from historical to contemporary period .', 'The case study in Gianyar City explores the meaning of urban space based on local wisdom that is still believed by Balinese people .', 'Such exploration provides a basis for reconnecting urban design with their cultural contexts , thereby promoting spatially expressed localism .', 'Especially for Gianyar City , respect for religious system , belief , and religion that have developed and are highly trusted by the public is expressed in symbolic element that are embodied in the composition of space , and in fact , give rise to the concept of uniformity .', 'This condition resulted in not achieving a more prominent urban cultural identity and being further damaged by the highly standardized process in the Indonesian planning system .', 'However , the principle of religion and culture that are still alive make Balinese architecture alive , despite changing value , whether we realize it or not .', 'Tradition , Transformation , and Re-creation in Two Marketplace : Souq Al Wakrah and Souq Waqif , Qatar .', 'Traditional marketplace are common in old city center .', 'Such place have a distinctive ambiance populated by local vendor , shopper , visiting tourist , and pedestrian on their way to somewhere else .', 'This genius loci or ‘ collective spirit of place ’ contributes to their character as destination for people to visit and linger .', 'They often serve as the focus of cultural heritage and historic preservation effort in rapidly developing city .', 'The paper focuses on two marketplace in Qatar : reconstructed Souq Al Wakrah in Al Wakrah and rehabilitated Souq Waqif in Old Doha .', 'Souq is a term from the Arabic “ sūq , ” meaning market , marketplace , or bazaar .', 'We examine their urban morphology and the probable impact on their function as public place today .', 'Both share similarity , including topography , history , culture , and architecture .', 'However , difference arose from settlement evolution in Al Wakrah and Doha .', 'The paper argues these characteristic show the vital role that urban morphology can play in promoting walkability , even in harsh climatic condition .', 'We conclude by briefly summarizing the potential for urban design enhancement to support their long-term sustainability as cultural heritage district .', 'Applied research on the design of signage and wayfinding system of historic block from the perspective of urban culture .', 'With the continuous improvement of spiritual and cultural need , the main reason why people are keen on traveling is that they want to learn about the cultural deposit of the scenic spot .', 'Under this context , this paper takes the signage and wayfinding System of historical block as the research object , emphasizes the necessity of extracting urban cultural information and applying it to the signage and wayfinding system design , analyzes the problem existing in the signage and wayfinding system of historical block and the application value of urban culture in the signage and wayfinding system of historical block .', 'Finally , from the perspective of urban culture , this paper puts forward a suggestion that the design of signage and wayfinding system of historical block shall take the characteristic of local building , regional style and folk culture element as the introduction point .', 'Re-locating the identity of Amman ’ s city through the hybridization process .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to define the identity , city identity and architectural identity ; to review , analyze and synthesize different piece from literature to explore and define the factor that shape the city identity ; to define the strategy of hybridization process that can be used to re-locate ( re-define ) the city identity ; to examine the most effective factor that shape the identity of Amman city from various perspective , to examine the relationships/interrelationships between all the factor that shape any city identity from the designer ’ perspective , finally , to apply the strategy of hybridization process to re-locate ( re-define ) Amman ’ s city identity .', 'Design/methodology/approach : This research used two research method to collect data as follows : literature review , content analysis and face-face questionnaire .', 'Descriptive statistic were used to examine the most effective factor that shape the Amman ’ s identity from different perspective .', 'The Pearson product-moment correlation coefficient ( Pearson r ) was computed to assess the relationship between all factor that shape the identity of any city from the perspective of Jordanian designer and expert .', 'Finding : This research concluded that the factor that shape the city identity are cultural factor ( socio-cultural , historical , economical and globalization factor ) , environmental factor ( geographic , climate and building material factor ) and urban and architectural factor ( spatial design organization , architectural style , open space and park , urban structure factor ) .', 'Additionally , the six urban development factor that responsible for the hybridization process in a city are new architectural typology and new special configuration , urban edge and hybrid texture , public hybridization open space , road highway-scapes , urban redevelopment through super site by star architect and downtown urban development .', 'This research found that there are different perspective about the definition and factor that shape the identity of Amman ’ s city because of difference in culture , experience , knowledge , education level and personal preference .', 'The city identity is not a constant concept .', 'It is changed according to time , place , people , culture , global trend , economic status and experience .', 'Moreover , the correlation result revealed that the relationships/interrelationships between all the factor that shape the identity of any city have strong/very strong positive linear association and significant relationship ( r > 0.89 ) .', 'Practical implication : Greater Amman Municipality ( GAM ) should provide a vision to redefine the identity of Amman city and control over the development pressure , built form and image of the city .', 'This vision should be based on research , analysis and adoption of the most effective road map .', 'GAM and all stakeholder should establish and enforce using specific architectural style , urban design guideline , building code , policy tool and land use regulation to re-define the city identity .', 'GAM should review , assess , approve and supervise all development project through all design and construction phase especially in sensitive area .', 'GAM should focus on building capacity , empower its architect and planner , and re-organize ( re-structure ) their unit and administration especially planning and licensing department to improve the city image and guide development .', 'This research recommended that architect should design new , diverse and innovative architectural concept , typology and spatial configuration .', 'Rapid development and new edge should be planned , designed and managed from the part to the whole .', 'The heterogeneous landscape and everyday activity will improve the vitality of urban and open public space and form of public culture .', 'Architect and star architect ought not to make a clear and sharp separation between old and new development , architectural style and typology .', 'Architect and urban designer ought to design hybrid physical urban environment , urban morphology , urban multi-functional activity , mix-use building , open space for social life , street pattern and furniture , square , architectural style and typology , spatial connectivity , green space and landscape entity .', 'The designer and planner should consider how to create a city for living , working and recreation .', 'Originality/value : This research defined the identity , city identity , architectural identity and the factor that may shape the city identity .', 'This research proposed and used the hybridization process as a tool to re-locate ( re-define ) the identity of Amman city and any city to be more obvious .', 'Additionally , this research examined the relationships/interrelationships between the factor that shape the city identity .', 'Altered perception of culture : Based on feature of pedestrian experience and aesthetic regeneration of built environment .', 'Culture and tradition are based on participation , engagement , and an idea that prioritizes equality for humanity .', 'And “ perception ” toward tradition has created the bonding between human value , tradition , and technological progression .', '“ Perception ” is the identification , organization , and interpretation of sensory information into coherent unified meaning to self and to the world .', 'Since perception is based on human interpretation and meaning ; it varies with factor like culture , civilization , and age of development .', 'Hence , perception form the “ imageability ” of the space and altered with time and space .', 'The chapter would concentrate on the rapid urbanization that has led to the disparity of identity , imbalance of the indigenous knowledge system , deterioration of cultural and regional asset , and hence , a decline in individual empowerment .', 'The chapter focused on the indigenous architectural form and knowledge system as a part of everyday aesthetic .', 'It attempts to grasp the physical , tangible architectural form and pattern of space .', 'Therefore , define and evaluate the form , style , and pattern of the architecture itself and space around by analyzing people ’ s perception toward it .', 'The study would culminate through assessment of architectural pattern and built environment in two different case study , namely , vernacular architecture at Santiniketan in Birbhum and Jorasanko Thakur Bari and their alternative response to different version and priority of nature and ecology .', 'This chapter brings to light how a pre-transitional context of Jorasanko Thakur Bari grafted from a hardcore urban footprint in British Industrial Calcutta had contrasted with a posttransitional eco-friendly setup of Birbhum in Rural Bengal from which Santiniketan and its eco-exploratory setup was carved out .', 'Thus there is a need of a search for quality of regional vernacular architectural aesthetic , use of space , and people ’ s perception toward it as against the more formal Bauhaus kind of design element of formal urban space and its built environment .', 'But the chapter does not end in contrasting and likening the two .', 'Rather it takes another step to bring together the best of the two world .', 'Therefore , integrating indigenous knowledge with modern technicality may help to promote , sustain , and alter people ’ s perception toward both vernacular and modern form and pattern , and arrive at a design vocabulary of the third kind .', 'Hence the chapter has been segmented into three sequence of discussion , i.e.', ', firstly , indigenous architecture as explored through the analysis and discussion of vernacularism and regionalism , on the one hand , and contemporary formal architectural aesthetic , on the other hand ; secondly , a composite focus on the range and gap of the experience in cultural and social context based on the twin case and its allied people ’ s perception ; and thirdly , at a need to delineate an attempt to chart out recommendation on the basis of an innovative and creative approach to integrate vernacular into modern architecture and vice versa .', 'With these three succession of discussion , the deliberation hopes to alter general perception toward the extremity , like “ Indigenous ” and “ Modern , ” and portray a new design vocabulary of the third order .', 'Geophysical setting and urban form of a traditional city : Examination of the Kurdish city of Sanandaj , Iran .', 'Considering the nature of place which includes both inside and outside characteristic , as essential part of existence , a city can not be imagined without nature .', 'Natural element determine the character of urban form and they can be recognised as the primary component of the urban form configuration .', "Based on this leading point , the traditional city of Sanandaj , the capital of the Kurdistan province , located in the western part of Iran , is examined to reveal the nature of interaction between the city 's urban form and its natural setting through time .", 'Drawing on document analysis and observation of existing built form and its natural context , this paper highlights how the traditional city has been forming and changing through time .', "The result present evidence of how people related to nature and how the overall spatial principle of the city 's traditional core were shaped on the basis of idea stemming from the natural order while culture shapes the detail of the place 's structure .", 'Architectural conservation as a promoter of cultural identity .', 'Culture has been generally understood as the characteristic and knowledge of a particular group of people in the area encompassing language , religion , cuisine , social habit , music and art .', "Margaret Mead , an American cultural anthropologist defined Culture as `` the whole complex of traditional behaviour which has been developed by the human race and is successively learned by each generation '' .", 'Such shared pattern on behaviour are largely influenced by the nature of space .', 'Since architecture is the physical manifestation of culture , any change in the same has the power to gradually bring about a change in culture .', 'Society which have been closely knit have grown to be non-concerned of each other with changing design pattern .', 'External influence on architecture and planning from different source has been modulating the culture of place .', 'And so , a conscious action towards conservation of culture can be strengthened by conservation of local architectural heritage .', 'This important fact has been established in this paper through the study of urban planning and designs case study through history of the city of Patna , Bihar , India .', 'With the assumption that architecture is a complete symbol of human culture it tries to study the role of architectural conservation in promoting cultural identity .', 'Understanding the vernacular heritage to design sustainable habitat in asni , Morocco .', 'The paper describes the result of the research and the three design workshop developed with the participation of student , teacher and researcher from University of Florence , in Asni , a rural municipality located forty kilometre from Marrakesh at the foot of the Atlas Mountains .', 'The research activity aimed to deepen the relationship between heritage , architectural design and innovation , considering local building culture as key input to develop a new eco-compatible living system .', 'The project of a new sustainable social housing start from the comprehension of the traditional knowledge system to define new appropriate solution , from the urban scale to architectural and constructive design , involving the participation of local people in the project through the mediation of local association .', 'The final objective is to identify sustainable strategy , form and constructive solution to meet the need of the new inhabitant , preserving at the same time the building culture and the cultural landscape .', 'Urban landscape perception in relation to collective mentality and memory : Case study : Tajrish District .', 'Introduction : Collective memory is directly related to the resident of a neighborhood and city .', 'Given the different position of a site , various approach are adopted to initiate or preserve memory in city .', 'In this respect , time , sociohistorical memory , tradition , myth , historical layer , the place where our memory take shape , the cultural context of city and understanding landscape gain importance as mental fact .', "In spite of being incomprehensible , time induces resistance in human so as to increase human 's tendency to control and dominate it .", "The mechanisms of such a control create the need to preserve ( keeping or stopping time ) , to accumulate , and also for projection manifesting themselves in the form of such mechanism as `` memory , '' `` retention , '' `` mental accumulation , '' `` dream , '' `` mental scenario , '' `` ideal , '' `` desire , '' etc .", 'in human life .', 'The issue at hand is how the importance of collective memory can be brought up by landscape design in the quality of life , physical quality , and urban landscape .', 'In certain case , the site needs to be observed by a close encounter and its resident need to be interviewed .', 'In other case , palimpsest tool are employed considering the urban history .', 'Any urban space in which an event has occurred and even all symbol and element constituting urban space are the place for the accumulation of our collective memory .', 'What matter here is to identify the element , symbol , and criterion associated with collective memory by which factor of identity , sense of place , and attachment to the residence and urban space can be preserved , reinforced , or created in landscape design .', 'The physical environment of city as the resource and the symbol of mental image and memory are especially formable .', 'Every individual becomes attached to city given the memory one has from the urban landscape .', 'Therefore , identifying the factor leading to the creation of memory and the relationship between urban landscape and mental perception are essential ignoring which causes a cultural break .', 'The relationship between mental perception , as a constant thing , and the physical structure of city , as a variable thing , creates a balanced space between city and collective memory causing people to partake in it .', 'Hence , the urban landscape can function as a context for the formation of collective memory and the mental perception of its user .', 'What matters is to identify the factor creating collective memory and its durability in environmental aspect and that whether adopting them in landscape design can prove to be effective in maintaining and enhancing cultural coherence , attachment to residence , and urban space .', 'Thus , this can also improve urban landscape quality .', 'Material and method : Given the information obtained from previous research and the identification of the scope of study , certain method were selected to achieve research objective .', 'Landscape is analyzed and perceived using all human sens .', 'There are two approach for landscape analysis , namely descriptive and perceptive .', 'The emphasis , in this study , is placed on landscape analysis on the basis of people mental structure .', 'Interview were conducted in order to find out what existed in the mind of user of the space .', "In this regard , the landscape analysis method ( using interview and questionnaire as tool for identifying people 's mental perception of the urban landscape as well as finding out the factor creating collective memory ) was adopted .", 'To conduct the interview , local resident who lived in the area under study ( Tajrish neighborhood ) and were familiar with the history of the neighborhood were taken into consideration .', 'Snowball sampling was used for identifying them Considering the landscape analysis method being perceptive and mental , six image from memorable space of Shemiran were prepared at first to begin working with the questionnaire .', 'Given the study carried out , certain component were then considered for each image in order for the viewer to score them given the impression they receive from each image ( l=strongly disagree , 2=disagree , 3=no comment , 4=agree , 5=strongly agree ) .', 'In doing so , the image were black and white so that visual beauty would not influence the viewer and they would answer the question bearing in mind what the image are associated in their mind and merely through their impression of the space .', 'The questionnaire were distributed among 30 person who were at least 30 year old .', 'According to the result , the factor affecting the mentality were extracted .', 'Result and discussion : Given the study and the information obtained through interview with the sample population , a mental map was obtained for the resident of Tajrish neighborhood ( Figure 1 ) .', "The map shows indeed that natural , artificial , and mental element leave durable effect on people 's mind each in its own specific way .", 'Depending on the condition of the time and place in which a person lives , certain component are of importance .', 'The existence of the factor can cause durable memory with attachment to place , formation of new memory , and cultural coherence .', '( Figure Presented ) On the other hand , given the analysis of the result of landscape score , we obtained the effectiveness of each of the component on mental perception in the urban landscape of Tajrish neighborhood .', 'On this basis , the element and symbol existing in the landscape leave the greatest positive effect on mental perception compared with other factor .', 'The most important component are garden , building , and old street with their specific vegetation with 100 % , alley within garden with 96 % , and river with 93 % of effectiveness .', 'In this respect , Rachel Gould and Chokor respectively consider historical symbol and pay attention to public demand as well as the symbol they have in their mind to be among the most important issue for perceiving urban landscape .', "In Belanger 's view , place as historical neighborhood can be replete with symbol .", 'This leads to the creation of collective memory that their result are the development of common value .', 'The next factor that its component play an important role in landscape perception is attachment .', 'This prefers a certain landscape over another with 88 % , the feeling of happiness therein with 74 % , recalling memory by visiting the place with 67 % , a feeling of nostalgia with 54 % , and convenience with 53 % of effectiveness .', 'These had the greatest effect on people mental perception and demonstrated an attachment to that landscape given the collective memory shaped in urban landscape .', 'In the discussion about collective memory , the last factor affecting mental perception of the space is social relation .', 'This causes what happens to the landscape in future to be of great importance to all resident with 92 % of effectiveness .', 'Social relation take shape in space where there are interaction and relationship among people .', 'In this regard , Schwartz considers the role of open space very important in improving the life of citizen and increased probability of memory being formed .', 'Conclusion : The method adopted in this study help find a mentality in people that articulates past memory and can be utilized to arrive at a social relationship between culture , environment , and landscape at the present time .', 'This trend brings about a mental network of public perception regarding the environment and the landscape where they live the memory are mentally valuable even if no objective symbol has remained in over the year .', 'According to the result , collective memory are directly related to a number of factor including identity and culture , memory and time , social memory , palimpsest , urban landscape as well as its constituting element .', 'In view of the context in which the memory have taken shape , taking these relationship into consideration leads to the identification of mental factor and criterion that have enormously contributed to the formation of collective memory .', 'Finally , the element and component were obtained that were employed to achieve the best pattern to perceive the urban landscape ( Tajrish neighborhood ) .', 'Considering the achievement of this study and the characteristic of the site , proposition are put forward .', 'Use of the proposition can play a significant role in increase of landscape quality , attachment , preservation of past memory , and formation of new one in similar site : 1 .', 'Use of element and symbol that are effective on the formation of memory and mental perception .', 'These are including use of element such as plane tree , creation of space resembling fruit garden of the past , creation of space for enhancing people socialization , planting plane tree in a row like Valiasr Street and the creation of a relationship between the landscape of mountain and river , use of watercourse as a natural element in design instead of hiding .', '2 .', 'Creation of space for social interaction : These are including creation of social-gathering space and hangout , creation of space for holding national and religious ceremony , creation of space for holding seasonal exhibition and event that attract family to urban space , use of appropriate urban furniture .', '3 .', 'Enhancement of natural context : these are in view of the natural context of the site , considering the slope , height difference of surface , and the vegetation used in design , embedding a pool that initially purifies the collected runoff to some extent and then directs it toward the watercourse .', 'A research on the continuity of the original settlement : A case study on Kemaliye/Erzincan .', 'One of the most important reason of settlement looking like each other , despite the difference of their geography and culture , is the cultural disengagement due to the uniformity of socio-cultural stratification .', 'This simultaneously creates negative impact on many original settlement .', 'Consequently ; today , we need design approach , aiming to provide solution for the disconnection of people and space to help continue the architectural and urban characteristic of original settlement while they are in a process of development .', 'This study handles such approach in line with the “ critical regionalism ” concept of Frampton .', 'A theoretical basis is formed over Giancarlo De Carlo and his architectural approach in Urbino can be assessed within the framework of critical regionalism .', 'Over this theoretical basis , Kemaliye , chosen as the study location , is evaluated in term of continuity , in light of data based on field practice .', 'Gadamer ’ s hermeneutics and the practice of design in architectural education [ A hermenêutica de gadamer e a prática de projeto no ensino da arquitetura ] .', 'This paper attempts to describe the way in which the recognition of the value of the architectural heritage is shaped and stressed in the teaching of architecture developed in the 3rd year of the Integrated Master ’ s Degree in Architecture at ISCTE , University Institute of Lisbon .', 'With a notion of legacy consisting of the collective heritage that encompasses the concept of culture and memory , the experience of teaching is the appropriate setting for an informed debate about heritage value that pass down from generation to generation .', 'This article intersects , in the preparation of architectural project , the recognition of the value of heritage as belonging to the organizational , technical and artistic field with the conception of “ historical consciousness ” and “ tradition ” from hermeneutic philosophy in the person of Hans-Georg Gadamer ( 1900-2002 ) , so as to provide new result in relation to traditional approach .', 'In methodological term , what is intended with these exercise is to enable student to develop a broad concept of heritage , where the idea of the recognition of its value allows a reading that includes the landscape as a whole .', 'The result obtained show us that student deal with heritage through action that include the restoration and rehabilitation of object ( building ) , but also through proposal where the organization and preparation of programme articulated with each other , taking into account people , landscape and culture in the present , are concept that are integrated in the project .', 'Sustainable living and building indicator in Old Aǧirnas and their interpretation for new practice and research .', 'There is usually a gap between the work of vernacular architecture and the current building practice in small town in Anatolia .', 'This gap grows each day , changes the living habit and culture , and damage the continuity of the development .', 'This paper attempts to address this disconnection from the eco-cultural logic perspective and analyses a small town called Aǧirnas in Central Anatolia Region in Turkey , in which the first settlement were assumed to be founded in the 1st century AD .', 'It highlights the unique ecological , socio-cultural and architectural value of the town and provides a glance to its current practice .', 'To do so , literature has been reviewed and interview have been conducted with local people , local authority , and the architect Cengiz Bektas , who is an Aga Khan and Mimar Sinan Award winner .', 'In addition to the exploration of the discontinuity of value , as an ultimate output , the paper proposes two framework , which provide sustainability roadmaps for current building practice and for further research and study in field other than building .', 'URBAN CODES : Familiarity , impressiveness , complexity and liking in façades of house .', 'This study aims to see the local resident of Kahramanmaras who are not in the design profession , to know how they find connotative meaning in house style concerning different culture and to see how these meaning differ according to socio-demographic quality .', "It is hypothesized that foreign example would be preferred as a 'social status ' indication compare to the domestic one which might be considered as 'warm ' .", 'Regarding this , a total of 102 respondent , composed of middle- aged people ( 25 female , 26 male ) and student ( 25 female , 26 male ) have evaluated the façades of 12 house through using five-point semantic differential scale under four heading : Familiarity , Impressiveness , Complexity and Liking .', 'The result have shown that different style with different form , element and material have been evaluated differently by the respondent group .', "While the most impressive foreign vernacular example were defined as the 'social status ' indication , the most familiar local vernacular example were indicated as the 'warmest ' house façades .", 'Amongst these result , it was also noted that the student appreciated the foreign vernacular example and found them attractive than the middle age respondent .', 'Design policy and mean related to rural settlement [ Kirsal yerleşmelere i̇li̇şki̇n tasarim poli̇ti̇kalari ve araçlar ] .', 'Rural settlement are the settlement that meet the requirement of local people considering cultural value important , combining them with nature , being harmonious with land form and local climate .', 'They are important for the creation of architectural culture amalgamating natural environment with the agricultural activity , recreational activity , social form and house and their related building within historical process .', 'Together with the changing technology and economic condition , urban area are becoming more and more similar and chaotic .', 'Consequently , rural dwelling are gaining importance and attracting attention , which is attributable to their authenticity , naturalness , and peacefulness .', 'Original settlement character and diversity in Turkey are ignored in as much as design and planning Works concerning rural settlement are often conducted at higher scale .', 'The regional design and planning Work may not only harm the original structure of the settlement but also degrade the touristic attractiveness as a major source for tourist development .', 'At this point village design guideline serve to describe the local characteristic of the village and its surroundings as well as to show how to protect and strengthen the local characteristic .', 'In this study the aim and context of these design guideline are explained and same sample done in foreign country are scrutinized .']

['Enhancing urban landscape configuration by integrating 3D landscape pattern analysis with people ’ s landscape preference .', 'Rapid urbanization in China has become an important social-economic issue .', 'During the process of urbanization , a diversity of factor should be balancedly considered for the design of landscape configuration .', 'Amongst these factor , people ’ s landscape preference are given growing emphasis .', 'Landscape preference have been widely examined and some study have been designed to link landscape preference to landscape pattern .', 'However , most study have been conducted from a 2D perspective and therefore can not simulate people ’ s actual perception of local landscape configuration .', 'This paper proposes a framework , based on which 3D landscape pattern analysis and landscape preference can be efficiently integrated for evaluating urban landscape configuration .', 'Airborne light detection and ranging ( Lidar ) is an ideal tool for conducting 3D landscape pattern analysis .', 'In accordance with 3D landscape pattern analysis , standardized and generally applicable survey of landscape preference can be designed and conducted in different area .', 'A case study was conducted in Cambridge and Canvey , UK to demonstrate how 3D urban landscape pattern can be analyzed .', 'Furthermore , a case study was conducted in Cambridge , UK and Nanjing , China to explain how people ’ s landscape preference can be acquired and compared .', 'Landscape pattern analysis indicated that 3D landscape model effectively revealed comprehensive landscape pattern and simulated people ’ s perception of local landscape configuration .', 'For instance , cross-culture survey on general landscape preference proved the existence of commonly shared landscape preference , which may be used as evaluation criterion .', 'This methodology provides reference for landscape planner and decision maker to enhance urban landscape configuration .', 'The methodology is of potential contribution to China ’ s rapid urbanization by suggesting practical approach to improve landscape pattern according to people ’ s preference .', 'Study on sustainable landscape design of abandoned quarry .', 'An example : Zhushan ecological park in Xuzhou .', 'With a growing concern about ecological issue nowadays , an unceasing re-greening tide of abandoned quarry is throughout the nation ( China ) .', "However , with the rapid development of urbanization and the comprehensiveness of urban function , we ca n't fully realize the social , economic and cultural value of abandoned quarry by simply conducting green-mountain project of abandoned quarry just from ecology .", "We takes Zhushan ecological park in Xuzhou as an example , analyzes the park 's ecological and landscape characteristic , refers to the project of abandoned quarry at home and abroad , and puts forward a sustainable development strategy of a systematic design-landscape for ecosystem , economy and culture .", "By this mean , the ecological restoration and landscape reshaping can be favorable for the ecosystem , local economy , and improvement of people 's living standard and the preservation of mining culture .", 'Rural ecotourism planning and design based on SWOT analysis .', 'With the increasing pace of urban life , people are yearning more and more for a slow-paced rural life .', 'Rural ecotourism is a new type of tourism produced for people to experience rural scenery .', 'In order to ensure the sustainable development of rural eco-tourism , it is necessary to analyze its planning in many aspect .', 'In this study , Tianjin rural eco-tourism was analyzed using the superiority , weakness , opportunity and threat analysis method .', 'Then , according to the analysis , the superiority , weakness , opportunity and threat were obtained , and they were quantitatively analyzed by mean of a questionnaire .', 'The result showed that the development of Tianjin rural eco-tourism had four superiority , i.e .', 'convenient transportation , rich water resource , rich animal and plant resource and rich eco-tourism resource ; three weakness , i.e .', 'homogeneous content , unclear theme and low quality of staff ; three opportunity , i.e .', 'government support , effective combination of local culture with tourism activity and increased demand for tourism ; and two threat , i.e .', 'fierce competition among peer and diversified demand of tourist .', 'In the comprehensive quantitative analysis , the comprehensive score of superiority , weakness , opportunity and threat were 3.6 , −2.8 , 4.4 and −4.4 , respectively .', 'To sum up , Tianjin rural ecotourism has superiority over weakness and equivalent opportunity and threat ; i.e .', 'it is basically in a state of sustainable development .', 'Published by Oxford University Press .', 'Protecting the Biodiversity in the Fast Urbanization Age - An Ecotourism Zone in Hainan , China .', "In China 's rush to urbanize , development practice are often forceful on local people .", 'Displacing development of the Chinese countryside to make way for expensive housing and large hotel is a regularity .', 'This paper looks at the Yanoda Ecotourism Zone Planning project in Hainan , China as an example of the method of the Ecotourism and Sustainable Development approach .', 'The design team thoroughly collected and analyzed the natural and culture element of the area , and hosted public meeting of all party including local governmental , developer , local farmer , potential buyer and came up an innovated master plan for the 164 km2 ( 40,525 acre ) project area that all party receive some benefit ; at the same time , the natural resource and cultural character of the area was preserved in a maximize way .', 'The Ecoland design team also came up with a demonstration design for Phase I area as well as a design guideline for the rest of the project area .', "Three year after the project , the local resident ' income , the government tax income from tourism , and developer 's investment return have all proved the success of the development .", 'The goal of preserving the sensitive environmental area was accomplished as well .', 'By incorporating scientific research , urban infrastructure , and job training , the plan shows that the goal of ecological , cultural , and economic sustainability can be combined to create a successful development for all party involved .', 'The result is a popular tourist destination that has the support of both the people and the government .', 'Yanoda Ecotourism Zone shows how a model developed with the community can lead to successful future growth .', 'The master plan for Yanoda is not merely a guideline for development but a model for a system of continued sustainability and growth .', 'From ecology landscape to construction of rural aesthetic space .', 'On the surface , rural aesthetic space are not considered practical or utilitarian .', 'However , mapping them out is valuable , because permanently sustainable development is the essence of the relationship between man and land .', "In the early agrarian age , the layout of rural area was guided by people 's aesthetic view of ecology rather than modern precise statistic , calculation , and related design principle .", 'The inherited philosophy of respecting the natural landscape is the original driving force for preserving aesthetic space .', 'Ancient feng shui landforms should be preserved in China .', "These non-utilitarian element carried villager ' natural aesthetic philosophy across generation and captured the meaning of continuous development of the man-land relationship .", 'At present , rural research focuses on the economics of land use .', 'Research on the ecological landscape construction of rural aesthetic space is limited , and this needs to be investigated as an important topic in the field .', 'As rural landscape evolve , human agricultural activity leave an imprint on the aesthetic of ecological space , and modern layout pattern result in an inversion of the rural landscape .', 'In recent year , the destruction of the regional geographical structure by the rapid development of modern urbanization has been devastating.My research aims to analyze rural ecological landscape and aesthetic space corresponding to the element , and how aesthetic space are constructed based on geographical frame .', 'I will carry out a multi-scale study of morphological characteristic , landscape space , and the relationship between evolution pattern and response mechanism .', 'In large-scale landscape area , preserving the spatial relationship between village and geographic landscape is particularly essential if village are to inherit cultural and historical tradition .', 'Town region are medium-scale landscape area .', 'Based on the investigation of geographic element such as mountain range and water system , the principle of ecological art composition requires village and field to consider distribution contrast and plan the height , scale , and density of rural construction , road linearity and strength , and other urban construction index from the perspective of ecological aesthetic .', 'Small-scale area usually adopt aesthetic space composition with architectural design method , which should consider natural aesthetic philosophy , interior and exterior space , and rural social factor .', 'The combination of geography and urban planning that shapes space and the connotation of space far exceeds social relationship when determining the development scale and construction layout of rural area .', 'The priority is to maintain harmony in the social space .', "The construction of rural aesthetic space operates through the `` hardware '' of the geographical landscape and the `` software '' of cultural inheritance and accumulation with respect to landscape form , mechanism , functional structure , and so on .", 'Rural landscape planning must use geography as its basic space structure , base itself on regional geographical space analysis and landscape preservation , and place importance on index of preservation of the regional landscape and traditional culture .', 'It should be specified that the requirement of landscape optimization and socioeconomic development are embedded in the requirement of ecological civilization and social development in the layout of landscape space .', 'These element form a landscape network that can maintain the comprehensive environment .', 'The philosophy of landscape aesthetic should be expanded to broader space in order to introduce the concept of landscape beauty to town , village , and even farmland .', 'Rooted in regional culture , creating urban characteristic - A case study of Dukang Road landscape design in Baishui county .', 'Urban road , as the most important aggregation point and generator of the urban life , is an important space for people to experience the city culture and awareness of city character .', 'This paper takes the phenomenon of city character crisis that the city lacks local culture characteristic as the starting point .', 'Through the analysis of landscape design of Dukang Road ( E ) , which is in Baishui county , discusses how to reasonable use local culture in urban road landscape design .', "With the regional culture as an important creating source , absorb its beneficial `` gene , '' so as to create urban road landscape with regional culture characteristic , thus to better showing the distinct personality and character of the city .", 'Study on landscape construction of ecological garden based on ecological perspective .', "With the gradual deterioration of the environment , people 's awareness of environmental protection has gradually increased .", 'Traditional garden design concept , concept and connotation can no longer meet the requirement of contemporary society .', 'Modern garden design should take the minimum environmental cost and protect the environment as the goal .', 'The garden design is carried out from an ecological perspective .', 'Ecological garden landscape construction under the influence of regional culture is studied .', 'The result show that in the process of building ecological garden landscape , we should adhere to the principle of people-oriented and ecological sustainability , and strive to create an ecological landscape integrating art , science and humanity .', 'Establishing urban ecological network , which has important significance for good urban ecosystem and sustainable development .', 'Research on the Regional Characteristics of Marine Coastal Architecture from the Perspective of Ecological Development .', 'In this paper , based on the theory of ecological development context on the basis of the building ecology theory and its related theory , the natural resource and ecological environment as a sea-coast construction of endogenous factor , the principle of economic benefit , ecological benefit principle as marine coastal construction should follow the basic principle of `` through research , natural resource , ecological environment interact with other factor of production , form associated with ecological resource , and affect the evolution of Marine coastal construction path .', '`` In the marine area , the marine architecture is the epitome of the history and culture of the marine city .', "The marine architecture with regional characteristic can not only continue the urban context , but also improve the image of the city and deepen people 's overall impression of the city .", 'Therefore , from the perspective of ecological development , this paper study the regional characteristic of marine coastal architecture .', 'Design of the landscape diversity of commercial street in the old downtown of Ho Chi Minh City .', 'Ho Chi Minh City is a city with many culture , architectural style , and different lifestyle .', 'This makes Ho Chi Minh City characterized as a diverse city satisfying the different element : spatial diversity , cultural diversity .', 'According to the Saigon master plan of Coffyn designed in the early 20th century , together with public space , the commercial area of Ho Chi Minh City were also identified as the main point for the city development .', 'Therefore , the commercial street in its old downtown also showed very obvious diversity .', 'Vietnamese people have adjusted the urban space planned by French people in order to match with their lifestyle for more than 100 year .', 'Besides , many old commercial building have been demolished and replaced with new building , causing the disturbance of life and cultural value of the city , leaving many street losing their original landscape and getting the same style .', 'Their uncontrolled diverse development causes the clutter , loss of order , and insecurity .', "From this above situation , the author has chosen the subject `` Design of the landscape diversity of commercial street in the old downtown of Ho Chi Minh City '' in order to find the oriented development for those street on the basis of maintaining and developing their inherent diverse characteristic .", 'Rural Design Ethics Based on Four Dimensions .', 'China has a large rural area with a large population , whose architectural feature , natural landscape , organizational structure and industrial structure are very different from that of city .', 'In the past , the contradictory between city and rural area in China had negative effect on rural construction , resulting in a slow development .', 'The excessive focus on city design has led to the neglect of rural design .', 'Blindly using the concept and method of city design to renewed the countryside is a kind of destruction to the countryside , and also wastes a lot of construction resource .', 'Design is influenced by ethical concept , which needs to pay more attention to the culture tendency and society .', 'Urban design makes theoretical investigation aiming at the ethical question that emerged from city , then summarizes the design strategy of the city .', "While Chinese rural design has only begun to enter people 's horizon , and there is very little discussion about it .", 'Due to the lack of ethical value guidance , Chinese rural design and construction has many problem at different level of ecology , culture and industry .', 'Therefore this paper primarily explores the domestic and foreign design ethic , attempting to provide a new perspective for Chinese rural design , aiming at finding a realistic and forward-looking solution for Chinese rural design concerning to the complex relation between city and rural area .', 'Application pattern innovation and value analysis of virtual reality assisted technology in urban landscape design .', 'In this research , we analyse the application and value analysis of virtual reality in urban landscape design .', "Along with society 's fast development , the present city botanical garden landscape already not merely was only provides the rest , the entertainment , the ornamental place for the people , meanwhile must meet people 's life need as well as the realization social function .", 'Each city has its own characteristic and history and culture .', 'In the process of urban landscaping , we should not neglect the characteristic of the city and the specific history and culture otherwise ; it will only lead to the monotony of the garden in all the city .', landscaping to become a business card for the city , displaying its unique cultural and humanistic atmosphere , and landscaping for a better cultural heritage .", 'The basic connotation and extension of the garden are constantly being enriched and expanded along with the development of the society and the progress of science and technology .', 'Therefore , this paper proposes the novel perspective on the project .', 'Integrated conservation of the Cantonese opera art museum and intangible cultural heritage .', 'Cantonese Opera , as the sole cultural heritage of Guangdong Province of China so far , which was included in the World Intangible Cultural Heritage List by the UNESCO , bears the cultural memory of the Lingnan region and as well as the overseas Chinese worldwide .', 'Located in the core historic urban area - Enning Road of Guangzhou , the Cantonese Opera Art Museum is designed in Lingnan traditional garden manner , through going deep into the Cantonese opera culture , Lingnan traditional garden culture and Lingnan cultural spirit .', 'The design highlights the integrated conservation of tangible and intangible cultural heritage , to protect living history and build the historical environment and place spirit for the intangible cultural heritage .', 'The Cantonese Opera Art Museum is not only a tangible space for exhibition , study , education and display of the Cantonese Opera art , but also a cultural space with the Lingnan cultural memory , gathering the Lingnan intangible heritage and closely linked with current life of successor and ordinary people .', 'Study on waterfront landscape design based on regional culture .', 'With the development of human society , people ’ s requirement on landscape environment have been increasingly higher .',
